description:
This review is based on the sheet cakes that my husband and I ordered from Schubert's Bakery for our wedding. Since they no longer make wedding cakes, we ordered our tiered cake elsewhere, and in order to feed our 350 guest count, we supplemented by ordering several sheet cakes from Schubert's. After trying at least five different individual mini cakes, we decided that we liked the double chocolate mousse the best - white and chocolate sponge with white and dark chocolate mousse, whipped cream and chocolate shavings. Doesn't that even SOUND dreamy?? 

On the day of the wedding, pick-up by one of our groomsmen was smooth and the cakes looked beautiful (even though nobody would know since they were cut up in the back). Some of our guests commented that this sheet cake tasted even better than our fancy tiered cake! Because we had ordered enough for every guest to have at least one slice, and also had a dessert bar, we did have some left over, much to my great great delight. The day after the wedding, I sat in bed eating this delicious cake at 1am and it was glorious. I've eaten a slice every day since then and I have no regrets - wedding diet is over, baby! 

But really, the double chocolate mousse is amazing and I would definitely recommend it! Ending this review here so that I can walk to the kitchen and fulfill my cake quota for today..
author: Nicole M.

description:
Was in the area so I bought 4 cakes:  
1) Swedish princess cake - so good, soft and not that sweet, just prefect
2) strawberry shortcake  - very good, I would get this for my parents ,  not sweet
3) Tiramisu mousse 
4) mango mousse

$18 total for all 4 slices.
author: Yonnie C.

description:
Schubert's has the best cakes in San Francisco hands DOWN! The crazy thing too is that they have always had the best cakes... even before foodie culture invaded in SF. Their princess cake is absolutely to die for and super reasonably priced. GET THE PRINCESS CAKE! Marzipan and raspberry... what's there not to like?! 

This parking here is absolutely terrible so being a friend who can run down and grab the cake while you circle the block. Also, this place is super popular and can get crowded. I thinner why are really efficient about getting people in and out though. You might want to go early to make sure they don't run out of stuff.
author: Jocelyn K.

description:
My daughter received a beautiful and delicious work of art birthday cake from Schubert's bakery.  It was a strawberry cheesecake creation.  
We loved the wonderful dessert.  We'll be back to order again.
author: Corine C.

description:
Right when I walked in, I was entranced by all the gorgeous looking desserts. OMG...princess cakes, cakes, tarts, eclairs, cream puffs, mousse, opera cake, Neapolitans, cookies, and so much more. The cakes come in different sizes and slices. The tarts come in cake size, handheld ($4-5), and bite size minis ~$2. Ya!  The mini bite size tart had a buttery dense crust with smooth custard filling and fresh berries. 

The ordering protocol is a bit wonky though. No numbering taking, which they should think about implementing because I was bypassed and had to holler loud about that. But the staff quickly apologized and made things right.  The fella had a great engaging personality and no rushing me about.

Oswald Schubert immigrated from Germany to SF in 1911 and started his bakery. He moved to the present day Clements Street location in the 1940s. The Maier family took over in 1968. In 1995, the Wenzel Brothers (4th generation German bakers) bought the biz. Schubert's longevity is plain and simple. The basic recipe is that Schubert's provides excellent customer service while providing delicious decadent pastries at reasonable price points. Each owners have brought along their recipes to ever evolve the dessert offerings. decadent pastries at reasonable price points. Each owners have brought along their recipes to ever evolve the dessert offerings. I hope they stay in biz for another 100 years...wouldn't that be something!
author: Lillian W.

description:
A cute little French style bakery on Clement at that has cakes, pastries, and Mousses. I ordered a chocolate mousse that tasted great. Very decadent and rich in chocolatey goodness, it was chocolate mousse with chocolate shavings, on a chocolate sponge cake, with pieces of chocolate on top. Then a raspberry on top! High quality but I would definitely recommend sharing it amongst 3 people. I think most people come here for the cakes and although I haven't tried em, they look beautiful.

Food: 4/5
Value: 3.25/5
Service: 4/5
Overall: 4/5
author: Brian G.

description: Every year my friend purchases a fruit tart from here for my birthday. It is the best fruit tart I've ever had - there's so much fruit all of which is very sweet and perfectly ripe, the custard is superb, the crust is perfect. I've actually never been in the bakery but I look forward to the fruit tart every year.
author: Melissa T.

description:
Highly recommend this place. The service was so fast and very friendly. They asked if we wanted forks to go. 
We ordered double chocolate mouse and Swedish princess cake. The presentation of the cakes are amazing and so is the taste. 
Both were fantastic. I just wish I had more.
author: Nellie P.

description:
Nice cake!

We got the Princess cake for a birthday celebration, and it was amazing. It's obvious why this cake is the store's signature cake: the yellow shell is actually a ice-cream like shell, that looks amazing because unlike other cakes, it is smooth and round, like a perfect egg. The shell is not just for show either--it tastes really good, like a kind of ice-cream that doesn't melt at room-temperature. Inside the shell is a cake with cherry jelly and cream. Overall the Princess cake tastes just right--sweet, but not too sweet. Soft, but not too soft. It reminds me of those Swedish cookies everyone ate when we were kids--it's not extreme in any trait (sweetness, fruitiness etc), but when everything is put together, it feels balanced. Like bottle of water when you are thirsty. The cake tastes just right. Balanced. Normal. Right. You just keep shoveling it into your mouth and not even notice.

The store itself is really nice too. Inside, you can see a brightly lit room with lots of cake and pastries on display. The entire shop is sparkling clean, with the floor and walls reflecting light :) The folks who work there are all very friendly, and greet you nicely. We ordered a cake in advance online, which is nice because they let you put custom messages on the cake, and also pay online so you can get everything done without showing up in person. Really convenient.

We came here before to buy a cup of coffee as well, and it tasted pretty good. The folks on staff then was different, but equally nice and courteous.

Overall, a great place to go get birthday cakes. They will take care of you.
author: Henry L.

description: This place continues to bring consistency and perfection to the classics.  The Princess cake continues to be my family's all time favorite and after years of ordering from Schuberts, we can always count in their quality. Looking forward to many more years of celebrating with their cakes!
author: C L.

description: Got 4 pieces of cakes and my hub and I thought it was just ok. Nothing mind blowing and some of the cake was dry and not as moist as it should be. Can't believe the rave reviews for the place. It's very pretty to look at just not much for taste buds
author: J S.

description:
This is my go-to bakery for all occasions whether it's Mother's Day, birthdays or holidays, there is a cake for everyone! Just this past Friday, I came to pick up a Mother's Day cake which I had ordered over the phone over a week in advance. I ordered a 6" Raspberry Mousse cake and when I came pick up, they said they ran out of 6" but instead gave me a 8" and charged me the 6" price. Now that's customer service! The cake was divine and my mother was very pleased with it. Yummy, beautiful intricate decorated cakes!

The one thing I would say to work on is their online ordering system. I am able to place an order sometimes when it works but most of the time it is down and I have to call in to place the order. Please fix that!
author: Annie L.

description: Our family loves Schubert's! It's a local spot, family-run, and the best cakes for any occasion. Here's my awesome birthday fruit tart from my family. It's my favorite!
author: Sydney G.

description: From cookies to cakes and every other delicious confectionary in-between, I have yet to try something here I do not love. We just started going here this summer and yet their cakes were so superb I wanted to have my birthday cake from them this year. Seriously, stop here for coffee and a slice of one of their indulgent cakes. Grab a bag of tea cookies for later or as a gift!
author: Bianca H.

description:
I love this place. It can be hard to find parking, busy and loud, a bit standoffish at times when it comes to service and the locals but their pastries are O-M-Delicious. I didn't like their princess cake as much as I thought I would but it was decent. 

There are a lot of locals who come in for coffee and take up seating which is limited. When you start having a line (which happens often) piling up, and you have someone's butt in your face while you're trying to shovel down a cake slice into your face it becomes awkward lol. Do yourself a favor and order large orders ahead and get your smaller orders to go. It's not a great place for large groups and people try to keep the noise levels down. It was louder than a 1995 bowling ally in there the last time I went LOL.
author: Bella B.

description:
I like to come here with my family and grab a small delicacy to enjoy while sitting and chatting in the bakery. Good bonding time! Unfortunately the place is a bit small and does get crowded, so it may be hard to nab a seat. 

The small fruit tarts are one of my favorite cakes to get. The fruit is fresh and doesn't taste mushy. The custard on the bottom is creamy and rich and goes so well with a bite of fruit. I've also gotten the cheesecake before, but it tastes fairly average.
author: Karen Y.

description:
One of my favorite bakeries for cakes. Honestly, you really cannot go wrong with anything here but my favorite would be the princess cake or really anything with chocolate. 

They're constantly bringing out cakes throughout the day so if you don't see something you like, they may advise you to come back a little later. But just to be safe, call in advance and preorder a cake so that you're guaranteed.
author: Serena L.

description: Love this place! Have been here a handful of times, consistent every time. Quick tip: they don't pick their phone up on weekends. Online orders require a 48 hour notice. Best is to go directly to the bakery and order if you need something overnight.
author: Veronika Z.

description:
I am not from San Francisco so any time I get to go to Schubert's is a treat for me. This bakery is no joke. The shop is somewhat small and often times crowded (especially during the holidays) but if you get a chance you should definitely stop by and try a slice (or several slices) of their amazing cakes. I have tried several different cakes and I honestly love them all! 

I first had the opera cake and immediately fell in love with the hazelnut and chocolate flavor! (I'm a certified nutella lover). Some may say that the opera cake is too rich but that's honestly the way I like my cakes so it was perfect for me! The St. Honore Cake with it's cream puffs and lady fingers is also a nice option if you want something a bit less sweet but still celebratory and decadent! But my favorite cake of all time would have to be the Swedish Princess Cake.....I'm drooling just thinking about it. 

I find it to be a perfect blend of sweet and tart because of the smooth sweetness of the marzipan and the tartness of the raspberry filling. The white cake layers keep the base of the cake nice and simple, letting the other components (marzipan, raspberry and custard filling) shine. I ask for this cake whenever I am celebrating ANYTHING in San Francisco. I've had it for several birthdays and even my college graduation and I'm just getting going!
author: Coleen J.

description: I searched the internet high and low to find a bakery to order my mom's favorite, a Black Forest cake, for her birthday. I finally decided to chose Schubert's this time because it was nearby and it seemed to get good reviews on its other cakes. I was a bit hesitant, however, because one review of the Black Forrest cake was pretty dismal. I felt that I should try it myself. I regret my decision. My reason is not so much the flavor of the cake (although it wasn't anything to write home about), but moreover the size and height of the cake for the cost. The cake is a standard round cake, around 8 inches, but the height of this cake is only 2 inches! The cost is $36.00, which is pricey for a cake that is only 2 inches tall. Some other reviews have described Schubert's cakes as being the texture of the less expensive Asian cakes that are sold throughout the neighborhood. I agree with these comments. The texture of the cake is light and the chocolate flavor is weak, like many of the Asian cakes that I frequently buy. I, like many people, enjoy the light, airy, and less expensive cakes sold at Asian bakeries. But that's not what I go to a European bakery for. Black Forrest cakes should be chocolatey and have a texture like a European cake. The whipped cream was real and tasty, and the cherry purée wasn't too bad, although I would have liked it to be sweeter. But the height of this cake is not acceptable and this is where Schubert's can't compete with other European bakeries in San Francisco. If you are planning a party where your cake is the centerpiece of the dessert table, don't chose Schubert's because you will be disappointed. If the flavors were exceptional, I might overlook the size. But this is not the case. My guests suggested that I try Safeway's Black Forrest cake, so I bought one the other day. It was half the price! It was tall, had real whipped cream, tasty cherries, and I was pleasantly surprised.  I have heard good things about Ambrosia bakery, so I plan on trying out their Black Forrest cake. Schubert's should increase the height of their cake by at least 2 inches to compete with the other European bakeries. It would also help if they change the batter of the chocolate cake so that it isn't so bland.
author: Kathy R.

description:
I heard this place is really good. It's good, but not good enough for me to go to the city.  Even if I happen to be in the area in the future, I don't think I'd return unless I was craving pastries and needed an immediate fix. (But hopefully that will never happen.)
Parking near the store is horrible, but if you are with someone else, drop them off to buy, then turn right on 6th and just before Geary, park and wait, as there's a loading zone.
author: Roger B.

description: We came for the princess cake. It wasn't very good. The fondant wasn't good. Cake was moist but we didn't finish it.
author: Nicole J.

description:
This bakery is delicious! They have some "special" offerings which I assume are like older cakes for about $3.15 each, and the normal cakes are around $4-5 each.

I had the Swedish Princess and the Chocolate Mousse cake, and both were delicious. The cake was covered in this beautiful yellow marzipan, and it had this excellent blend of a sweet taste with a touch of an almond flavor. It was also smooth and not too sweet, which made it quite nice. The cream in the middle with the raspberry sauce melded together beautifully with the soft cake. It all came together quite nicely.

The chocolate mousse was pretty good as well, with a rich chocolaty taste, with a good douse of cream to make it an extravagant indulgence.

My friends got the cheesecake and the apricot/almond tart. Both of those however weren't as good. I didn't like the cheesecake all that much, and while the tart was decent, I'm not a big fan of apricot.

Overall a great bakery with tasty options!
author: Tyler T.

description:
SWEETS GALORE! This place hits my sweet tooth spot every time. Whatever type of sweets you're craving, they'll have it. Chocolate, fruity, chocolate-fruity? 

I've only been here twice but I've tried the mango mousse (personal favorite), chocolate mousse, and chocolate truffle. The mango mousse is absolutely perfect-- it's not overly sweet and it's so light and fluffy that you don't feel too stuffed afterward. I preferred the chocolate mousse over the chocolate truffle. The truffle was super dense and rich-- it's the type of cake you'd just eat a small slice of and not binge-eat the whole thing like I usually do. I think of the chocolate mousse as a lighter version that'll hit your chocolate craving without making you feel guilty afterward.
author: Andrea K.

description: I've been getting cakes from Schubert's for a couple of years and being loving their cakes. Almost every birthday we get cakes from here and I highly recommend this place.
author: Liliana P.

description:
I highly recommend this bakery for their cakes- creativity, flavors, taste and customer service are all awesome and excellent. This is probably one of the best and first French-style Chinese cakes to ever exist in SF Chinatown which also hold a place for locals when there are celebrations, or any special occassion to congregate. Mousse cakes and Swedish Princess cakes are well-presented.
They even have a small delicacy where you can enjoy when you are down.
author: Jade M.

description:
Schubert's is great! They have beautiful cakes that are very beautiful and delicious. 

I've tried two of their cakes, the chocolate mouse cake and the mango mouse cake. Prices are reasonable. 

Expect to pay $23-45 depending on the size. 

Great customer service, my bf and I stopped by to pick up a cake for our friends bday and they custom wrote, "happy birthday" on a white chocolate bar and it was great. It took a little longer than expected but either the manager or owner of the shop gave us a free bag of almond cookies for the wait - although its something small, still great to know that they acknowledge that we are still there and that we waited! 

I suggest checking this place out!!
author: Michelle D.

description:
Everything is really amazing here, both in taste and pure visual delight. 

But for me, it's all about the blueberry scones. Not your mama's dry-n-crumbly pucks, no sir. These are crisp on the outside, but inside are juuuuuust moist enough that they can be eaten without dunking. Best I've had, although I bet there are some scone purists out there who don't consider these authentic. 

Go, go go, and try everything.
author: Greg J.

description:
This is our go to place for birthday cakes for everybody in our family.
Always fresh and tasty. I also like the cookies a lot.
author: George B.

description:
My go-to bakery for cakes. Princess cake is hands down best in the Bay Area. Everything is delicious! 
Their presentation of cakes is beautiful with rich details and colors. Staff is friendly and efficient. I always special order things for my fam and always look forward to coming back (prob bc I can prob eat half a princess cake to myself - it's that good...)
author: Jin Z.

description:
My go to place when I need to grab and go with great cake. Just go early in the day before they start to sell out

Their selection is solid: cakes, mousses, cheese cakes, tarts, and pastries are all there! I love how most of the cakes feature fresh fruit on top or in the cake and the fact that they don't over do it on the sugar. I can actually taste the flavors and not just the sugar eating away at my teeth!

I will usually grab the Swedish Princess cake and another. The princess cake is just as great as everyone says, very unique textures and refreshing flavor. The black currant mousse also another favorite it has a light fluffy texture with a creamy mousse yet a very rich flavorful black currant cream layer on top. 

If you want they can also write a message for you on a neat chocolate note card!
author: Yosof R.

description:
Two Saturdays ago on an early afternoon, I was here.

Now I'm not a fruity person, but their apricot tart is really good. A person who loves fruit might say otherwise. But it really hit the spot and wasn't overly sweet. I'm glad this was picked out for me.

4.5-5 rating.
author: Lilian L.

description: Delicious princess cake!! Usually I really dislike heavy frosting but this place has got it figured out! The frosting on the princess cake is so light, fluffy and tasty. This is one of our go-to cakes for celebrations.
author: Emily Y.

description:
we had strawberry mousse,mango mousse, chocolate mousse and some other pastries. 
I expected  a lot about mango mousse.. Because usually mango mousse is my favorite one. But I found the one in here wouldn't be my favorite after I tried..same as strawberry mousse too. 
Their mousse cakes are a little foamy. Some people might like it but not me.. 
Chocolate mousse is the only one real mousse i felt. So among those, Chocolate mousse is my favorite as for the taste. But my happiness lasted only until I found some piece of plastic paper from my mouth while I was eating the chocolate mousse cake..
Pastries were ok..The raisin pastry is better one.. 
But overall I couldn't find the point what makes this place popular in terms of taste, price, service...
author: JS P.

description:
This is my absolute favorite German cake place in town!  The mango mouse and the double chocolate cakes are my favorites as they are amazingly delicious and beautifully decorated.  

A whole cake or cake by a slice are quite reasonable in price.  The place has only a few tables and chairs so take out is ideal. 

People working here are very nice and polite. It's nice to come here for cakes!

Always stop by when I'm near the area!  Have never tried the princess cake.  Will try it next time!
author: Ivory B.

description:
I love the cakes from Schubert's! They offer an assortment of flavors and sizes that are beautifully decorated and perfect for any occasion. My favorite is the chocolate mousse with almonds. The cake is extremely moist and topped with rich creamy chocolate that's complemented perfectly with the extra crunch of almonds. 

For special occasions, I'd go with the Mango Mousse, one of their most popular flavors or the Raspberry or Tropical Mousse. I recommend calling in advance to reserve your cake as they do run out of selections quickly on weekends. Sometimes, you're able to reserve a cake last minute if you call in the morning of. 

Parking is challenging in the area so I bring a friend along for a quick pickup.
author: Kristy L.

description: My fiance has been a fan of Schubert's ever since I met him. We've tried an assortment of their desserts and so far our favorite is the swedish princess cake. He recently introduced me to it and when I tried it, I was hooked. The cake is so fluffy and the custard and whipped cream were so delectable. The best part for me was the raspberry though. I don't know why but it just melded so well with everything else and gave it a refreshing tang but it wasn't sour. The outside marzipan icing is a bit sweet but also adds an extra element of chewiness to the whole thing. I think all of their desserts are amazing.
author: Christine L.

description:
My boyfriend got me my 21st birthday cake and it was delicious! My boyfriend ordered my birthday cake a couple days before my birthday and it was a smooth process! He ordered the cake online and was able to put a message on the cake very easy! He was able to pick the day of pick up and exactly what time he'll pick it up which is nice because their flexible! The day of my birthday, he picked up the cake with no problems!

My boyfriend got the medium chocolate cake! It was big enough to feed 15 people! 

Highly recommend :)
author: Katty X.

description:
Heard a lot about this place and was in the area today so decided to drop by. This place is more of a cake shop as it mostly sells cakes, and some tarts.

The tarts looked good and I was really tempted as I'm not a huge fan of mouse based bakes or
Tiramisu, but being my first time here, I had to try their most popular cake - the Swedish princess.

It was ok, but not really my style and I don't know what the hype is about. Not sure I'll be back, but it's a cute little shop.
author: Cynthia X.

description:
My amazing coworkers surprised me with this incredible marzipan princess cake from Schubert's for my birthday. I love princess cakes (literally my favorite cake) but I haven't had one this beautiful before. It even has little truffles and macaroons on it. Just exquisite! 

Taste-wise, it was moist, sweet, and just so delicious. This cake really made my birthday special. I will definitely order from them when another birthday comes around.
author: Jessica D.

description: Amazing Swedish Princess cake. From the raspberry jam layer to the custard to the whipped cream filling, the components complimented each other perfectly. Nothing was too sweet and the jam wasn't too tart. Typically I'll take a bite to taste the marzipan at other places, but it was so good here I ate it all! Definitely try it if you are a fan of princess cake or cake in general :)
author: Tammy H.

description:
Service at this bakery has gone to the toilet. First, they don't ever answer the phone. Why have a phone and not answer it? We called for 2 HRs straight and no one picked up. When we get there and ask them why they didn't answer the phone, they said they were busy. So we drove across town to find out they don't have the cake we need. 

On a separate occasion (today), we got the cake we want but they refused to write "Happy Birthday" on the cake. They told us they can only write "Happy Thanksgiving"! Unbelievable! 

Never again will we give them our business. I only give them 2 stars because of the quality of the cake in the past.
author: Tracy L.

description: Super busy which is a good sign, get there early as the later in the day select gets slim. Cake are out of this world
author: Murrough M.

description: Grabbed 3 different desserts from here while in SF. Their princess cake is their speciality but I am personally not a big fan of it myself. All the desserts we took for take away were good. The pastries were very fresh and Price's were very reasonable. If you are looking to pick up a last minute birthday cake, head to this bakery.
author: Samhita R.

description:
Great bakery with a lovely staff! Called ahead a few days and got a beautifully decorated tiramisu cake for my boyfriend's birthday. 

The cake itself looked delicious with a white chocolate ganache name placard and elaborate decorations. The tiramisu flavors were great - just the right amount of a light fluffiness. I would prefer to up the intensity on the espresso flavor and depth of booziness, but it was still delicious. Check this place out if you're in need of ordering a cake!
author: Chandani D.

description:
Best bakery!  I love their cakes especially for a special occasion.  I just ordered a "Strawberry Cake" with fresh strawberries and whipped cream (my favorite) for a birthday.  It was fresh and delicious! 
If you know what you want order it ahead just so they don't run out of your special cake.  There are so many choices and they also carry a lot of other bakery goodies!  Yummy, yummy, yummy!
Oh and the decorations on top of the cake are all edible and it's always a beautiful and yummy presentation.

Very friendly atmosphere and service is a Plus!
author: Wayne P.

description:
Interior: It's what you would imagine a bakery would look like. So much color and beautiful pastries, cakes on display. They definitely know how to make their products look appetizing.

Service: When it was busy, the employees would ask if they could help the next person. When it slowed down, I walked up to the register and awkwardly stood there for 2 minutes or so waiting for someone to approach me. I don't know what the standard etiquette is for bakeries, but if you're in front of the cash register with you wallet out and trying to make eye contact, you'd think they would say something. In the end, I just asked if someone could help me. So don't wait, just ask. 

Food: My sister and I shared a fruit tart because I wanted something somewhat healthy looking. I really enjoyed this tart because it was on the sweeter side. The fruits were all sweet and tasty too! The best part was that I didn't feel guilty eating it. I would recommend it!

Overall, definitely worth a visit! I would go back for more when I visit SF again.
author: Helen H.

description:
Even a half hour before closing time, they still had quite the selection. 

Their plain cheesecake was a little on the creamier side (not much grainy texture) but the taste was spot on. The crust was not a typical graham cracker crumbly crust, but it worked.

Princess cake was fantastic - the best I've had since going to Sweden. Light, not too sweet, so fresh tasting.

Almond sables, available by the bag on the counter, is the best cookie I've had in a long time. Perfectly crunchy and great almond flavor and buttery. I already can't wait to come back!!
author: Christina G.

description:
This is my absolute favorite cake shop in San Francisco! I've ordered multiple cakes from them because they are consistently delicious, beautiful, and moist. 
Earlier this week, I ordered a sheet cake on their website for a baby shower at work. My coworker picked it up today and it didnt have any writing on it. I called the bakery to see what happened because it looked so bare. The older asian lady that I initially spoke with was rude and unhelpful, but luckily she handed me off to the owner of the bakery. He was such a gentleman. He offered to come to the office and write on the cake. A couple hours later, he showed up with everything needed to decorate the cake (and even added some baby decorations). Not only did he make the cake look perfect just in time for the party, he brought us a box of cookies for the inconvenience. He explained that they were planning on updating their website soon and apologized for the mixup. 
Though the missing cake message and rude woman on the phone would normally be a reason I'd lower the rating, the customer service and every other cake I've gotten from them more than make up for it. There were nothing but compliments from everyone at the party. They loved the cake.
author: Soli Z.

description:
Always my go to for picking up a cake either for a special occasion or battling a bad day. Cakes are always consistent and service is friendly.

My only gripe is that whoever writes the names for birthday cakes need to practice writing. If you don't pre order your cake. Likely the writing will look like more of an unprofessional scribble versus the elegant pre ordered cake look. 

Otherwise. Prices are decent. There's usually parking right out in front on weekdays. Weekends are a doozy as Clement street is poppin'
author: Kay H.

description:
Schubert's is definitely a well-known bakery in San Francisco, known for their huge selection of cakes and sweets. My family and I ordered their princess cake for our relative's birthday. It looked very beautiful and different from other cakes I've seen, in that it has a firm yellow layer on the outside. The cake itself was good -- the inside had layers of sponge cake with some whipped cream and raspberry sandwiched in between. Raspberry was a very unique flavor that went very well with the sweetness of the cake However, the outer yellow marzipan layer was, in my opinion, not that good -- it was way too sweet and didn't mesh well with the softness of the cake.

If I were to go back, I would definitely try one of the other options.
author: Alvin W.

description:
Updating. Schubert's STILL can do no wrong. That chocolate cake really is my kryptonite. So moist, so fluffy, so sweet and tasty.

It's the key to my heart. And pharm reps know this. Keep it coming!
author: Fanny W.

description:
Best. Cake. Ever. No really though - I've eaten a lot of cakes in my day and the napoleon cake is truly a best in class item. Get your butt out to Schubert's and treat yo self to a flaky, crunchy, creamy and fresh concoction that defines everything a cake should be. This is a destination worthy food and I'd highlight as a worthwhile detour for out of town guests. 

The slices go for about $4, but I recommend ordering a whole cake as it's quite a bit less costly per serving (at $35 for the smallest size) and let  me tell you, you're going to want seconds, thirds and maybe eighths. To ensure they don't sell out on you, I recommend ordering the cake online ahead of time; usually a day or two in advance is sufficient. 

The only real negative is that this cake does not keep well, so be sure to invite some friends to enjoy with you that first day!
author: Stephanie T.

description: Got a Swedish princess cake for my gfs birthday and I was not disappointed.  I've never had this kind of cake before and it might be the best cake I've ever had.   I also tried their mango and tropical mousse cakes which were great.  I'm already trying to come up with my next special occasion I can buy a cake for.  Prices here are very reasonable as well
author: Shawn A.

description:
Came by Schubert's on a Saturday afternoon for a post-lunch dessert. I was confused about what to get as soon as I walked in because everything looked so good! There were cakes, cheesecakes, mousse, eclairs, etc. You basically peruse the display case and then place your order.

I am a chocolate fiend so I had to try the chocolate truffle cake. I also really wanted to try the swedish princess cake since it seemed to be a crowd favorite. Oh my god, can we talk about the Swedish Princess Cake? It was absolutely delicious. Light, creamy, and flavorful without being to sweet. The fondant on top was not my favorite, but hey the rest of the cake was extremely good. The chocolate truffle cake was also quite good! Very rich, but not overly sweet. I think the swedish princess cake just became my favorite cake flavor ever. It was a complete delight to eat and I regretted not getting more of it.

Seating is limited (~3 tables with maye 3-4 chairs each) so you'll most likely have to take the cake to go unless you come in when there isn't much of a crowd. I decided to grab cake and walk over to Golden Gate Park to consume it~

Overall, this is a very solid bakery. I would highly recommend that you try it out, especially if you are in the area!
author: Lakshmi M.

description: Really tasty cakes and pastries that won't break your bank, highly recommended for a snack or a birthday cake. Their coffee is meh though
author: Balu V.

description: We get mousse cakes and apple strudels or pies from here. I really love Schubert's! Great desserts all the time..always satisfying.
author: Denise C.

description: This bakery has the best chocolate mousse cake and princess cake! Staff is always very friendly and helpful and I'm never disappointed in the presentation and tastiness of their cakes. I feel like they are very consistent and always produce good quality cakes every time I order from here. Never had a better princess cake for sure.
author: Christina C.

description:
Love this bakery!
We can't imagine our birthdays without this bakery's cake. Their products are perfect for all occasions!
author: Dilrabohon I.

description:
This is my go to special occasions bakery place. It's such a gem of a place that has been open for decades. My favorites are:
- Mango Mousse $4.55: sadly they ran out this past weekend- probably because it was that good!
- Tiramisu $4.55- one of the lightest ones I have ever had with deep flavor and it is addictingly good! Like seriously.
- Raspberry Mousse $4.55- this was airy had a mildly sweet and tart flavor balance with fresh raspberries to top it off. Yum!
- Mango cheesecake $4.55- this is surprisingly good. Trying it for the first time this weekend was such a delight. 

The princess cake is what they are known for, but I prefer more mildly sweet and light flavors more so then robust and sweet. 

This place is a must go if you like pastries, I mean come on they have 1000+ 4.5 star reviews.
author: Melissa N.

description:
Very delicious cakes and really well  organized, clean store. Even price is doable, I would highly recommend you  come and try it. 
My favorite cake is - Opera cake  I always order it make my friends happy
author: Khusan A.

description: Unpopular opinion here! I've been to Schubert's several times before and their cakes and pastries are good, but just not that good. I'd say quality and taste is comparable to Cocola bakery. Their sponge cakes have an artificial taste and too weak to hold up to the moisture of mousses and jams. I got the tiramisu mini cake last week and it lacked coffee or any depth of flavor. The quality of the chocolate flakes they use is also sub-par. I will say their Napoleon pastries and cakes are their better products. Otherwise for good quality pastries, try places like Tartine or b patisserie where you can taste the quality. They use ingredients like Valrhona chocolate.
author: Melissa N.

description:
Princess cake oh my is to die for actually most of the cakes are pretty good too 
I won't give 5 stars because I am still waiting for the baker to uau me 
If you need a cake order in advance most of time their are sold out
author: A. M.

description:
If you find yourself in Inner Richmond or thereabouts, make a quick trip to Schubert's to satisfy your sweet tooth now (or later). And please don't let challenging parking turn you away. Park a few blocks away from Clement for a few quarters or for free; it's really not bad.

Their bakery cases are such a beautiful sight with all the colorful cakes and other desserts. Unlike other bakeries, they are well stocked too. We've come several times in the afternoon and luckily they were full.

Both the Swedish Princess Cake and the Mousse Cakes were recommended so we got those. The mousse on the Mango Mousse Cake had a nice flavor and texture, but the bottom cake part was dry. Both the Chocolate Mousse Cake and the slide of Swedish Princess Cake on the other hand were fantastic, and I'm not a cake person.

For those unfamiliar with Swedish Princess Cake, their variety is layers of white cake with raspberry and kirsch custard filling, whipped cream and marzipan icing. The cake was nice and fluffy, and went well with all the other layers. I love that you can buy it by the slice too, without committing to an entire cake. Highly recommend a slice for a sweet treat or one of their larger desserts for an occasion.
author: Lindsey C.

description:
Schubert's Bakery has some of the best cakes in all of San Francisco, and even writing this now makes me want to order a cake immediately!

If this is your first time coming here, I highly recommend trying the Black Forest Cake or the Mango Mousse Cake. Both are customer favorites and highly recommended by the bakery itself. One thing to note about the Mango Mouse Cake is that the cake is 80-90% mousse and only 10% of cake, so if you're looking for something more traditional in terms of cake to non-cake ratio, I would opt for the Black Forest Cake. I've also tried their famous Princess cake, but the marzipan covering was a bit too sweet for me, so if prefer less sweet desserts, I would definitely opt for the tangy mousse cakes.

Do beware what some of the other Yelpers have said about dry cake! There ARE dry cakes, and this seems to mostly happen with some of the individual, small cakes they have on display that may have been sitting there for days. If you want to guarantee yourself a fresh, moist cake, make sure to place an order online 2 days before and then pick it up yourself in-store.
author: Yuan J.

description:
I really enjoy coming to this bakery. It always smells great, and the workers there are extremely nice. I called in for an order of mango mousse cake for my gf's birthday. They had it ready right when I asked and even put some nice looking words on it for me.

The cake was delicious - the mango mousse cake was amazing. It was perfectly sweet but not over-powering. Consistency was on point and you the mousse was just so well made. The actual cake on the mousse cake was really good too. Overall, service was quick and still personal, and the pastries, not just the mango mousse was absolutely wonderful.
author: Julian H.

description:
I was recommended this bakery by a friend because I need to pick up a cake for a friends bday. I was going to SF for the weekend from San Jose and thought I would just get a cake in the city. I was tempted to get the tiramisu cake but after doing further research, we noticed that the Princess Cake was super popular and highly reviewed. 

I ordered the cake online which was super easy and convenient. I ordered the cake 4 days in advance and set the pick up time for 11am the following Saturday. As usual, my friends are never on time and I needed to pick up the cake later in the day around 1:30pm. I tried calling multiple times to push back the pick up time but I guess they don't answer the phones on Saturdays. When we arrived to the bakery at 1:30ish, we were in and out in less than 5 mins. No hassle for coming late, just a big smile and a pretty interesting looking cake. 

Ok into how it tasted. IT WAS DELICIOUS! Although the cake was not aesthetically pleasing, it definitely makes up in taste. It was nice and moist. Sweet but not too sweet. The filling gave the cake a great refreshing taste. Hands down a great cake that everyone should try!
author: Brandolph T.

description: I think hands down they are the best bakery in town. There cakes have right portion of sweetness, cream and bread. I love their Pastries, Cakes and croissant. They did our baby shower cake and also my daughter's first bday cake. All of my guests loved their cake.
author: AJAY G.

description:
SO DELICIOUS. I wish I lived here so I could get a slice of cake every day. We came here after getting lunch down the street at B Star Bar for some sweet dessert. They have whole cakes for sale at a very reasonable price (starting around $24 for a 6"), and slices for around $4.55 each. We got the following slices:

Neopolitan ($4.55): such an amazing cake. The whipped cream was smooth, creamy, and light and airy on the tongue. The pastry underneath was flaky and super crunchy, and the fresh fruit on the top made it look beautiful and added some much-appreciated freshness to the cake. I could eat 5 of these at once.
Tiramisu mousse ($4.55): very beautifully presented, complete with a tiny Schubert's sign made of white chocolate. The mousse itself was smooth and decadent, and had a strong coffee flavor. We enjoyed both desserts very much and ate every last crumb off of the plate.

Will definitely be back whenever I am in the area in SF!
author: Amy C.

description: I ordered a whole cake for this past Christmas and it was perfect! Their strawberry shortcake is just amazing. I'll def return to buy whole cakes again. Ordering over the phone and the pick up process is also very easy.
author: Soo L.

description:
Best cakes ever!!!!!!!! Although parking is a b-word, I would say worth it if you can score parking easily. Otherwise, drop someone off and have them pick up the cake for you. Luckily, my friend and I swooped right in when someone was coming out of a parking spot. It was on MLK Day, so beware that on holidays other than Christmas, New Year's or Thanksgiving, you still have to feed the meter. Please refer to the SF Parking website for more specific info & to fact-check me. 

Back to the cakes: I've had their cakes before so I knew I was in for a treat. My friend and I ordered the large round mango cake and included a special message. It cost about $40 dollars. We brought it over to a friends party, gathering. It was such a huge hit! Practically finished when we got there. The cake itself was super moist and not too sweet. I loved the gel icing on the cake! And it was complete with beautiful chocolate flowers & raspberries for design and to add different colors. For sure if I lived close to one of these babies, I'd be coming more often.
author: Brittany D.

description:
Yes. 

We were watching the great british baking show and we saw this princess cake being made by the contestants for a technical. Schubert's has a slice of that and opera cake and we knew we had to try it. They were both delicious and highly recommend them. 

Protip: slices of cake
author: Nina Y.

description:
HALLELUJAH. That's what I wanted to say when I took my first bite of the the chocolate mousse cake (with ganache and shavings. because they have a few variations). It has got to be one of the best chocolate mousses I've ever had. Creamy dark chocolate just melting in my mouth.

Also tried the tiramisu which was heavenly as well. Light, creamy, boozy. 

I just wish they're Napoleon cake came in an individual mini size. I mean, I could buy the whole thing, but I probably shouldn't finish it.
author: Jen P.

description:
This bakery was great. I ordered a (same day ) birthday cake for my main squeeze and it was the Swedish Princess cake.  I asked if it could be ready with added text and they did it in two hours. 

I am not one of those guys that's plans thing way out in advance and I rarely order cakes, so for them to be so accommodating was great! As long as I continue to live in the inner richmond, I will continue to get sweets from here.
author: Shaun C.

description:
Schuberts is one of those SF staples. It's been around since as long as I can remember. I think my 10th birthday cake came out with this neon green exterior and the oddest texture but once you got past it (marzipan), there was a delicious fluffy sponge cake and mysterious red fruit jam layer (because I was too unsophisticated to tell the difference between my tart berries). It was the Swedish princess cake! Since then I can't really handle more than a slice at a time, but it's still amazing and the highlight of their shop! 

Some other things I've tried (small slices/desserts $4-5): 
+ tiramisu is one of their best with the fluffiest lady fingers, not too sweet, and not overpowering in any way but a perfect balance of coffee and cream. 

+ mango mousse is not a favourite because the base/surrounding sponge cake has such a hard texture that is too stark in contrast with the lightness mango filling. I wish the mango flavour came out a tad bit more to give it that oomph and tang. 

+opéra cake (not pictured) is also just not my cup of tea. The chocolate is certainly well done, and a touch of it is on all the cakes-- tiny Schubert bakery written on a piece of white chocolate and beautiful milk chocolate flowers. But the opera cake is sorta like a torte.. the hard textured layers just have not balance with any mouse or cream. 

+mysterious summer seasonal cake: it was surrounded with their awesome chocolate ganache with layers of white and chocolate cake and raspberry layer, it was bomb and I recommend trying it if you see it in the pastry box! 

At the end of writing this, there are equal amounts of dislikes and likes but schuberts is one of those bakeries that does it all and does it well enough that anyone with any preference can find something they like! 

P.s. Come early because I wanted to grab a princess cake slice to relive my childhood, but they were out of the small slices by 3 pm!
author: Kimberly Y.

description: I've been coming here for a while now and this place has wonderful cakes. They make them so good and decorate them nicely as well. The time that I came here was a weekend so there was a very big line but once I got to the cashier my cake was all ready for me to pick up. Definitely would keep on coming here if I needed another cake.
author: Albert Z.

description:
Honestly, it is a bit overrated. Perhaps because of the hype, i expected too much. We ordered the signature princess cake and italian rum cake. 

The princess cake was too sweet with a thick yellow layer outside; it also tasted like cough syrup. The inner cake was alright: moist and not too sweet. I finished the princess cake without the yellow layer. 

The italian rum cake was decent. However, i wouldn't recommend it to others, esp my friends living in the south.

A star is for the italian rum cake while the other star is for friendly service.
author: Lily M.

description: Super good desserts. Not too sweet. We had mango cheesecake, strawberry cheesecake, fruit tart and raspberry pistachio tart! All delicious.
author: Laura S.

description: Have been coming here for years, and their cakes are always my favorite. Great service, and still I cannot seem to find any quality cakes around SF that are comparable!
author: Kelvin Y.

description:
I've been coming here for 10 years, and Schubert's is still my favorite bakery in the Bay Area. Their cakes are consistent in quality, fresh, and reasonably priced. The chocolate varieties are good but tend to be on the sweeter side, so I usually get the princess cake or fruit mousse cakes which are so delicious.

On a recent visit, I spotted a slice of pineapple coconut cake in the corner (first time seeing this flavor here) and gave it a try. It was light, fluffy, and full of piña colada flavor. Mmm... another one to add to the yummy list!
author: Tina H.

description:
Prelim review:
Sometimes a 5-star rating is supposed to mean 4.5 rounded up. Schubert's is truly a 5.0 star bakery. Presentation, taste, uniqueness, service... all perfect.
author: Andrew H.

description: Finally made the trek out here on a day off from work to get a slice of my all time favorite princess cake. Only a few bakeries offer this cake but this place makes it the best. The European way with multiple layers and marzipan that doesn't get soggy. It's just really good.
author: Debbie L.

description: My wife favorite bakery!!! She comes here to  buy our sons birthday cake! And pastries. Definitely delicious
author: Jay R.

description:
Love this bakery!
Their mousse cakes and princess cakes and opera cakes and Napoleon are so good!
Staff are amazing and kind!!
Always can write anything on your cake but would be best to pro order the opera cake or the napoleon cake!!
author: Lydia B.

description: This is based on just one item - their Princess sheet cake. Light, flavorful, lovely marzipan layer. Friends were celebrating a wedding and a birthday... so it was only right to have two pieces....
author: Marla P.

description:
I'm never..never..never in this neighborhood so when I was rolling in the passenger side of my good friends ride (but I wasn't a TLC "scrub" I swear).   I said..."I think I have somewhere around here bookmarked". 

Sure enough Schubert's popped up and wouldn't fate have  it..we were going to a special event as well! 

I asked the young lady what they were known for and she indicated that the Swedish Princess Cake was the "goods" and I was sold.  

From the website: Swedish Princess Cake:  "One of our all time classics; our delicious white cake layers with raspberry and kirsch custard filling, whipped cream and marzipan icing " 

I bought a whole cake and shared it with some close friends and we all agreed that it was unique and very tasty as others have pointed out.

I like lists what can I say? 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. 

Here is a look at how I rank the SF Bakeries I've visited and I indicated what they're known for or a dish I recommend:

Rod's SF Bakery rankings (and what they're known for or what I like). ?) Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.

2 B Patisserie=Choco Bannana croissant
3 Zanze's Cheesecake=Regular cheesecake
4 Ariscault =Croissant
5 Yasukochis=Coffee Crunch Cake
6 Chili Pies Baking Co=Pies

9 Mr Holmes Bakehouse=Green tea croissant ,Cruffin, 
10 La Luna Cupcakes=cupcakes
11 Three Babes Bakeshop=pies
12 Anthony's Cookies=Cookies
13 New Hollywood Bakery=Egg tart
14 Dianda's Italian American Pastry=Napoleon , Cannoli
15 Mission Pies=Banana Cream Pie
16 Schubert=Swedish Princess cake
17 Yummy Bakery=egg tarts
18 Stella Pastry & Café=Cannoli , Tiramisu
19 Craftsman & Wolves=Rebel within
20 Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop=any donut 
21 Noe Valley Bakery=dipped cupcake
22 Café Greco=Cannoli 
23 Kings Bakery=Tres leches cake
24 Benkyodo Co=mochi
25 Cupcake cove=cupcakes
26 Cups and Cakes Bakery=cupcakes
27 Good Mong Kok Bakery=dim sum
28 Karas cupcake=cupcakes
29 Mission Minis=cupcakes
30 Sift Dessert=cupcakes
31 Tartine Bakery=lemon tart
32 Jane The Bakery=matcha twist , cardamom Lattice Bun
33 Café Madeline=various goods
34 Panaderia La Mexicana=mexican sweet bread
35 Hot cookie=Cookies
36 Les Gourmands Bakery=Croissant
37 Mee Mee Bakery=Cow ears
rs
author: Rod M.

description:
Got a Princess Cake for a dinner party and let me just tell you... unbelievable, delicious, gorgeous, hit of the night, crazy yummy, best money on dessert ever. 

That's a fact.
author: ash E.

description: My brother and his gf got the princess cake for my birthday and it was soooooooooo goooood! My husband is usually very picky about food and cakes and he says he never had such a tasty and delicious . The best cake i ever had  thank you
author: Narges N.

description: The pastries are amazing. I had the almond pear tart and it was amazing. The coffee was not great but the baked goods more than make up for it
author: Vera P.

description: My husband and I purchased our wedding cake from Schubert's 13 years ago!  We did their cake testing and ordered the opera cake in a three tiered style.  The staff did a fabulous job putting the layers together and our guests were surprised to indulge in a slice.  We froze the top layer and for our one year anniversary had the last of the cake.  It was not as wonderful as when fresh but still flavorful.  We moved away from the SF Bay and once a year on our anniversary we would take the Amtrak train and head to Schubert's for a piece of the rich cake.  Through the years we have moved farther east and searched for a cake similar to the Schubert's opera cake, to no avail.  Our anniversary was this week and my husband's request was to eat a slice of Schubert's Opera Cake!
author: Karen S.

description:
The quality and decadence of these scrumptious sweet cakes and pastries are so darn delicious. From the cute intricate designs, the fluffiness of the cakes/pastries, and the satisfying tastes are definite reasons to stop by. 
***Note: Parking can be a pain, ESPECIALLY on Clement St. and it is all meter based or if you park far enough to do residential.
author: Stacey M.

description:
Princess cake has been a hit at many family events: showers, baptisms. 
It never fails.
This bakery has been a family favorite since before we were born. 

Classic same dangerously delicious cakes (plus fancier ones), same yummy tastes, higher price tag... cause it's in SF, son.
author: Athena S.

description: This little gem was recommended to me by a coworker. They are famous for their Swedish Princess cake, but they do not sell a small individual sized version of it. My sister and I opted for a mango mousse cake, which, while it was delicious, was not as tasty as it looked. I still look forward to when I have an excuse to buy a Swedish Princess cake!
author: Alice L.

description: Bought the opera cake for my boyfriend's birthday. Tbh, everyone raves about it but I don't know why. It's not bad but it's definitely not as great as everyone makes it out to be. Way too sweet...the cake also isn't as moist as I typically would like. Not a win for me.
author: Cynthia H.

description: Just craving for some sweets...and yes, I got out of there super satisfied with their pear tarts, and chocolate mousse. Best taste ever! Looove it!!! We also tried their mango mousse, peach mousse, and plain cheesecake but it's nothing compared to the chocolate mousse. Even my 1 year old and husband, who's not a chocolate lover, preferred it over anything else. I'm definitely coming back for their chocolate mousse that's for sure.
author: Glenna C.

description:
Not to shabby for their baked goods, sampled their cinnamon bun, bacon & egg criossant, and a danish crushed from head to toe with mixed nuts. 

We were in the area looking for sweets, this place did not disappoint, several cakes to choose from as well as other smaller pastries

We sampled several of their pastries here is how we felt about each one, the cinnamon bun was light and fluffy not hard or dense, not to sweet, made just right

The bacon and egg criossant was decent, criossant was light eggs and bacon always puts a smile on my face

The danish with crushed nuts was delicious, must try, I recommend it, if you like crushed nuts and danish's it is definite must

Ice cold milk for my son with his cinnamon bun he stated delicious with his at the time 4 new teeth

Pastries **** must try cakes next
Price $
Service ***** 
Ambiance **** very clean
author: Clarence A.

description:
This bakery has a German/Austrian name but it's really all about the cake. My favorite so far is the Mango cake with light mango mousse and creative chocolate pieces on top.

I like that the cakes are not loaded with cream and heavy ingredients, and that they are definitely more on the fruitier side, nicely decorated.

Cake galore, my friend.
author: Sebastian F.

description: The princess cake is the bomb. The mazipan has just the right amount of sweetness. The other cakes are tasty too. I particularly liked the black Forrest here. Most of the cakes actually taste taiwanese style. The cream is very light and not super sweet. There are alot of different mouse/pudding options.
author: Diane Z.

description: My go to bakery for birthday cakes for the past 20 years!  We love the chocolate mousse with fresh strawberries cake. Order 3 days in advance and ask for last fingers around the cake.  The chocolate mousse is not too sweet with a deep rich decadent chocolate. This will surely cure any chocolate craving!
author: Kim T.

description:
Great cakes and personalizing available at no extra cost.  Bought a 6" cheesecake for my fiancés birthday and they did a nice job of personalizing the cake.  

What makes these cakes special are the decorative adornments which also happen to be delectable. 

Not to mention of course the cake itself was delicious.   Thanks Schubert's.
author: Dan O.

description: I'm one of the fortunate (or unfortunate) to live within walking distance to Shuberts.   This is best bakery I've been too.  The Swedish Princess cake is my absolute favorite and I just can't resist buying a slice whenever I pass by.
author: Acura Nsx T.

description: I am visiting from Southern California and I come to this bakery specifically for their Swedish Princess cake. Yellow marzipan icing and raspberry filling. Other bakeries sell something similar but nothing compares to Schubert's. The price of a full Princess cake is $35. A must try in San Francisco!
author: Katherine N.

description:
I ordered the Princess cake on line for my daughter's birthday.  When my nephew picked up the cake and brought it home, I was upset to see that the cake was not the green color that is pictured on line.  The cake was  a VERY UGLY AND UNAPPETIZING YELLOW.  I called and left a message with the bakery.  I asked that I get a call back.  Still have not received a phone call back.  I've purchased cakes from you many times before.  
Schubert's:  If a cake is going to be different than pictured on line, LET YOUR CUSTOMER KNOW.  We were very upset that the cake was a such an unappetizing color.  The bright green on the Princess cake pictured on line is my daughter's favorite color! The color was one of the primary reasons we ordered this cake. And the cake was over $40!  
FYI: you can only get in through the phone Monday thru Friday for orders.  Otherwise, you need to go in person.
author: Doris W.

description: Must try the napoleon cake before you die! We got our mom one for her birthday, let's just say it was a smash hit with everyone! 100% legit!
author: Karla G.

description:
Go to place for things Cakes in The City. Decorated to perfection. Maybe to perfect and scary perfect details on the cake. It's a Love Affair if you go down that path.

Quality beats Quantity any day. You pay for what you get.

Order the cake guys and be the hero. Been going
For years, never anywhere else. Bias maybe. But it is the Best. Amen and amen.
author: Paulie P.

description:
Let's be real, this place is a staple of San Francisco and The Richmond District as a whole. With that said, it blew my mind that I have yet to leave my obligatory 5 star review for Schubert's. I've been here so many times that I can't even count. Even when I was a kid my parents would take me here. 

This morning I stopped by for a danish with vanilla filling in the middle, and as usual, it was fantastic. I'm a big pastry guy, and I don't take it lightly when I say they have arguably the best danish in the city. For just under $3, it's absolutely worth the price considering how large it is, just tasty and perfect. Another underrated thing about Schubert's is that they serve Equator Coffee - a coffee chain based out of Marin - and it's one of the best. For 2 large danishes and 2 coffees, it's just under $10. Very reasonable for high quality coffee and pastry. All in all, this is one of my go to breakfast sports and if you're in need of a birthday cake, they have one of the best selections of cake in all of the city, and their reputation (1,400+ reviews and 4 1/2 stars) speaks for itself. Do yourself a favor and visit.
author: Alex B.

description: If you're like me, you'll need to exercise some serious self-control when walking into this bakery to refrain from buying WAY too many delectable confections.  Everything here is superb, but my favorite is the chocolate mousse cake.  Wonderful velvety smooth mousse with rich dark chocolate shavings and ganache.  Intense but not so heavy that it gives you a tummy ache!  The chocolate truffle cake is also really luscious, but that needs to be ordered in advance.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
Schuberts is a clement st. staple! It's been around for SOOO long, and it's because of their excellent service and deliciously beautiful desserts. 

Each of their delectable treats have uniquely eye-catching designs. Usually topped with a combination of fruits, creme, gelatin, or chocolate flecks. I find myself STARING into the glass cabinet of treats. My personal favorites are their strawberry shortcake and apple tart :) 

Schuberts is more for picking up desserts. There are only a few small tables inside the bakery to sit and enjoy your dessert. 

In addition to their beautifully decorated and delicious treats, they are very reliable for a quick job. I called Schubert's at 10am on a weekday, asked how long it would take to get a birthday cake with a personalized message on it. They said, 30 minutes and it will be ready! And it was. I arrived 30 min later and it was boxed and ready to go. 

Bottom Line: Schuberts is clutch for quick dessert jobs.
author: Jaime W.

description: Love this bakery. The best cakes are made here. Strawberry Shortcake is my absolute favorite. Cream Puffs are always fresh, even the next day or early morning ones are still good & even sometimes on special. Really everything is good here.
author: Cristal P.

description:
For all of the reviews and stars, this was WAY overrated to me. The chocolate croissant was terrible. The princess cake is decent, and very sweet. 

Neither option really made me want to come back. I could see ordering a cake here because the prices did seem reasonable and they were pretty, but I would stay away from the breakfast pastries.
author: Lauren A.

description: I've been enjoying Schubert's baked items for years, especially around Christmas time (e.g. Princess, Teramisu and Napoleon) but lately have noticed the quality and taste have gone down - I don't mind too much the price increases but Schubert's No.6 ranking among SF bakeries is enough proof for me.  I won't be returning anytime soon.
author: Paulus S.

description:
My now husband and I selected Schubert's to get our wedding cakes, as we didn't want traditional white cakes but rather sheets that would taste amazing. This bakery fit he bill and then some. We came in and bought mini versions of some cakes months before and decided the strawberry mousse and the triple chocolate were our winners. We ordered our cakes online and came to pick them up the day before the wedding. The staff was absolutely phenomenal and helped get the cakes into our car, wrapped them perfectly, and even gave us cookies to go.
All night long we had to field questions and provide directions to Schubert's for our guests, who ate probably three slices each and kept coming back for more.

What's great about their flavors is they don't make things cloyingly sweet and you feel the ingredients are high quality.

Thank you for everything, Schubert's. You made our day that much more special.
author: Arielle G.

description: Awesome! It is worth the trip to step into this curio cabinet of cakes! The princess cakes are delicate and beautiful, the shortbread cookies are perfect, chocolate mousse cake amazing. Helpful smiling customer service. Great place!
author: M M.

description: Love the Princess Cake!!!! Very yummy and I been coming here for years. Great service
author: Wena D.

description:
Old school bakeshop. 

Croissant - 3/5
Raspberry croissant - 2/5
Mango mousse cake - 4/5
Princess cake - 5/5 - 7x7

Overall, great bakery. Princess cake is worth its spot on the list. "As good as it gets."
author: Mark O.

description: I'm not writing any lengthy review. Go. Just go. Get. Get it all. The quality is stellar. The price terrific to value. Go. Stop reading and go.
author: Peddie A.

description:
I've purchased quite a few cakes here over the years, mostly for family get-togethers. I was surprised to find out this is a 100+ year-old German bakery. To me, it has a lot of the telltale signs of a typical Asian bakery with mousse-y cakes and lots of fruit topping. Maybe the neighborhood changed over the years and they added a few things to accommodate their clientele? But then I remind myself that Princess Cake, Opera Cake, Tiramisu, etc. are not Asian. Duh. Sometimes I forget, because it seems like many Asian-owned cake shops crank out some version of these cakes.

Cakes here are heavily decorated with glazes, fruits, chocolate flowers, chocolate shavings, etc. Most of the time, there isn't room on the cake to write 'Happy Birthday' or whatever occasion you're celebrating. So they usually write it on a white chocolate square, which is a little too sweet and not too pretty.

Swedish Princess Cake - not for me. I'm not a fan of marzipan or marzipan icing. It is good for decorative purpose and gives a smooth finish, but it has a gummy consistency, like fondant.
The filling is moist, but I just don't like the flavor of kirsch, or cherry liqueur.

Chocolate Mousse w/ Whipped Cream - moist inside, lots of whipped cream & chocolate shavings, topped with a few raspberries
Chocolate Mousse w/ Almonds - very chocolate-y with chocolate mousse filling & chocolate ganache, crunchy toasted almonds are a nice contrast

White Chocolate Raspberry Mousse - extra mousse-y with white chocolate mousse & raspberry mousse, topped with raspberry coulis and ladyfingers

St. Honore - lots of whipped cream, has layers of puff pastry, topped with cream puffs and lady fingers. The cream puffs are okay, could be lighter.

Tiramisu Mousse - sweet, moist, pretty light. Indistinguishable from a typical tiramisu with cocoa powder and ladyfingers. These are covered in chocolate shavings and more flower-shaped chocolates. The chocolate rectangles on the border are good, but kind of a pain because you have to remove all the chocolates to be able to slice the cake. By the time everyone has had some cake and some of the chocolates on top of the cake, nobody is interested in eating the chocolate squares.

It's a small bakery with a couple of tables for dining in. Cakes are about $30-$40 for an 8-10 inch. Service is usually more about efficiency than about being inviting, but that is understandable when it gets crowded, especially around closing time.

The cakes are good, but not my favorite as I don't love a lot of mousse or whipped cream. It's not my first choice for cake or for satisfying a sweet tooth. But it is a good option for birthdays or some other occasion when people get together to eat cake and be merry.
author: Joy W.

description:
Bites of bliss. I love cake and this is as good as it gets. I got the strawberry shortcake and princess cake. Oh god, I don't know how they make the cake so fluffy and the fruit is so fresh. This is my to go place for cakes.

Plus green apple book store is right across the street so made a fun date of book browsing + cake eating.
author: Mimi T.

description: My favorite Swedish Princess cake.  A great day is Green Apple books then Schubert's for a cake slice.
author: Genevieve W.

description:
This bakery is *literally* my absolute favorite thing in the neighborhood! It's one of the few places in SF where you can get a high quality cake that you're proud to share with friends for ~$25 or less -- plus, they've been open for 105 years so know a thing or two about baking good cakes. 

Birthdays? Princess cake.
Housewarmings? Strawberry shortcake. 
Thanksgiving family festivities? Pumpkin pie (only ~$12 for a whole pie). 
Treat yo self weekends? Slice of princess or strawberry shortcake. 
Visitors from out of town? Slice of various cakes to try. 

There are other bakeries in the city that I love and frequent (Tartine for bread, and b. Patisserie for pastries), but Schubert's is my failsafe go-to when it comes to cake. 

I've on numerous occasions gotten feedback from friends and colleagues alike along the lines of "so and so usually doesn't like cake, but loved the cake you brought!" and "where did you get this?!", which just emphasizes how good this place is -- go try it for yourself!
author: Diana C.

description:
Loved this place! I actually had never heard of Schubert's, but my boyfriend told me we had to go (GOOD CALL). There were so many lovely desserts and pastries to choose from, but I tried the famous Swedish Princess Cake which was amazing! I'm actually not the biggest fan of marzipan, but it was just the right amount to balance out the light fluffy white cake and raspberry filling. 

The inside of the shop is small with three small tables, and it's just a great place to have a conversation over something sweet. People were constantly coming in, and it definitely has the feel of the local neighborhood bakery, even in busy San Francisco. I wish I lived closer so I can try everything!
author: Salley P.

description:
Avoid this place like a plague, but only if ....

.... you are trying to lose weight!! There is absolutely no way you are going to walk into this place and not get tempted to try one or more of their awesome looking and great tasting sweets! Their cakes not overly loaded with sugar, so you can actually taste their delicate flavors. I am not even going to suggest you try one item or another, because that will be doing injustice to all the other items! So just pick something to start with and then try another item the next time you are there. However, do not visit too often because when you get on your scale and see the result, you will revisit my review here and leave me mean comments!
author: Afshin A.

description: Expensive cake but it's good cake. Love the sweets there. If you want to order a large cake, make sure to do it weeks ahead of the party.
author: Yosita L.

description: I'm addicted to their tiramisu cake. I wasn't really into cakes that had chocolate on it, but after trying their tiramisu for the first time, it changed my life forever. The princess cake and petite fours are also delicious, oh and can't forget about the fruit tart. Love love loooove that custard filling. I couldn't care less about service, as long as I get my fix I'm happy.
author: Crazy B.

description: I'm not a sweet tooth person but this place is a bum! they have an awesome selection of cakes and made fresh.
author: Lezig B.

description:
If Schuberts had stamp cards....I would have gotten so many free cakes by now...

ANY occasion. ANY event. ANY...ANYTHING. Cakes here will please the crowd no doubt. Though on the pricer side of cakes...it is worth it for any occasion you are celebrating. Honestly all of the cakes here are mouth watering and depending on your personal preference, any cake you choose will be great.

My personal favorites are the tiramisu, mango mousse, and their princess cake (on the sweeter side). I highly suggest checking out their website for cake prices before going into the store and also calling in ahead of time to place a (large) cake order!
author: Mary L.

description: Love their chocolate truffle cake! Oh so yummy  my friends tried their mango mousse cake! They ended up attacking my slice, as it was more delish!  Won't blame them...
author: Anusha B.

description:
Got tasked to buy a coworker a birthday cake and was not allowed to ask her what type of cake she liked because it was supposed to be a surprise. 

I ended up going with the 10 inch tiramisu mousse cake, which I ordered online. Called in the day before I was supposed to pick it up just to confirm that the store received the order. The woman who answered the phone was so friendly and helpful! She said she didn't see the order and would find out what happened to it and then call me back. Literally two minutes later, I got a phone call saying that she couldn't find it earlier because the orders for that day hadn't been printed out yet. But she printed out my order and assured me that it would be ready for pick-up the next day. I was thankful in how fast she worked to find my order! 

Day arrives to pick up the cake and service in store was excellent as well. Was genuinely greeted when I walked into the store! The presentation of the cake was gorgeous! It was decorated with chocolate shavings, pieces of chocolate shaped into flowers, and a couple of raspberries on top. The side of the cake was lined with alternating pieces of dark and white chocolate rectangles, all tied together with an elegant red ribbon. The cake itself was a chocolate sponge cake layered with a marscapone filling, and flavored with a bit of coffee liqueur. I loved that the cake wasn't overly sweet since most of it was mousse. 

The 10" cake was recommended for 12-16 people online and it was definitely accurate. With 15 people at the office, everyone received a generous slice and there was still some left over! Overall, the cake was a hit! 

Note: online orders have to be placed at least two days in advance!
author: Cynthia T.

description: Can't even drive by this place without my s/o asking for a slice of princess cake. This place is charming has some of the nicest looking cake in all of SF. When I custom ordered an opera cake from them for my grandmothers 90th they really went all out to make the cake look amazing. Everyone exclaimed at the party and asked where the cake was from. I hope this SF institution is around for years to come.
author: Alex H.

description:
My friend wasn't a fan of marzipan; he said it was too thick and chewy and dry.  I made him try the Swedish Princess cake.  He declared that the cake was delicious and that he never knew marzipan could be so light!  Thank you Schubert's for helping me change his mind!  

Now if only I could get to their Black Forest cakes before they run out ...
author: Rhea S.

description:
They're probably are best cake and bakery in California .
Little bit pricey but overall it's worth it because nobody around it can make the good quality like this.
Few years ago they used to be better but nowadays they Lil Bit off in the there performance.
Maybe the change theme some of the product that used or different types of them ingredients overall everything looks the same but the taste looks a little bit different from original what they had before.
Also the prices are increased and the product is not as it used to be.
You be quiet quite expensive
author: Yevgeny D.

description:
Wow I can't believe I haven't left a review for this place.
This place has been my to go place since I moved to SF in 2006.
Even after I moved, whenever I visit SF, I will always come back to this place.
I always get their mango mousse!
The princess cake is good too, but their mango mousse is so moist and sweet (just the perfect sweet).
When I go there, I feel like I want to get everything, but always opt for the mango mousse in the end :)
author: Candice L.

description:
I went just for the black forest, or what's called, in Germany, the schwarzwalderkirschtorte.

There are always slight variations in how people make this cake, but the basic version is always layers of chocolate cake and whipped cream, and a layer of kirsch-soaked cherries. Now some people add several layers of cherries. Some do one layer. Some put cherries on top, too. Some don't. 

Regardless, the one thing no one (who claims to know anything about black forest cake) does is create an entire, thick layer of what seemed to be a fruit jam you'd get in a can when living in a war zone. Consistency like the cranberry sauce you get in a can. 

Just think about that for a moment.

No cherries in the cake. None. Just one cherry on top of the slice. A good one, though. Imagine those in the cake. That would be heavenly, because the cake was good. The cream wasn't the best, but good enough. With cherries in there, this could be 3.5 (4, if feeling generous) stars instead of one. But I had to toss half my slice. The bottom half. The half that made me feel like I was back in a war zone.

I think they *used* to do cherries years ago; I saw a Yelp photo that looked like it. Who knows why they stopped. And why are people buying this? Come on, San Francisco. I know it might feel like it on some days, but you're not in a war zone.
author: C J.

description: Ordered a cake for someone's birthday and when I came by to pick it up my order wasn't ready for pickup. Apparently they thought I was supposed to pick it up the day before (even though I said I would pick it up today), but since I never came to pick it up they threw out the cake. What was the point of me giving them my phone number if they never called me to ask/confirm when I was going to pick it up? Terrible service, extremely incompetent workers.
author: Janice L.

description:
You want to be a hit at your next party?!? Bring Schubert's Swedish Princess cake.......DONE! Your friends and fam will love you (even more!)

The Swedish Princess cake is an all-time classic. White cake with raspberry and custard filling, fresh whipped cream and marzipan icing (like fondant, but moist!). So moist and airy it's practically heavenly.......They sell it by the slice so you can indulge in your own individual slice of heaven....

All other cakes and treats here are just as divine. Staff is courteous and helpful and they take phone orders (along with credit card info) over the phone. By far one of the better bakeries in all of SF.
author: Caye Q.
