description: My favorite bakery in town!  Close to home and my kids love them! All their birthday cakes were from here! All my guests love them!
author: Ichi Y.

description: Very cute store and many varieties，came here on a mango mousse craving，quality mousse，can be better
author: Farrah Y.

description:
Good European Styled deserts in an Asian neighborhood.

The strawberry shortcake is delicious, try a slice !!!
author: Rick S.

description: This bakery is awesome! I highly recommend the tiramisu cake, chocolate mousse, princess cake and their regular chocolate cake! All the cakes were so fresh and moist and flavorful! Id come here everyday if i lived in the city!
author: Auriyon J.

description: Definitely one of my favorite bakeries for cakes. The pastries and pies aren't my thing so I took away a star. Anyway, I LOVE the chocolate mouse with shaved chocolate and my favorite cake is by order only or by the slice--Fuerst Pueckler. I rarely eat raspberry anything, but I could probably eat an entire FP cake.
author: Hanster P.

description: Simple, old school, and very good, you can just drop in and get a great birthday cake for under $30, they even put the name on it!
author: Ron B.

description: Perhaps I tried something other than what people are raving about.  But the almond croissant was as dry and crusty as it can be.  When you bite in, it's hollow and not kneaded like.  It is very flakey.  However the bread does taste good. I would give 2 stars but the cake selections and the decor were very nice.  So I prob have to give a try to the cakes.
author: Paris F.

description:
I've been ordering from Schubert's for years now, my parents have been obsessed with the mango mousse cake ever since we got it the first time (We ordered it so many times, literally for every birthday and occasion you can imagine and sometimes just because, that I can't handle it anymore hahah). Not to say it doesn't taste delicious because it really is so good. 

1) Chocolate Mousse with Ganache shavings: CHOCOLATE HEAVEN MMMMM 

2) Mango Mousse (family ate it before I could get a picture LOL): the fruit mousses here are aammmaazziingg! Perfect balance. Not too sweet, not too sour, super moist and soft cake, worth every penny. 

PARKING: street, metered (or park a little further and there are also unmetered spots, 2 hours). Can be a nightmare to find parking, clement is a busy area indeed. 

PRICE: yeah it's a bit expensive for cake, but they're good and definitely top quality
author: Vivian S.

description:
There are countless reviews for this place, but OMG there cakes...gah TO. DIE.FOR.

Their princess cake and their mango mousse cake are heavily. I really can't express how fluffy and delicious they both are. I would highly suggest ordering one for a friend's/family;s upcoming birthday or any other celebration.

Truly amazing texture, not overly sweet (win win), and quick service. I ordered my cake online and a few days later, it was all ready for me for pick up. 

They do get quite busy, so i definitely recommended ordering in advance as you dont know when they might run out of a specific cake that you're looking for. 

They also have a huge selection of single servings, mini cake and slices if you're simply wanting to tend to your sweet tooth. 

Parking can be tough as it's around the clement/richmond area. So be mindful of that.
author: Diane T.

description:
So you mean all this time I've been going to the wrong bakeries for the elusive Princess cakes? I remembered, fondly, when I first discovered this delicacy, it was with my then Telegraph Hill boyfriend, who took me to Tiburon or Sausalito on some date from circa 1998. We also had our last meal there after we'd broken up. Teary and puppy eyed while taking small bits of princess cake. So very not princess like. Strangely enough, while in Sweden over the last few years, I've yet to find one good bakery that made good princess cakes. 

It was raining. Pouring rain in the summer. Who ordered the rain? Did I bring it back from London? We ducked in for a much needed coffee. It's raining in July for god's sake. Someone needs coffee to wake her up from this wet dream alright.

Hurriedly scanning Yelp reviews for must haves. Bingo. Princess cake is on the top of the list. Mind you, this is NOT my neighborhood. And I've NOT had princess cake for eons. 

He said, "Princess cake for a princess." 

I said, "Where?" 

Ordered cakes, pastries, and a cup of coffee to go. It was exceptionally warm and smooth. No hint of cherries or strawberries or chocolate, it's not necessarily organic / hand grind / pour over stuff, but it's perfectly acceptable just the way it is. It kept two very wet, under dressed pedestrians warm, and dry (inside). 

AND I learned something new yet again. 

Princess cake is made best here, not across the bay; coffee is best served super hot on a raining day; and stranger than fiction things do happen: we got rain in July.
author: Victoria E.

description: Delicious!!!! Ordered the mango mousse cake, so light and fluffy. The staff was also very friendly.
author: Tigerchik Z.

description: Today I went and got a birthday cake for my cousin. The cake that he wanted usually you have to call two days in advance, but I called them Friday night and was able to pick it up on Saturday. It was my first time and my cousins first time and aunties and uncles mom and dad to try it their Napoleon. It was so beautiful and so good the strawberry was fresh. That cake is now my favorite cake lots of strawberry the whole thing was just so delicious. So thank you for taking my offer at the last minute.
author: Michele T.

description: I've come back to Schubert's three times to get birthday cakes! Their strawberry shortcakes are fluffy, sweet (but not too sweet), and reasonably priced :)
author: Mako U.

description: Had amazing service from Ashley!! I came in with my fiance and we got the tiramisu after a long day (which was the best tiramisu we've ever had!). She was extremely friendly and had excellent customer service. We will definitely be returning to this adorable bakery due to the delicious cake and welcoming, courteous staff like Ashley. Would give more than 5 stars if I could!
author: Karinna S.

description: My go-to bakery for birthdays & special occasions. Schubert's has been in the neighborhood for many years. My favorites are the tiramisu and mango mousse cake. If you need writing on the cakes, they will put it on a piece of white chocolate. Every time I walk past the bakery I'm always tempted to buy a mini cake/slice.
author: Joe L.

description:
Schubert's is always a great place to grab baked goods. 

A few friends and I decided to surprise a birthday girl with a cake, and I called in to have a strawberry cheesecake put aside for me. You can still do it on the day-of, and they write what you want on the cake (yay!). I was able to swing by and pick up the cake, super easy and quick. If you run in around 5PM (after work hours...) parking is also a breeze. In and out in 10 min. 

What made it only a 4 right now is that the staff seemed a little disorganized. I told them my name, which is what the cake was under, and the type of cake. I also mentioned the writing on it. The girl helping me disappeared for quite some time, and returned asking if it was a slice of cake. Umm...no. I did not ask for "Happy Birthday" to be written on a SLICE. It was a little disappointing, but eventually she found the cake. So hooray for that.
author: Lily W.

description: Their strawberry cheesecakes are so light and fluffy with beautiful shaved chocolate on top. Almost too pretty to eat! I like that it's not too sweet. The bakery has such beautiful cakes in their display and the prices are reasonable. Parking can be tough on Clement and be careful of the meter maids giving tickets.
author: Ellen H.

description: Me and my girlfriend go here alot and we usually have a great experience but today we had this 20 year old asian guy, he had to be about 5'8 or 5'9. Give us some straight attitude. We bought a 6" and 8" Swedish princes cake which is by far the best cake they got. Bought these cakes that cost a total of $63 dollars and this dude gave us like some mean facial expressions when we would ask for certain cakes. He would mumble to himself every time we said if we can get this one instead. I had to take my glasses and give him the look for him to adjust. The customer service is usually there but today felt disrespectful. To give the guy the benefit of the doubt he looked sick and his boss probably made him come in due to the bakery being so busy. I still recommend to go but hopefully the guy changes.
author: Gio G.

description: Good desserts and lots of choices. We have tried many and all are delicious. We wanted the Princess cake but at 8:30 am the salesperson said will not be ready until 11:00?  Wasn't going to wait and no time to come back later. We bought a day old Mango Cheesecake and a Raspberry Chiffon with lady fingers ( not day old). Both were delicious, even the day old cheesecake.  I think no matter what you decide on it will be good. Salesperson was helpful and great service.
author: Em D.

description: Paid for 2 slices of stollen, even confirmed with the sale clerk before I left. It looked like 1 slice in the bag. She said she gave me 2. Went home, opened the bag, only saw one slice. Bad customer service:(
author: Edith C.

description: This is a go-to spot for cake at your next party. Very busy store, best to order ahead of time, tho
author: David A.

description: Amazing cheese cakes. Not crazy expensive but definitely not cheap. I guess you Oy for what you get bc I was completely satisfied with the traditional style cheese cake with a black currant topping which was out of this world. Did not last more than a day.
author: Kaveh M.

description:
Great place to frequent when you are in the mood for something sweet. Every time I go in there, I just want to order everything. 
Hmmmm! Yummmm!
author: Renee C.

description:
The best bakery in the area! There is a good selection of pastries that is artistically presented and quiet tasty. 

I am a huge fan of tiramisu and this place has the best tiramisu cake. The lady fingers were fresh, the filling was light and perfectly flavored and the presentation was amazing. It was biter sweet eating this cake as it was so artistically decorated, i didn't want to cut into it. After the first bite, I didn't feel bad anymore as it was too good to stop.

I would definitely come back again!
author: Herlina N.

description: I got the Swedish princess cake for my mother's birthday, considering that it is one of the most popular cakes here. The cake has a simple design but regardless it looked very appealing with a covering of fondon. I thoroughly enjoyed the cake because the cream inside wasn't too sweet. I'm usually not a fan of raspberry flavored food but the raspberry layer wasn't too overwhelming. The only thing that I didn't quite enjoy was the fondon layer that went over the cake. I believe it was lemon flavor and it tasted doughy. But definitely waiting for the next special occasion to buy another cake ^_^
author: Annie H.

description: So many amazing cakes to choose from.  Had the chocolate mousse cake with shaved chocolate which is best served chilled.
author: Ann T.

description: Their cakes are not only delicious (especially mousse cakes), but they have wonderful customer's service.   Today, I picked up the birthday cake for my daughter, but as I drove home, something toppled over the cake box and the birthday message on the cake was partly erased.   I took it back to the bakery, and they were very nice about writing the message again.   I love the decorations (flowers made of chocolates, etc) on the birthday cakes, too.
author: Yuka H.

description:
There are some things here that are soooooooooooo good. The little flaky bacon and egg croissants (and the ham and egg) Other pastries. The easter only hot cross buns.

Of course the more exotic cakes etc. 

They've done a nice job of sticking to their old recipes.
author: Glen B.

description: Got the princess cake and some of the dry pastries.   Everything was very delicious.  I don't think I liked the fondant on the princess cake but the inside made up for it.  Didn't place an order beforehand.  They have some cakes ready.  This place seems to be very popular.  Parking is a hassle just like any other place in SF. They do have numbered candles for sale.
author: Rou M.

description:
Whoa, how have I not written a review for Schubert's yet?

Not that I'm all that old, but Schubert's has been around for as long as I can remember.  Much like Green Apple across the way and Toy Boat down the street, this classic, European bakery is practically an institution on this part of Clement.   

While they offer a variety of delicious pies, tarts, pastries, and cookies to choose from, desserts are the name of the game here.  Or, more specifically, cakes.  There are a few that stand out, like the Mango Mousse and Tiramisu, but the one that they're probably best known for is their SWEDISH PRINCESS CAKE.

Although I'm not fanatical when it comes to cakes, I will say that this is one tasty treat.  Between this and Swedish pancakes, it's clear those Swedes know their confections!  The cake itself is rather light and airy, but what's most impressive is how well the custard, raspberry, and whipped cream come together.  Not only are the fruitiness and creaminess balanced, but the taste isn't overly sweet either (except, perhaps, for the fondant, which has a strong almond flavor).

If you are planning on picking up a dessert from Schubert's for a special occasion, it's definitely recommended to call ahead and reserve one, especially around the holidays and Valentine's.  The line here may not be as bad as other places in SF, but there's a steady flow of customers throughout the day, so it's not uncommon for the more popular items to sell out.

FOUR AND A HALF STARS rounded down, but not for anything Schubert's has done wrong or for their service (all of the workers are pretty friendly).  Rather, as I mentioned, I'm just not big on cakes, so some of the amazement and wonder is lost on me (nor am I a princess).  However, it shouldn't stop you from checking out this neighborhood gem.  Princess or not...
author: Mike L.

description: Heard so much about Schubert's Bakery and how great everything is especially their tiramisu. In a busy location next to plenty of restaurants, Schubert's stands out. The storefront was very clean and well kept. And even at 530pm they had pretty much every dessert available. I definitely recommend their tiramisu mousse and almond cookies. Looks like I found my favorite bakery with all the classics!
author: Abigail D.

description:
Found myself in the Inner Richmond and walked into this tiny sugarland. The butter croissant  took me back to Paris. The Black Forest was decadent !!

Grabbed a small table inside. Just go !
author: Vijay C.

description: Best cakes in town! Excellent customer service!  Thank you
author: Szandora L.

description: My favorite bakery. Cute tasty cakes just scream my name every time I come in here. I love their Tiramisu and Swedish Princess Cake. I high recommend placing an order a head of time especially near the holidays. I had the pleasure of trying their pies one time because I was too late for the cakes. Their pies tho, pretty bomb. So far, everything I had here, tastes good. If you are not sure what is to your liking, get the mini cakes and try it all! Their cakes aren't too sweet, and I know this because my mommy DOES NOT like things that are sweet (where as I love them) but she loves their cakes. Most of their cakes goes great with dessert wine :)
author: Kristina L.

description: Thank you so much for delicious cake and beautiful presentation! Me and my family really enjoyed it. Swedish Princess is my absolute favorite
author: Jessica J.

description: Overrated. Service was good but the cakes were meh. I did enjoy seeing the other restaurants in the same neighborhood though.
author: Rori G.

description:
Never knew about this place until my boss brought in a strawberry cake to work!  OH MY! it was one of the best cakes i've ever had...it was light, not too sweet and you can tell, quality ingredient using real whipped cream and not that 'pastry pride' stuff or lard.  Delicious.  

After experiencing this place, i demanded that my "frugal" uncle (who lives close by) get this cake...when i mentioned this place his response was 'its expensive' ...hmmm...no wonder for the last 15+ years he always brought Chinese cake which i am not a fan of (spongy, not sweet, and dry).  

I guess with enough 'pressure' he got the mini mango mousse cake and it was heavanly!!!  I don't think even my uncle could deny it was a GOOD cake (even thought it was pricier than he's used to) but heck live a little! It's definitely not something we get every day but makes that special day even more special!
author: Cheryl M.

description: Beautiful and tasty cakes! Discovered ''tis bakery via Yelp, and so glad I did! Prices are great and cakes are creative and stunning! Can't wait to order my next treat from this bakery :-)
author: Ashley K.

description:
My favorite cake shop in the city. They have the bestest tiramisu and princess cakes! I heard the strawberry cheesecake is amazing too! 

Their cakes are a bit pricey but totally worth the buck for any party. They're so beautiful and delicious -- definitely a party favorite!
author: Ellen W.

description:
Schubert's is my favorite bakery! Ever since my grandma bought me a cake from there for my 8th birthday (I'm now almost 25), my family has been going there for pretty much every occasion for their delicious cakes! My top favorites are the Double Chocolate Mousse (the absolute best!), Napoleon, Tiramisu Mousse, and the Fruit Basket/Strawberry Shortcake (the two are similar). Each cake is beautifully decorated with good quality chocolate pieces, chocolate shavings, and/or fresh mixed fruit, and the yummy whipped cream is piped to perfection. Every layer of cake is moist and fluffy, and their mousse is so satisfyingly creamy and tasty.

The price is slightly on the expensive side, but it's not that much more than a way less delicious cake from places like Sheng Kee or other bakeries. Plus, Schubert's is just THAT GOOD. Totally worth it in my opinion! They make their cakes daily too, so it's always super fresh! If you're ever in the area, they're definitely worth trying!

Thanks Schubert's for making every birthday and holiday of ours a bit more enjoyable!
author: Angela C.

description: Excellent cakes! My friends rave about this place so I wanted to try it for a really long time. Finally it was my boyfriend birthday coming up. I've decided to order him a cake a day before his birthday. Called the store and ordered the cake through the phone. Also paid for it already since I told my other friend to pick it up the morning afterwards. Process was easy. I asked what's their bestseller and the girl said it was the Swedish princess cake. Also there is complimentary writing on the cake. I ordered a six inch Swedish princess cake and it was $24. Would love to come back and try their other top sellers like mango mousse or Black Forest! P.s everyone loved the cake at the dinner!!!
author: Tina C.

description: Hot cross bun already? I'm on it.  This place has the best.  They run out early.  Then you have to rack your brain on which dessert to get.  I love their shortbread cookies.  All the mouse cakes are good. With their cheesecake, best to preorder to get the crunchiness of the crust.  If sitting too long the crust gets soggy.
author: Helen L.

description:
We bought our wedding cakes from here in March! They were WONDERFUL! The hit of the night. 
We wanted to go with something very non-traditional. Something that people would actually like, find interesting and exciting, and something that would keep people talking long afterwards ("Did you try the cheesecake at their wedding?!").
When we found this place (via all the awesome reviews and well defined website), we sifted through the options and found 6 that appealed to us from NYC. On Christmas, I taste-tested all the flavors except for the cheesecake - cheesecake slices were only put out at certain times during the week. 

For the order- we arrived in SF on Friday and ordered the cakes on Saturday. 
Cakes were ready the following Friday - we picked this day because our wedding was Saturday and it's best to serve the cakes as fresh as possible.
Saturday, they were served! 

We of course ordered the princess cake. Then the following:
Raspberry Mousse
Strawberry Cheesecake
Fresh Fruit Tart
Tiramisu Cake 

Needless to say, going with an assortment not only saved our budget (who spends less than $200 on wedding cake for 54 people in Palo Alto? Hmm? No one!), but people were blown away by the flavors!

My husband and I STILL talk about these cakes! We would definitely get them again for any occasion :)
author: Melissa R.

description:
I'm not really sure how this came up on our radar, but it did just in time as I was getting ready to order a cake for my fiancé's birthday. After going through the website, we decided the Chantilly cake would be the best bet given it's blend of the chocolate and rum shavings (yes, rum was the deciding factor). The checkout online was simplistic eough and we anxiously awaited the day that we could pick up the cake.

On the day that we did that, we knew we wouldn't get to eat the cake that night so we opted to get ourselves a few slices of different cakes because why not? That plus they actually offer single slices so you don't have to commit to the whole thing. We picked up a slice of the Swedish Princess Cake, an eclair, and a Mango Mousse Cake. While we did get to taste each of them, the Swedish Princess Cake slice was pretty much all me due to the marzipan frosting. It was so delicious along with everything else we got. On the night that we did finally eat the cake, everyone was amazed at how delicious it was. Seriously, I'm so glad we now know of this place but it is so good.
author: Shauna S.

description:
My husband and I have gotten multiple birthday cakes from Schubert's in the past two years. When the time came for us to get married, we just couldn't buy cake from any other bakery. 

We ordered 2 cakes (Swedish Princess and Opera) a month in advance. Our caterer recommended that we get the cakes frozen and Schubert's delivered just that. They even helped my parents who picked up the cake properly pack it with complimentary freezer packs so the cake can survive for 6 hours. All the decoration survived too! 

Protip: We bought insulated pizza carrier bags from Amazon to transport the cakes to the party because no cooler was big enough for these 30-50 people cakes. The plan worked great and our caterer was impressed!

 All the guests at our wedding loved the cakes and couldn't get enough.
author: Sylvia W.

description: I got their signature Fuerst Pueckler cake for my bfs surprise birthday and EVERYONE loved the cake. Will definitely be going back for my next cake!
author: Skye W.

description:
Desserts: 
-Rugelach: So delicious! I only bought 2 but could have eaten many more! Delicious pastry filled with a sweet fruit filling and topped with sugar that gave it a perfect crunch. 
-Princess cake: the flavor of the cake, filling, and marzipan is incredible. So pretty too!

Ambiance: The desserts are beautifully decorated, making the dessert case wonderful eye candy. There are some tables for small parties to dine at as well. 

Service: Prompt and so polite. Love it when you get a smile and friendly service!
author: Susan G.

description: Fun little place with little delectable desserts of all kind. They will have something you will like. I came in thinking i would only have one thing but i ended up eating one there and brining 4 others home. I really liked this place and thought they did a great job with all their desserts. I really need to come back again.
author: Leme K.

description:
I heard so many good things about Schubert's Bakery, so I made a specific trip to Clement Street to find out what all the hype was about. Schubert's Bakery is located between 6th and 7th Avenue, with a good number of street parking. There are a various number of restaurants and stores around the bakery, so parking can get tough if you come during a busy time. 

I had already poured through the many pictures of the various cakes from Schubert's, so I came with the intention of trying the popular Swedish Princess Cake and the Fruit Tart. Because the cakes look so pretty in the photos, I had expected the bakery to be just as fancy. I was actually a bit surprised at how small and low-key the bakery really is. Walking in, if I didn't know how popular Schubert's Bakery is, I probably wouldn't have expected too much from the store. The bakery in itself is quite old, with a few tables inside the restaurant, signs on the wall that explain the popular menu items, and big refrigerator display cases of cakes and other treats. I think I expected more of a Porto's or Tartine's type bakery, but there is something pretty comforting and unique about how low key everything is - you know they put a lot of time and effort into their food. 

I really wanted to try the fruit tart, but sadly they were all out. I only was able to try a slice of the Princess Cake, which set me back about $4-$5. Kind of pricey for a simple slice of cake. It was put into a plain box, and I was quickly on my way. The cake in itself is quite fancy looking. There are layers of sponge cake with raspberry and custard filling. The cake itself is wrapped in marzipan with simple decorations adorned on top. If you're gentle enough, you can pull the marzipan layer off of the cake. Eating the marzipan, sponge cake, and the fillings altogether allow you to get a complete taste of the cake. I personally really enjoyed the marzipan because it has a unique almond flavor. The cake is light and springy and because the custard and raspberry fillings aren't too tart or sweet, they provide the perfect complement to the cake and marzipan. It's definitely a delicious cake, but I feel that even one slice was too much for me and I had to eat it in several visits. I can only imagine eating the whole cake! 

tl;dr - Swedish Princess Cake was pretty good and worth a try if you're in the area, but it's not something I would go out of my way for. It's a bit pricey and a little on the heavy side. I'm glad I had the opportunity to try it, but I would probably return to Schubert's to try out the fruit tart next time or one of the other various cakes.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Schubert's Bakery is amazing!!  The tropical cake is cake and mousse and passionfruit and all things wonderful!  I live an hour an a half away from Schubert's and would drive there without a second thought to get a cake here.  So good!  Plus Wing Lee Bakery is a couple doors down - dim sum and dessert?  Yes, please!!!!
author: Denise R.

description:
After years of buying our cakes at Schubert's we're finally done with them.  I don't know whether they changed owners or what but the quality has gone down considerably while the prices have risen.  Granted I'm not going to knock someone for raising their prices in order to make a living because SF makes it hard on anyone who is motivated to make a living.  However I do frown on raising prices and cutting corners - thus lowering quality.

We tried to order a lemon mousse cake but were told they discontinued it.  What gives?  Why did you get rid of that and yet kept that awful sour black currant cake - which, by the way, is always on the discount shelf?!?!?!  Totally does not make sense but ok whatever we sucked it up and moved on.

So we order the 8" raspberry mousse.  First of all the decorations were missing.  No chocolate pieces on top.  No white scroll decoration either.  It was just a plain mouse jello top with unglazed raspberries.  The raspberries look like they were dying a slow death.

The cake looked underdone.  Also where' the second layer?  In the past, you get 2 layers of cake sandwiched with mousse. Now you get a layer of cake and a big fat layer of mousse.  WTF!

This cake costs almost $30.  For that price I want it to look just like it did in the past.  This is unacceptable and they just lost a customer.
author: Wendy H.

description: Pretty but super old school. Opera cake super dry, rum cake super similar to opera cake.. cheesecake was fluffy but the strawberry preserves tasted artificial.. not a fan of their product at all
author: Tea C.

description:
Not sure if I love this place because their cakes and cookies of all sizes and quantities are so good, or if it's just been such a part of my childhood in San Francisco, that I love it so... either way, I've been coming here since I can remember and have never been disappointed. 

They take phone orders and through their website OR if you're the spontaneous type, they have cakes already made ready to be taken home, just sitting in their bakery. You might not get the exact cake you want though, if you do that. . If you haven't been and you're considering trying something, they also have mini sizes and slices. The Swedish Princess cake is great, as are other go-to's such as the Mango mousse and Tiramisu.
author: Frances T.

description: One of my favorite bakeries in the city. Great variety and also bite size desserts so you can try more different types. Its on a street with a nice vibe and often one can find street parking toward the end of the day.
author: Stefan T.

description: A marvelous bakery and the Princess Cake was a perfect addition to our family gathering for a birthday dinner. Had to drive a bit to get to bakery but well worth it.
author: Claudia H.

description:
There's always a long line here, but definitely worth waiting. The staff here are really accommodating. I'm sure they're used to the craziness. They have mini cakes too so you can try a few. We tried their staple princess cake and tiramisu. LOVED the tiramisu!! 

We only got the princess cake because it was their staple cake.. It actually does not "look" very yummy. It's yellow, and looks a bit tacky. Thankfully it doesn't taste how it looks. It was pretty refreshing actually, not super sweet or creamy. I'm pretty sure that's how all their cakes are, which is why this bakery is probably highly-rated on yelp. Also, GET THE TIRAMISU. Surprisingly, that mini cake was pretty filling. Maybe I'll just succumb to my desires and get order the 6" cake next time.
author: Connie L.

description:
Are you an SF native?
Then you've surely had a cake from Schubert's.

Here, there are 2 stars of the show...
The Swedish princess cake,
& the mousse cakes.  
Mango mousse, lemon mousse, raspberry mousse, what have you.  Mousse is an art form here.  Go for it.

They do an impressive cookie selection, too.  Get a dozen, or 2, or 3, & they're gently packed in a Schubert's box, w the string tied around & everything.  I love that.

There are several chocolate cake options that are also good, but the fruit themed items here are really where it's at.  

It's busy.  Almost chaotic.  There's only street parking, & it's clement street.  Read: the kingdom of double parking.  I swear the double parking here is worse than in north beach.  Be prepared.

A must.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: My go to place for birthday cakes. We absolutely love this place, the selection is amazing and the cakes are not only delicious, they are beautiful. Always courteous service, I must have ordered at least 5 cakes this year's for friend's birthdays. Will be going in today for another one!
author: Sharon V.

description:
Well this bakery came out of nowhere! Definitely stands out in this area.

Area jn which, by the way, parking is so hard to come by.

The beautiful front turned my head. The wonderful smells made me walk in.

The cakes in the display case are so beautiful and the accompanying prices look reasonable. When I'm in town and it's someone's birthday, I will go out of my way to try out their cake.

Tried out their cookies and they're pretty good.
author: Kislev A.

description: I always look forward to this time of year. Not only is it my birthday month  but, it gives me an excuse to come to the city, where I was born and raised.  This by far is my favorite bakery small but quaint and always happy when I leave. That being said my "Swedish Princess Cake" is always amazing and if I don't get that one they Double Chocolate Mousse " never let's me down. Thank you for being the frosting on my cake.
author: Angela S.

description: Tira misu is amazing! Friendly staff and quaint cafe. An absolute treat on our SF day trip.
author: Andrea M.

description: Ordered the princess cake here for my girls birthday. Even they don't have much options on customize cakes, but they offered to make the princess cake in pink color, and helped me put on the decoration I brought. My all kids in the party loved the cake
author: Vic H.

description:
It's my BFF's birthday today, and if she were here, I would get her a cake from Schubert's.

But she's not here anymore because she moved down to SoCal a couple of years ago. Nowadays when we talk on the phone, I always picture her in sunglasses, on the account of SoCal always being hot and all. And if I were to mail her a cake, which I won't, I imagine the cake would reflect off the lens of her shades as she goes in for a bite. I reckon that'll make a pretty good birthday picture.

Maybe I should mail her a cake. But I probably won't. Not because I'm not a good friend, because I am, but because it just doesn't make sense to mail her a cake. You see, Schubert's most popular cake would be their Princess Cake, and that's the one I'll mail to her if I were to mail her one. The Princess Cake not only tastes real good, and it does taste real good with its multi-layers of flavor and its subtle taste of raspberry. But also, the cake itself is quite a looker, too. It's covered in a thin layer of bright green candy frosting, and really, the whole thing looks like a powdery green snowball. It's a beauty. And when something is a beauty like that, you can't just go off and trust that USPS will mail it unharm. The whole cake might be destroyed by the time it gets to SoCal. I bet it would still be delicious, though, and the cake itself would still be pretty fluffy. But sometimes when something doesn't look the way it's supposed to, you go and think that it doesn't taste as good. It probably still tastes exactly the same, but you would be totally convinced that it tastes different just because it looks different. And maybe my bff would think that way too when USPS shows up to her front door with a damaged Princess Cake. That's the real reason why I won't mail her the cake. 

Maybe I'll just go with her to Schubert's next time she comes home. And instead of buying a whole cake, we would just buy a slice of the Princess Cake. You can do that at Schubert's, just buy one slice of a cake that you like. And I'll get their Chocolate Mousse with Almonds, so that way, my bff can taste two cakes instead of just one. But she'll want to take the first bite first, on the account of her being a germo-phobe, so she'll probably get the raspberry on top. I guess that's okay, since it's her birthday and all.

And I can be there to help her take her belated birthday picture, with the cake reflecting off the lens of her sunglasses. Unless she wears those polarized ones, then I guess all you can see are her eyes. Or she may not even be wearing sunglasses since she'll be in the San Francisco fog once she comes back. But I guess we can still take a picture at Schubert's. It won't be the way I imagine it, but I bet it'll still end up being a good picture. We'll make it work, we usually make things work. I guess that's why we're best buddies. 

Happy Birthday, Lisa :) 8/15/16
author: Ringo M.

description:
My boyfriend's favorite cake is Tiramisu, and I called about the top 10 places in SF that weren't out in the boons. They all charge somewhere between $30 and $35 (and are mostly located in Financial District), but thank god for Schubert's! I got a beautiful 6-inch tiramisu, customized, for only $17.95. By far the best price I found.

I hit a little snag when I got to the store on Friday afternoon and the cake I'd called in  on Thursday was nowhere to be found. They had no record of the order (and that makes me wonder what a situation I'd be in if it were a more complicated/larger order), but were nice about it and just got another cake and wrote my boyfriend's name on it right there.

I loved the large chunks of chocolate surrounding the cake. There was a good balance of the coffee flavor and sweetness. It was more light and fluffy in texture; about 10 of us shared this for dessert and it was more than enough! We even had a couple slices leftover.

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/schuberts-bakery-san-francisco?select=QMYVtDWmWzCRu30l1ioHjA#QMYVtDWmWzCRu30l1ioHjA
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Cakes here are heaven! I've tried the fruit tart and mango mousse. The fruit tart is definitely my favorite and the best I've had so far. They are super generous with the fruit and the tart itself is very moist.

Tip: You can call in to reserve a cake for pick up! I would suggest doing this if you are trying to get a cake that might sell out faster. I did this for the fruit tart. When I got there, they were actually out but had one in the back saved for me. :)
author: Sophia H.

description: I usually buy the cakes for all of my family members and this is THE place to go!  The cakes are so good!    It's much better than the typical HK style bakeries stuff.  I have not been disappointed yet.
author: Joyce L.

description: I got some sweets for a friend's birthday.  They are very light and tasty!  I'll come back again.
author: HQ S.

description: I still remember my first taste of Schubert's Princess Cake. Its the same every time regardless. Schubert's never disappoints. Their cakes are always delicious and beautiful. Where else would you go for a winning cake experience?
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Schubert's Bakery's Swedish Princess cake must be the stuff that princesses dream of.

$3.75 for a slice of the SWEDISH PRINCESS made of delicious white cake layers with raspberry and kirsch custard filling, whipped cream, and marzipan icing (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/schuberts-bakery-san-francisco?select=btTBAQ-24HWtUTupnpjzmw#btTBAQ-24HWtUTupnpjzmw). I loved the white cake layers, but I was not a fan of the outer marzipan icing--way too sweet and ickily stickily.

Guess I'm not really a princess ehehe.
author: Adele F.

description:
-Swedish princess cake: SO FREAKING GOOD.  

- call in advance next time for the 6in swedish cake.  Didn't have any left when I dropped by.
author: Jon P.

description:
My favorite bakery in the city! They produce high quality cakes with many distinctive flavors that are not too sweet and are to perfection! They have fruit mousse cakes, chocolate cakes, rum cakes, fruit whipped cakes, and many more! They have an online system that allows you to place an order online, which normally requires at least two days to make. You can specify the date and time needed for pick up. 

In case you want to try the cakes, they have small versions of the cakes available for $3-4 each. It is a perfect size to have to try out but also a nice snack for lunch. They also have other pastries available if you want to try: cookies, tarts, and many more.

Parking is available but most are metered spots. Street parking is normally available 2-4 blocks down from clement but can be sparse on weekends and late during weekdays. A must try! You can always enjoy your treats inside, they have 3 tables there :)
author: Wendy Z.

description:
week

We were having a 50th birthday party and they made the most tasty beautiful cakes we have ever had. People could not stop complimenting us on the chocolate cake with chocolate mousse filling and gorgeous chocolate decorations. Thank you so much.
author: Bryn S.

description:
I adore Schubert's Bakery! I've been coming here for years, and the only thing that has changed which has disappointed me is that they no longer sell a the whole selection of small cookies by the piece, only by the box. I've tried a number of cakes here and have had a Schubert's cake for many birthdays.

The chocolate mousse cake is the best I've ever had! The mousse is light, creamy and fluffly. The chocolate shavings on the outside make it more decadent. You can buy a mini cake for yourself or larger ones for bigger occasions. I used to love the little cookies, but now they only have the little jam filled (apricot or raspberry) rugelachs for purchase by the piece. At 60 cents a piece I always stop in a buy a ton!

For custom cakes, they have several variations of cake, frosting and filling. They will also do custom designs (although nothing crazy like your face on the cake). The service is also fantastic. I remember one time we weren't entirely pleased with the outcome of the design, so they gave us a free box of cookies! They're very sweet and are very willing to please and help get your order right.

Favorites: Chocolate mousse, rugelachs
Atmosphere: Cute, with some tables, but can get crowded and not great for sitting down; mostly a stop in and go 
Service: Always super friendly!
Tips: For a bigger cake, order ahead - they customize with all sorts of fillings and designs
author: Amanda C.

description: It's a pretty low-key place. You won't notice it if you never heard of this place. I saw many great reviews about here and ordered the highly recommended Swedish Princess cake. It's a OK cake, it's not that sweet, but not as good as a "wow" cake as many people suggested. I'd come to this place if I am in this area, but not a place worth a trip.
author: Cecily W.

description:
I was in the neighborhood with another foodie friend of mine, and he swore this was THE BEST place to get princess cake.  We had tried it before at IKEA in Emeryville (why on Earth would we do that when that place is known for excellent meatballs?!? Lol) and weren't too impressed. For those of you who don't know what princess cake is, it's a greenish/looking cake with marzipan on the outside, white ish tasting cake on the inside accompanied by a thin layer of what I think would be raspberry glaze. 

Schubert's Princess cake is the bomb! The marzipan is like a chewy light greenish fondant with an almondy essence and amaretto flavor. Cake is like, fluffy and moist & just enough raspberry glaze is on the cake to compliment the flavor, not overpower it.  Definitely try the princess cake here if you are in the neighborhood!
author: Erica S.

description: This is my go to bakery for cakes.  I usually stick to the cheesecakes and the chocolate cakes.  So delicious!!! Service is always friendly and quick.  It takes a lot of willpower not to buy everything on display and gorge myself into oblivion!
author: Mary V.

description: came here maybe 3 weeks ago really long line but worth it . got an éclair and a crème puff and a tiramisu cake.we weren't  able to eat it for 3 days but it was in the fridge .it was still really,really good and yummy ! which means it was really fresh ! oh should I be saying that ? now the lines might be even longer !!!
author: Nellie J.

description:
I'm pretty much sold on anything with the word "Princess." Unfortunately, the Princess Cake was sold out when I went the first time, so I got the Mango Mousse. I thought it was good, but not any more special compared to other Asian bakeries with mousse cakes.

I was in the area on another day, and came back to try my luck with the Princess Cake. They were sold out again, BUT the lady was nice enough to hook me up with a slice from the back. White cake layers with raspberry and kirsch custard filling, whipped cream and yellow marzipan icing. It's super cute and fitting for a princess.
author: Christine C.

description:
I love sweet stuff! And I love chocolate! And this bakery made one of the best chocolate mousse cake I've ever had! Not only does it look cute (great for Instagram) but it also taste amazing. Must must must try if you're a chocoholic like me.
We also got a fruit tart and I've never really liked these things cuz the tart never quite cook well enough. But to my surprise it was very tasty.. Especially the tart. This is probably the only place I will rely on for a good fruit tart. 
My friend also bought me a raspberry cake waaaay back and idk if they have it anymore but it was total Yum and if possible I'll come back to look for it again.
author: Katie T.

description:
Order strawberry short cake and come mini cake. 

Strawberry cake: sooo good. Not to sweet. A lot of strawberry inside and fruits in the outside. 

Mini cake were cute and good. Smaller version of the big cake. 

Almost $100 for all. A little pricy but good.
author: Jasmin T.

description: Amazing cakes and pastries. Picked up the perfect cake for a family dinner with no wait. Delicious! It was a berry mousse, perfect and light.
author: Lily C.

description:
THANK JEEEBUSSS-BUDDHA-CAKEFAIRIES FOR SCHUBERTS! The NIGHT before I remembered it was my roommates birthday the next day and i panicked... not knowing what to do. I KNOW... NOMINATE ME FOR WORST FRIEND/ROOMMATE EVER! Had to plan a last minute surprise party and of course, the cake had to be the perfect i-forgot-it-was-your-bday-but-this-cake-looks -so-fabulous-it-was-like -i-looked-for-weeks-for-this-cake kind of cake. LOL PERFECT pricing. Came here before for other cakes as well! All were good!

Swedish Princess cake $17.95: 4 stars. Princess cake because he's our princess, HAPPY BIRTHDAY JORDAN T.! One of their all time classics with delicious white cake layers with raspberry and kirsch custard filling, whipped cream and marzipan icing. 6" served 6-8 people! Loved the combo of everything meshed together. The marzipan icing complimented the raspberry and kirsch filling like ketchup with fries.... and... cookies with milk... hahah. Sweet enough and not too sweet! I like it!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/schuberts-bakery-san-francisco?select=_yhXSWXhJITll7ZkzGAaew#qtbdb0ryhwfolzVV_gc4Ow

Here are other cakes I got!!! They ranged around $3.25-4.75!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/schuberts-bakery-san-francisco?select=_yhXSWXhJITll7ZkzGAaew#_yhXSWXhJITll7ZkzGAaew
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/schuberts-bakery-san-francisco?select=_yhXSWXhJITll7ZkzGAaew#Vo-hB8ixZH9hQ4vsf8lKBQ
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/schuberts-bakery-san-francisco?select=_yhXSWXhJITll7ZkzGAaew#sxHdgq_QtLKOSCQbJQ94Ew

All in all, great quality variety of cakes for decent price! 

PS. I HOPE HE NEVER READS THIS TO FIND OUT I FORGOT HIS BDAY! LOL
author: Chena N.

description: Stopped by on a Friday and picked up a lovely strawberry whipped cream birthday cake that was a big hit.  It was so tasty!  The person behind the counter was so patient and sweet.  I can understand why it was so crowded but I didn't feel rushed and the line moved quickly.
author: Roxanne M.

description:
I LOVE their chocolate mousse cake - rich and chocolately yet not too heavy or sweet. They accept online orders which normally take 2 days but I ordered a small 6" one (~$23) for my husband's birthday over the phone around 9 in the morning and picked it up the next day. They were very friendly and helpful throughout the entire process and I've also heard great things about their tiramisu and mango mousse cakes.

Highly recommended for special occasions or whenever you feel like cake!
author: Lauren T.

description:
My Go To: Fruit Napoleon!

My tip is to go there before 12pm to ensure that you get get a slice of the awesome fruit Napoleon. There has been so many times when I came around 2pm and they were all gone and especially on weekends, they go by fast! Who can resist it, they are not overly sweet and their fruits have never been sour when I got them.
author: Eva O.

description: Ordered a chocolate mousse cake for a friend's birthday and it was awesome. Not too creamy or chocolaty, was soft and all the stuff for decoration on the top was also amazing!!
author: Teby T.

description:
I've been a customer of Schubert Bakery for almost two decades now , ordering cakes and pastries for casual and festive occasions many many times. ,always getting a fresh and tasty product. But one cake deserves to be highlighted-it's a Swedish Princess!
I've traveled a lot and tasted this type  of cake all over many times.
Ralph's Swedish Princess is the best!
And it's getting better throughout the years also. 
Recently I found out that he constantly working on improving the quality of ingredients - marzipan now- is the pure almond!!- which makes it lighter and even more delicious ! 
Also needles to say, that their service is great, wether you're eating in or taking to go- they will help you in every way.
Thank you,Ralph, Your Swedish Princess at our event at Davis Symphony Hall was a wonderful dessert,that everyone loved!
author: Marianna M.

description: The Swedish Princess Cake is the only thing you need to get when you come here. It is amazing! White cake with raspberry and kirsch custard filling, whipped cream and marzipan icing - nom Nom NOM! You can get it by the slice at $4.50 which I did but after having a couple bites when I got home I wish I got an entire cake! I had my friend try it even though she was full from our lunch and she loved it too that she had more than a couple bites. YES, even when you think you're full all the way up to your throat you can still make room for this fine cake. The shop is small, 2 blocks from Burma Superstar so make sure you come here after having that delicious tea salad.
author: Michelle T.

description: This is how heaven should be! If ever feel so full that you can't eat anymore, or walk or talk or do anything else, just visit this place. I am very confident you would end up jumping with joy, moving forward and backward trying to find that cake or cakes you can eat. This was really how my behavior was when I entered this place after a very heavy Indian buffet. I tried the Italian rum cake and man it was delicious. Perfect softness and moist on the cake as I would imagine it should be. I am not sure how my stomach made more space but it did and it was craving for more. I will be visiting this place whenever I can. Highly recommended.
author: Shreyas P.

description: I ordered a cake at the very last minute for a friend's birthday party and the bakery was more than happy to accommodate. The cake was an absolute huge hit (it was the champagne cake) and was the right amount of sweet! I can't wait to go back to try more flavors!
author: Alyssa P.

description:
Although everything I've had from here is a tad too sweet for me, Schubert's truly know their cakes. Native San Franciscans seem to love this place although in my personal non-bias opinion, it's not the best bakery in the city. 

They're particularly famous for their princess cakes which look absolutely mouthwatering even though I'm not a fan of marzipan. Now if only I can get my hands on a slice. Some of these review seem to find them life changing. Hm perhaps another trip to Schubert's is in order!
author: Esther A.

description:
An old school favorite that has endured the test of time.
Enjoy everything from cakes (whole or by the slice) to cookies and pastries.
Everything because it is all yummy.
author: David H.

description: This bakery became my new favorite shop! We got a raspberry cheesecake for our daughter's birthday. It looks pretty and tastes great!!
author: Kazue R.

description: Got an 8-inch Swedish princess cake for my birthday. It was amazing! One of the best cakes I've ever had in my life, Definitely worth the price and the trip going there to get it.
author: Melody H.

description:
Lots of lovely looking desserts, lots of time was spent on decorations. For the detail in presentation-5 stars

Got the tiramisu mousse- not a huge fan of mousse, I do wish they had one with more cake. The alcohol was the strongest I've ever had, and as an avid tiramisu eater, that must say a lot. Based off of just the food, it was just average. 

Would love to come back and try some of the other cakes.
author: Braden H.

description: A sweet oasis. They have a good variety of cakes, tarts that your sweet tooth might crave.
author: Janice F.

description:
Going by the Yelp star ratings which equates two starts to "Meh. I've experienced better."

Why it is better +'s:
+ Friendly service on phone and in person.
+ Online ordering is available with great pictures and descriptions.

Why it's meh -'s:
- Cappuccino cake for my birthday was a sweet sponge confection that just didn't hit the coffee taste and texture for my taste buds. Too rich. Didn't even finish my slice--that's a first.
- Inner Richmond parking is a *&%#$! on the weekend.

Unfortunately disappointment on the taste of my birthday cake. Also seek elsewhere if you want a traditional cake.
author: Yiven C.

description: This place is one of my favorite cake places. I used to come here a lot when I was younger and bought their apricot cookies. One thing I'll keep coming back here for is their Swedish Princess cake. I always get it for my birthday basically ever year and it's safe to say that I'm not tired of it yet. The smallest size costs 20.95$ (including tax) FYI. Just thinking of the texture and taste of the marzipan outside layer and the raspberry inside the cake makes me crave for a slice (currently in my fridge).
author: Erica K.

description:
I've tried about 3 of their cakes from office parties. I must say that their cakes are very well decorated and are consistently good. Their prices are reasonable as well. For most cakes with chocolate flower shell decorations - less than $40 and feeds up to 15!

Today we had a 10" tiramisu cake. It was a good balance of the rum and mousse. It's my favorite so far.

We've had their chocolate truffle torte and opera cake. The chocolate torte is dense with mostly dark chocolate. It's heavy so be prepared to eat with a side of coffee or tea. 

The opera cake is a hazelnut sponge with chocolate truffle and mocha-praline filling topped with toasted almonds. I found it to be too sweet for my liking. I could barely finish my slice.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
One of the best cake place in San Francisco. For Birthday, special occasion, etc etc. I like their Black Forest Cake. IMO, this shop has the best Black Forest cake in the city! Their cake are not overly sweet ( just enough to want more) fluffy, yet very chocolatey. Hm mmm good! 

Mango Moose, Swedish Princess, Tiramisu,  etc etc they are all good!

If you want to make some one else diet fail, go buy a cake or two from this place, give it to them and see their diet fail in an instance!  I have seen people shy away and ask for just a little pieces, only to have full serving of second and third later. :)
author: Dan A.

description:
I've never been inside, but I've been devouring empty calories at various San Francisco birthday parties thanks to Schubert's since approximately 2003.

The cakes are delicious and definitely worth the weight!
author: John S.

description:
I ordered a rather large cake from Schubert's for a colleague's retirement party at work, and the consensus at the party was YUM.

I called about a week in advance to order the cake - a full sheet Fruit Basket cake with fluffy whipped cream frosting. The lady who placed my order was very professional and asked if I wanted anything special written on the cake for the occasion. They wrote our message beautifully on chocolate pieces that adorned the cake. Pickup was a breeze, and one of the bakers graciously helped carry the cake out to the car for me. 

As for the cake - wonderfully fresh and delicious. Everyone was asking where it came from and many went up for seconds (and thirds!). I'm very proud and happy to support this local business, which upholds the highest quality in ingredients and customer service. Thanks for making our party delicious, Schubert's!
author: Liz G.

description:
My coworker brought some pastries from Schubert's to celebrate her naturalization and man, was I glad that she became an American! The pastries were absolutely out of this world! I think she brought in a few pieces of chocolate mousse cake (soaked with rum) and mango mousse. They were so light and fluffy and went down easy like a fine wine. It was so light, in fact, I didn't feel all that guilty going for another taste :). 

I was also able to sample a cheesecake from the bakery and it had the perfect balance between fluffiness and actual cheesecake-ness. Some light cheesecakes are so over gelatin-ed sometimes, it loses the texture of normal cheesecake. This one still had enough texture to make me think it was a baked cheesecake, not one that holds firmly entirely based on gelatin. Man oh man, I love that cake! Would certainly hint to the hubby to pick up a cake from here for important occasions :)
author: Alice W.

description: Best bakery in the city! Must try the swedish princess cake, chocolate mousse with nuts and the blueberry tart.
author: Stephen C.

description:
Got a slice of mango cheesecake 
Was delicious and wished I bough the whole cheesecake
author: Kelly C.

description: To me this is just a typical bakery nothing really was like "wow so bomb" to me. I can't see what the hype is about because there wasn't anything special about the cakes I got. My friend got me the tiramisu mousse cake and fruit tart both were just alright nothing that really wowed me. I think there are way better cake places to get cakes from and this isn't my ideal place but in the future I'll maybe give it another try but for now I'll just stick with my other favorite bakeries.
author: Maybeline C.

description:
Families rarely all agree on anything, right? Except Schubert's. My entire family, grandparents, cousins, etc. all agree Schubert's is the best place for cakes. It's a pricey must for every celebration we have. Which cake is the best? Unfortunately, I can't tell you that because we keep changing our minds. Just know you have to try them all no matter what your wallet says. Also black forest cake. But still, try out the other cakes, too.
When I want to just treat myself, I'll swing by and endure the painful process of finding parking in that hellish part of Clement just to buy a personal slice of opera cake or princess cake. There's always a line because everyone knows this place is the best. Why do I even need to write a review?
author: Tina K.

description: I'm always able to pick up a cake whether is is last minute or a few hours ahead of time. The bad thing is that they don't seem to like to answer their phone during the business day. Parking can and will most likely be a nightmare.
author: Jess W.

description: Answer the goddamn phone!!!! i need to change the delivery date and have no way of contacting you. I've been calling for 8 hours straight and you don't even have a voicemail.  This is the last time I would be ordering from you and will not be recommending to anyone else!
author: svetlana f.

description:
Been to this place twice in the past month and have yet to be disappointed. 

I got the chocolate mousse cake for my uncle's birthday and then an all chocolate cake for Mother's Day. I really wanted to try the swedish princess cake but the kids don't like fruit filings so I'll come back and get a slice just for myself.

All cakes are so beautifully decorated (not your standard white frosting around the cake). Just look at the pictures and you'll see.

The place is in a weird location, very tucked away in between Asian restaurants and markets. You wouldn't expect it to be here but it doesn't stop customers from coming in to buy delicious cake. Staff is super friendly and cakes are very decently priced. What more can I ask for?
author: Cathy N.

description:
2 STARS for mediocre cakes that photograph & look way better than they taste.

Lowest rating I've given to a bakery so far & it really pains me to do so since I'm I live & breathe to eat desserts. I had such high hopes for Schubert's after going on Yelp & seeing that it had close to 5 stars and over 1000 reviews. 

Needless to say, I was severely disappointed at the quality & taste of the cakes. My sister & I got the strawberry mousse cake & tiramisu to share and we couldn't even finish them completely. 

The layer of jam on the strawberry mousse was far too sour & the actual strawberry topping was coated with such a thick layer of sweet jam that it didn't even taste like fruit anymore. The bottom chiffon layer of the mousse cake was OK but on the dry side. The actual mousse part was good but coupled with the overly sour top layer & the dry bottom layer, the cake itself was mediocre at best ):
http://s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/G4SlNMfV-yziv7wNRbbagg/l.jpg

The tiramisu was ok & definitely better than the strawberry mousse. It was loaded with a ton of whipped cream on top & again it tasted more like your standard chiffon cake. I didn't taste any mascarpone which is a pretty crucial ingredient for tiramisus. Almost tasted like tiramisu you could buy from Safeway. http://s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/3FmGHlnc4rtmLJPzZ5kfgQ/l.jpg


I believe each slice of cake was $3.95 which I think is pretty standard for specialty cake shops so I didn't think much of it however after having tasted the cakes, its definitely not worth the price.

Maybe I went on a bad day or maybe I should try their pastries next time? I don't really know but I definitely know I won't be stopping by Schubert's any time soon =/
author: June Y.

description:
This Bakery is the most reviewed bakery in SF.  Authentic and tasty cakes... parking is hard to find but the there are a lot of cars parking in/out.  So my wife usually gets out while I have  the right turn signal on waiting for the parking spot.  

Also it is better to order you cake a day earlier because their cakes sell out fast.
author: James L.

description:
My first Schubert's cake was when I was in middle school (almost 10 years ago!). I've had a Schubert's Birthday Cake almost every year since 14.  It never disappoints. My all-time favorite is the Tiramisu Cake. It's so yummy. Moist, soft, tasty, rich, creamy sweet, and rummy. The coffee taste is also there. It's just right! I'm already craving for another one... It's a must try. Try it, my friend.

The mini mango mousse cake and princess cakes are also palatable. Almost everything there is perfect. It is a little on the pricey side, but you do get what you paid for: mouthwatering cakes.
author: Alex L.

description:
The wife loves Swedish Princess Cakes.  So whenever we can, we get her a Princess Cake.  This year for her birthday, we were lunching in Chinatown so decided to try Victoria Pastry's princess cake.  It was a perfectly fine princess cake, a little on the pricey side, but it just wasn't right.

It wasn't from Shubert's.

A couple of weeks after her birthday I had an appointment in the Richmond. So I made a point to stop by Shubert's early and pick up a princes cake.  She was soooo happy.  The marzipan is nice and light, the sugar sweetness not overpowering.  The small size is just the right size as my son and I are not real sweet eaters.  So the wife gets almost all of it for herself.

Happy wife, happy life.  While we have princess cake, she's really happy.
author: Steve G.

description: If you want to experience the best of the best pastry then Schubert's Bakery is the place.  My favorite are the cheesecakes with the fancy chocolate flowers on top.  Always a crowd pleaser- I am a bit ashamed to admit it, but I always buy a cake for myself and one to share.
author: Curtis A.

description: One of my favorite things to do when I was younger (and now!) is to go into random bakeries, look at the little cakes and pastries they have, and then pick a bunch to share. I think out of all the random bakeries I've wandered into, Schubert's has got to have the prettiest, and most delicious little (and big!) cakes! Recently got a bunch of little cakes for my mom's birthday and pro tip: early in the day they bring out more cake flavors so if you don't see the one you want, try and ask! They also have pastries (tarts, croissants, etc.) and these were also some of the best I've ever had.
author: Jingxi Z.

description:
It's all about the Princess Cake for me. I absolutely love the stuff and was the main reason for me visiting Schuberts. It didn't disappoint either.. the ordering system however was a completely different story and is in desperate need of revising. There is no real line and the staff do not care who was waiting there the longest and will serve anybody they feel like. You really need to be aggressive here, something which I really am not. If it wasn't for another very polite customer I could have been waiting here all day.
That aside, great selection (when they replenish the display case) and the Princess Cake (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/schuberts-bakery-san-francisco#Q9J6zj-EHCmnp32IS0mEFw) is indeed delicious. Light and fluffy with sweet (but not too sweet) fondant. I also picked up a  Chocolate Truffle Torte (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/schuberts-bakery-san-francisco#NodPBvG9oZkYitfQ3pp4gA) to share with my Husband and even though neither  of us are huge fan's of Chocolate Cake we both enjoyed it. 

I wouldn't agree it's ''The best Bakery in SF'' but it it is way up there.
author: Emmalouise B.

description: Ordered a cake, and gave them my phone number. When I came to pick it up for the birthday, they said they threw it away. They never called me or anything. They then forced me to pay for a standard display cake instead of giving me one complimentary.
author: Jack C.

description:
I am European who grew up on homemade delicious deserts and cakes I can honestly say that this is the best bakery I have found in the USA!!!  This place is always clean, (no fingerprints on the display although everyone points out at those yummy looking cakes), always nice and friendly service, and as I said, and range of delicious cakes that is hard to choose from. 
This place deserve more that 5 stars!!!!!
author: D C.

description:
In one word: awful!
Now let me elaborate: I've been buying cakes at Schubert's for about 25 years; not too often: 2-3 times per year. It used to be so good! I heard they changed the ownership (i wouldln't care) and also the cake baker (makes all the difference!). Schubert's was never 'cheap' but I always found their prices to be justified because of the high quality of their cakes. This time I opted for Black Forrest. Their average-sized cake that would feed (per their estimate) 8-12 people is $35.95.  Not cheap. But again, when you want a good cake, you are willing to pay.  First of all, this cake is about 2/3 of the height of the old Black Forrest they used to make. They still use the tall large box, so it's a bit of an optical illusion when you prepay and just pick up that nice large box.  The old Black Forrest had moist porous tall 2 layers of cake with whipped cream and fresh strawberries in between and on top.   This one had two thin spongy cake layers (similar to cakes from lots of Asian bakeries in the area) that had no distinct flavor whatsoever.  It also had NO berries in-between; there was some sour concoction in place of berries that looked and tasted like sour mashed up and pressed together jam. Then they put some cherries on top: I have no clue what they've done to those cherries, but they were very bitter and tasted like they were soaked in some cheap alcohol. Everyone who tried it, had to spit it out. The only 'normal' thing about that cake was whipped cream. Would you pay $35.95 for about 1/2 lb of whipped cream?! My husband, who I have yet to see not to finish a slice of cake in 30 years we've been married (let alone a cake from Schubert's), ate top half and then said that he simply can't eat the bottom part (including that pressed jam) and threw it away! If you knew my husband, you'd understand that the cake had to be remarkably bad for him to do that! 
Bottom line: the Black Forrest from Safeway for 3rd of the price of Schubert's tastes better. That should tell you something. 
People say that Schubert's mousses are good, and they are, but mousses are almost as good in many bakeries in the Richmond for, literally, half the price, so why overpay? And although not as nearly tasty as before,  Opera and Swedish Princess are still good, especially considering that you can't get them anywhere else in the neighborhood.    
I am really sad: the quality dipped so low, but yet the owners are milking the original name and reputation for all its worth!
author: MS S.

description:
7x7 100 Best Things To Eat In SF Before You Die 2013

#7 Princess Cake at Schubert's Bakery

At work, our leadership team brought us a half sheet of the Princess Cake for Valentines Day and also to celebrate all March Birthdays.

Both times were equally amazing! The cake is super moist, pure in flavor and with just the right balance of sweetness. The thing layers of raspberry and custard filling were what sold me on the cake. I would gladly pay just for the filling and eat spoonfuls of it straight out of the container. 

The marzipan added a great accent to the cake without stealing the show. I liked the chewy quality to it and actually was surprised how much I enjoyed eating each bite. 

Overall Thoughts

So far 7x7 and I are best friends! Definitely a great cake to have for any celebrations
author: Eddie W.

description:
Oh Schubert's, you never disappoint. For years, we've been coming to good ol' Schubert's for our special occasion cakes. Hands down one of the best strawberry shortcakes around. Well presented cakes made with love and quality and not to mention excellent customer service.

Swedish princess cake is another popular option with jam filling, custard and marzipan but do keep in mind, it is a bit sweeter due to the icing.

Custom orders recommended but not necessary, come early and you can get a decent selection of available ready made cakes.
author: Amy L.

description:
A packed bakery w/ no system whatsoever. Don't assume there is a line because people will talk over you to get dibs on service. 

Service lacked a backbone and a smile. The girl that helped me was unwelcoming and impatient. The thing that turned me off about this bakery is the piece of raspberry on every baked creation. I have a fruit phobia! 

I did order the tiramisu because of Janet O. and I have to say that the cake was extremely moist. You can taste the espresso soaked cake. I did not see traces of ladyfingers. The frosting was light, airy, and a little sweet. I usually like my desserts to be decadent, rich, and sweet but to be fair, I did not order a chocolate cake. 

I'm glad to knock this bookmark off w/ Emmalouise but it's a one hit wonder for me.
author: Tram N.

description:
Once of the best bakeries in sf for birthday cakes. 
Personally, I love their fruit tarts ($3.95)
My brother lives their napoleons and my parents love their princess cakes. 
The desserts are always fresh, tasty and pretty. :)
author: Juliana B.

description: Very high quality  cake at reasonable price. This small place was packed on a Sunday afternoon.
author: Edward S.

description: Yummy!
author: Emi J.

description:
I came by on a Sunday afternoon to pick up a cake for my dad's birthday. All the options looked so delicious and I wanted to try them all but I ended up settling on a tropical mousse cake. Great decision as it was the perfect blend of sweet and sour and my dad loved it. I also got a berry fruit tart for myself (couldn't resist) and it was delicious although it could have fit a little more custard inside. :) I love that the desserts here aren't too sweet, which is sometimes hard to find among bakeries. 

My only gripe is that I called a few times to try and place an order in advance but no one picked up. But they still had a pretty good selection when I arrived so no problems there! Also parking in inner Richmond can be horrendous.
author: Evelyn C.

description: Best Tiramisu, still one of the best sweets shop in town. I always visit every time I am back in town!
author: Phoebe G.

description:
Classic bakery near where some relatives live so I have visited multiple times with different people. Definitely a favorite among family and friends.

Swedish Princess Cake: definitely the best thing here, get it.
Strawberry Shortcake: first time I got this it was amazing, second time it was a little dry. 
Bear Claw (forgot their name for it): great almond flavor and crunchy!
Raspberry Croissant: sounds better than it tastes, just has jam inside.

TLDR: get the princess cake.
author: Chrissy G.

description: This bakery makes amazing cakes! I've had quite a few for birthday parties, and ordered a delicious tiramisu cake for my boyfriend for his birthday. It did not disappoint.
author: Larissa S.

description: The best cake in town, hands down -- Schubert's Opera cake. It's been a huge hit at all our birthday and holiday celebrations. Beautiful decorating, fresh ingredients, perfect richness.
author: Dejana B.

description: Best princess cake! Color is actually customizable, instead of a green cake we had a pink one and asked for simplified decor. Delicious!
author: Sarah L.

description:
OMG--I can't believe I haven't written a review of Schubert's!

I've been here no less than 15 times.  It's another MUST stop whenever we go to  Green Apple Books.

I am hooked on their Princess Cake---aptly name since I feel like a princess eating this lovely, luscious calorie-laden cake.

The staff here is very sweet.  I think it helps that the customers are sooooooooooooooo happy to be there--I've never seen anyone there without a smile on their face.

I went there with my friend, a Schubert's Newbie, she studied the items in the case so carefully and ended up ordering a Strawberry Mousse cake. I got the Swedish Princess cake.  Both were delicious although NT thought my princess cake was too sweet.

As we were leaving we ran into our East Bay neighbor, MM, who works in the city but was on a break.  Yup she was there to satisfy her Schubert's fix.  She mentioned that her daughter,B, liked the Chocolate Mousse.  So undaunted by the possible embarrassment of re-entering Schubert's i knew I HAD to get B her Mousse cake.
I of course had to get a slice of Tiramisu (to go) for myself.

I've never been much of a tiramisu fan.  The ones I've had in the US have had too much alcohol and ladyfingers.  When we were in Italy we had the BEST tiramisu--
so so good.  The Schubert's tiramisu was really darn good.
author: Rinky N.

description:
Came here upon friend's recommendation, and was not disappointed! 

We walked in near closing and was surprised with the amount of options still left! My friends and I decided on the Princess Cake for our own little Princess's birthday :p. Everyone was very nice and answered all our questions. ie. What's a Princess cake? heh.

The birthday cake was a success! It was cute and delicious. The main point was it wasn't too sweet!

I'm not a SF local, but whenever I think I'm in the area (aka Irving, not Clement) I always ask if Schubert's is nearby.  BUT, it's not. *cries* Either way, I am glad we got to try Schubert's and I can't wait to go back! (Hopefully soon, and on the correct side of Golden Gate Park)
author: Winnie I.

description:
One word: TIRAMISU.
GET IT GET IT. It's the best Tiramisu I've ever had. It's the only cake worth the calories, lol. This is a must get everytime I'm on Clement. Their Napolean is also very good-- puff pastry that is flaky with a sweet cream and strawberries!
author: Cassandra T.

description: Old School charm and high quality cakes you don't find anymore. I've ordered cakes from this place and they are high quality, classic tastes and are presented great. Parking was tough but its well worth it. Also the prices are very affordable for the quality they put out.
author: John O.

description:
There's a reason why Schubert's has been around for 94 years! 

Actually, reasons: excellent cakes that are very pretty, airy, not too sweet and easy on the wallet. 

I love their Swedish Princess cake: layers of white cake with raspberry and Kirsch custard, whipped cream and covered in a perfect Marzipan icing. This is a classic!

The chocolate mousse is a chocolate cake with chocolate mousse and chocolate whipped cream topped with chocolate shavings. Is that chocolatey enough for you? Oh, I think so!

The mango mousse is a tropical delight and always a hit with the co-workers. 

Thank you Schubert's for making me fat!
author: Janice C.

description:
BEST BAKERY IN THE BAY!!!! I grew up in the city and used to frequent this place. I now live in Fremont and STILL make the trip out here to get my cakes. Their princess cake is hands down best in the bay area and I've tried princess cakes from like 8 different bakeries and Schubert's win by a mile. My best friends got me their princess cake with pink fondant and it was just beautiful! And so tasty! 

I'd recommend their princess cake, chocolate mousse, Italian rum, and opera cake! Their cakes are really great because 1) it's not too sweet, 2) chocolate tastes like real chocolate and not that fake powder stuff, 3) soft moist cake consistency, 4) original cakes. 

I used to be a big fan for their mango/currant mousse but the last two times, the cakes were a little drier than I'd like it to be. It's a hit or miss though because sometimes it's perfectly moist! Definitely try if you haven't before :)
author: Christal T.

description:
The cakes are top notch! Every year my birthday cake is the Saint Honore cake and Schubert's does it best! I've tried many places and nothing compares to Schubert's! Quality is excellent. They have many choices for slices too. Double chocolate mousse is a fav! 
If you're in the area, do it...grab a cake or a slice! You won't regret it!
author: ReliSu P.

description:
Schubert's, you are a delectable surprise. Who would have thought that I'd find a European bakery nestled amongst all the Asian storefronts on Clement? Not me.

Within mere moments, I was able to ascertain that Schubert's pièce de résistance is the Swedish Princess cake. Made for the discerning adult sweet lover in mind - and perhaps smaller people who happen to love Disney princesses? - this multi-layered white cake features a not-so-attractive neon fondant exterior but is filled with raspberry, kirsch custard, whipped cream, and marzipan icing. And the best part? They sell it by the slice for less than $4, so I can get my sweet fix without committing to a huge cake. Perfect for when then craving strikes!

Don't miss any of their signature cakes or the unbelievably flaky croissant filled with sweet vanilla custard... Schubert's is the real deal!
author: Jelena Z.

description:
Mango mousse cake and swedish princess cake:
-Pretty presentation but tasted predictable and nothing at all mindblowing
-The marzipan icing on the swedish princess cake was actually kind of disgusting; I prefer my desserts come without covered in artificial playdo
author: Tian Q.

description: Came in to order 4 mini chocolate mouse and 1 mini tiramisu for a few coworker's birthday.  Happy birthday with each coworker's name was written on the individual mini cake, it turned out great! The people there are genuinely nice.
author: April N.

description:
This review is only for their fruit tart, since that is all I was able to try.
