I kind of hate to admit this, but the fruit tarts here beat out the fruit tarts at Porto's in LA area.  I love the fruit tarts at both places because they look wondrous and are nto overly sweet.  While both places fill their fruit tarts to the brim with fresh fruit, I've noticed that Porto's has been cutting cost and using nasty canned peaches and pears on some of their fruit tarts.  I also think Shubert's has a better crust because it was just hard enough to hold everything together, but was so easy to cut and bite through (it just crumbles in your mouth).  I'll have to come back to try their fruit cake, which I overheard from one of their regular patrons was delicious enough for her to attempt to place an order for one two weeks in advance (the fruit cakes are only made during holiday season apparently).
author: Will L.

description: My mom tasted this cake at a babys first birthdays. She wanted me to give thanks to the chef and bakery. She says the strawberry shortcake was beautifully decorated with an assortment of fresh fruit. The taste was familiar but on a completely higher level. Super fresh. They use a balanced whipping cream with the right proportion to cake. When my mom went to nanny the next day at the baby's house she noticed there was cake from the party. She definitely had another helping.
author: Lara H.

description: Wow! Huge selection, delicious treats, kind and friendly service.. impressive. I ordered a cake for my bff who LOVES their Napoleon. They wrote her name and the whole 9 yards, and it looked just beautiful. It was ready when I arrived and then they helped me pick out a DELICIOUS coffee cake to take into work. For $8.99 it was a steal and everyone raved about how delicious it was.
author: Kristina K.

description:
You know when it's a legit celebration when you see the Schubert's box. ALL of their cakes are really good (the ones I've tried so far).. they're always moist and just the right amount of sweetness - a thorough variety of cakes!!!

I typically judge quality of a bakery based on their whipped cream - this place does it right: fluffy, subtly sweet and light.

I recommend all of their cakes - high quality at fair prices - about $29 for an 8' cake, not bad at all. (My personal favorites thus far are the opera cake and St. Honore cake :))

Constantly busy but workers are always super attentive and friendly.
author: Emily C.

description:
Beautiful creative cakes! I always pick up the princess cake here which seems to be the best out of most of the cakes I've tasted here.

You can call ahead and reserve a cake for a special occasion and I've gotten so many compliments on the princess cake!

Customer service is great.
author: Sarah K.

description:
I drove up to San Francisco from San Jose to buy some princess cake for my princess of a mom whose birthday was a couple of days ago. This cake is frickin BOMB! I always thought that I didn't really care for marzipan, but this is something else! Seriously try the princess cake, you won't regret it. 

Also, I know some bakeries will sell out their cakes really quickly. I was nervous that I would leave empty handed, being that I got to the bakery around 2pm, but there was no problem at all. They can write on the cake for you really quickly, and the staff here is extremely friendly as well. 

Definitely recommend, and am totally going to return. Good thing I don't live next door, I would probably be 200 lbs heavier, phew, I guess its not too horrible that I live pretty far!
author: Chloe R.

description:
Schubert's has become my family's go to place for birthday cakes. Pretty much everything is good, some of my favorites include the double chocolate mousse, tiramisu, white raspberry mousse, and the fruit basket. Cheesecakes, pastries, and cookies are also great. 

For a recent birthday, I chose a fruit tart since the huge mound of fruit looked super fresh which is not always true when it's not fruit season. Although the fruit was really good, I found the crust to be too thick and not crisp enough for my liking. There was also an artificial or off vanilla flavor in the custard or perhaps the jam they used in the tart. While their cakes are good, I would try another place for fruit tarts.
author: Melissa C.

description: Picked up a cake here for my boyfriend's mother and was very happy with it! We ordered the chocolate mousse cake and the chocolate work on the top was gorgeous! The bakery itself has lots of pastries to choose from and also ones on the menu that you can order ahead to make sure it's there when you arrive.
author: Pauline T.

description:
Mango mousse cake
Strawberry mousse cake

These two are stellar cakes and affordable too at $18.95 for a 6" and $28.95 for an 8". I highly recommend a day-of purchase for birthdays and other celebrations. I always want to try the princess cake (sweet marzipan goodness) , but can't resist the usual staples. Next time!
author: Sarah W.

description: Got a wonderful princess cake for my 1 year old's birthday as well as additional desserts. Ordered everything a few days before the event, pickup and everything went well! Everything was very delicious!!!
author: Timea B.

description:
Nice staff, clean place, and lovely delicious cakes!

They have lots of flavors but I recommend the tiramisu cakes. Theres small for 4$ and the regular size for 18$. 

Always buy cakes for my friends' birthdays and myself, and Ive never been disappointed!!
author: Josie D.

description:
Great cakes! Great prices! You can even order online if you want it in a couple of days or if you want it sooner just call in.
I ordered the Tiramisu cake which is my fiancé's favorite for his birthday. It was designed very nicely!
They had written what I wanted on there perfectly also.
The cake was delicious. Not too rich... Pretty light actually. Not super sweet either. Just right :)
I am super excited to have found a new favorite. I will certainly order other ones to try.... August is the month of Birthdays in my family so we will be eating a lot of cake :D
author: Kimia R.

description: Schubert's bakery is one of the best bakeries in the city. I have tried the Swedish Princess Cake Slice, Mini Mango Mousse, Mini Raspberry Mousse and Raspberry Mousse cake. Everything that I got tasted so good and I definitely do RECOMMEND THE SWEDISH PRINCESS CAKE! It's perfect for birthdays, special events or anytime you feel like having some yummy cake. I liked how there cakes are not too sweet because although I like sweets, I don't want to have diabetes... The cake itself was moist and light while the mousse was creamy and rich. Yummy! I love how they decorate there cakes as well! Just too cute! This place is also an excellent place for you to have some afternoon tea time with your friend. Great atmosphere, good customer service and yummy treats! What more can you ask for!?
author: Shirley G.

description:
We were very impressed with this little bakery! We were just returning to our car from having dinner with friends when Schubert's caught our eye. Someone in our group knew its reputation so even though we were stuffed we just couldn't pass up the chance to see if all the accolades were deserved. Spoiler alert: they were...

Our group had tiramisu, opera cake, German cheesecake, and little butter cookies topped with fruit. All the pastries were awesome,with my favorite being the little slice of heaven disguised as German cheesecake.

We may have to go really far out of our way to try this place again. Highly recommended...
author: Art C.

description:
A party is never a party without the presence of a cake or cheesecake from this amazing place. Absolutely everything is to die for. The flavor, the freshness, and the designs are always perfect! 

Every family gathering and event, we always have a cake from this bakery because everyone is so obsessed. 

I usually always get the opera cake, no matter the occasion, but lately I've been exploring the fruity cakes and they are just as delicious. 

Always recommend this place to everyone :) 
You won't regret it!
author: Julia K.

description: Get the strawberry mouse cake. The small size is perfect for 6 people. Light and fresh tasting!
author: Valerie G.

description: Their sweets are simply the best. Keep coming back here for Birthday cakes every year.
author: Julie D.

description:
Beautiful cake designs, 
Wonderful taste,
so many different flavors or types of cakes,
fantastic staff[friendly and accommodating],
you can order your cake online,
yay!

there are 3 mini tables inside if you want to grab a cake and indulge. nice hangout on a rainy day. at least that's what I did for half an hour with my chocolate cake. I was such a happy girl.

fantastic flavors:
princess cake,
tiramisu,
mango mousse,
opera cake [wow!]
author: Veranna N.

description:
I haven't tried anything aside from the Princess Cake, but that cake itself deserves 5 stars. The cake is so light and fluffy, the raspberry in between the layers aren't too sweet. The fondant is a delicious almond extract fondant, and is definitely not thick or disgusting like most other fondants. 

Prices are reasonable too. I think its around $4 for a slice and $18 for a 6" cake which could easily feed 8 people.
author: Stacey L.

description:
Every time I have to get a cake for some special occasion, Schubert's Bakery is the 1st place to come to mind. I've never been disappointed by any cake I've eaten from there. 

I live in the opposite side of the city from here, but I make the 20-minute trek to get some of their delicious cakes. 

My all-time favorite cake is the Opera Cake, which is defined in their website as "hazelnut sponge with chocolate truffle and mocha-praline filling topped with toasted almonds." It may sound extremely sweet, but it actually contains just the right amount of sweetness in my opinion. After purchasing it today, I've converted my cousin. It is now her favorite as well. 

The St. Honore is probably my second favorite. It's a tiramisu cake garnished with lady fingers & cream puffs. 

I've also had their Swedish Princess cake. It's great, but still doesn't beat the Opera cake in my book. 

I like to think that the prices for this place is commensurate to what you get. The consistency in the taste & look of their cakes keeps me coming back.
author: Katrina R.

description:
Schubert's has one of the best Princess Cakes I've ever tried, ever. If you love Princess Cake, you need to check out Schubert's version as soon as possible! Aside from Princess Cake, and other cakes, Schubert's also has a wide variety of pastries to choose from, which is what I opted for this time:

-Mini Hazelnut? Pistachio? Cookies ($4.25): I can't remember which flavor cookies we got, but they were delicious! They were buttery tasting and not too sweet, which made it very easy to eat half the bag without noticing. Highly recommended!
-Danish ($2.35, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/schuberts-bakery-san-francisco?select=Pq-viAX1iaXtLIkrd71AFg#Pq-viAX1iaXtLIkrd71AFg): This was good, but nothing special. The pastry was nicely flaky, but I probably wouldn't get it again.
-Cheese Danish ($2.95, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/schuberts-bakery-san-francisco?select=Pq-viAX1iaXtLIkrd71AFg#7a4A4JomkyjYwjlrBz2vAw): Yum! I loved how much cheese filling they had, and the texture of this danish. Recommended.
-Hot Cross Bun ($1.65, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/schuberts-bakery-san-francisco?select=Pq-viAX1iaXtLIkrd71AFg#rucoryUBvak8yz8IjkrY2g): Eh.. not so great. However, I haven't met a hot cross bun that I've liked, so I'm just going to skip trying anymore of these. 

My only complaint about Schubert's is that they don't have the most efficient ordering system. The customers just mill around until one of the employees is available to help them, and it's on the honor system of helping whoever came first. Aside from that, Schubert's Bakery is one of those San Francisco institutions that is a must stop for anyone with a sweet tooth! Parking is horrible in this area, so some circling may be necessary, but street parking spots are available.
author: Amy D.

description:
One of my favorite bakeries ever. 

I've only tried two things here: the princess cake and fruit tart. Both are out of this world! If you're a marzipan fan, you will love princess cake. It's a little too sweet for me, but paired with a cup of green tea, it's perfect. 

Their fruit tart is THE BEST. I tried it just once a few months ago, and I crave it till this day.
author: Nari C.

description: This bakery is near and dear to my heart. My family use to come here for literally every occasion even though we live on the other side of the city. The prices are fair for quality desserts in San Francisco - I bought a white chocolate raspberry mousse today for $4.25. Other treats - cheesecakes of various flavors, mousses, etc - were more or less the same price for a single serving. It was light and fluffy, which I really enjoy with my desserts. When I say light and fluffy, I don't mean flavorless at all - it is so packed with delicate flavors and nice textures that play well off the tastes. The delicate chocolate shavings on top were delightful too (and also the main reason I ordered a slice). Also the princess cake is amazing, so if you have never had one or even heard of one, trust me and order up!
author: Sophie D.

description:
Schubert's. Schubert's. Schubert's. Where do I begin? 

When you walk into this Clement Street bakery you find yourself overwhelmed with 3 glass cases of goodies. You can choose from fruit tarts of all sizes, big, colorful fondant covered cakes, small cheesecake slices, danishes, croissants and so much more. There's always customers in here enjoying their sweets and coffee if not a small line of people waiting to be helped. I have never seen this quaint little bakery empty. 

They make the desserts right in the back and even make their own edible chocolate decorations painted with edible gold and purple paint. The prices are reasonable for the quality dessert you are getting. I've had many different sweets from here. My boyfriend likes to get a couple different desserts and share them every once and a while. He can never choose just one :)

Recently I ordered a cake for a birthday and it was delicious. They didn't even charge me extra for adding fresh raspberries on top of my chocolate cake with a rum cream filling. Everyone at the party loved it. It served about 10 people and was only $24. 

The people have been on and off friendly to me. I have had some really helpful and nice ladies help me and then other annoyed and unhelpful ladies as well. It's a fast paced purchase though so I don't really care most of the time. 

This bakery has been around for almost 95 years and once you try their pastries and cakes you'll know why. Be careful if you come in here hungry! It's already hard enough to choose!
author: Ashley M.

description: Fruit basket cake (all kinds of fruit between white cake layers and yummy cream frosting topped with more fruit) is our gang's go-to birthday cake in SF. So light and moist, you can have two slices and not feel guilty! Hats off to a wonderful neighborhood bakery!
author: Angelique V.

description:
The raspberry lemon cake was amazing. White sponge cake with a raspberry rum filling. Which were delicious. Not overly sweet. Its buttercream frosting on top with a checkered design using raspberry syrup and the circumference is covered in nuts. The milk chocolate flowers are soo good and they had syrups inside. The white chocolate is perfectly flavored n rich.
Another recommendation is the raspberry ring and raspberry melanges? (Small pastries.)
author: Mar L.

description:
I totally rely on yelp to find the best bakeries wherever I travel to and when I was in SF, this bakery popped up.  Once I walked in, my inner fatty self felt like she died and gone to heaven!  There were just so many items to choose from!  But since it was my sister's birthday, I got a small Swedish Princess with her bday greeting and name on it.  I also got the mango mousse.  

The Swedish princess was good but I loved the mango mousse!  I nearly inhaled my piece and was sad when it was gone.  I should've ordered more.  But next time I come back to SF, I know to grab a few.  

I will be back to Schubert.  Only bad thing is that the parking sucks!
author: Mel B.

description:
This review is solely for the Swedish princess cake.

A family friend was talking about how "amazinggggg" it was when she had it at a party and said that she would bring some by, so she brought it over today!

Basically a sponge-cake,  with raspberry custard, and whipped cream, topped with marzipan.  Was it "amazingggg"??? No. Honestly, I had great expectations for it.  But it's a glorified, overhyped cake that is so easy to make yourself. Also, I'm not a marzipan kind of gal. So that didn't help make it any better.

It's a fairly good cake, light and airy...just not as amazing as it's hyped up to be.

My suggestion is that you go to Ikea. They have petit princess cakes in the food area and in their refrigerated aisles. They are just as good. Actually tastes the exact same at a fraction of the price. The Marzipan is pink and not as overpowering. I'm not into Marzipan, that's why I like it better.  But if you are a fan of Marzipan you may prefer Schubert's cake over Ikea's. 

I think I'd like to go to the store myself and try a couple other things. The chocolate cake look amazing.
author: Tien H.

description:
For any occasion, whether it be Mother's day, Father's day or a birthday, I always come to Schubert's bakery for a cake.

I've tried a variety of cakes from Schubert's and they're very light and refreshing.

Mango Mousse - a light and refreshing cake that's not too sweet and not too tart.
Swedish princess - a green fondant cake
Tropical and peach mousse - again a very light and refreshing cake
Almond chocolate cake - by far the most delicious! A yummy chocolate cake with bits of almonds and decorating garnishes.

Schubert's also has a variety a little pastries for you to try.
author: Mabel Y.

description: Can't wait to have the princess cake for my birthday soon !! My friends ordered the princess cake for their Christmas party and it was soooo delicious! Super light and not overly sweet! Perfection! If I could eat princess cake everyday I would
author: Rita A.

description:
Great bakery with delicious cakes, but prices keep rising too fast! What used to be 3.50 for a slice of their cakes is now 4.25 a slice within a year.  

I really like the Swedish princess cake and Opera cake.
author: Mary X.

description: I love their Swedish Princess Cake. Love the green marzipan and the delicious laters with raspberry filling.
author: Melissa T.

description: Walked in to get a cake for my sister. The service was quick and the cakes were delicious! I would totally recommend the chocolate truffle for all you chocolate fans out there!
author: Katy Z.

description: Local seafood. Great ceviche. Conch salad was tasty. The empanas were super crispy. We had a crab and the lobster empanadas.
author: Jenny G.

description:
I looooove this place. Love. Every time I get a cake from this place to gift to someone, I will always get complimented and get asked where the cake is from. 

#1 reason why Schubert's cakes are so awesome: sweet but not overwhelmingly so. You can taste that the cream is freshly made, not made from a factory and taste like plastic, like Safeway cakes. 

The prices are also so reasonable. 

They're also open every day.

Get the strawberry shortcake! That's my favorite.
author: Jessica Y.

description:
This place is the real deal. An honest-to-goodness bakery with a kitchen in the back, which serves up the most delicious cakes and individual pieces. You'll want to photograph their main display case. 

Chocolate lovers beware: it's going to be difficult to leave without eating one (or two) chocolate mousse cakes or chocolate rum layer cakes. At 4.25 - 4.50 each these items aren't cheap, but you get what you pay for. Try the cherry streusel squares if you're there on a Thursday or Saturday. Only 2-3 tables and no atmosphere -- it's a bakery, after all -- but you can sit down with two cakes and a coffee, and watch the world go by on Clement Street.
author: Donald J L.

description: Schubert's bakery carried a variety of different cakes ranging from chocolate to fruity. I love that they make small cakes that are perfect for one or for two. This allowed me to try three different flavors: tropical mousse, chocolate almond cake, and the princess cake. I liked all of them but the princess cake was my favorite. The pricing on these cakes were all very affordable, I think around $4 for one.
author: Vy T.

description:
I first had some cake made with lady fingers from Schubert's at my friend's birthday party and one bite was all it took. After I finished mine, I continued to eyeball other people's plates to see if they would be interested in just giving me the rest of their cake  BECAUSE IT IS SERIOUSLY THE BOMB.COM.
Anyway, since that day I've made frequent trips to Schubert's, even though it's way in the Richmond, and I'm pleased to say that I have yet to be disappointed.
author: Tania S.

description: Looking for a good special occasion cake to take to families and friends.. This one is too die for.. They had a very good staff and very inviting cakes.. I think im going back there just to try each cake that they sell.. Cake is not too sweet but it really melts in your mouth where in you dont want to take anything to loose the taste..well try it, hard to put it in words the experience of Real Good Cake.. Parking is metered but its worth it..
author: Marnie P.

description:
This bakery made me meet by new best friend - Napolean. Its the best pastry i have ever had. We drive all the way to SF to just have this killer creation - love the layers freshness. Yes, it gets sold out very fast. So book ahead of time and eat asap.

I have tried almost everything on the menu - all pastries are fresh, moist and super delicious. Opera is my second favorite,  a very well done cake, rich layers of Chocolate and Ganache, wrapped in almonds. Oh soo good. May be i should driving again. 

Top of that service is A class , and all pastries and cake look out of the world. I wish i could give them 6 stars.
author: Hitashi D.

description: This place is so good. I try to stop there every time  on my way to work. Their cinnamon bun are really good! There are a lot of different cakes and desserts I need to try ;)
author: Kuba T.

description:
Thank alot Schubert. 
I order this for birthday party and everyone was talking about cake. 
IT WAS THE BEST CAKE I EVER HAD!!!!
author: Saurabh M.

description: I'll give it four stars just because it is hard to find a Swedish Princess cake unless you make it yourself, otherwise three. Also, it was very reasonably priced at 19.95 for the smallest size of 8 inches. The marzipan was good and not too green or sweet. Disappointing was the fact that there was not any custard in between just whipped cream (not homemade) and raspberry filling. It wasn't very authentic but still the best deal given limited options. They will write an inscription for free, unlike Victoria's. I also decided to go with Schuberts instead because I heard hers is way too sweet. Overall, cute little reasonably priced German Bakery that's been around for many generations, just wish they at least put custard in the Swedish Princess cake like it's supposed to have.
author: Emily B.

description:
Hubby needed his coffee fix after a lunch visit with mom, it was pure luck that we wondered into Schubert's based on the assumption that coffee is better at western bakeries. I didn't realize it's such a popular place until trying to write a review.  Like I said, it was our lucky day.

I decided to do some grocery shopping while hubby was sitting at one of the 3 little tables with his cup of coffee, a mini blueberry tart and free WIFI. When I returned I found a very happy man, completely satisfied with his little coffee break. He said the tart was REALLY good. 

We purchased a large blueberry tart which happened to be on special for only $11, can't believe how reasonable it was. Although not a dessert lover myself, I do agree that the tart is quite good. The blueberry filling layered on top of marzipan was flavorful and not too sweet, the tart crust was softer then what we are used to but turned out to be a plus. All the desserts large or small looked fantastic, will definitely be coming back to try more varieties of the beautiful desserts.
author: Julie W.

description:
One of my favorite bakeries in SF! This place has a lot of good tasty items to choose from. I mostly like their fruit tart and their Napoleon and some of their cakes. I wouldn't say the super popular princess cake is my favorite since I'm not a big fan of marzipan...
The price is a little high but since everyone loves it it doesn't really matter. Usually they sell out of things like fruit tarts so you need to call in advance. You also need to call in if you want a specific cake to be made. 
There was one time I went in and there were flies inside the glass counter... That made me not want to get anything that day. I told them about it and the workers didn't seem to care.
The seating is very limited which is something that can be annoying but overall it's a decent bakery!
author: Vicky C.

description:
What a great place!  The quality of all their products is excellent in taste, appearance and price, and their staff is friendly, efficient and helpful, never making you feel like you're being rushed. 

The variety of baked goods is the best I've ever seen in the City, and I've never been disappointed with anything I've purchased there. 

Here's a clue showing how good Schubert's is;  ... When we have dinner guests, or if we're the guests at dinner elsewhere, it's never considered a faux pas to leave the box the dessert came in out in the open, as long as the box says "Schubert's."  

Corny, but true. It's that good.
author: Chuck L.

description: Yummy cakes! If you are looking for beautiful tasty cake, you should definitely be here.
author: Surada L.

description:
Ever since I was living in the neighborhood in the nineties (because I'm old, natch) I have loved Schubert's,

My two favorite things are...

 the people who work here, who are really nice and accommodating either in person, or taking an order over the phone

the princess cake!!

I always feel silly ordering it, because of the name, but it is so,so good!!!
author: Laura C.

description: Best princess cake in San Francisco. The mocha cake is also amazing. The cake isn't overly sweet and perfect for Asian parents. They have great service and know what they are doing.
author: Diana L.

description: My goodness, this place is delicious! I went in to pick up some pasties for a small get together I was attending, so I got a variety so I could cut them up and plate them. It was an absolute hit, and everyone needed to know where I them from. Their pastries were delicious, I can't wait to go back and check out their cakes! Check this place out! It's a little on the pricey side, but completely worth it.
author: Faye S.

description: When you make my boyfriend's birthday special by getting his cake just right and *incredibly* beautiful, you get 5 stars from me. Everyone at the birthday party table enjoyed the amazing Strawberry Shortcake, and the secret slice of Strawberry Cheesecake the birthday boy got to eat all to himself was just the cherry on top. BEAUTIFUL cakes. Delicious. Affordable (for how beautiful and tasty it all is). And so perfect. Will be back again for many more birthdays and celebrations in the future!
author: Sherilynn M.

description:
My sweet tooth longs for cakes from here a lot. 

Schubert's Bakery is a quaint little bakery that only has about 2 tables inside for you to sit at, but what they don't have in sitting, they make up for by their GINORMOUS amount of cakes and cookies and pastries and awesomeness. Did you get the last part? Okay, cool. Just making sure. 

This bakery is located on Clement St. between 6th and 7th avenue. Parking is all on the street and it's metered parking unless you want to try looking for spots in the residential zone. 

Service here is pretty good although sometimes the person helping me lacks a smile or a friendly atmosphere. But hey- at least they attempt to help me. 

They have a large variety of cakes like mango/strawberry/raspberry/peach mousse, tiramisu, original/mango cheesecake, Swedish Princess... etc. You definitely should make an effort to come check this place out. 

Prices are sort of expensive for a small cake, but they're pretty yummy cakes so I'm not gonna complain.
author: Venus L.

description: My family's favorite sf bakery. We usually get the princess cake here and I was worried they would sell out since they don't take phone orders on the weekend.  I was still able to buy a cake around 3pm on a Sunday but don't recommend it. Definitely try to order 2 days ahead.
author: Amy G.

description:
This German bakery is currently celebrating its 94th anniversary so I used this occasion to order the Swedish Princess Cake to share with Yelpers at a get together in San Francisco. I first learned about this bakery from Cassie J Rinky N, and Shannon F and their stellar reviews, and was able to order the cake ahead of time with a great deal of convenience. They bake their cakes fresh daily and the Princess Cake is usually available by 11 in the morning. By the time I stopped by to visit with fellow Yelper Fia R, the bakery was bustling with cake enthusiasts at every turn. 

The squared shaped bakery is put together with a small seating area and two huge glass cases adorned with all sorts of cakes stacked on display. Above it all was a row of overhead boards listing an extensive selection of cakes that ranged from three distinct categories: Mousse Cakes, Buttercream Cakes, and Whipped Cream Cakes. I was so pleased with all the exquisite presentations I was tempted to get an additional cake for the event.

The 8 inch Swedish Princess Cake ($27.95) came out looking like a big tennis ball. It was layered with smooth marzipan icing and whipped cream over a moist white spongy cake embodied with raspberry and custard fillings. The sticky elastic texture coming from the marzipan icing gave a nice contrast to the light whipped cream and smooth custard, and the overall taste was sensational and perfectly sweet. The cake was easy to slice into and the perfect size to feed the eight of us with leftovers. 

Service was quick, friendly, responsive, and efficient. The bakery gets really busy throughout the day but their staff does a great job at keeping a sense of order. Next time I'll have to try their Saint Honore Cake and see how they compare to Dianda's. Their Mousse Cakes seem to be their top sellers too so I hope to have plenty of chances to come back to visit. 5 stars for originality and refined balance between texture, moisture, and flavor.
author: Daniel L.

description:
I really don't care for chocolate. For the most part, I don't even care for cake.

Then I had Schubert's Chocolate Truffle cake.

I'm probably going to get my best friend's birthday cake from here now because it was the most delectable, creamy and luscious but not-too-heavy chocolate cake I have ever had in my entire life.

I finished the entire slice.
I haven't done that since I was a kid.

Maybe I should be too scared to step into this awesome bakery in case I leave with EVERYTHING. Then everyone will be angry for them selling out :))

But seriously, awesome cakes, good price point and they look good! What else can you ask for?!
author: Winè C.

description:
The reviews of this place definitely drew me in. I agree the Swedish princess cake was different from anything I had previously. 

But the array of mouses they have didn't click with me.
They were pretty but they were dry to me and not very flavorful. 

The sponge concoctions were ok. But I wouldn't get it again.

One gripe is that the 2 cakes i wanted to try are only sold as a whole. So you can't get 1 or 2 pieces. You have to get the whole damn thing.

I came expecting something entirely different and maybe that's what got me...

Still on the hunt for a fav bakery here...
author: Marlena P.

description:
I walk in Schuberts and the smell is just delicious! I gained 5 lbs just smelling the aroma! I feel myself getting larger! Since I filled myself up with baked aroma air, I had to fill myself up with the baked goods! There was just so much to choose from! I felt like Charlie from "willy wonka and the chocolate factory" when he goes in the candy store deciding what to get for him and his grandpa Joe. Well my grandpa Joe is my belly and he's asking for a slice of tiramisu! I make my grandpa joe happy and feed him tiramisu! Sooo good! 

He's rumbling again and wants the chocolate mousse with almonds! No problem! I love feeding my grandpa Joe! Creamy chocolate goodness he tells me! At this point I was hoping there was a golden ticket inside my desserts so I could end up owning this place! But no, there wasn't, oh well I'll just have to keep getting more desserts till a golden ticket appears! If not? Well at least I'm eating, I mean my "grandpa joe" is eating,some of the best desserts around!
author: Roger P.

description:
I really had trouble finding a bakery who makes "GOOD" Princess Cake after Miette discontinued to make one. 

A tweet from Twitter directed me to visit this bakery located in Richmond District. 

Well, I am going to get another princess cake for 4th of July weekend gathering today. 

An overheard conversation like "What is good?" and a store clerk's response "Everything perfect" make perfectly sense to me. 

A friend who has never tried their cake say "Why do you need to go to all the way to Richmond District to get cakes from Mission?" and other who happen to know this bakery said "I know that place" when I bring up their cakes. 

The friend resides in Hayes Valley gets cakes from Safeway on Market St. I think he needs to learn a route to get Richmond district pretty soon.
author: Vicki S.

description: Bought a strawberry shortcake for my boyfriend's birthday. The cake was so cute, I couldn't wait to show it to him so I showed it to him a day early LOL. He really loved the cake like I did. The cake was moist, strawberries were very sweet, and the cream was so perfect! Not too sweet and not too heavy. I also bought a blueberry pastry which was flaky and so good!! Love this place!
author: Michelle K.

description:
Swedish Princess.

That's all I seriously need to say!

Get it!

All their cakes are so beautiful and delicious looking! The Swedish Princess wasn't like the typical heavy and rich American style cake. This was is really light and fluffy with just the right flavor of raspberry to it. I never eat the frosting on a cake, but the cheese mixture they use for their frosting was just too delicious to pass up!

I haven't had any problems finding parking on the street. Their service was prompt and cordial. I had reserved a cake for my mom's 70th birthday about 4 days prior and scheduled to pick it up at 4pm on a Sunday and they even gave me a call to remind me to pick it up when I was running a bit late. 

I vow to come here....again....and again!
author: Sam L.

description:
A friendly, popular, neighborhood bakery with a reputation for creating some pretty darn delicious sweets. I won't deny it! I love the no frills/fuss when placing orders. I've ordered cakes online, over the phone, and in-person and have never had an issue whatsoever. Each order is always ready when it needs to be and the staff are pleasant to work with, even on busy weekends.

Must tries:
-Princess cake - not a big fondant person, but the inner layers are light and sweet; not too overpowering. One of the best desserts offered here.
-Tiramisu cake - definitely for chocolate lovers. I have a big sweet tooth and this one is a great treat for it. Cake is moist with a hint of a coffee taste to it.
-Mango mousse cake - tangy yet somehow it balances the sweetness of the cake.

Another highlight is that they really pay attention to presentation. These cakes are absolutely beautiful to look at...and devour. Enjoy!
author: Loriel L.

description:
This decidedly European bakery has always struck me as something of an anomaly on this stretch of Clement which otherwise feels like an Asian bazaar - sushi bars, pho shops, Korean barbecue, bubble tea. There's even a Hong Kong-style restaurant supply store next door. So you really don't expect to find a tiramisu or a princess cake in these parts, but sure enough, there it is with all these intricately designed cakes and glorious tarts on display. It's all very nice eye candy.

But on the fringe, it does feel a bit tired. The back shelves are filled with unfolded boxes and tired-looking decorations like none of the staff have turned their backs in twenty years. But if I was in need of a birthday cake, I would definitely come here considering the artistry I saw. As it was, Jamie W. and I were looking for something a bit sweet after our mochi bacon at Halu. We went for a $2.50 square of Apple Strudel which was as sweet as you would expect with all sorts of sugary crumble on top (see photo).

BAKED GOODS - 3 stars...very traditional stuff
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...beautiful cakes to look at, the rest of the decor not so much
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...lots of women waiting to serve you the sweets
TOTAL - 3 stars...like a Tyrolean village in the middle of the Far East
author: Ed U.

description:
Not sure what I can add. The princess cake was A HIT at a birthday party I attended.

I ordered online. No problems. Paid for in advance. Walk in, give my name, walk out with cake. The other cakes on display were stunning to look at. Too bad I don't live in SF.
author: Martin S.

description:
It was just an ordinary day doing some exploring around the Inner Richmond district and we stumbled into this bakery after having lunch at Q Restaurant and Wine Bar. It's a popular bakery with lots of people inside ordering and only like 4 tables but the "line" is quick and people are in and out. I don't think many people were here to dine-in like I was. 

I went with the popular swedish princess cake because of all the raving about it. It was pretty good, but not sure if it falls into the to-die-for category since I'm not really a dessert dude. But if you're like me and just want to try out something tasty here, then it's not a bad idea to go with that. Basically, it's a great place to stop and satisfy a sweet tooth or maybe get a birthday cake.
author: Marlon T.

description: My favorite bakery in San Francisco! High quality. A grand variety of desserts, and each one is beautifully presentable. No doubt, each treat is delightfully tasteful & just perfect (minus the calories)! Friendly service = another plus!
author: Pina U.

description: I've tried the princess cake, tiramisu, tropical mousse, mango mousse, currant mousse, and the napoleon. All were great! Kinda pricey. My next stop will be the gym.
author: Mingmei N.

description:
The yelpers have done it again!

Such an amazing establishment for a great team of cake-sters. The must have is the tiramisu. What is in it you might asked? Heaven.

Fluffs and fluffs of chocolate delight-ness. Who doesn't like cake dunked in alcohol and with lightly whipped creamy icing. They make it so light yet so rich. I day dream about this cake while I am at work, thinking when my diet can squeeze a thick slice of the tiramisu or even the whole cake since its pretty tiny. 

Expect for your favorite cake to be gone. It is pretty popular. I would highly recommend calling in ahead of time and putting it on reserve. I have not tried the other cakes since I am scared to take risks, but the sound of the other yelpers the princess cake sounds pretty delicious as well. Maybe next time!
author: Phuong V.

description:
We went into Schubert's Bakery last time we were in SF but didn't order anything as we were stuffed. This time we ordered a couple things to take on the go and enjoyed them in the car when we were stuck in some insanely, barely moving traffic.

We tried three small desserts:
- Opera cake ($3.75)
- Mini lemon mousse ($3.75)
- Another I can't remember now but it was chocolate layered.

They were all delicious. Not overly sweet and very smooth. My mom and I gobbled up all three between the two of us. If your a cake/dessert lover, you will love this place. Also, the prices for the large cakes are very reasonable. Definitely worth a stop if your in the area!
author: Jonny M.

description:
*this review is based solely on their FRUIT TART.

I ordered a "berries-only fruit tart" for my bf's birthday--it was a-mazing. filled to the brim with lots and lots of blackberries, blueberries, raspberries, strawberries...i think that covers all of them? (maybe...). The bottom layer was a moist, rum custard which I was crossing my fingers to not be dry (and it wasnt! score.) 

Thanks for helping me with the "supplies," Schubert's :)
author: G L.

description:
Why I'll Think Twice Before Ordering a Birthday Cake Here:

1) I ordered two birthday cakes over the phone but when I showed up they did not have my name or order.  

2) They eventually found one of the cakes, the Princess Cake, but had it noted as pick up for the day before so it had been sitting around for a day.

3)  They didn't have the Opera Cake I had ordered at all!  #EPICFAIL

Luckily, it was in the morning and there was an Opera Cake still available in the case.  Whew!

4)  There was no concern and no apology regarding the botched order.   

While I like the tasty and prettily decorated cakes, the customer service could use some serious help!  :P
author: Amy C.

description:
This review might just be biased. I have nothing bad to say regarding this place. The only thing I may complain about is why it only has 1 branch, in Clement St where parking is almost always, impossible. 

The Princess Cake, absolutely divine!!!

Now, just writing this makes me want to go drive there and get a piece. haha
author: Jan R.

description:
My family has been buying cakes and desserts here for special occasions for who knows how long. Birthdays, anniversaries, graduations, etc. are not complete without a cake from Schubert's. 

My go-to is the Tiramisu, but I also love White Chocolate Raspberry Mousse and Princess Cakes. All of the cakes are beautifully decorated and just taste incredible.
author: Elaine N.

description:
One of the best bakery place in san francisco.
I came here once to get a birthday cake for my gf. I got chocolate truffle cake. It was good.
Since then, I started coming here more often to get some cheesecake.
The asian girl who helped me was really nice and friendly.
I would recommend this place.
author: H R M.

description:
So much variety, so many flavors, so elegant, and decadent!

Some of the best artistry I have ever seen! Everything is uniform and very neat. No little garnish is ever out of place. OOOH MAN, and the taste! I always come in with an idea of what I want to get. Then I see all the other flavors and I have to stand around a good few minutes debating in my head. 

Their MANGO MOUSSE cake is a classic for me, as well as their tiramisu and chocolate truffle! :D 

I recently tried their Swedish Princess but was a bit disappointed. The fondant was too sweet and it was a little crunchy towards the bottom, which I found quite odd. The cake itself is light and the filling isn't too sweet, so it was pleasant. Overall it's a good cake, but I wouldn't buy it again. Stick to their chocolates and fruit mousses! I'm sure their strawberry shortcake and Napoleon will be yummy; they're my next targets!

THE PRICE IS WORTH IT! ;]
author: Angie Y.

description:
Over twenty years ago, this used to be my twice-a-week breakfast spot.  I'd succumb to their almond croissants, chocolate croissants, or danishes for my morning sugar rush.  After a long hiatus, a friend recently told me about my new dessert crush.

Swedish Princess Cake equals B-O-M-B!

***  Non-almond lovers need not reply!
author: Mike C.

description:
Two words... PRINCESS CAKE 

If you only walk out of there with one thing, make sure it's a slice of their Swedish Princess Cake!! 


I've tried several of their other goodies, and they're all pretty good. But 5 stars for their princess cake alone - hands down. I may seem slightly obsessed, but try it and you'll understand. I've tried other places' princess cake, and no where else ever compares to Schubert's.
author: Dana M.

description:
The Baked goods were delicious! We just happened to walk past this little shop and decided to walk in a try a few treats! We tried their napoleon and a slice of their tuxedo cake . Both equally delicious in their own ways! 

The location is a little awkward. Its surrounded by a bunch of Chinese shops. Its also a very small shop tucked in between a bunch of other Chinese shops/restaurants. 

The service..... they did not have a way of assisting customers. The girls actually skipped us. Which I'm okay with, but they could have handled the situation a bit better. But otherwise the girls were still sweet and assisted us In a friendly manner.
author: Nancy T.

description: Great cheese cake and bakery goods! Seemed busy (and crowded) but the service was fast! Would recommend.
author: Emily M.

description:
I use to love this bakery. I use to be totally loyal to this bakery for 15 years... I went there yesterday because they didn't pick up their phone to pre-order. I drove over in the storm so I can pre-order my FAVORITE coffee crunch cake with extra crunch on the side for my BIRTHDAY... to my disappointment, the nice lady said, "Sorry we discontinued that cake". @@@***^^$^$&^%^%^%$%^. How can you guys discontinue the best cake in the world???? I know it was a special order type of cake but I guarantee you if you made it regularly in the display, everyone will buy it. Don't get me wrong, the other cakes you have are great too but the coffee crunch is amazing. Why get rid of a good thing? As you can see I am very very disappointed. I even texted my friends my disappointment because it's our favorite cake. They gave me a suggestion to order it from a different bakery (There are only 2 other bakeries in SF that makes this cake) even though I was hesitant because I only order from Schuberts, I made that call. I am going to pick up that cake later today. 

Sigh~ First World Problems.....
author: Karen L.

description:
One of the best bakeries in the city, for classic cakes. The variety is enough to make you go back and forth on your decision. All the flavors are great.

I recently got a small chocolate mousse cake with almonds for a birthday. They have several cakes (all different sizes and flavors) ready to go, and they can personalize it in less than 2 minutes.

My only ding is that their website prices are outdated so I ended up paying more than I thought, no biggie but still good to know.
author: Alyssa G.

description:
Finally made it out to this year old bookmark a few weeks back, and holy balls there's so much cake here (some 20-30+ varieties of cakes, by the slice, and whole). Always on the prowl for the perfect cakes, it's a rare occurrence to come across a bakery that serves up these tasty pastries without making them so heavily laden with sugar as to be inedible, or only enjoyable in small doses. 

Even more rare is the non-Asian bakery that manages to do this, with Asian (Taiwanese, in particular) bakeries being known for making the lighter, fluffier, and often fruity varieties of cake. But, Schubert's actually manages all of these! While they certainly have the richer options, they also offer up a variety of what I consider Asian-style fruit cakes.

Coming after a lunch date down the street, the two of us ordered a mango mousse, strawberry shortcake, and a fruit tart [ Photo: http://instagram.com/p/YFCknHQfhp/ ]. The tart, which I had a day or two later, was definitely among some of the tastier ones I've had, with a deliciously smooth custard center. The cakes, which we devoured on-site, had that exact fluffy lightness I associate with my Taiwanese bakeries, so, needless to say, I was a fan.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - It's a little narrow in here, so when it's busy (which I imagine is almost always), things can get a bit crowded. Their display cases also run the length of their counter, so expect a bit of difficulty and the need to reach as you're paying, or getting your cakes. Best to come with someone (or ask one of the many people around you), lest you drop your cake!

Bathroom - Didn't check them out, so I can't comment.
author: Johnny W.

description: This is my favorite bakery... maybe in the entire world but I don't know yet because I haven't gone to every bakery in the world. But for now, Schubert's holds the top spot. Their mousse cakes are THE BEST (mango and tropical!) and now that I have relocated back to the Bay Area, I am very much looking forward to all the birthdays that include a schuberts cake!
author: Rebecca Y.

description:
Mango mouse delicious!

I was here on a Monday with my coworker to pass time prior to our appointment.  It was around noon time and when we got here it was slow at first - then we sat down and a few minutes later - their front door kept opening every 3 minutes and was nonstop until we left.  Wow - great business!  We even met a World War II Japanese hero (105 years old) from Hawaii and shared his experiences during the war and how he got to know the owner of Schubert's Bakery.  

This establishment is locally owned.  Much of their foot traffic from what appears to be -- regulars and called them by their first name basis!  Amazing.  How wonderful is that.  

We ordered their mango (one serving) mouse which was delicious.  Their chocolate fudge mouse was just out of this world.  They serve coffee too as well as pre-ordered party cakes for large groups and parties.

The staff is very nice and from what it looked liked - they have been working here for a very long time.  They know their cakes and they know their customers personally by name.  Some of the staff even asked how their kids and dogs are doing!

What a really cool place to hangout, chill, have coffee and enjoy their delicious pastries and watch the locals come in and catch up with the staff with their daily affairs!  Way cool.

Cheers!
author: Edwin R.

description:
I've come here on different occasions to buy cakes and I have to say, it's quite good. When I used to live down the street, I would walk by and drool at all the pretty cakes.

The mango mousse and the raspberry mousse  is light, fluffy, and slightly sweet and tangy.
The chocolate mousse with nuts is light, fluffy, and very rich in chocolate.

The strawberry shortcake is divine. It's light and airy of course. The strawberries are very fresh. Make sure you call ahead because they usually run out of these .

I can go on and on but their desserts have never failed me. I will always keep coming back for more.... all the way from SJ.
author: Sandra L.

description: No words can describe when that piece of tiramisu just drops into your mouth...beautiful art,taste of gods,walking on clouds,and no regrets weight gained lol must try,always busy and everything runs out but it's worth it and so fresh!!
author: Annie W.

description:
3.5 stars.

Someone brought the Swedish Princess Cake to a function and I really liked it. So on my recent trip to SF, I had to visit the store in person. The store is definitely surrounded by a lot of Chinese restaurants. There was a lot to choose from but I just knew I had to get the sliced Swedish Princess Cake. The Tropical Fruit Mousse is not something I would order again; although, the cake was on a nice plate. The Tiramisu was soft; however, I wished there was a stronger rum taste. It was also nice that there was actual cake in the Tiramisu and not 80% mascarpone cheese.

Each slice of cake is ~$3.75. I would only purchase the Swedish Princess Cake since that almond fondant is different from any other bakery. If you don't take my word for it, just read all the other reviews...that's all they rave about. If you're up for the drive, I would recommend Satura Cakes, which is a Euro-Japanese bakery, in Los Altos.
author: Kathy W.

description:
I am not a huge fan of cakes or maybe we just ordered the wrong one. My boyfriend's friend had this delicious cake at his party. Once we saw this store across the street from Green Apple we had to go in and see what all the hype is about. 

It was clean and had a lot of open space. It was run like those bakeries in Chinatown but the ladies actually looked like they want to be there. The service was quick!

We got a slice of the

Swedish Princess Cake- the infamous cake from the party. I did not like the green fondant! It was like a bad piece of candy! The cake itself was alright. The texture was different throughout the entire cake. The bottom was very crusty. Did not like that. My boyfriend loved it though. 

I would like to come again and try another cake. I probably just don't like this one.
author: Sarah C.

description: I only come here for their Swedish Princess Cake and trust me, it's worth every penny and worth every drop of gas, since we drive from San Jose. The cake is moist and full of the marzipan flavor, which is what I truly love about this cake. The tart raspberry filling inside the cake cancels out the sweetness of the marzipan fondant so that it doesn't taste as sweet. All of their cakes are presented well and beautifully. I'm not sure about the taste of the other cakes, but judging from appearance, they look really good!
author: Kara M.

description: if this bakery was any closer to me, i would be 10 pounds heavier.  everything here looks amazingg.  the swedish princess cake is to die for - not too sweet, just the right texture.. i would probably eat a whole sheet of it. service is always friendly, and the store is clean and inviting!
author: Christina L.

description:
(See pics) Review #1329.  I love the cheerful colors and bright taste with the fluffy light cake base at Schubert's. Each one is carefully designed, crafted and delicately painted. The amazing complementary colors and contrast will easily make your eyes smile with that sublime bite.

Apart from the design choices, you also get to pick whether you want something more of fruit theme, richer taste, or a balance of the two.

Am also happy to be able to get the smaller pieces for the more popular cakes because really, you want to try all of them!

And hey, it's Valentine's Day, this will be a great place to pick up something sweet and a few of them are specifically designed to add some edible inscriptions!
author: T L.

description:
nothing to complain about.

Quality is good.
On time  : get my order.
customer service: they right now hiring the native born who could speak English very well.

The only thing is we have to order 2 days ahead of time. I wish rather get my cake by ordering one day ahead of time and next day I could pick up the cakes at there.
author: Ryan S.

description:
I have been to Schubert's many times while taking out of town guests through Richmond.......always pick up some cookies.....

Well, for my bday last nite, one of my friends ordered a mango mousse, I am not really a mousse cake type but this really was good.....it had a little cake on the bottom that was very good.....

I had asked my friend to pick up those flower shape mini cookies on their counter.....instead he got me a gift box that was assorted and so so delicious.....I will not share more than one per person....lol

I love their cookies.....but I think next time I will get their white cake with raspberry
author: Leslie Y.

description:
Service is prompt, staff is friendly, and pastries superb!

What more can I say, go get yourself a slice of cake, or even a whole cake. 

Try their St. Honore Cake & Opera Cake.

Try their pastries, you will not be disappointed!
author: Alex C.

description:
Schubert's Opera Cake: hazelnut sponge cake with chocolate truffle and mocha-praline filling topped with toasted almonds. 

Doesn't that sound incredible? Well...it is! 

I recently bought a sheet cake (8x12, easily fed 20+ people) for my great-uncle's 90th birthday and everyone absolutely loved it!  So many people asked me where I'd gotten the cake from, and once I mentioned Schubert's, it was really neat seeing the look of recognition from all of the seniors present, and younger generations too. 

And that's how I learned that my great-grandfather used to bring home a wreath cake from Schuberts nearly every week.  Pretty amazing that this place has been bringing happy memories to San Franciscans since 1911, and still continues to do so. Schubert's cakes have found their place in my family for special occasions, and the opera cake is most definitely our new favorite.
author: Joanne G.

description: I ordered a tiramisu cake and fruit tart for a work celebration, and both were outstanding!  Everyone raved about both desserts. Very pleased with my experience here and plan to order all of my work cakes from Schubert's from now on.
author: A W.

description:
Every member of my family has birthday within 2 months of each other. So the only time I am in the Bay, we decide to celebrate all of them together. Four birthdays call for FOUR cakes/desserts. One of the cakes we bought was the raspberry mousse from Schubert's. We got a 6" cake, and it was about $17. It was decorated nicely with chocolate flowers and scrolls on top, and lined with lady fingers on the side, all wrapped in a matching ribbon.

The cake was moist, the mousse was executed well, and overall delicious. They had a lot of flavours and the employee helping us was patient enough to name and describe all of them before we decided on the raspberry mousse. There were some other ones that I want to try next time.
author: Leslie P.

description: Amazing place , coffee is soooo fresh .Really good cakes, every morning this place makes my day. Pastries are amazing. They have my favorite tiramissu :)
author: Carl D.

description:
How about a 4.75 - 4.85 - 4.95 star rating for this bakery!!!! :O)

I'm a sucker for pastries, for mousse, for tarts, for sweet treats....brownies, anything chocolate, anything dessert, anything with cocoa...dark cocoa, single origin!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Sigh!!

So, Schubert's has been my go-to place for everything that calls for celebrating with a cake! Parking is a PAIN!!! That's the ONLY reason why this bakery doesn't earn a full 5 star rating. :O(

The seating is limited, but it adds to the quaint atmosphere. Pricing is wallet friendly, choice is fabulous..

What else can I say....do go there for a sugar-rush-day, for a cake-therapy-day, for treat-myself-day...................it's better than a pedicure! :O)))
author: Me Iz S.

description: Absolutely love this place! Been coming here for years to pick up cakes for All Occasions! The Princess cake is definitely by far my favorite. Also a good place to pick up small treats for the office or loved ones. The apricot tart,  pear tart, as well as fruit tart are all so delicious! Make sure to order your cake ahead of time, as they tend to run out by late afternoon! Was here last week to pick up a last minute cake and the staff was friendly and quick!  Although the cake I wanted  was not available, the one I picked out was decorated beautifully! Definitely a go-to if you are in the area.. or not!
author: Jennifer D.

description: An amazing old fashioned bakery with gorgeous and delicious cakes and super wonderful service. The Russian dude who helped me today was so friendly and genuine and accommodating. I felt like I was in some small town in a wonderful way. I never want this place to close. Ever.
author: Andrew K.

description: Everything here is sooo cute! I love little desserts and these do not disappoint! I can't wait to come back and try some more! Everything from the strawberry shortcake to the eclair was nice and light with just the right amount of sweetness. Delish!
author: Elena N.

description:
I have been to this bakery for over 40 years. 
Very friendly service, the viennoiseries are just ok, the coffee cakes are good, but the cakes here are so scrumptious!! From strawberry shortcakes to Black Forest, opera cakes, Swedish princess, chocolate mousse cakes, they are ALL sooooo good!! 
They used to decorate the kids's birthday cakes with themes you can select from a book, but now times have changed, and it's only fruits or toys put on top. 
This is my favorite store for cakes. The prices are pretty decent, the cakes are excellent, and the selection is huge. The only problem is to decide on which cake to buy!
author: lovetoeat a.

description: Schubert's Bakery is amazing! Sooooooo many delectable choices in cakes! I went to buy a bday cake for my cuzzo. They have a variety of cakes ready for easy pick up. There are whole cakes in different sizes as well as cakes by the slice. My cuzzo loves fruit type cakes so I picked the 8" Tropical/Passion Mousse Cake that was topped entirely with fruit. Beautiful presentation. The lady that helped me was super friendly. I asked them if they could put something with "happy birthday" on it since there was no room of writing on the cake. She said yes and in a few minutes brought the cake back that had with a small plate of white chocolate with the writing on it standing in the middle of the fruit. Very nice! The price was very reasonable. $27.95. I will definitely be back to try the other cakes soon! And yes, the cake was absolutely delish!
author: Liv A.

description: Their princess cake is to die for. Never tasted anything like it. First heard about it from my sibling. FYI, there's a two day reservation for their cakes so plan ahead.
author: Johnny N.

description:
I have been curious about this place for the longest time and I finally got the chance to get something just last week.

The place itself is very lovely. Old fashioned with tons of colorful, delicious looking desserts! I wanted to buy everything....

My friend and I were hanging out and decided to get some treats for our little trip. We decided to get the chocolate mousse without almonds and the lemon mousse. 

The chocolate mousse is very chocolaty and rich. Worth getting. The lemon mousse on the other hand is very tart and refreshing. Both are way sweet, but oh man we were satisfied. 

If you're ever in the area, be sure to get something. I can't wait til I can go back and try something new!
author: Sofia R.

description:
Pardon my skepticism but I was most reluctant to have dessert here, a long-standing and old-fashioned German bakery with colorful, fanciful desserts that had me seeing barrels of sugar.  I had faith in my friend who brought me here but still, imagine my surprise when we opened the goods, dug in, and I discovered these beauties held sweetness in restraint?  We tried the shockingly lime-green coated Swedish Princess cake, a fruit tart, and a raspberry mousse.  Every one of these were delicious and delicate.  The light cream and crumbly crust might be the best I ever had in a fruit tart, the mousse had a refreshing tart, and the Swedish Princess, very fluffy, like air.

Schubert's is small, the space primarily occupied by the counters with rows and rows of their baked goods.  There are a few tables for dining but we took the pastries to go.  Many of their pastries are available in both larger cake/pie sizes as well as small, individual servings.  Reasonably priced.  If in the neighborhood, I'm definitely coming by again.
author: Valery C.

description:
They have so many good cakes and mousses that you can't have just one. So what did we do? We ordered a half dozen of different slices to try! Well not all for me thankfully, but I did tell the lady to seal the box or else....

You really can't go wrong with any of the selections they have. They're all really delicious. Just pick out what you're craving and you're good to go! 

We opted for: 

Princess Cake
Opera
Mango Mousse 
Currant cheesecake 
Fruit tart

I'll definitely be back to pick one up for a birthday or special event.
author: Andrew S.

description: Pastries are delicious, and like buying birthday cakes from here too. Customer service is ok.
author: Mary T.

description: So yummy! All their pastries looked great and were reasonably priced! Big shout out to the owner who let me run in at 4:00PM before closing... Well technically they were closed. Parking in that neighborhood is rough but I'm glad I was able to walk in and purchase a mini fruit tart and mini chocolate mousse cake. Highly recommend this cute bakery!
author: Maggie G.

description: The Napoleon is a masterpiece that little words can describe. Light flaky layers of crispy pastry stacked and sandwiched with fresh cream and strawberries topped with seasonal sweet and ripened fruits. One bite and you will end up eating the whole darn pastry!
author: Charmaine L.

description: My boss would bring different cakes for our Birthdays and they were always delicious,  so I ordered the chocolate mousse w/almonds to feed over 50 people for my mother's 1 yr memorial service and not only did they do a beautiful job decorating it was absolutely delicious and every person who had a slice commented how good it tasted, thankuou for the memories Schuberts!!
author: Virginia S.

description: This review is an FYI for those looking for a wedding cake. Called today 4/3/15 after seeing reviews on wedding cakes. If you're looking for a wedding cake look elsewhere as they no longer make them at this place.
author: Rich L.

description:
PROS: The fruit tart is AMAZING!! It's buttery and sweet, but with the tart fruits it offers a perfect balance. I've ordered a few other things from here, but the fruit tart sticks out in my head the most. 

CONS: Parking. And the small space inside doesn't offer much room to form a line, so there are people that come right in and cut others to get an order.
author: RoseMichelle M.

description:
I don't always eat cake, but when I do...I prefer Schubert's. 

I've now ordered three different cakes from this heaven of a bakery, and have been wow-ed each time.

Wow #1: Swedish Princess Cake: white cake layers with raspberry and kirsch custard filling, whipped cream and marzipan icing.

Wow #2: Chocolate Mousse with Almonds: chocolate cake with chocolate mousse  filling, surrounded by chocolate ganache and garnished with toasted almonds

Wow #3: Opera Cake: hazelnut sponge with chocolate truffle and mocha-praline filling topped with toasted almonds

All of these are amazing and are not too sweet, which is great. 

Personally, the Swedish Princess Cake is my favorite because I love marzipan.  Plus, I got this cake for my Swedish friend's birthday and she loved it as well. #authentic
author: Juliana K.

description:
Now, add this to my reviews!

"Excellent fruit cake!", say my uncle and aunt!  I take their word for it since fruit cake is not ever on my list of sweet things to eat. Too bad they sold out before Christmas because I had a request to try and get another one the day after Christmas.
author: Debbie T.

description: I ordered the Swedish princess cake for my birthday and it was absolutely delicious,  and visually appealing. This will now be my go to bakery.
author: Emily G.

description:
I've been here a couple of times previous and recently ordered a fruit tart for my aunt's birthday.

OMG!

The tart was beautifully decorated and all of the fruit was sweet and the rum custard crust is to die for! (I've found that the fruit on tarts from other bakeries are both unripened and not sweet)

The process of ordering either via phone or in-person is seamless. Excellent and friendly customer service.
author: Jen F.

description:
Schuberts is a good place if you forgot to bring something to a party or want to impress your girlfriend's parents. They have a variety of cakes/pastries in all different sizes and colors. They are all unique, pretty, and good (but some are way to sweet for my taste). Service is pretty quick.

My only catch is to always, ALWAYS get your receipt. I'm pretty sure I got ripped off here. I paid less than $4 for 3 small personal cakes, and the total came up to over $16. How the hell is that possible?! On top of that, the cashier didnt give me my receipt. Sketchy...
author: Justin L.

description: love the sweden princess cake! yumyum! beautiful too! Chocolate musse cake was great too! Will go back soon and try more!
author: Blue B.

description: This place is the best..... Coming from a culinary grad who grew up in Brooklyn where the cakes grow like the Salmon of Capistrano. Bomb.... Nuff said.
author: Frank B.

description: I ordered their mango mousse cake for my sister's surprise proposal in SF. As a congratulatory cake, we only got a small size. Since this was the first time I was ordering from Schubert's bakery (I live in NY), I was nervous about the quality and taste. But it was the best mango mousse cake that we had ever had. The newly engaged couple told me they would be checking back at the bakery and thanked me for pointing Schubert's out for them! Yay!
author: Seethal J.

description:
Having meaning to make a trip to Schuberts for many moons, I managed to remember on my way home from the Golden Gate park and quickly made an exit from the CA-1/Park Presidio Dr on Clement St for my tryst with the patisserie.

Upon making my way in to what was a tiny little shop with about 4 tables indoors, I mulled over the goodies like a kid in a candy store, except, this wasn't a kid and I was in a cake shop. I picked up an Italian Rum pastry and mulled over my choices as I enjoyed my rummy chocolatey entity of goodness.

Here is an attempt to review all that I had:

Opera - although it looks like a slimmer cousin of the Italian Rum, at first sight, it was anything but. There was a coffee bean on top and had a very "coffeechic" flavour in essence. I particularly enjoyed the slightly 'chewy' texture of the underlying layers of cake against the backdrop of the crunchy nuts on it. With every bite of it I went "Wow" and I think this is the start of a budding love-affair with this tantalising lady.

Italian rum - the smooth chocolate frosting with crunchy nuts and soft layers of cakes underneath offset each other really well.

Petit fours passion fruit - it had a very interesting fruity flavor with mango mousse between the layers of cake

Petit fours hazelnut - this pastry reminded me of a marzipan chocolate candy. I didn't feel the hazelnut which made me wonder if the girl mixed them up; I had asked her to remove the chocolate petit-fours she had added. But absolutely no regrets as it was still delicious!

Swedish princess - the green fondant is citrusy in flavor with a soft layer of cream directly beneath it. I'd like to say it tasted lemony but that's not it; it tastes familiar but I just can't quite put a finger to it (passionfruit, perhaps?). The rest of it is pretty much a layered sponge cake with raspberry jam or some mixed-fruit preserve lining it that reminded me of a swiss roll. While still tasty, the rest of it doesn't quite measure up to the outer two layers of fondant and cream. The middle layer had a berry-based creamy spread that I wish formed every layer of this pastry; and I am sure we would have had another winner right here!

Black forest - the "vanilla ice-cream" of pastries, the black forest has always been the safest choice. Rarely, if ever, do patisseries get this wrong (except for Safeway -- dry and crumbly ugh!) not because it's easy but, due to it's popularity, most aspiring chefs probably learn how to make it like a fundamental essential step in Baking-101. The chocolate cake base was spongy and moist alternating with thick layers of fresh cream with a layer that was bursting with cherries. In an ever so slight twist, the whole slice was sitting on a thin layer of firmer (sponge, vanilla?) cake that, besides providing structural support, added it's own flavor to the mix.

White chocolate raspberry mousse - a tri-storeyed dessert with the raspberry mousse, white chocolate mouse, and a sponge cake layered in that order, this was a veritable powerhouse. The mousse layers are well set firm and bouncy. The top was glazed with a tangy raspberry preserve with shavings of white chocolate. The lightly sour flavour of the raspberry mousse offset the sweet and creamy white-chocolate mousse layer pretty well, with the sponge cake providing for a variance in texture and taste. I am not a huge fan of preserves spread on dessert pastries but I will let this one slide. I dunno why but it reminds me of lemon curd a little. Well, maybe it's the texture combined with the zestiness of the raspberry layer.

Lemon mousse - Wow ! What a surprise! This is the last one I sampled, of the lot, and it has a *very* interesting construction. As opposed to the tried and tested structure of one layer over the other, this one was whimsically fashioned with a layer that went *around* the base of the pastry. Yes. Around! I can't recall having eaten one fashioned in such a manner! The mousse is essentially a lemon glaze with raspberries sitting atop a lemony zesty mousse set on a circular angel cake surrounded by said layer of spotted-striped cake wrapped around it. The wrapped cake is slightly chewy and the taste is not something I can recall; the closest I can get to describing it is Orange. I only wish they made whole cakes of just this wrap. That would be so amazing.

Lastly, I wanted the Napoleon too but by the time I decided, the two I saw were already long gone.

In conclusion, Schubert's Bakery is spot on, I was disappointed with nary a single offering, and the price was moderate and reasonable at about $3.50 apiece.

Postscript: But nope, I still don't agree with berry/fruit preserves on my cake based pastries. To me it's like a cheap shortcut to getting the desired flavour completely ignoring the fact that it doesn't work, but serves to be a jarring reminder that preserves do not belong there.
author: Umesh T.

description: This is a really cute shop offering a wide variety of cakes and pastries. We ordered the Swedish princess cake, which didn't taste great. The layer of yellow on top did not help. We also ordered the mango mousse cake and that was delicious. I'd recommend ordering the smaller cakes to see what you like before ordering a bigger one, because they are pretty huge in size.
author: Lily Z.

description:
I heart Schubert's Bakery! I've tried several cakes from Schubert's: Tiramisu, Mango Mousse, and Swedish Princess. The cakes are delicious! I always have seconds if the cakes are from Schubert's! 

My favorite cake is the Swedish Princess cake. The white cake with the raspberry filling is not too sweet. The best part is the green marzipan on the outside of the cake. Yum yum yum. This cake is also really moist a couple days later. I've never tried the Princess cake from Ikea, so I can't compare the flavors between the two.

The Tiramisu is good, but it's extremely sweet. I feel like I get diabetes every time I eat this cake. The decorations on this cake is extremely pretty.

I don't really remember the Mango Mousse cake. The cake must not stand out compared to the other cakes.

The ordering process is easy. You order your cake with the pick up time and cake text through their website, and pay with a credit card. You receive a copy of your invoice in your email inbox. All you have to do is pick up the cake.

A second option is to purchase a cake at the bakery. My aunt usually goes to the bakery at 7am whenever there is a family dinner so she can pick up a cake. Choices may be limited depending on the time of the day.

Parking may be a challenge, since Clement Street is extremely busy.

I wish Schubert's was in the South Bay so I don't have to make a special trip to SF!
author: Jackie S.

description:
I am disappoint. 

You see a soul with few great joys in life left and managed to rob one more.

Those Gingerbread St. Nick cookies that you made me stand in line for WERE STALE -- VERY stale. 

Last year, I tasted NIRVANA, but this year you ripped me off for TWO $2.95 cookies. For shame. And it wasn't because I kept them too long. Heaven's no. I scarfed one down the very day I bought them. Coal in your stocking. ;_;
author: Ziggy J.

description:
I purchased a larger version of the Swedish Princess cake to bring with me to a 50th Anniversary party for my grandparents.  They invited extra people so I wanted to make sure there was enough cake.  

The consistency and quality of cakes plus the fast ordering/pick-up makes this the best place in SF for an authentic cake.  Plus their food health cleanliness score is 100.
author: C L.

description: Fantastic strawberry shortcake.  Had one for a birthday last Saturday and almost everyone asked for seconds.
author: Nancy T.

description: Swedish Princess cake is LIFE-CHANGING. I don't even like marzipan!!! I will go to sleep dreaming about this cake until i can have it again!!!!!!!
author: Gloria P.

description:
Still 4.5 stars...

But I guess if you want those lady fingers, order in advance and they will kindly add them for you at no extra charge! Thanks Schuberts :) 

10" Mango Mousse cake for $37.95 - not bad. The cake is ginormous (third tier in the shelves). The next best alternative is a Safeway/Costco cake for 3/4 of that price... so I'm happy to paid 1/4 more for a better cake!
author: Michelle L.

description: Schubert's is the best bakery in the SF Bay Area.  I have ordered over 20 cakes (for personal and work purposes) and they are ALWAYS consistent and beautiful.  Only problem is you need to order a size bigger than you think because people will not stop at 1 piece.  The prices are far better than other bakeries that completely overcharge and under deliver (calling you out, Katrina Rozzelle and La Farine).  All of the ingredients are fresh and items are not overly sweet. The cookies and pastries are all delicious as well.  Their chocolate items are always a crowd pleaser, as is the Tiramisu cake.  I can't say enough good things about Schubert's.  Thanks for being my go-to!
author: Karen W.

description: Small little bakery. Staff was friendly. Pastries is rich and delicious. Price is good for the quality  for the pastry. Would recommend this place if any one enjoy delicious pastries that made with love
author: Gruber T.

description: fantastic cakes!
author: Anna S.

description: Great cakes. Always delicious and beautifully decorated. Please note they close at 4pm on Sundays (not 5pm) and they do not answer calls on weekends. Best to order online for special occasions as popular cakes may be sold out day of.
author: Mischen C.

description: Two words..... PRINCESS CAKE! Omg, they have the best princess cake ever!!! But all of the cakes are good. Everything is so fresh unlike some bakeries. They are slightly on the pricey side but it's worth it. If you're in the neighborhood you gotta stop and get a slice of anything. Even the shortbread cookies are yummy. :)
author: Holly D.

description: Stopped by here and got 4 desserts to go to celebrate our last day in SF... We got a chocolate cheesecake, Strawberry mousse, chocolate layered cake and Napoleon Layered cake... The Chocolate cheesecake was our favorite and the strawberry mousse was our least fav. Each cake was $4.25? or something so I wish they tasted a bit more WOW! I think we will be trying somewhere else next time.
author: Anna K.

description:
