Love love love the cheese danish which runs out early on Sunday. Have to get in by 10am to buy a few. It's limited on Sunday because I think they don't bake on the Sunday. So come early for the cheese danish. Yummy
The cheese cake is yummiest. Try the small portion and go for variety. 
Overall I am willing to sacrifice the work out just for the Danish and cheese cake. Every weekend I will be there
author: Nelle L.

description:
I ordered 7 slices of different cakes for my birthday the day before, and they were ready the next morning, so I was already incredibly impressed by their abilities to take and produce orders rapidly. Then I tasted the cakes and was in heaven. I had an assortment of mousse cakes.. ALL DELICIOUS! Opera - delicious. Swedish princess - delicious. White chocolate raspberry mousse... probably the best of them all - although it's hard to truly judge! 
Thank you for delicious quality - VERY AUTHENTIC EUROPEAN - and great customer service. Happy birthday to ME!
author: Nadia N.

description: I ordered a 14x22 Swedish princess cake for my son's third birthday. We ordered in ivory marzipan and requested Spanish wording. It looked and tasted amazing! It also traveled well to San Jose. I Don't plan on going anywhere else for birthday cakes. Highly recommend! :)
author: Paloma L.

description: Can someone tell me why this place has the best most amazing cakes ever made?? I've been here for years and years and not once have it been a let down and I will be extremely surprised when that day does come. The mousse cakes are absolutely delicious! I've gotten mango mousse, raspberry mousse, strawberry mousse and chocolate mousse with almonds and they all taste so amazing! The flavors are delicious, the cakes are always moist, they always taste fresh and the lady fingers that come around the fruit mousse cakes are so good!!! I don't like to buy my cakes from other places...and when I do, I should have very low expectations because I am never as satisfied as when I get a cake from this place!
author: Jane S.

description:
Pros: accepts credit, online ordering
Cons: pricey cakes

I am basing my review strictly on the online cake ordering option. I purchased an 8 inch Princess Cake online and ordering could not be any easier. I only wish that the cake prices weren't so steep! The cake was chilled when I picked it up (you can also state that you would like it to be kept in their freezer until pick up if not to be consumed within a reasonable time after pick up). The green marzipan was so good and usually raspberry things aren't to my fancy, but altogether this cake was pretty good. I would have given Schubert's a 5 star rating, but the pricing is something that I can't overlook. Sure, I understand that the Princess Cake, as well as all the cakes they make here, are popular, but for the prices you pay for the cake sizes, I wish we could get a little more.
author: Alex T.

description:
This place and location rocks....

Will always order my cakes here....

People on the phone are nice and will work with you and your order....

Swedish Princess cake is the bomb!!!
author: P S.

description:
Have been to Schubert's quite a few times, and while the cakes that I have sampled have been good each time, on my most recent visit, the service truly blew me away!

I didn't catch the name of the gentleman that helped me, but he was very friendly, cheerful, and helpful, which makes me appreciate this little bakery even more.
author: Miss C.

description:
Three adults.  Four cake slices.  Sometimes my head is in the fog, and I do things like that.

I was out shopping when my friend called and suggested that she and her sister wanted to drop by later in the evening for a visit.  Since I was already in the Inner Richmond I suggested picking up a cake from Schubert's.  My friend suggested picking up three cake slices instead for a bit of variety.  I'm still not sure how I ended up buying four cake slices.  It worked out though as we split each slice into three pieces each.

We had the Swedish Princess (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/DyXoC_NhJW0Xx5j_OPQRHQ?select=k7J1jAn5QS-V3w2zjw-PKg).  My friend said she didn't care what I picked up as long as one was the Swedish Princess.  I didn't think I would feel very manly by telling her that Schubert's princess cake was one of my all-time favorites so I quietly enjoyed my portion of the moist cake, smooth custard, tart jelly and marzipan as if I was trying it for the very first time.

My friend's sister loves chocolate covered cherries hence my selection of a slice of Black Forest (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/DyXoC_NhJW0Xx5j_OPQRHQ?select=bJ5xoTcApCerfK7JcQHp9A).  I recall having tried this once before but I never noticed the thin shortbread layer on the bottom of the chocolate cake, whipped cream and chunky cherry filling.  It was very good but probably more so because I had not had it in awhile.

The consensus on the Double Mousse (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/DyXoC_NhJW0Xx5j_OPQRHQ?select=i6sRF8Gv0kjs84dUl2DRqg) was that it was a bit rich.  There is lots of cream and whipped custard but very little cake.  It was at this point that we really enjoyed having the hot beverages to go with our cake.

The Neapolitan (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/DyXoC_NhJW0Xx5j_OPQRHQ?select=RJe5SKzNDqE1LyULkdwIsw) was my favorite with coffee and berry flavored creams sandwiched in between layers of moist chocolate and yellow cakes and a thin layer of tart raspberry jelly finished off with a smooth chocolate ganache.  Thin pieces of bittersweet chocolate were added to the sides and the chocolate covered rice crispy balls sprinkled on top made for an interesting contrast in flavor and texture.

I don't visit Schubert's too often, but when I do I can always count on beautifully made treats that are rich and delicious and so bad for me!  I guess that's what makes it so good!
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
So i saw this on yelp and I ordered only. It was fast and easy and you got to even choose what you wanted to write on your chocolate tag!

I got here and was surrounded by chinese and asian markets and restaurants....Did i take a wrong turn? Nope! In the middle of all of it is this nice little bakery. When I ordered, there was no option for times in between so I selected 6 and in comments asked for 5:30 and sure enough my cake was ready when I got there to pick it up.

Strawberry short cake
Cream was very light low sugar and very delicious. All the fruits were very fresh. It made you want more. The small pieces of chocolate on top were also freshly made. Overall it was very delicious, I want to try their other cakes! I will be back if I am ever in the city again!
author: Qi H.

description:
Delicious, beautiful, consistent, friendly staff and order online...need I say more?  

Gonna have to try this Swedish princess cake!
author: Jenn D.

description:
So, tonight I will devour the 4th birthday cake we have gotten from Schubert's

WARNING!  Bringing a cake from schubert's will make you the designated cake person for all future birthdays.  So tasty, and whenever my circle of friends needs a cake for something they always go "Hey Rach can you get something from that amazing bakery again?".  I always get to be the hero when the cake comes out though :)
author: Rachel O.

description:
Schubert's came to my attention and i managed to find a parking space nearby to pop in here. to my surprise, the buying area is very small. there are also some tables for sitdown. cakes weren't labeled but prices of some cakes  were on the walls. people were filing in behind me so i hurried and choose, passing over the chocolates.

eats: 6" tiramisu mousse (17.95)
-"mousse" surrounded by panels of thin chocolates-tasty
-cake internixed with creaminess=mousse, i guess
-similar but cheaper than the cake at crixia.
-not much resemblance to italian tiramisu.

crumbs:
-on line catalog has pics and pricing. best to choose before going
-lines forms fast. 3 ladies courteous, quick, no hassle.
-browsing here not practical. might lose place in line.
-definitely would repeat. family requested lemon.....
-charged it on am. ex.
author: Victor G.

description:
My cousin told me this place had really good European cakes.  We went on a Sunday to go try it out for her birthday.  The cakes looked delicious, but it didn't taste like a 5 star.  If I had to compare, it'd taste like Safeway's bakery, which isn't bad, but it's not the best like everyone raves it to be. 

It's usually rather busy here, but the staff is fairly friendly, so I give them props.
author: Nhu-Quynh N.

description:
It could have been my friend's lucky day!

Someone dropped $20 on the ground in the bakery and my friend was standing by it. This man came out of nowhere and picked it up. He told the workers he found it on the floor and  tried to give it to them. They didn't want to take it so he bought a personal fruit tart and  told them to keep the change. He was such a kind and honest person. 

Anyways, when I entered the bakery, I noticed the chalk boards with beautiful writing on it. The chalk boards listed the items that are available along with their description. I thought that was very useful since it was my first time at this place. 

Everything I bought was priced at $3.45 each. I left the bakery with  Opera Cake, Raspberry Mousse, Cappuccino Mousse, and Princess Cake. The Opera Cake was pretty delicious and so was the Princess Cake. On the other hand,  I was very disappointed in the Raspberry Mousse because the cake was very dry. Maybe it was old? Sometimes looks can be deceiving and that was the case for the Raspberry Mousse. It was definitely beautiful and it's a shame that it didn't taste good.  I actually wanted to try the Raspberry White Chocolate Mousse, but ordered the Raspberry Mousse by accident. I'm not sure how the Cappuccino Mousse tastes because I bought that for my sis.

I'll probably come back here again when I'm in SF to see what else this place offers.
author: Thao L.

description:
Found amongst a multitude of Asian stores, this bakery can hold its own. I was brought here through a recommendation and enjoyed the experience.
I came here with a couple friends who were also here for the first time, so we asked one of the staff for a recommendation. She was friendly and very accommodating even when we were indecisive. We ended up getting a slice of princess cake, a raspberry croissant, and a fruit tart.
I am personally not a huge fan of marzipan but I must say the princess cake was very good. The marzipan added nice texture to the light and fluffy cake and cream. The flavors balanced well without being too sweet from the marzipan. The fruit tart was excellent. Light and flaky crust with good custard and fresh fruit. The raspberry croissant was the only problem. The raspberry filling was simple raspberry jam but much too sweet. The croissant itself was incredible when I didn't get a piece of jam in it: light, flaky, and perfectly buttery.
An overall good bakery and I'd love to come back and try what other baked goods they have.
author: Bryant C.

description: The best bakery in all of San Francisco! You could tell everything is made from scratch and it has been there for a really long time so that tells you that they have good pastries. My favorite is there princess cake.
author: G A.

description: Princess cake was pretty good. I thought the baked goods were pretty overpriced, I believe I paid $5 for each one I got. I didn't think I would like marzipan this much.
author: Joy S.

description:
I have been going here for years and have only now realized I should leave a review.

Having tried almost every variety of cake there, I say confidently that you cannot go wrong. Everything is soft, moist, fluffy, chocolatey, not too sweet, appropriately decadent and, best of all, well priced. 

My parents will get the Swedish Princess cake for any family occasion - no matter how large or small, birthday or just a welcome home dinner, the Swedish Princess is their girl. Having eaten it like 149 times, I highly recommend it. That marzipan is kickass. It also often sells out by the end of the day. 

Other standouts:
- Chocolate Truffle and essentially any of the chocolate mousse cakes
- Almond + random fruit tart 
- Mango Mousse

Why not 5* you say? Because there is this one lady there that stresses me out. She is on the severe side and always makes me feel like I have to choose my treat RIGHT THIS SECOND.
author: Subie C.

description: Forget all those bakeries you've been to, Schubert's Bakery has the best cake (and shortbread cookies) I've ever tasted! My sister and I came here on a Sunday morning and purchased 2 slices of cake to taste for our mom's birthday: Princess Cake and Strawberry Shortcake, which were about $4 a piece. Although we liked both, we were instantly satisfied with the Strawberry Shortcake cake as we found it to be very moist and fluffy! The Princess Cake was equally as moist and fluffy, but the Marzipan icing was a little too sweet for our liking. The best part? The cakes are inexpensive and really pretty to look at. Everyone at my mom's birthday was raving about the delicious cake and kept asking me where I got it from. Don't forget to add a bag of their delicious pistachio shortbread cookies! I can't wait to go to Schubert's this Sunday for my sister's birthday!
author: Joyce E.

description: Nice place has history.. the chocolate mousse yumm!! the special cake I think I was too sweet
author: Patterson N.

description:
Love the fact they open early on the weekdays. First timer and I ordered the strawberry shortcake. Sooo good and the frosting was so light. 
I can't wait to go back and try another flavor. 
:)
author: Felicia S.

description:
LOVE the cakes and pastries from this decades old European bakery, famous for their mousse cakes and the Princess Cake. My family and relatives buy cakes here every year. Pic from a recent family gathering. http://static1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/ofhez_uVqDSrwHqIRC-DpA/l

Just FYI that last Saturday 2/27 was National Strawberry Day.
author: Luis C.

description: The service was really nice. The lady helped me really well to decide the cake i wanted. However, i didnot like the cake that much. The cake wasnot spongy enough at all. I would recommend going to this place for the service but not for the cake.
author: Jason M.

description:
One of my go-to places for Euro-style pastries, Schubert's has never disappointed me. I usually get their various danish pastries, tarts, croissants in a box or two containing 8, 10 or 12 of these. It depends on the size of the marketing program. I do feel a little guilty sometimes when I "clean" out the pastry trays. Quality sweetz here, to the point where one can get the shakes after consuming a couple of these.

When I get a box of their assorted pastries, 
it's the same as saying 
I got a box of assorted heaven!
author: Derek N.

description:
Schubert's is my go to place to pick up birthday cakes for smaller and more intimate birthday dinners. Get ready to splurge because it's not like you're paying for your standard Safeway cake! It's worth every penny. 

My family always buys the mango or raspberry mousse cakes but I love to get the chocolate mousse. So many layers of chocolate goodness! The shaved chocolate covering the entire cake is the cherry on top! Best served with coffee or ice cold milk. I often get the tiramisu as well, which is extremely rum-my.

The best part about this little shop is the different sizes of cakes. Most cakes can be bought by the slice and some in little single serving cakes. They're so cute! Sometimes I just get a variety of the little round cakes if I'm buying for 6 or less people. 

I also really like their frosted sugar cookies when they're available! Buttery and not extremely sweet. Just what I'm looking for with a cup of coffee in the afternoon!
author: Jessica L.

description:
Outstanding bakery; their cakes are beautifully decorated, and taste fantastic.

On our most recent visit, we picked up the pink champagne cake, and 4 mini desserts (an eclair, and 3 various mousses). Well priced, and high quality. I definitely recommend this place!

Note: be expect to wait in line for a while if you come during a peak hour (weekends especially!).
author: Claire S.

description:
Best cakes in Bay Area especially for the colourful design and soft texture.Ordered various large b'day cakes.Don't touch those pre-made cakes from elsewhere which are so dry!!!

I've also tried peach mousse and raspberry cakes with polka dots.Really good.
author: Priyanka L.

description:
Awesome place for baby pastries.

The bf always brings me here when he wants to cheer me up. We always have a hard to chose from all their selection of petite cakes. I usually end up getting cheesecake or mouse. Raspberry cheesecake and white chocolate and raspberry mouse are my favorite (:

He always wants me to try the Swedish Princess cake but idk if it's because he likes it or because his favorite color is green! But i will try it next time, probably this week!
author: Oriel F.

description:
Schubert's is the type of bakery that you will get in line (even though their system isn't the greatest) for to order something, get it..scarf it down the second you pay for it, and then get right back in line for something else. Believe me when I say that everything here is delicious - from the morning pastries to the cookies to the scrumptious cakes. Everything is awesome and expertly executed.

There's usually a line and like I said before they don't have the greatest system, but it usually moves pretty quickly. Prices are reasonable and the service is very friendly. I have to acknowledge a couple particular workers, CHARLENE and LAURA, because I always come in the mornings and when they're working, they're very helpful and cheerful at such an early time (7:45am). The store is small and has very few tables. But still, a fantastic experience and a must-eat in SF!
author: Dora S.

description:
After some bad dim sum a friend wanted to get some desserts at Schubert's. So we walked a couple blocks on Clement St. In the midst of all the Asian restaurants and markets there sits Schubert's bakery. 

The cakes are beautiful and creative. I wasn't too sure what to pick but knew I had to get something. After reviewing the board and each cake I was leaning towards the Opera cake because they had me at HAZELNUT. I ordered one piece and it was small but super rich. Pretty much it was like a ferrero rocher chocolate on crack! Divine! Loved it! If you like nutella or hazelnut then the Opera is the cake for you! 

And come on, how can you not smile when you see this cake: 
http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=h4o8e_Xbca2kXQO_vzOqgg&select=4ieeNMddDjxKa-oV5sPofA
Cute, right?
author: Lily A.

description: The best croissant ever! I like Vanilla custard croissant when I eat the first bite! OMG! it's so delicious! and I bought some strawberry cheesecake that it yummy too. I can't wait to come and get another bites!!
author: Season P.

description:
I had tried part of a Schubert's cake for a birthday before a long time ago and remembered it being yummy, so since I was in the area, I decided to drop by. There was a small line of customers when I walked in and all the tables (they only have 3-4) were full. All the desserts in the cases looked mouthwatering and good thing there was a line because I really couldn't decide. The peach mousse cake had a really cute smiley face drawn on it and I'm a sucker for cute things, but I resolved on the mango mousse instead since I was feeling that one more.

What I ordered:
- Mango Mousse ($3.75): http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/DyXoC_NhJW0Xx5j_OPQRHQ?select=OD8kMj_1njU_sN4D9yS4bg#OD8kMj_1njU_sN4D9yS4bg

The cake was decorated very nicely with a raspberry and diamond shaped chocolate on the top. It was perfectly light and fluffy and the mango flavor was spot on! Definitely will be back to try more!
author: Jessica C.

description:
Well this place is pretty pricey but you get what you paid for.  Usually their Mousse cake is pretty good. 

The only negative comments I would have for this place is the price and distance.  THey need more location in SF.  I haven't been back there for so long because I live like 50 mins away.  That's 2 hour almost drive for a cake.  Plus, they should have some promotions or lower cost for some less fortune people to try tasty pastries. :)
author: Juila L.

description:
Hands down the best bakery in San Francisco. Be prepared to become the official cake bringing person for all future events if you get their cale once for your friends.

Ordered once and many more to come!
author: Nitish S.

description:
Upon the arrival of my newborn, my husband's buddy brought over Cuban  cigars (for hubby) and a Princess Cake from Schubert's (for me). The cake had fresh fruit slices, strawbs, mango, kiwi, and some other berries--no fondant.

This cake was delightful and completely surpassed the quality of my wedding cake-- which was a very similar style. My favorite icing is whipped cream icing, not butter creme, so I was super impressed. 

The best cake I've had in years!!! Though I can't comment on the service or the atmosphere of the shop itself as the cake was a gift, I would recommend this bakery to anyone and I will definitely use them in the near future. Something must be said for an establishment that has been in the cake business for almost 100 years!!! Thank you Schubert's!!!!
author: Stephaney K.

description: Excellent service and an amazing bakery! I have been a customer for many years. Schubert bakery has best cakes in the city! I get my cakes only there! Today, I went and got a cake for my friends birthday. While I was getting an uber my cake was ruined. I went back to get another cake... I was promptly recognized... I was offered a free cake!  Wow! I was so thrilled by service!
author: Olga P.

description: You can't beat there pastries don't waste your time trying. WONDERFUL cakes!! Order in advance.
author: Sharine d.

description: Employee named Jessica was simply amazing,  it was bday and I wanted to get some cake , but when I got there  store was closed already,  she let me go in even though  registers were closed ,reopened it and I got my cake, Jessica  thank you ,u made my day.
author: Tea Z.

description:
Maybe it's a good thing this bakery is so far away from me. Given the opportunity to come here on a weekly basis, I'd go broke, get fat, and probably become a diabetic. Not that there's anything wrong with enjoying the sweet simple pleasures in life, but these highly addictive delights are not meant to be eaten in moderation even if you tried.

There's only one reason I'll stop by Schubert's - Swedish princess cake. In my first two visits, they had run out. Saddened by the absence of my craved confection, I was open to tasting their other deliciously baked goods. Their berry flavored mousse cakes and cheesecakes are piercing with tartness, but their tropical flavors tend to be more subtle and easy to nibble on. The cassis mousse was especially tart, squinting in discomfort with each bite. Never again, but I'm not mad. This wasn't the main event I came here for.

Finally during my third visit, showcased behind the glass display case, there they were...2 beautiful slices of marzipan wrapped raspberry custard filled princess cakes. I raced to the counter to beat out the crowd of indecisive customers, locking in the remaining 2 slices. Like a kid in a candy factory, I told the clerk "Princess cake, please!!!" Shockingly, she replied with "I'm sorry, we're currently out". Confused, I quickly pointed out the 2 slices right below me. She said those have been "damaged", so there's a 30% discount if I wanted to take them. I took a peek and saw no such damage, but the 30% sealed the deal without any hesitation. Mission accomplished!

Taking my little joys home, I carefully inspected the cakes to make sure there really wasn't anything wrong with them. The only "damage" I saw was a bit of marzipan scraped off the edges, but that's it. So for Schubert's to discount their baked goods for a slightly distorted presentation, that really shows they care about the quality of their products. I love that!! And I loved my princess cake! Believe the hype, it's as heavenly as everyone makes it out to be.
author: Michelle W.

description:
I happened to be in the richmond area and thought I would stop by. After having lunch, a little dessert seemed like a good idea. This place is located in the strangest place, it's between two very fobby asian stores. It totally stands out.  

Overall, there is a huge selection of pastries and cakes you can choose from. I opted out for the tiramasu and their famous princess cake. 

The tiramasu was ok, I liked the chocolate that they included on top of the cake, otherwise the cake itself was one I could skip. The princess cake on the other hand was delicious. I would go back just to eat it again. I can see why they are famous for it. 

Overall, dessert is dessert and I would come back here.
author: Stacey L.

description: Probably the best bakery I have ever been to. Definitely the best in the bay area. Awesome creations including cakes, tarts, mousses... Incredible single serving cakes! This place is unmatched! You can't get a better cake anywhere else. I honestly don't want a cake from anywhere but here!
author: Peter K.

description: Three words:  Swedish Princess Cake!!!  You must try it.  I brought one to my book club last night and everyone raved about it - delicious!  On the bakery itself, the service is mixed - sometimes friendly, sometimes not.  Go for the baked goods!!
author: Kathleen B.

description: Schubert's has the best cakes I've found so far in SF (and I've been looking).  I've tried the raspberry cheesecake, strawberry cheesecake, and the swedish princess cake, and all of them were amazing.  The swedish princess cake with its marzipan frosting was especially popular at the party I brought it to.  I also tried the the petit fours, which were okay but not nearly as good as the cakes.
author: Cici A.

description: Princess cake is grubbin!  Triple layers of moist cake, fruit filling, and light frosting.  Thought I'd just eat half my slice and save the rest for later, nope!  Ate the whole slice!
author: Erick L.

description: I'm honestly not too crazy about the princes cake, which is their specialty, but the fruit tart are so amazingly delicious. I live in Daly City and don't mind driving through traffic once a wk for it. Love the crust and the cream on these tarts. I also like the shortbread cake w/mix fruits on top, better than the princes cake. Very light and airy. Maybe it's just me, but I'd give this place a try if you haven't! Not as busy as the Tartine Bakery. It gets crowded at times, but the employees are fast, friendly and attentive.
author: Sal T.

description:
Simple - get the Black Forest cake.  Call them ahead and maybe reserve because they do sell out early on.

Some of the best German Black Forest cake, evvaaahh (on the West Coast) !!
author: Ajay P.

description:
The cakes here are quite good. I tend to prefer desserts that don't necessarily hit me over the head with sugar and find that Schubert's cakes give me enough of a mellow balance of sweetness to pacify my cravings. We've ordered here before for my Mom's birthday and everything went well. 

The mango mousse is delicate and has a slight tanginess. The Swedish Princess cake is also delicious. The cakes here are all skillfully decorated and extremely pleasing to look at. Afterall, as the saying goes; We eat with our eyes first. And trust me... my eyes were eating aplenty just from the cake display case alone! Next time, I'm gunning for the Tiramisu.

Attentive and polite customer service. I shall return.
author: Ann S.

description: The cake that I ordered was Chocolate Cheese Cake. Cheese inside was not greasy at all. It tastes perfect and delicious. I just love their chocolate chips and cream cheese.
author: YY Z.

description:
Love their cakes, all their cakes look beautiful. I came to buy a ten inch tropical mousse for a gathering. They were able to write a little message, written with nice calligraphy writing on a big piece of white chocolate. Everyone said it tasted great and enough to go around for a group of 15 people. Not too sweet with just the right amount of tartness. Schubert's has been my go-to cake for birthdays, celebrations, etc. 

The only downside to getting the big cakes are they are they don't have bags big enough with a handle so that you can carry it out the door. They gave me a bag but the cake had to be placed in sideways. Had to trek down clement holding the cake from under the bag.
author: Kelly C.

description: I absolutely LOVE this bakery! The cakes can be on the pricey side, but they are worth it! The cakes are not only beautifully decorated but also delicious! The fruit tarts is a must! My favorite is the princess cake and the sugar cookies. Customer service is also great here. If you want to get all the goodies like the fruit tarts, you must stop by before 3PM.
author: Alex U.

description:
I stop in for pastry in the morning, they have big chocolate croissants for less than $3. They are still warm and gooey inside when I get them.

I am desperately awaiting the occasion to order a cake from here. I get all the right vibes from this bakery. It smells delicious,  the cakes and baked goods are beautiful, and the women behind the counter are friendly and magical. Can't miss.
author: Halley S.

description: Not much more to say but great all around. Can't really go wrong with any choices - only real downside is what to choose. The coffee is excellent also. Parking is not easy - the only reason not to go to shuberts.
author: Joe B.

description:
I walked by Schubert's Bakery to go to another store... but failed to resist my sweet tooth and had to turn around to buy some goodies.

Thank you Schubert's for my delightful mixed fruit tart! The crunchy crust, the creamy custard, the fresh and bold blackberries, raspberries, strawberries, and mangoes made the best. mini. tart. ever. I'm going to save my raspberry and cheese danish for dessert later tonight! $5.50 for happiness = worth it!!

The service is on top of it all! I needed more time to gaze longingly at all the different cakes, cookies, and baked goods before I could possibly even choose what to bring home with me.  I barely made it to the end of the display case before someone asked me what I would like to buy.

5 stars every time.
author: Samantha L.

description:
MY FAVORITE PLACE TO BUY CAKES IN SF!

Princess cake is to die for! I've had princess cake from a few other places, but I would have to say this is my favorite place to get it. Cakes always look amazing and of course taste amazing. I always try to get birthday cakes here. 

I love the mango mousse cake too!

I appreciate that they have little slices of each cake so that you can try it out too.

Definitely come check this out if you're in the area!
author: Odes K.

description:
Schubert's is my go-to place for cakes for any occasion. I recommend you go in and order ahead of time if you're planning to pick up the day after. They also sell individual slices of cake that are priced between $3-$4 dollars, in addition to bite-sized cookies and the sorts. My favorite is the Princess cake.

Princess cake: http://s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/DTM1n6YM3S3_dWG4V5iCww/l.jpg
Mango mousse: http://s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/aJkWEbuSPpN-Wxh2uYjeAg/l.jpg
Variety of cake in the display window: http://s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/_EUZP8kOW1r8Y8TNc8doNA/l.jpg
author: Ximeng W.

description: I would give this bakery four stars out of five. I ordered a mango moose cake for my husband's birthday. We loved the cake a lot. It tasted so good, not that sweet. The smallest size is prefect for four people. I like their service as well. The only one think I don't like it's hard to find parking which I felt inconvenient.
author: Grace K.

description: I've been coming to Schubert's for about a decade now and it's never failed me! I still haven't tried everything here but it will happen one day! My family love their Tiramisu, Fresh Fruit Tart, Strawberry Shortcake, & their most of their Mousse cakes! I can't even decide what's my favorite thing here! Is it someone's birthday yet so we can get our hands on another one of these cakes???
author: Michelle L.

description: I have been ordering cakes from this place for YEARS! Place certainly doesn't disappoint, each and every time the items are delicious. My favorite is the strawberry short cake which i just ordered again today for my roommates birthday! Only thing that is disappointing is that they are no longer making custom cakes. Def recommend trying this place out if you are looking for a birthday cake or some dessert.
author: Dmitriy G.

description:
Yes, lots of desserts.

No, not that great.

1 star off: The bakery is quite small, with only 4 small tables for seating.  My friend and I waited for half an hour for a seat after we purchased our desserts.  There was a table of old Chinese ladies who were eating dim sum (clearly not purchased from here).  I did not mind their loud and obnoxious manners...'cuz well, that is how we Chinese people roll =)...but they took up half of the chairs in an already small bakery.

1 star off: Even though it is called *Schubert's* Bakery, its desserts are more representative of a typical Chinese bakery found in grocery stores like 99 Ranch.  You know, it looks appealing on the outside, but tastes less appealing on the inside.  It might as well be called Golden Jade Panda Dragon Bamboo Bakery...or any combo of these words.
author: Ally W.

description: Yum! My mom and I dropped in for a light breakfast. We split an almost croissant and a fruit tart. They were both perfection. The almond flavor was perfect, and the pastry was full of fresh fruit. The coffee was a bit lacking, but that's not what we were there for. It was just over $10 for our treats. I would gladly return.
author: Alison M.

description: These cakes are AMAZING!!! My favorite is the Princess cake! The marzipan fondant I can eat it by itself! I love that they have single slices, 8' and 10' round and preorder quarter, half and full sheets as well. Small shop but well worth the trip across town! =)
author: Ms C.

description:
Swedish princess cake- 5/5 stars

White chocolate raspberry mousse cake- 5/5 stars 

Tiramisu cake- 3.5/5 stars
author: Frank U.

description: I got Schbuert's to cater my wedding cake and it turned out amazing! All my guests love the cake and it looked absolutely beautiful!!! I already miss their cake although it is only 1 week ago...
author: Athena C.

description:
Schubert's is the real deal when it comes to bakeries and cakes. My sister lives right around the corner from here and we always walk over the get coffee and perfectly baked croissants in the morning. A couple weekends ago our family was going to her place for her birthday and I ordered the Opera Cake online and it was absolutely beautiful! There was a little chocolate plate with "Happy Birthday Emily"- usually bakeries just write on the cake- this was SO much cuter and unique. The cake was amazing and the whole family of course loved it. You can order their cakes online too- just give them at least 2 days and you can design and pay online too! 
The ladies who work here are friendly and super helpful! They also have some cakes ready to go if you need to pick one up last minute.
author: Sarah R.

description: Got the Swedish Princess Cake and Chocolate Cheesecake. They both were very delicious and very cutely designed! This place was a bit of journey for me, but totally worth it.
author: John D.

description: My cousin keeps bring cakes and I keep eatting. Until now. I decided to find out the source and to my amazement it was a nice little tucked bakery. The service is great and will write messages for free on your cakes. The cakes themselves are too sweet for my taste, but I still have them because they look lovely and elegant to give as gifts. Also they are able to prepare cakes from a day to two days worth of notice so that is really nice for last minute birthdays you might forget. Check it out!
author: Robert H.

description:
This place is wonderful; cake slices and whole cakes for any occasion, petite four and various cookies, teas and coffee. Although not all the cakes ate to my taste, I would recommend the place to everyone to try. It is a nice little place to enjoy sugary things alone or with a friend (or bring it home to share) 

I definitely want to see them expand and have more seating area. Oh, and maybe have some slices of all the cakes listed; people tend not to order a whole cake of something if they don't know what it taste like. 

If you want a cake for sure to be available, pre-order because they sell out most of their goodies by closing!
author: Christina L.

description:
Ordered the Swedish Princess cake the day before a birthday. When I went to pick it up, the lettering of the name was off, but I did place the order over the phone and they might've easily misheard me. They fixed it quickly and added yellow icing to cover the stain left on the marzipan. No biggie.
I'm not a fan of marzipan but after trying the cake, my mind was completely changed. It was a tad too sweet but had a nice hint of almond. It was also light when I usually find marzipan dense and chewy. The cake and whipped cream was so fluffy and the raspberries were tart. Loved it.
I wish I had never tried it, now it's all I can think about.
author: Ana I.

description:
Never disappointed by the quality of cakes here. It can be a bit pricey but if you want a quality cake for a special someone this is the place to go.

My favorite cake is the princess cake. The outside skin of the cake is the driving factor as both the texture and the flavor is heavenly.

Perfect to go in and grab a slice for when you need a little pick me up.
author: Monica Z.

description: It was a surprise that Zen Spa provided our party a cake from Schubert's. It was such a delightful cake: a white cake with layers of rum custard, fluffy whipped cream, chocolate, and topped off with a cream puff and edged with lady fingers. It was so delicious and not to sweet. So decadent with the cream puffs on the top!
author: Vivian A.

description: I haven't had cake this good in a long time. I got to try their cake at a friend's birthday and it was amazing. Princess cake (marzipan and raspberries) both looks and tastes delicious! Their prices are super reasonable too. I just have to figure out how to get this cake to the East bay!
author: Alicia C.

description:
This used to be THE gold standard for pastries and cakes in the City, but many good places are around now. Still, they are at or very near the top.

And, while it can be difficult at certain times of the day, the parking situation is so much better than, say, that at Tartine's.
author: George T.

description: I got the swedish princess cake and I called them ahead of time for the order. At first they didn't have the size that I wanted (10 inches), but they said they would try to make one and if I got there in time and they had one when I got there. The cake itself was pretty meh. There wasn't anything too special about it, but the service was really good. I made the reservation at 10 in the morning to be picked up at 11:30 and it went very smoothly.
author: Victor D.

description: The cake I got for my father was yummy! It wasn't that sweet so my father enjoyed it. I'll be coming back to try more of their cakes.
author: Michelle C.

description:
hands down the best place to get cakes! I love the fact that my work is just a mere 5 minute walk....or maybe it hinders me bc i can easily pack on 1,000 calories in 10 minutes
not the point! lol 
come to schuberts for bdays anniversaries.... any kind of event where you want an amazing cake done =)
author: Natasha I.

description: There is only one dessert to get here, the princess cake!   Delicious and light cake, not overly sweet.  I love the marzipan layer on top.  I have been to schuberts multiples times now, sampled a lot of their desserts.  Most are okay, the chocolate mousse and princess cakes are my two favorite go to items.  The other desserts are just okay, nothing special or "wow" except the princess cake.
author: Terence N.

description: The pastries were mediocre. We looked at the reviews online and we actually took a detour to go there. But was nothing worth 4.5 stars.
author: Lipi P.

description:
The best cakes in Bay Area. You have to try them all. No kidding. But if I have to choose the best 2 cakes...........................................
...........................Opera Cake and ................
...........Double Chocolate Mousse cake........
author: Costel B.

description: I love white cake and I love raspberry so of course I loved the princess cake at Schubert's! It's so delicious, light, and not too sweet. I wasn't expecting much from the (almond?) fondant, but that was really good too. That cake is so perfect. I haven't tried anything else from here YET, but I'll be back to get more princess cake and try other cakes and tarts!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
We were looking for a place that could do a sheet cake with THIS IS YOUR LIFE on it and many bakeries that we called said that their picture-making machines were broken. Schubert's said they could do it, so we went there. 

What I didn't realize is that they still offer coffee crunch cake as an option. It was my favorite when I was a child and not many bakeries offer it any more, so we were doubly pleased to have the coffee crunch choice.

Schubert's made the most elegant sheet cake I have ever seen. It was the absolute hit of the party. We ordered the half sheet cake, and I was certain it would be too much, but the 1/4 sheet cake seemed too small. There was some leftover cake and we walked it over to the people having a picnic next to us and they gladly took it. 

It turned out there were three birthdays involved, and I think everyone was more than happy. (Oh, and Ken brought homemade ice cream, so that made it even better!)
author: Alberta M.

description:
Ordered a birthday cake here online and came to pick up 3 days later. Line was not too too long however I went straight to the register and had bypassed the line given I had already paid and was just there to pick up! One of the cashiers addressed me, ready to help, and then some guy behind me must have given her an "I'm next in line" look. Taking that as my cue to step into the queue (my first time here), I stood in line just to be helped 10 min by the same cashier, as I told her I was just there to pick up a cake I had already paid for. She thanked me for waiting -- SO I'm still confused, did she make a mistake and thanked me for stepping into line and waiting when I shouldn't have? If so, they need to be clear about this, and not let customers bully them with their eyes/demeanor. If a customer has already pre-ordered and pre-paid online, why do they have to stand in the same queue as the people who are there to order/pay in the shop!

HMPH! 

Overall the strawberry shortcake was just OK in my opinion. A bit expensive for a cake you can find at Asian bakeries for much cheaper with the same fluffy/not so sweet taste.
author: Siv L.

description: love their cakes! it's not super duper sweet or dense which i like. their cakes are very fresh, soft and fluffy and the fruits are yummy. we always get our birthday cakes from here!
author: Vicky L.

description:
Princess cake is yummy. It tastes a little too sweet if you leave it at the room temperature for too long. I prefer to eat them a little cold. I also love their Tiramisu!! 

Their cakes are very pretty and yummy. My favorite bakery in SF.
author: Bo Y.

description:
Came here to try their inFAMOUS swedish princess cake, and it was everything that people said and more. It tasted great and not too rich. The workers here were nice and even handed my daughter a free small pastery while we were waiting for our cake slice. 

One worker knew what the regulars wanted before they even asked. That's how you know it's been in business for a long time, and that they're so good people come in here regularly. 

I also tried the neopolitan, rasberry mousse, and mango mousse, which were good but nothing outstanding.
author: Mia S.

description: First timer with the Princess Cake. Never tried it before. Trusted the reviews and the cake was bomb ! Will be buying that again for sure.
author: Sonny S.

description: Still the best cakes around, but I'm taking away 2 stars for the remodel and all the awful changes. Gone is the beautiful chalkboard with cakes and prices. I had to pull out my phone, just to look at the menu. The remodel looks like it was designed by the same people who design Safeway's. And the killer is, they stopped selling their character sugar cookies. I have been taking my 12 yr old autistic son here, since he was a baby. And he asked me the question " why did they stop making cookies?" Not one of my best moments, but I was in a bad mood. And my answer was not pretty. Nevertheless, we don't go in anymore. Even though we are at the neighborhood shops regularly (Restaurant supply &  Green Apple Books)
author: Ken W.

description:
The apricot tart is absolutely delicious.  The crust is perfect!  I think this is the best tart crust I've ever had from a bakery.  It has great taste and texture.  The taste is buttery and sweet and just right!  Not too sweet and not too buttery.  The texture is divine! It wasn't all soggy like I've had so many times and maintained its own crust deliciousness without absorbing the filling.  The crust flaked into little bits as the fork easily went through it.  The crust, filling and 3 apricot halves arranged atop was just so good!  I will definitely have to get a large one next time for the thrill of a great tart that is not my first choice when something with chocolate or whipped cream is offered.

The napoleons are very good too.  

Can't wait to get back for an apricot tart.

I'm thinking of apricot tartlets or a large apricot tart from Schuberts.  Gosh they are good!
author: Rebecca B.

description: I would've given this place  5 stars if it wasn't for the unpleasant encounter with one of the young staff that worked there. I came to this bakery at 7:10 am on November 23, 2016 and wanted to buy a cake for my job as a treat. I got in when the cashier had just finish helping everyone that was in there earlier. When I stepped in there wasn't a line yet. I stood there and waited patiently for someone to help me. A man walked in a couple of minutes later and the person behind the counter greeted him and asked if he needed some help. I jumped in and told her I was here before him. She snapped at me and told me I was not it line. I was a bit confused since I was the only person standing there for those few minutes. I guess there was a tape there and I was suppose to stand on the other side of it eventhough I was the only person there at that time. I brushed it off and looked at three different chocolate cakes they had available. One was chocolate with nuts around it, the other was chocolate with shaving on it and lastly there was one with chocolate whipped creme. I asked the lady about the first one and she told me its chocolate mousse cake, I asked about the second one and she gave me the same response, then I asked about the third one and still the same response. I am not stupid because the cake menu board has different type of cake listed. So I wanted her to be specific and I asked her what was in each cake and she gave me the same stupid response. She said, "some chocolate and some cake!" I started to feel agitated so I requested a tiramisu cake that was listed on the menu board. The next visit I hope I do not get her. The cakes are great there and I been buying cakes from there for over 15 years. I just don't like that particular person now. She was a short, young girl, medium built with light brown hair with a slight accent. Buy the cakes there and be helped by other folks who are friendly, except for her. Maybe she shouldn't be working the morning shift with that type of personality.
author: davee c.

description: Ordered a strawberry mouse cake on a Friday at around 5:30 p.m. and they were still able to produce one for me the following day to be picked up at 2:00 p.m.  The cake was $17.95 for 6" and was more than enough for 4 people, more than enough for 6 people in my opinion.  It was my dad's favorite cake and it's actually not too sweet which I appreciate.  Would definitely return for future cake purchases.
author: Vanessa K.

description: We have used Schubert's on several occasions and the desserts are simply divine. They look and taste beautiful and the prices are reasonable as well. Delicious!
author: Issy G.

description:
It's rare that you get 5 star service from anywhere, but I've consistently gotten it from Schubert's (this includes early morning changes to a cake I was picking up in the afternoon).   It helps that parking is easily found out front & you can order online for pick-up the next day.

Aside from the great customer service are the seriously delicious cakes. I've ordered the Chocolate Truffle Torte for numerous birthdays (including my own & dude, as a general rule I don't even like chocolate cake; the cake is that good), the Cappuccino Mousse cake & the Strawberry Shortcake  - each to equal, "Oohs" & "Ahhs" for parties & events.  So before you consider doing-it-yourself, order from Schubert's; you, your co-workers, friends, & significant others will thank you.
author: Natasha R.

description: Just amazing! Chocolate mousse with almonds is Incredible! 3.75 for your own personal cake which is plenty!
author: Ryne O.

description: Ill keep this short and sweet, Schubert's is nothing short of perfection. Ordered strawberry cheesecake,  mango cheesecake, princess cake and mango mousse. Not overly sweet but full of flavor and excellent texture. I will return for sure after I hit the gym.
author: Todd T.

description: Love their desserts! They are all amazing. Every time I'm in the area I cannot avoid to stop in and get something.
author: Myna Z.

description: I give Shubert's Bakery a 5 because they are easy to work with and have delicious princess cake. It is the best I have ever had. It has the best ratio of ingredients and so light and delicious. Calling into order is super easy and they have a great display of their goodies. I've had some of their other deserts and they were also really good. You can't go wrong with this place!!! They even customize if you want a name or something on it.
author: Tosca B.

description:
Delicious stuff!
I've only had the Swedish princess and some type of cheesecake bar (I think it was a German cheesecake).
Loved the Swedish princess, hated the cheesecake bar...it had raisins in it and I hate raisins. I asked the girl helping me if it was similar to a regular cheesecake and she shrugged her shoulders and said "I guess"...I don't know why she is allowed to help customers...but I'd still go back for that damn Swedish princess.
author: Shelby S.

description:
I am a believer of Schubert's princess cake! It's light and fluffy. It's faintly sweet. Even the fondant was delicious!

It is not my favorite princess cake (my heart belongs to the one at Ettores in Sacramento), but it's certainly high up on my list of deliciously, delectable cakes!
author: Emily T.

description:
The best wedding cake I ever had came from this bakery and it wasn't even mine. 

I ate this cake almost 10 years ago and still dream about it.  When I think about this cake, I wish I hadn't been the first one married among my siblings, because then this would have been MY wedding cake. 

Schubert's makes the very best Swedish princess cake you could eat. For years after I had this cake at my sister's wedding, I had to order Swedish princess cake at every bakery I went to. Unfortunately, Schubert's cake has ruined the genre for me. 

We had this cake at my grandmother's memorial and it made the event that much more special.  Kudos to Schubert's for making such an amazing cake.
author: Nora S.

description:
I am the only person in my family that likes Princess cake but when I brought my family here, even they had to grudgingly admit that princess cake CAN taste good. The marzipan is thin and delicious; the genoise cake itself is soft and spongey and the the best part is that the buttercream on top to form the dome shape was well-made and there wasn't an overdose of it, a common fatality in most princess cakes. 

The rest of the items that I tried were only so-so, but considering the price for most slices is only $3.75 instead of say, $5 for a small cake, you get what you pay for. One thing I am not a big fan of is their cheesecakes. They are a little too gooey and sweet. Their mousse cakes are quite popular. There is just one layer of mousse, however, and I  prefer a multi-layer cake, maybe with 2 thinner layers. Some of the mousses are more flavorful than others. I saw a cassis one for the first time during my last trip there, and it was my favorite thus far. 

Murata's cafe in Japantown seems to carry cake slices from Schubert. I saw many small cakes I ate at Schubert's for sale there, including the Swedish Princess cake.
author: Alice L.

description: Totally love this place. We used to live in Daly City and just moved to east bay. Tried a new bakery in my neighborhood and nothing compares to Schubert's. Now that I'm away, I realized the value that this bakery brought to me and miss some of the really nice pastries and tarts that they have. Will keep coming back whenever I get a chance.
author: Varun V.

description:
Box O' Cake slices is my new box of chocolates. Wanted to do something different for Valentine's Day so looked up Schubert's. I pass by this place whenever I hit up San Tung and it's always packed so I wanted to give them a try.

 I'm so glad I did!!

I called and placed my order the week prior to V-day. I adore the girls there because I called about 3 times to change my order (look @ their website SOOooo many options) and at the last minute needed to pick up the order 1 day early. The girls were always helpful and very sweet over the phone and even sweeter in person.

Once I tasted the cake I immediately understood, why this place is so packed. Loved the princess cake and the strawberry cake and the and the white chocolate raspberry mousse and the....let's just say I liked everything I tried. 

The next time I have an occasion that calls for cake I know where I'm going...the only problem I have is deciding which cake to get. Which actually is the kind of problem you like to have. 

Great service and great cake = great experience
author: Troy R.

description: I love Schubert's baker! A most go if your in the area. You know how a place use to be good and then all of sudden they change up the recipe or a new cook takes over and its just not as good anymore....?  Well, I've been coming here since I was little girl and always get their Petit Fours- yep, their still good every time!
author: Corey G.

description: hint: if you are not a fan of food colored marzipan, you can special order a princess cake without food coloring. it's still gorgeous, and is missing the neon glow. go for it!
author: El B.

description: I used to pass by this bakery a lot when I'm on Clement but never actually went in because it looked so fancy. But my friends got me two miniature cakes as a late birthday celebration and they surely left a lasting impression on me! The cakes are so delicious! I love that they give an option of the tiny cakes so if you suddenly have a craving for something sweet and delicious, you don't have to buy a whole cake and feel too guilty. Although I've never had La Baguette French Bakery cakes, just comparing their mini cakes, Schuberts is alot cheaper at about $3.75 vs. $5.00 cakes. Their cakes are so cute and I'd definitely dish out a little more cash for a celebratory cake that happens once a year than to have these cream-infested Asian fruit cakes that I've grown up on in the past.
author: Judy C.

description:
One of the best places for the special cake for a special event. They've been around
For ages and only get better ever year - the princess cake is perfection.
author: Kae D.

description: I always come here for their napoleon, it's amazingly delicious, I have had their strawberry cake, and tried their mousse cakes, all of which are good but nothing for me beats the  napoleon! Staff is good and I came in one morning for a napoleon, they didn't have any but I was told to wait 5 minutes and the Baker would assemble it for me :) delicious as always!
author: Terilyn T.

description:
On the suggestion of a former partner in crime, I recently ordered a birthday cake from this place.

The order process on their website needs improvement, but the problem was quickly resolved with a phone call.

The strawberry cheesecake was absolutely delightful and a big hit for the evening.

I would most definitely order from them again.
author: Anthony D.

description:
Ever since I learned of this place, it has become my go-to place for cakes for all special occasions. They offer a huge array of cakes, ranging from decadent chocolate cakes to light mousse cakes. I've never had a cake from Schubert's that I didn't like.  Their mango mousse deserves particularly high praise. I've tried iterations of mango mousse cake from several other bakeries and nothing comes close to Schubert's. Schubert's mousse is just so light and airy, yet full of delicious mango flavor. The sponge cake is delicate and moist, not dense and dry like at many other places. 

During the holidays, this place gets packed with customers waiting to pick up cakes, but I've never not been able to get the cake I wanted, so props to them for keeping up with demand. 

On the downside, there are only a few tables available for sit-down. Also, since it is on Clement, parking can be a bit of a challenge. 

The store is small, so look for the maroon colored building.  


Recommendations:

Mango Mousse 
Strawberry Mousse
Tiramisu
Swedish Princess Cake
author: Jenny C.

description: Thank you Yelpers!  Based on your reviews we tried Schuberts for the first time, ordering a Princess cake for my father's 89th birthday.  It was fabulous...a light airy vanilla cake with light fresh whipped cream, raspberry jam, and coated with a marzipan fondant.  Good enough to be a wedding cake...memorable and worth going back to again for sure.  Wonderful.
author: Jay S.

description: Ordered a rasberry cheesecake online for my bae's birthday, and arranged delivery with a courier. Everything was seamless, and he LOVED the cake. I can't wait to try their cakes myself!
author: Roxana G.

description: Thank you for baking my birthday cake. I ordered the tropical cake on their website and it was delicious. Cake was moist, not too sweet and it was just perfect. Highly recommend the cakes here and it's so easy to order on their website. Next special event I'll be sure to consider Schubert's bakery first .
author: Vinkin Ken T.

description: Really don't understand the hype - we ordered the mango mousse cake and were disappointed. The mousse was not as smooth as expected and the sponge layer under the mousse wasn't either - in fact it may be the most 'coarse' sponge cake I've ever had. Perhaps this place is hyped up for its history in SF but honestly the cakes aren't really that great. (I also had their princess cake some other time at a friend's birthday - there's really nothing special about it.)
author: Essie L.

description: Another perfect place to get a birthday cake.  Delicious cakes and nicely decorated.  However, cakes here do tend to be overly sweet.
author: Karen L.

description: $21 for a 6" Princess Cake? Yes pls! For a only a slice its about $4-$5 so I recommend buying it as a whole rather than a slice.
author: Sarah C.

description: Went there today to order custome cake for my daughter's birthday. But the counter person saying they don't make custom cake anymore. I was so disappointed. Always bought there  the birthday cake for my daugther since she was 2 years old and other custom for any occasion.
author: Arya H.

description: We come here to buy their fruit tart. It's super good and fresh. They do not skim on the fruits either. Haven't tried anything else besides the fruit tart, but will do in the future.
author: Priscilla D.

description:
As my bestfriend would say "Nommy!" So glad she brought me here. It was mommy's bday so she got the princess cake, extremely fitting for her mom. And I got a fruit tart. We decided to sit there for a little bit to chill but I devoured mines in about 10 min it was SOOOO SOOOOO GOOOOD!

Located in a cute strip of what seems like an extension of Chinatown sits this unassuming bakery. On the outside it looks like any other Chinese Bakery but go inside and BAM! Lovely decorated cakes and cakes and cakes and cakes. Look up and the menu sits high, describing each and every cake's nomminess. 

Better seating, a more efficient way of ordering and bigger drink selection would be nice. 

We saw a couple ordering their wedding cake in the corner, AWWWW!!! They do that too?!?!?! Fiance would be so mad at me for playing with that idea.

I would LOVE to come back to try to mango mousse. That looks even Nommier.
author: Judie H.

description:
For my son's first birthday, I ordered a princess cake for all the guests and the chocolate mousse cake for his smash cake. 

Pro's: 
1. I could order on-line
2. Cakes were ready on time 
3. The best tasting cake my guests or I have ever  ever had. Everyone was asking where I got the cake because they wanted to get their next cake there.
4. My son's smash cake was a success. I thought I would be able to save at least have of it for my husband who is a fan of chocolat... nope! My son dove into it and made it ALL his. My husband was able to taste a little, but that was it.
5. This was the easiest purchase and the best results I have ever had from a cake.

Con's:
None

I use to do something local, but the last cake I ordered wasn't the best tasting, but it looked good. I decided to try something new. To be honest, these cakes are beautiful and you can't go wrong with the taste. I'm sold and I will only order cakes from here from now on. It's a win win situation. The price... I feel is very reasonable... comparing it to the local bakeries that charged twice as much for a tasteless cake that looked good. 

My sister-in-law makes fabulous looking cakes, and the next time she is in town I will take her here to try the princess cake or whatever her heart desires.
author: Mary M.

description:
I love sweets to death and Schubert's was pretty much my ideal bakery!

Location: Easy to find. The store name is huge on the outside. You can't miss it.

Appearance: First thing I saw when I entered, a huge variety of vibrant, colorful cakes and pastries sitting there waiting for me! Oh my gosh...me and my friend, Chelsey, literally were like kids at a candy store, putting our faces to the display windows, deciding which ones we wanted to eat but had a hard time choosing because we wanted them all! Ah I'm craving it right now as I'm typing about it! Basically, I'm saying, you can't resist getting a dessert from here. The set up of the place was a decent size store, open enough, Two big sections of cakes and pastries. There's also a bread section but sorry I was not on a mission for bread. Lots of people were coming in. And I love how there's elderly, Chinese people sitting there having a dessert with their coffee. There was a group of ladies sitting at one table as if this is their usual hangout spot. Adorable!

Service: Plenty of employees there to help every customer out. They were nice and patient with me and Chelsey because we took a while making our final decisions.

Food: It really is hard to choose which cake you want because they look all too good. A lot of colors and variety from the cream, glazes, the fresh fruit, chocolate finishing touches on top of the cakes. Some had smiley faces on them. They are a little bit on the pricier range because they're specialty cakes but I had to indulge myself. I will spend on desserts. I ordered the mixed fruit tart, the napoleon, and the chocolate mousse cake. Each one was about $3.75. Even after I sat down ready to eat, I still couldn't choose which one to start with! Napoleon: crunchy crust, lots of cream, and fruits aligned for every bite of the napoleon. Chocolate mousse cake: Chocolatey heavenly goodness! Moist and melts in your mouth but a bit messy with the flakes falling out from the surface of it. Fruit tart: I knew it would not disappoint me unlike other fruit tarts I've had.

My newest favorite bakery. I am willing to make a special trip all the way across the Bay just to get my dessert fix.
author: Candice L.

description: Great customer service. I was dealing with a miscommunication on an order...they went above and beyond to make it right. The display case is beautiful. The last time I saw baked goods like this I was in a little German village outside of Strasbourg, France.
author: Lincoln W.

description:
I had the princess cake and the tiramisu .  They look quite pretty but I thought the cake was missing the wow factor.

They have been around for 100 year, that's pretty amazing!
author: Coco L.

description:
This place is cake heaven to me. I love most of their cakes.
My family doesn't really like rich and sense traditional American cakes and I was tired of the Chinese angel food and fruit cakes. Apparently banana is a flavor in November when other fruits are out.
I decided to always get my birthday cakes from her since age of 10 and after more than a decade get cakes for everyone else I know from here. I also get the pastries and cookies!!! They have the best chocolate covered gingerbread men/soldiers.
My favorite cake raspberry white  chocolate mousse. All the fruit mousse cakes are highly endorsed by my Chinese parents. My sister loves the cheesecake and jade me drive them down to her in Ventura!!! I also need to mention the to die for rich chocolate cakes and their strawberry angel cake is another one I just discovered. My goal is to try all their cakes!! I have tried about 10!
author: Annie P.

description:
My friend was so nice to buy me two cakes from Schubert.  It was Princess cake and Italian Rum.  Both cakes were so good.  At first I thought the icing for the princess cake was very sweet but it wasn't.  

Can't wait to try other flavors next time.
author: Liza T.

description:
Our favorite bakery - the mousse cake is a must-everything is tasty
Awesome staff!!
They are very accomodating- the decorations are very creative
author: Satoko B.

description:
There's not much to say about this place, except that it is an amazing bakery!

The cakes are beautiful, and they are tasty too. I am a huge fan of the Swedish Princess Cake. They provide cute chocolate blocks that feature your particular occasion's greetings, which makes it nice but doesn't detract from the beauty of the cakes.

I'd call them art, but I'd prefer to eat them than to look at them too long. However, you could get away with putting one on display!
author: Daniel H.

description:
I bought a chocolate truffle yesterday for $3.75. It's delicious and the price is pretty reasonable compared to other similar bakeries! Girls at the counter are friendly, by the way, their open time is longer than others'.

Overall, pretty good, definitely worth to try. I will come back to try other flavors!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
BEST mousse cakes EVER!!!

I usually hate cakes...but when my dad's customer bought him a Mango Mousse cake from Schubert's to bring home, I had a slice and I fell in love! I almost ate the whole 10" cake, it was truly delicious! Everyone in the family loved it. I ordered the Tropical & Peach Mousse Cake for my birthday and Father's Day over the phone in the morning and got it picked up the same afternoon. It was similar to the Mango Mousse but sooo good!! A bit pricey for the size I think, but worth it. Gonna try the other mousse cakes soon!!
author: Jessica Y.

description:
It's a bit pricey. At 3.75 a slice.
It's good to try once or twice to try a few different flavors.
Personally I'm not a fan of mousse. They do feel airy and not heavy at all, but I just don't like mousse typically. 
The truffle chocolate is okay. I may or may not try that one again when
Their cheesecakes are good, but I would share a slice since it gets too rich and heavy eventually. 
The strawberry shortcake was actually nothing amazing so I'm a bit disappointed. I did not like the whipped cream and the cake wasn't too memorable.
The Princess cake was okay. I didn't like the marzipan.

Overall, I would recommend coming here to grab some cute slices. It's fun to do esp. if you want to grab a few for a date in Golden Gate Park. (I recommend walking over to the Botanical Garden)

Don't come here too much or you will gain a few lb, while your wallet gets skinnier!
author: Nona T.

description:
Desserts Galore! One of the best places to satisfy my sweet tooth! so many cakes to choose from! They had Chocolate Raspberry Mousse, Swedish Princess Cake, Black Forest Cake, Strawberry Cheesecake...etc. When I first got here, it was located in an Asian area, so I was confused as to whether or not this was a European type bakery or an Asian bakery. It is a European style bakery because I went on their homepage. 

I got my mom a birthday cake from here and went with the Currant Mousse Cake. It had like Cranberry flavoring I think. I chose this one because my parents don't usually like super sweet stuff and I thought this was well-balanced in taste and flavoring. I was right! It wasn't to sweet or too bitter, it was just right! Their cake designs are pretty elegant and classy. They also have a bunch of different pastries and other desserts. 

The price is way better than other cake places by where I live. About $28 for about 10-12 servings?! Good deal for this type of cake. I paid $25 for an itty bitty cake of this type in San Jose before and it does not compare at all. This place is TOO GOOD! I am coming back for sure!
author: Katrina T.

description: I love love love this place! As a Swede I have tried all kinds if awful attempts at the Swedish Princess cakes here in the US. This is the absolute best I have had and I go here for every birthday in our family for a taste of home.
author: Ellinor M.

description: My cousin mentioned this bakery to me and told me all about the yummy desserts I should try. So far I tried the Chocolate Mousse, Mango Mousse, Neapolitan, & some of there pastries, not all in one day! LOL!  My favorite is the Strawberry Shortcake. It has fresh strawberries and whipped cream between layers of white cake. Yummm! The cake is so moist and so delicious. I highly recommend this place if you are looking for something to satisfy your sweet tooth!
author: Anna P.

description:
I chose this bakery after reading all the great reviews on yelp. I am glad I did because it was a great cake.

I selected the tropical fruit cake for my girlfriends dad's birthday. I ordered it off the website. I was a little hesitant because I usually like to order things face to face, but I decided to use the website instead. The website was easy to use and had clear instructions. The pictures really do look like the actual cakes. The family really enjoyed the cake and so did I. They commented on how light and fresh it tasted without being too sweet. 

I am however knocking off one star for the baked goods that were available for purchase at the store when I went there. I selected a chocolate croissant and an almond croissant. I must say that I've actually had better of both versions at coffee shops such as Starbucks and Peets. Otherwise the cake and the shop and the ordering process were great.

I would definitely recommend Schuberts for any birthday cakes or any kind of other specialty desserts such as those. Great business.
author: Jesson d.

description:
I've been coming here for years.  I would say 95% of the cakes I buy is from Schubert's.  The other 5% I probably had to buy somewhere else last min because Schubert's was closed.  They have an array of different kinds of mousse cakes, cheesecakes and more.  My three favorites are the Princess, the Tiramisu & the Viennesse Fruit Torte (but you have to pre-order this particular cake as they never have any dispplayed).

Kevin & I also ordered our 4 tiered square Princess wedding cake (plus an additional sheet cake) here almost two years ago in May.  But I remember it like it was just yesterday.  We made an appointment to have our cake tasting and tried a variety of option off their menu.  We were sold that very day.  Very affordable. 

Photos posted
author: Stacey L.

description:
My favorite bakery in SF! I've been coming here ever since high school and maybe even middle school. Whenever it's someone's birthday in the family, we always resort to Schubert's!

I love the tiramisu and mango mousse. I also love their fruit tart. Even when it's not someone's birthday, I like to come here for a small cake or tart for about $4. The cakes always look beautiful. The tart's shell is so good and the fruits are always fresh with a glaze on top. Yum! 

The only disappointment that I have sometimes is that they run out of my favorites by the end of the day :( If you want a specific cake for a special occasion, make sure to come earlier in the day so it doesn't run out!
author: Connie Y.

description: Delicious strawberry short cake. Finally a decent one outside of NYC! Highly recommend!
author: Henry P.

description: Best cheesecake (NY style) in the bay area. Everything else is also delicious and of superb quality. 5 Big Stars!
author: Ibrahim S.

description: Impossible to choose a bad cake from here! All are sooooooo good:)!
author: Elena P.

description:
A delicious bakery store that is hidden in the busy street of Clement.  

All I can think of is to try their Swedish Princess and Neopolitan Cakes.  I totally ignored all the other ones because I was super excited to try these two from all the raving reviews. 

They were very delicious! I like the unusual textures of the marzipan. It was sweet, but not overwhelming. I'm happy that I came here to find a new place to get yummy cakes.  :)

I like the simplicity of the set up.  Hand-written menus of their desserts, coffee/tea/water for beverages, chairs and tables.  Clean glass cases to see their beautiful decorated cakes.  

I really like the atmosphere because I saw a bunch of locals coming in-and-out of the sweet bakery shop.  

All you want to do is stay eat, drink and watch the day go by in front of you in happiness.  

So next time you are roaming around Clement, I suggest you to stop by either to grab a cake to-go or take a short break.  :)

Get your sweet tooth on! :P
author: Deborah C.

description:
I really love this place. Just seeing all these wonderful cakes, pies, tarts in the storefront will make your day.
I would recommend the raspberry white chocolate mousse, it's just insanely good.

One last note to my fellow Germans: it's not a bakery where you get bread and bread rolls. Be prepared for that.
author: Henriette K.

description:
How could you not love this quaint little bakery. 
Their princess cake is amazing, I highly recommend it. 
Besides that, they have a bunch of mini cakes and mouses you can try. I just bought a little back of assorted cookies from them and oh my goodness they were so good.

A little pricier than some of the Chinese bakeries nearby, but their quality and design are great so you get what you pay for basically :)
author: Cara O.

description: I tried the chocolate mouse, tiramisu and mango cheese cake. All were beautiful and very delicious.  YUM sums it up!
author: Tricia G.

description:
Croissant, cakes, pastries yum.   Best croissants in the city.  A big thumbs up for all the tarts, the mouse cakes, pastries as well.  Have yet to have anything that wasn't delicious.

We also used to get all our bday and other cakes there.  Sadly we live too far away now but stop by whenever we're in the neighborhood.
author: Joshua W.

description: This has been a great neighborhood joint for years, I recently got a birthday cake for my coworker's birthday and not only was it gorgeous but it was delicious. Now everyone wants a Schubert's cake for their birthdays...
author: Rachel M.

description:
Crap! Their strawberry shortcake is so friggin' good! I also order their fruit tarts regularly. Pricey except its worth it. 

The ladies behind the counter are super helpful in finding a specific cake for me, especially when it comes to dietary restrictions.
author: Winn D.

description: Ordered a chocolate cake with whipped cream for my mom's birthday today.  Triple checked with the young girl that took the order that it would be layered with white whipped cream and it would have chocolate with gold flakes like the one pictured.  Today we picked up an all chocolate mousse cake with no white whipped cream nor the gold flaked chocolate.  The cake was light and not too chocalatey (in a good way), but not what we ordered.  Beautifully decorated as well, just not what we were expecting.
author: Lisa R.

description: An institution here in Richmond. It's my mom's favorite cake place. I get all her cakes & pastries here whenever I visit. The service is always friendly. The place is always well kept & clean. It has a nice calm ambiance inside when I have coffee there away from the hustle & bustle on Clement Street. I can't scarf down desserts like I used to but the cravings are always there. I get their single serving cheesecakes to hold me off. Cakes can get expensive and they're always priced reasonable. Only obstacle is that the street parking is a challenge.
author: Stevie C.

description:
Decadent and delicious, the cakes here are simply addictive. 
I love the history of the place, the beautifully made cakes and the friendly staff. I would definitely order a cake here in the future for any special events.
As a first timer, I was advised to sample a selection of the more popular cakes. I got the Princess cake, the Mango mousse, the Neapolitan and the Strawberry Shortcake. They were all delicious. 
Back in my mind, I know that I still have to fit into my New Year Eve's dress that I just bought. But hey, it's the holiday season, so I say for now, lets just dig in. Happy indulging!
author: Helen Y.

description: I have been frequenting this place since I was a kid. Always the first place I think of in the avenues when I need a cake. Recently I ordered a princess cake for my daughters birthday and again I wasn't disappointed. They had my cake ready on time and ready for pick up. The kids and the adults all loved it.
author: Anthony M.

description:
Based on what I know about the bakery, this one is pretty darn good. My friend purchased a slice of princess cake for me once and I was immediately addicted. My husband and I ended up going with cupcakes and an 8-inch round princess from Schubert's for our wedding, and he also drove all the way from South Bay up to this bakery to get me another princess cake for my birthday.

Since I haven't had any of their other baked goods, I feel wary giving it 5 stars, but if I find myself nearby again I'm going to try some of their other things.
author: Maureen C.

description:
