I've ordered cakes from Schubert for years now be it for birthdays, christmas, anniversary, valentine's day, etc. My wife's favorite is the princess cake, which can be made in ANY color by the way (not just in that funky green color). I didn't like marzipan at first, but Schubert's princess cake converted me. 

4 stars for very delicious cheesecake, princess cake, black forest cake, and awesomely decorated cakes during christmas. 

Minus 1 star for the ho-hum mango mousse cake. It was just marginally better than those mango mousse cake you can buy at Chinese bakeries like Sheng Kee. 

Also, the place gets very crowded. Sometimes you get ditzy and SUPER-annoying chicks who HAVE to INSTAGRAM like, EVERY cake. God forbids if the whole world (aka Facebook) doesn't get to see every minute of their "fabulous" lives.They hog  the counters taking stupid pictures, while other customers wait for them to FINALLY order 1 croissant to share among 3 skinny girls. I just wish the employees at the counter would shoo these annoying people away. 


Will return again and again and again.
author: Kelvin Y.

description: Everything they say about this place is true. We wanted to get a cake for our daughter's birthday and ended up trying the strawberry shortcake and the chocolate mousse cake with almonds. Both were superlative - there was no cake left! We also tried the princess cake. All of the cakes are extremely light and airy - it seems as if it melts in your mouth when you eat it. And they have the perfect amount of sweetness (I think the chocolate mousse cake might be too rich for kids though). They'll definitely be our go to bakery from now on!
author: Ruchi M.

description:
"Now I will perform a hypnotic act for you."

"Look at my watch as it rocks left and right, left and right, left and right..."

"Now you are under my magical power with your eyes motionless."

"You must look at this picture, while salivating on your keyboard!"
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/DyXoC_NhJW0Xx5j_OPQRHQ?select=UIMGUIVqgL95WDrBwO_JtA
"Then, dig into your wallet and grab a twenty-dollar bill!"

"Now grab your car keys and drive to the Clement and 6th Ave bakery and pick "your boy" up six of these $3.00 nutty tarts!"
author: Matt G.

description:
Best bakery of my life!

I have tried wayyy too many of Schubert's offerings to admit to and all of them were absolutely delicious. My personal fave is the Italian Rum cake though if you are a big cheesecake fan then you have to try the Currant Cheesecake. All of Schubert's mini desserts are gorgeous and at about $3.75 they are a very affordable treat. I love getting birthday cakes at this bakery, which are also incredibly affordable considering how amazing they are (about $15 for a serving of 6-8, I think). The only dessert i wouldn't try again was the fruit tart; it was good but not as good as everything else. 

Lastly, keep in mind that on Saturdays, they close at 6, not 6:30pm.
author: Ilana V.

description:
I bought my wedding cake (Swedish Princess) here and I and the rest of my guests were extremely impressed both with the presentation of the cake and the taste of it.  Swedish Princess has the most delightful almond fondant that is to die for.  One of our guests who had attended about 7 other weddings the same summer said that ours won for best wedding cake.  If I were a gambling lady, I'd bet that our cake was the cheapest one of the 8 weddings.

Schubert's Bakery is a bustling place on Irving in Chinatown where business is always booming.  It does not make for the best sit down experience, but I always order to-go.  

As for wedding planning, the woman I spoke with on the phone was not too friendly, but the young lady who assisted us with the cake sampling was very accommodating and organized.  We tried about 5 different cake flavors with an actual free slice at the end to boot.  I brought an image of the style I wanted  for the cake and the baker did a phenomenal job replicating it.  Schubert's Bakery is good about responding to emails and their delivery rate within SF is quite reasonable.  Might I add that instead of freezing the top layer of your cake to eat on your first anniversary, Schubert's Bakery lets your redeem a free cake (one layer, of course) on your anniversary?  

Overall, this bakery is a wonderful place both for a quick snack to-go and for special events.  I have tried other cakes as well.  The mousse did not disappoint and nor did anything else I've tried.  Swedish Princess will always remain favorite though.
author: Michelle M.

description:
Every time I'm in the richmond area I have to stop in if they're open. I may not be hungry but there is always room for the mango mousse cake. Sometimes we'll get the chocolate mousse cake too! so gluttonous, but who could resist??

And the best part- its cheap! I think its about $3-4 per mini cake. For the quality of product this is an amazingly low price. Next time I need a birthday cake - we're coming here!!
author: Komal B.

description:
Son brought me a Princess cake for my birthday.  

Very yummy, light moist multi-layered white cake with whipped cream and raspberry between each layer, topped with whipped cream and almond fondant.

It's a light cake with gentle flavoring added, sometimes I wished it had more raspberry, but at others I was glad it wasn't too rich.
author: J. G.

description:
A sweet conversation between me and Amy C. 

Me, "Shame on me! I don't know why but I've never been there yet!!!! I gotto go!"

Amy C. "Definitely go!  The Swedish Princess Cake is awesome.  :) "

Me, "I didn't know that Schubert is Swedish!!"

Amy C. "I don't know if they are either.  Swedish or not it's a great bakery!"

it's a great bakery indeed.

I came here because Amy's review:
http://www.yelp.com/biz/schuberts-bakery-san-francisco#hrid:Ky1nnxDJJ6QsZ3saixAxbA

Shame on me, I live in SF for over 30 years but I've never even care to stop by here before. Why? I think because the place is kind of hidden surrounded by all Asian junk places like - Asian Supermarkets, Dim sum-take outs, Sushi bars, Pho shops, Korean barbecue, Bubble tea, Viet's sandwiches. There's even a Hong Kong-style restaurant supply store next door. 
So, Schubert's? Give me a break, Clement St is Asian St.

But, the place is, the last man standing. On Clement Street.

This is time for us to care.
Original Non Asian Bakers in SF since 1911. Even though there are many Asians work there.
"Schubert's Bakery is celebrating its 94th anniversary. One of the area's oldest bakeries, Schubert's first opened its doors in 1911 on Fillmore Street. Since the 1940's, the bakery has been at its present location on Clement Street."

The place is very hard core bakery.
The Swedish Princess Cake does sound so porn, doesn't it?
author: Nobu K.

description: Dropped in toward the end of the day hoping they'd have something for the dinner party we were to attend. Much to my surprise there were many choices if flavors and sizes. Got two small cakes - one dome shaped green princess with the traditional marzipan on top. Had custard, kirsch and raspberry inside with white or yellow cake. Also got the mango mousse cake. Not being a big mousse fan I wasn't expecting much. They were both great. Princess wasn't the very best I've ever had - Katarina Rozelle takes that prize but they were both really good and Im looking forward to the next dinner party that brings me to SF.
author: Marco M.

description:
I've been a long time customer at Sheng Kee Bakery, but I feel like their cake is getting smaller and more expensive. Same goes for Baskin robins. So I searched on Yelp for another bakery in replacement and found Schubert's Bakery! Their cake look SO MUCH more delightful and plus they have more choices. 

First one I got was the Tiramisu Mouse, but it was WAYYYYY too sweet. This will satisfy and chocolate cravings! It looks AMAZING (refer to pix). 

Second one I got was the Swedish Princess Cake. MY FAVE CAKE SO FAR. Not too sweet. Chewy but not so chewy texture for the outside. Very soft and moist cake. Omg it's just so delicious. A must try!
author: Sandy T.

description:
I have to agree with Amy C., Victor, Nobu and many other 5-star reviewers of Schubert's  I first tasted the delicacies of Schubert's in 1971 when I was a relative newcomer to S.F. It was not yet surrounded then by Asian culture.  The concept of New Chinatown was still years away in the sense that we now experience it.  Schubert's held an iconic position in the 70s as a great bakery in the tradition of European bakeries.  The current iteration still has its original class ... the standards are still the same.  I can not say the same for my metabolism.  What I could enjoy in my 20s compared to my current dietary selections means that my visits to Schubert's has to be quite limited ... and mostly really a fond memory.  

If I wanted a baked good representative of European traditions, I'd surely pick Schubert's even after all these years as my go-to location.  It's number one in its category and enduring the stiff competition from the delicious offerings of the "not so new any more" New Chinatown of Clement Street.
author: Em S.

description:
Schubert's definitely makes the most visually pleasing cakes. Taste-wise, I think their cakes are good but not the best in the city. 

The cakes I've had are:
- the popular princess cake (not a fan) 
- black currant mousse (my favorite of the 3, not too sweet, but was a bit too tart)
- the pink champagne cake 

I need to come back to try their chocolatey cakes, the mango mousse, and the tiramisu.

If you need a good cake and one that looks impressive, definitely order a schubert's cake!
author: C. Z.

description:
CONSISTENCY 

whether it be you coming home to your significant other to a warm hug, or having a stripper take all of your money. there is consistency in both.

Schuberts is no exception and for all the right reasons.
Ive order so many cakes from the tiramisu mousse and the princess. Every time it comes out moist, flavorful and just the right amount of sweet for me. They have it ready on the dot, which is a double edged sword because im usually staring at the small cakes they have display and trying add to my order. yes imma fatty. but who can blame you when you have this great bakery in your city? the ladies are so nice! they need to add tip to the credit card reciepts though so i can show my appreciation and get 5 percent cash back on my us bank cash plus card. yes i work for us bank, self advertising. But in the mean while i carry cash to show the ladies some love. unlike the strippers that take all your money, this bakery will make you come back for more.
author: Q L.

description: Quick service, and a bounty good sweets...that pretty much sums up Schubert's.  When you come in you see a display counter full of colorful temptations.  The stand-outs (of what I tried) were the raspberry mousse and the mango mousse.  The marzipan was adorable but just tasted ok, just not my thing.  However, there is a great variety of moderately priced desserts here and it's definitely worth multiple trips to  try everything out.
author: Christine W.

description: Friendly staff, and quality products. Got the tiramisu from here last minute for a small office gathering. Ordering in advance is advisable, but they do have some stuff in store for last minute purchases. The cake was delicious. Wonderful mousse and sponge combination, but not too sweet, and my coworkers loved it. They REALLY decorate their cakes. It was a little over-styled for my taste, but that's just because I like minimalist design. The decoration wouldn't stop me from going here again. Overall excellent experience.
author: Brian H.

description:
Any bakery on Clement you want to assume is a Chinese bakery. Standard sponge cakes, whipped cream frosting and fresh fruits for filling and decorations. But not Schuberts! One of the only long time standing German bakeries in SF and they're still around for a reason.

Whatever you're in the mood for, they will have. Fruity or chocolate cakes? They offer whipped creamed cakes, custard filled cakes, mousse cakes and cheesecakes. Pastries? Fresh fruit tarts, fruit filled pastries, danishes, coffee cakes, and muffins. 

They're also beautifully decorated cakes. Such as the Princess Cake, Tiramisu, and Mango Mousse... there's just too many to name.  My personal faves are the Strawberry Romanoff; white cake, custard, strawberries and frosted in fresh whipped cream. The Opera cake fulfills my chocolate cake cravings with a praline truffle filling and crunchy almonds all around.

Anytime I see a cake at a party that looks like a Schubert cake, I look for that little chocolate oval with their logo. Come in for a slice and know the sliced cakes won't taste like other cakes because it's all fresh!
author: S Y.

description:
all i have to say is.. swedish princess cake !!!!!! you won't understand until you try it ! 

its looooveeeeeeeeeeeee !
author: Jane N.

description:
This bakery had always popped up in my yelp searches for the ' best' cakes but I never did get a chance to try them until now....I got a strawberry short cake for my friends birthday here.... everyone's raving about it!

Wonderful little bakery. Very accessible to public transportation, super friendly staff, beautiful cakes, great prices, and so delicious!
author: I Am Anonymous X.

description: So many great things too choose from! This was the only problem with the place! The berries tart that we had was great. You should go there if you are in a need of a great cake!
author: Idan B.

description: Last minute bday cake run... Mango mousse cake is perfect. Not overly sweet n it's fluffy n light. place gets packed but there are many servers. Just be ready when its your turn...
author: Vee V.

description:
Cashier doesn't know how to count. Total was $29.05. I gave her $30.25. She gave me $0.20 back. 

Me: um I gave you $30.25
Cashier: so i give you $0.20
Me: the total was $29.05...
Cashier: yeah so oh! It was supposed to be $0.15 (she took back a dime and gave me 15 cents)
Me: no. I gave you $30.25 and the total was $29.05
-she used the calculator-
Cashier: okay so i give you $1.20 back
Me: so you only gave me $0.20
Cashier: and?

At that point, I was like "okay whatever. It's only a dollar" but seriously, it just felt like she wanted a dollar for herself. It wasn't like I wasn't going to give tip.. I planned on dropping $3 in the tip jar but because of that situation, I just put the $0.20 instead. Never going back. Even if I do, I'll walk back out if I see her.
author: Irene T.

description:
When it comes to cakes, I usually like my cakes fluffy and sweet. However, the Napoleon cake has changed my take on it. Everything about it is just perfect. 

Make sure to come early as they run out of slices or call early in the morning to reserve a slice or two, or even three in my case. 

Yum!
author: Kelly T.

description:
This place is my favorite place to order birthday cakes, and cakes of any other occasion. They have a variety ranging from mousse to fondant, and fruit tarts to tiramisu cake. My top favorites would be the Princess cake and their Mango Mousse. 
Definitely recommend giving it a try if you haven't yet!
author: Amanda C.

description: Ordered online and picked up 2 days later so simple! Having lived in Europe before I was craving for European sweets and so glad to have found Shubert's! The white chocolate raspberry mousse is heavenly! Definitely my favourite European bakery out here in SF!
author: Jan L.

description:
Best bakery ever! Amazing cakes and great service. Really good. An excellent place to buy fancy cakes.  Great cakes, high in quality. I loved it! Schubert's Bakery's Swedish Princess cake must be the stuff that princesses dream of.The raspberry lemon cake was amazing. I love the mango mousse cake too!  Amazing cakes. Fluffy and light chocolate mousse. None of those thick fattening  butter cream. Schubert's, 
Highly recommended!
author: Tom S.

description: Heard of the place a for a long time and finally got to try it out. The pastry was great. Full of flavor and not overly sweet. Would love to try the rest of the items!
author: J Y.

description:
OMG this place is crazy! The Tiramisu is enough to make me do anything. Super delicious and there is nothing out there like it.
After writing this now I gotta go to SF to get me some. It's been a favorite for years now but I miss it after moving to SJ.
author: Janet D.

description:
Seriously one of the best bakeries I've ever tried thus far.  

As you enter, you'll notice that everything looks soooo good and nicely decorated that you'll probably want one of each.  There is no clutter and every pastry or cake is organized.  It was hard for me to choose but I just got the princess cake and a slice of a black forest cake.  They both contain the perfect amount of sweetness and had a good proportion/ratio as well.  

I'm definitely coming back to this place for cakes and pastries.
author: Deborah W.

description:
I'd probably write a better review if I weren't still blinded by how delicious the Swedish Princess Cake is. Either that or it's the intense sugar rush that accompanies such an eating experience. Hmm. It's this perfect dome of marzipan that's lightly textured and tastes oh-so-almondy and velvety. Instead you'll find two fluffy layers of castella cake/sponge cake squeezing some buttercream and jam. Somehow I keep thinking the jam makes the cake healthy. Delusionality. 

Get one! Bet you can't make it last more than two nights.
author: Kevin L.

description:
The entire store is filled with amazing and beautiful cakes and pasties. You can't come in and only get one piece. You have to get an entire cake to yourself and it has to be the TIRAMISU. The cake is fluffy, flavorful, and pact filled with yummy goodness! 

Parking is always tough on Clement St. But you can grab a cake earlier in the day since they close early anyway. Priced reasonably and service is always great.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
This bakery is the real deal, the quality is outstanding.  I love coming and looking at the old bakery picture on the wall of how the inside of Schubert's looked in the 1940s.  If I am not ordering whipped cream cakes from Golden Chariot I come HERE for their fabulous variety.  You cannot go wrong getting anything from this bakery.  All of their pastries and cakes are absolutely wonderful.  Their princess cake is one of their most popular cakes that they sell...and for good reason!  I hate to say it but they even make it a million times better than Victoria Pastry.

At the end of the day, probably around 4pm, their coffee cakes and pastries sell at discounted prices...and they go fast, so don't get upset if you walk in at 5pm (an hour before they close) and find bare skimmings.  No question on their freshness here folks, it's ALL good!
author: Emy B.

description:
The princess cake is to die for. Tasty... tasty ... tasty. I am not a big fan of Mazipan but I can easily peel it off, besides it makes it look so pretty. A fellow Yelper and friend suggested this place to meet up and boy oh boy I am glad she did. The yummy treats are displayed so beautifully and all look amazing. Wish I could try them all. 

Definetly a place I would suggest others to go to.
author: Christina K.

description:
I always come here anytime I need to buy a birthday cake (I even request Schubert's for my own birthday!)

I'm in love with their tiramisu cake - fluffy layers mixed in a perfect blend of marscapone filling in between. The exterior of the cake is also beautifully layered with chocolate slices varying between white and milk (or dark) chocolate pieces. 

Some other cakes I've tried:
Strawberry Shortcake - The cake is super airy and light with very fresh strawberries. Not too sweet and perfect for those who want a light dessert. However, if you're going to order a Strawberry Shortcake, I'd recommend to either order online or call in in advance. The shortcakes that sit in the shop for too long tend to soak up all the juices from the filling, which creates an unappetizing wet consistency. The cake's taste is still good, but we definitely didn't enjoy it as much as the fresh ones.

Swedish Princess - their most popular! This cake is good, but the fondant surrounding the cake tends to be a little overbearing in sweetness. Plus its thick, chewy shell didn't match the light and fluffy interior when biting down into the cake. 

Schubert's is also very accommodating in adding personalized messages to your cake (They even added little plastic baby themed toys on a baby shower cake we ordered a couple months back).
author: Gelene V.

description: Mmmmm Princess Cake (hello marzipan!) and Strawberry Shortcake!  Sugar heaven!
author: Kristen S.

description:
No star. Just to be sure I meant to rate this place, Schubert. Of course, I know Schubert,  living in the area since the 70's.  But no. Products have changed.  We had a Chocolate cheesecake that did not meet any of our expectations in the family of 20 or so.
Sorry. This is our last,  I told my wife before we even cut it. The decorations on top really looks like another 
Bakers, ' Seng's -precut chocolate flowers.
Not the same as used to be.
author: Kenneth L.

description: My go-to place for cakes. I've tried the tiramisu with lady fingers, strawberry shortcake with lady fingers, Princess cake, Opera cake, fruit tart, petite fours-all good. The decoration is beautiful and the cakes aren't super super sweet-just the perfect amount. I usually don't need to order in advance because every time I come in, there are so many cakes to choose from.
author: Laura T.

description:
This has got to be my favorite bakery ever. This place is really close to my work so I go here whenever I need to get a cake for someone or that extra bump to get through work. 

I love their tiramisu cake. It's a little on the sweeter side but it's so delicious. It's very moist, mousey, and you can taste the coffee!  Mmmm! I also love how it looks! The chocolate pieces on top and the little berries they used. So cute!

I also tried their mango cheesecake which was really refreshing for some reason. The cheesecake itself was the perfect it was soft and creamy and it wasn't too sweet. 

Every time I come to this bakery I always get so excited and happy. The workers are really sweet. I've never felt rushed, which is good since i take forever to decide what I want because everything looks so good!
author: Nguyet T.

description:
I LOVE CAKE, especially if they come from Schubert's.

Work ALWAYS buys cake from here, it is sooo good. Too bad there aren't many birthdays in November or December. People at work are born in January, I'll be at work all the time then.

On Friday, we had...I think it was the Vienesse Fruit Torte, yummy cookie crust. Another memorable cake was the princess cake, i love the marzipan, I could eat that by itself. There is lot more, but those are the only ones I can remember.

The only thing I don't like about this place is the price, maybe it's just expensive to me, a starving college student, but whatever I eat these cakes at work for free. I think I may get one of these cakes for my mom for her birthday though.
author: Kylie L.

description:
If I want Mango Mousse, I only go to Schubert's. 

I've lived in SF for over ten years and I went to Schubert's twice per month for a Mango Mousse cake. Their other selections are heavenly, but as a mango lover, Schubert's Mango Mousse is perfect and so satisfying.

Their service is great, although they do get busy, especially in the afternoon. But it's in a nice area, and after getting my desserts I make a 10 minute walk to Golden Gate Park, 5/6 blocks away, and sit in the shade of a tree to enjoy them. 

Definitely recommend!
author: Amy C.

description:
What can I say that has not been said? It is such a reasonable price for a good dessert. Great way to treat yourself and indulge in some mousses or buy a friend who loves chocolate. 

The chocolate mousse just melts in your mouth...mmMm. Just give into your craving!
author: Mandy D.

description: Omg I had the Napoleon cake slice and it was just heavenly... It has layers of puff pastry filled with rum custard, strawberries, and whipped cream and had a variety of fruit on top. All the flavors go so well together and I was very impressed at how light this dessert was! I can't wait to come back and try more of their desserts!!
author: Sarah S.

description:
One hundred year old cake.

That's actually kind of gross.

Unless it's Schubert's Neopolitan which they've been serving since 1911.

Features both white and chocolate cake (why not), chocolate and raspberry whipped cream (again why not) and complemented by chocolate pieces (most definitely why not).

Predict they'll be eating this delicious creation for another one hundred years.
author: Jason B.

description: I love their cakes. And they are reasonable too compared to what other bakeries charge. All the fruit mousse cakes are light and fluffy and not too sweet. Special order cakes can be done online and then you just swing by and pick it up. All the folks who work here are nice too.
author: Priscilla C.

description: Black forest cake was so good until I bit hard on a cherry seed and hurt my teeth. The cherries are probably homemade which are good, but if I can't safely eat a cake, then I can't enjoy it.
author: Kevin W.

description:
I love cakes (yes...I know...who doesn't?). But what I love most are those cakes that you will not be able to find everywhere; those cakes that just refuse to get out of your mind; those cakes that doesn't let you sleep night after night...until you decide to fulfill your "sweet" hunger. These are the kind of cakes that I found here.
The only unfulfilled wish is related to the fact that this bakery doesn't have several other locations near to the place where I live. But the long trip to Clement St. will always have a happy end.
author: Sandra S.

description:
For special occassions and celebrations, I always come here for cakes. They mostly have medium-sized cakes that serves about 6-8, with a handful of single-serving cakes.

I particularly like the:
Mango mousse
Strawberry mouse
Strawberry cheescake
Fruit tart

Their Swedish princess cake seems to be a popular choice, but I didn't think it was that good.

Service is always wonderful and they will write a message on the cake upon request. Takes credit cards!
author: Alfred L.

description:
Outside and inside, this is an old school bakery, serving awesome mousse cake creations.  Along with whole cakes, they have single serve portions (around $3) and several tables to enjoy them at.  Perhaps not as cheap as lower quality cakes at Costco (http://www.yelp.com/biz/sn2c7alrdos9KJUlxg6KWg) or Safeway, but if you compare them to quality bakeries like Just Desserts (http://www.yelp.com/biz/WJo-Tfq_xdOnlcaHWm_4_w) or Boulangerie Bay Bread (http://www.yelp.com/biz/tQE4SPlX9ZlFSbF4JPU4pg), Schubert's prices are very reasonable.

UPDATE (09 July 2006)
Went back and tried their chocolate cheese cake, which was very good.  I couldn't stop at one cake and went for another slice, this time Strawberry Shortcake, which was also very nice.  It had fresh fruits like blackberry, peach, and of course strawberry.
author: トモ T.

description: Chocolate cake didn't have much flavour, expected better from a specialty bakery.
author: Cayla C.

description:
I ordered their "Princess" cake for a friend's birthday and half the cake was devoured in a heart beat.  Delicious cake, definitely does not have that standard "bakery" taste to it, but really soft and moist. 

The cool part was they have tons of cakes ready that you can "reserve" for later - which is what I did (call the day of and get the cake in the evening).

If this is your first time ordering a cake, go with the "Princess" cake - you definitely will not be disappointed!
author: Sejal D.

description: Cute spot and good location. The staff was efficient but not particularly welcoming or friendly. I ordered the highly acclaimed #8 must try before you die according to 7x7 magazines Princess Cake. At $3.75 a slice I was hoping it was delicious. The cake was moist and not overwhelming. I didn't eat the marzipan but enjoyed the moist and subtle sweetness underneath. I wouldn't proclaim this as a MUST TRY but it was good and I have no complaints. I would return again and try something else next time.
author: Kristy F.

description:
When I realized last minute that my husband wasn't in the mood for the 9-course dinner at the Ritz that I'd reserved a month in advance, I knew I had to get a cake.

I placed an order by phone about an hour before they closed - half an hour before my flatmate would be able to pick it up for me since she was in the city and kindly offered to help. I had to avoid the mousse cakes since (based on past experience) he doesn't prefer them.. and finally settled for the safe pick - the Opera cake. (Plus, he loves hazelnut.) Although the cake itself looked a little tacky to me, one bite was enough to sway me. It was delicious! I especially appreciated that it wasn't too sweet.. 

One of these days, I'll have to head back for a taster session.

(If you're not creatively inclined and can't think of something sweet/funny to put on your cake, check their website - they've got some great ideas for inscriptions!)
author: Asha S.

description:
Pretty decent. Overall, 3.5 solid stars. 

Ordered:
1) Piece Chocolate & Almonds Cake-2.5/5
2) Neopolitan- 4.5/5

I really enjoyed the Neopolitan cake. It was light, fluffy, with the perfect amount of fruits.  If I come back, I would get the Neopolitan cake.
author: Jen H.

description:
I love their strawberry shortcake! Love, Love, Love it!

I couldn't resist stopping in for an individual slice of their strawberry shortcake since I was in the area. I have to say that the lady that was helping my aunt and I was pretty freakin' rude and impatient. It wasn't like there were any other customers that came in after us. She made it seem like it was such a hassle to separate our orders into two boxes. Seriously? 

Anyways... I looked around and noticed the German Cheesecake. It looked pretty good so I decided to try one as well. I have to say that I much prefer a New York cheesecake any day, but it wasn't bad. I love their cakes so as long as the food continues to be delicious I wouldn't mind putting up with Miss Rude Pants for a few minutes. But only once in a while, a long while.
author: Tracy Y.

description:
chocolate mousse cake! yummmy!!! The fruit tarts were also very good!
A great place to go when you want a little dessert or snack or just to grab and go. 

My sister got my birthday cake from here, the chocolate mousse cake i think it was big enough to feed 5-10 people.
author: Elsa Y.

description:
Pro:
Love the mousse cake here, any mousse cake.  My favorites are lemon and currant.  
I also love their Cream Puff cakes, esp. with rum.
The decorations are beautiful.

Con:
Check your cake order before you leave the shop.  I had a friend pick up 2 cakes I ordered and 1 of them was NOT the one I ordered.  

Website is flaky; trying to order on the phone could take a bit of try and try again....  You need to order 2 days ahead, not 1 day ahead.  

Trying to get here on the weekend can take a while - first the traffic, then the line that is coming outside of the bakery.  Give yourself a lot of extra time if you're picking up for a special occasion.
author: E W.

description:
Pricey, but good

BF ordered large fruit tart for his mom's bday. $30. Large size. Fruit was fresh, had mangos, pineapples, blueberries, strawberries... Sweet and In season. There were lots of fruit. Tart was well made, crust was crisp. Filling was not too sweet. Everyone was a fan from the adults to kids.

Had the apple turnover.  Good, Expensive but nothing extraordinary.
author: Andrea K.

description: The service isn't always great but the pastries make up for it. I love the mango mousse and tiramisu cake. This is my favorite spot to pick up cakes for any celebrations.
author: Suze C.

description: My two cents: an awesome tiramisu that's very light and delicate, airy and full of chocolate goodness! The service was excellent. It was my first time here and the lady behind the counter was lovely and recommended some of the most popular-- tiramisu, mango mousse, etc. We were too stuffed to try anything else, so I'll definitely be back to try the rest!
author: Allison S.

description: the owner contacted me and apologized for the bug I found in the pastry. Great attitude and awesome cakes!
author: Moko R.

description: I will gladly go out of my way for these cakes again. They have a wide selection and fast service. I got slices of both the peach mousse cake and the princess cake for around $7. They were fantastic-- especially the latter! This place is so good! GO.
author: Tanya S.

description:
Oh my god, how have I not written a review for Schubert's Bakery yet?!  It's a perennial favorite!  Year after year after year, for every special occasion, we always get a cake from good ol' Schubert's!  

The last time I got a cake here was for Father's Day, and like the one million other times I've ordered a cake here, it was reliable and delicious.  I think that the best item on their seriously extensive menu is the double chocolate mousse cake.  It's got chocolate and white chocolate mousse in the center, as well as two layers of cake - chocolate and err...cake-flavored layers.  The whipped cream is light, fluffy, EXCELLENT.  The chocolate pieces are always fun to munch on - quality chocolate!  And I don't even really like chocolate!

Their other cakes are also really good, you can't really go wrong here.  The Napoleon is great, and each layer is good!  As is the Tiramisu.  Although, I would caution that if you do get either of these two, make sure to eat them right away because otherwise they get kind of wet and soggy, and that's no good!  

The Swedish Princess is a classic if you're into lots of whipped cream and fruit and no-frills.  The Black Forest is a must-get if you're a chocolate lover, which is most people.  Even their cookies are good!

Everything here is good.  8" cakes run about $30/cake, and if you're pre-ordering, you should probably call in two days before you intend to pick it up.  One time I ordered a cake one day beforehand, and they didn't have it ready by the next day - totally my fault.  

Schubert's is yet another reason why I like holidays, birthdays, Mom and Dad days.  TIME TO BUY A CAKE!
author: Vivian C.

description:
Oh how I love Schuberts for providing me with yet another delicious and perfectly prepared Pink Champagne Cake.  This is my absolute most favorite cake in the world and I love the Schuberts gets it right each and every time!

The Pink Champagne Cake is white cake, raspberries, kirshwasser liqueur, champagne custard, and whipped cream and topped with strawberry-flavored white chocolate shavings.  
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/DyXoC_NhJW0Xx5j_OPQRHQ?select=gPA58NkN4u_Hggj2t0qMxg

My family ordered me this pretty cake for my birthday dinner last week and they never seize to amaze me at just how consistent they are--with the cake made to it's most fluffy texture, and the custard, cream, etc, perfectly equal within the cake.  

What I also love about this cake is that it still tastes just as fresh as the day I got it!  It's 3-4 days later and it's still full of fluffy, yumminess! 

The addition of Lady Fingers (no exra charge) around the edge of the cake are lightly sweetened on the outside and soft on the inside.  The most perfeclty baked Lady Fingers  e v e r ! 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/DyXoC_NhJW0Xx5j_OPQRHQ?select=qWSAH5AEU4MPkQUiuM3TEQ

All in all, I will probably be updating this spot for years to come, as they have never failed to disappoint up until this point!  Sure I'l be repeating myself over and over, but Schubert's total deserves it!
author: Cass J.

description:
I've never broke up with anyone over the cellphone.

I mean, he's been broken up by post-it, so I suppose taking it over the cellphone is a notch up from the previous, but at least I did not take advantage of him and the situation for 6 years.  I don't have that time to waste.  I'm perfectly capable of drawing out the terms of the end face-to-face in a public space, but I guess some people just aren't use to these sort of situations yet.  C'est la Vie.

In times like these, the mature thing to do is to move along, indifferently, which is easy once you delete their contact information, in addition to blocking him on other sites that may serve as potential kill zones, but I have a feeling he'll be lurking around this site for sympathy.  Sort of like cake.  I sense a bunch of stories waiting to be revealed between those layers.

Schubert Bakery steps in at the right time for the checking, as fast as  Mario Lemieux pulled in 1,033 assists, for the lady looking out for her sweet tooth and sanity.  

I met one of the bakers long ago through some networking event and while I had yet to visit the shop, always knew where the bakery was located.  I'm so glad I made the choice to step in recently with some friends.  A small slice along a busy strip on Geary but oh so decadent and the pastries smiling up at all of us can't help but bring out the wallets.

My favorite so far has got to be the Mango Cheesecake.  Perfectly tart, creamy, with a nod toward the tropical fruit.  In addition to texture and taste, the decorations atop are absolutely divine.  My friend tried a slice of the Strawberry Romanoff and found it equally stirring as the liquor piquing the cake.  In addition to wonderfully colorful array of cakes, they have a good variation of cookies and pastries to go.

Special orders, weddings, special occasions, walk-ins = this is the place in the Inner Richmond to cater to your celebratory moments, even if it does mean it had to happen over the cellphone.

Give me a break, I need all the sugar now rather than go to some Break-Up support meeting with a bunch of my girlfriends, Sex and the City style.  Although since this is in his hood, I need my mafia to support my cakewalk.
author: Miika M.

description: Last minute simple wedding cake needed. Called in to place an order for the princess cake the next day & asked to change the color to off white. On the phone for less than 10 minutes & the next day ta-da a wedding cake which everyone loved & actually ate. Just the perfect sweetness.
author: Julieann D.

description:
I've always heard good things about Schubert's but never had the chance to try it.  Until the day of my friend's birthday.. I decided to pick up a cake before heading back to Davis.  Picked up the cheesecake which I unfortunate was not able to try but I got a slice of the Princess Cake for myself.  It was about $4 for the slice and omg, it was delicious.  It's a bit pricey but I can see why.  The decorations are also lovely. 

Keep in mind to look at the menu ahead of time because a lot of their cakes are made when ordered priors other than the normal cakes. Can't wait to go back and try more!
author: Lisa L.

description:
love the selections here. i will keep this review simple. 

2 words: try everything

you won't regret it.
author: Toni Rose M.

description:
5 Stars for quality of food and service!

I typically come here to order the Mango Mousse Cake. It's very light and it's not overwhelmingly sweet. I also bought a Black Forest Cake for my boyfriend, and he really enjoyed it.

The other day, I called in to place an order for a Coffee Crunch cake for my Dad's birthday, and told them I would pick it up the next day. I arrive to the bakery and told them my order. I'm not sure what happened that day, but they didn't have my cake. They were very very apologetic. They told me to pick a cake that they currently have in their display and they wouldn't charge me for it. On top of that, they gave me a $25 gift certificate and a small bag of cookies! I thought being offered a free cake was enough, but to me they went well and beyond what was called for. 

I'll definitely come back if I'm in the area!
author: Selina T.

description: We got our wedding cake here.  So we got history with the place. I don't think they don't even sell wedding cakes any more. Buy what they do sell is best of class every time. Their danish is the best I've had outside of Europe.   We usually get a danish or 2 and then a piece of something random just to try a new taste.  Really can't lose, everything is always beautifully ptepared and presented.   A must try if you are in the neighborhood.
author: Kelly P.

description: Schubert's has been baking old world cakes and pastries in San Francisco since 1911.  That is a very long time - older than Fenway Park and Chevrolet.  Schubert's longevity is a testament to the bakery's quality and dedication to artisanship.  All of Schubert's cakes and pastries are hand crafted using the finest ingredients - European style butter, Swiss jams, Guittard chocolate - quality you can taste from the first bite.  This is not a trendy bakery (like Tartine) to be sure.  It is simply a bakery steeped in tradition that does everything right.  If you are looking for a special treat that takes you back to European days gone by - Schubert's has you covered - and then some.  Just be sure to save me a bite!
author: Mathew S.

description:
The Opera Cake is the BOMB. 

My sister bought the smallest one for my birthday ^_^, and with a family of five, it took us three days to finish it. But we didn't get tired of it at all because it is so effing amazing. 

If you're a chocolate fan, I think you'll like as well!
author: Pui L.

description: After dinner a few blocks down I stumbled upon this place for dessert. After looking up reviews I decided to give it a try. Ordered the famous princess cake which was just ok. The outside layer was gross I had to peel that off and just eat the cake. Also had a slice of some kind of chocolate cake, texturally it was good. Soft moist cake with a mousse like layer but the mousse was just too sweet.
author: Julie C.

description:
I  love Schubert's!  They make an excellent princess cake.  I could eat an entire tray of princess cake if I turned it into a meal.  It is that good, I kid you not.

They have other things too that are tasty.  How could you go wrong trying them all?
author: Carb Q.

description:
A cute little bakery offering a delicious array of cakes, pastries, cookies, and breads. The more pretty-looking pastries and cakes were a bit too pricey for me, but the croissants and danishes were good deals. After fretting between the chocolate and blueberry-filled croissants, I finally decided on the classic apple-filled croissant. I must admit that the apple one looked huge and I always find myself buying the biggest-looking pastry merely on principle. I believe it only cost $2! 
        The dough was soft, buttery, and delicious. Although it could have used more apples, I was still happy with my choice. I have my eye on some of the other tasty-looking pastries so I'll definitely be back for more.
author: Shana E.

description:
The Princess cake was a little too sweet for my liking...until I removed the fondant! That's the Princess cake secret: REMOVE THE FONDANT. The cake itself was very tasty. My favorite was the Neapolitan. Delicious! The chocolate mousse was creamy and delightful.

I'll be sure to stop by Schubert's whenever I am in the neighborhood.
author: Kara L.

description:
Best bakery in town when it comes to cakes, sweet confections.  I don't think anywhere in San Francisco, including Tartine, even comes close.

This is not a bread bakery.  It is a fine, upscale, sugar oriented German style bakery.  This place stand above the rest.
author: Joe S.

description:
This is the only place  I get birthday cakes for my entire family !they are just Delicious I also love their cookies 
I live in San Ramon  but this place it is worth the drive
author: John H.

description:
If I could give this place more than 5 stars, you know I would!! Did any of you yelpers know that if you come to Schubert's about 30-40 minutes before they close...you can actually get 30% off on select pastries/danishes?! And it's not like you're getting leftovers...you can also get it for fresh made stuff too. 

So I bought this amazing fruit tart with raspberries/blackberries/strawberries piled to the max inside a tart for LESS than $3  - omg, you guys rock! And seriously, you would think that a late bus is a bad thing...but in this case, I arrived just in time for this amazing deal. I also bought the opera cake. Thanks Schubert's - you helped me make my father's b-day extra special!! :)
author: Rayne W.

description: came in at the end of the day so the strawberry shortcake wasn't very fresh, but I could imagine it to be very delicious earlier in the day. the cake is make in the way cakes are supposed to be, soft and moist. Will come back for the princess cake
author: Annie L.

description: I got a few cakes a couple years ago and decided to get another mango mousse and it looked perfect.  The taste and texture was great. However I thought it was a bit sweet.  I will be back though!
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
I absolutely love this bakery!  Not only are the cakes beautiful, they taste delicious and fresh!  We went around 10am and there was a line that last about 10 minutes, not bad at all. The staff were quick and friendly. 

We ordered the following little cakes/slices:
Princess cake - cake was moist and delicious...had to eat around the fondant because I personally don't eat fondant
Chocolate Truffle - so creamy and rich, this was my sister's favorite
Raspberry mousse - beautiful designs around a small circular cake, subtly sweet and delicious

I will definitely return the next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: My Linh H.

description: My taste buds have never experienced such delightful sensations
author: Jenny Q.

description:
After trying Citizen Cake, Delessio, Paris Baguette, Sogo Bakery, and Oliver's Market, this place still remains at the top of my list.

Only update is that I don't think I like Swedish Princess cakes in general.  It's still very nicely done here; I've seen those cakes in very odd shades of green elsewhere.

Their mousse cakes, opera cake, strawberry shortcake and fruit basket stand out.  

If you like decadent desserts, this might not be your thing, though.  It's not crazy sweet or rich like some places.
author: Erika C.

description: A real favorite of mine for cakes!!  I've been to many places in SF and nothing beats this place for a classic birthday cake.  No matter which one, chocolate, fruit, strawberry shortcake, its always super fresh, moist and delicious!  And also very pretty decorated.  Definitely 5stars!
author: Kailee Q.

description:
Everyone loves their Swedish Princess cake.  I'm no exception.  So when I got married, I had to get it.  The wedding cake selection process was  easy enough.  Just call and let them know when you're coming, and they will prepare a tasting.  

Unfortunately, the cake on the day of was kind of stale.  It wasn't the same! I don't know what happened... =( So minus one star.  Otherwise, they were so easy to work with.  They replicated the design I wanted pretty closely enough, and the pricing was very good considering what it could've been (four tiered cake).
author: S. D.

description: My favorite cake place! But I only like one of their cakes. Napoleon. I literally came here out of my just to get a slice of their Napoleon, but don't come too late in the afternoon because they'll run out.
author: Lina C.

description: Best cake in town - accompanies every birthday celebration in our family. I love their mousse cakes - especially the lemon mousse and the chocolate raspberry one. Napoleon cake is much heavier option, but is worth every calorie!!! They have different sizes, variety of options, very reasonable prices. I recommend them to everybody I know! If you pass by, get a treat - you won't regret it!
author: Ralitsa G.

description: Totally reliable on-line web ordering service. The cake was beautiful.
author: Morris R.

description:
I don't know about you, but I know quite a few people that change their minds- constantly.  The party was supposed to be on Wednesday, then moved to Friday, then to Thursday and finally back to Friday.

I ordered cakes for pick up on Friday and when I called my boss to remind her to pick up the cakes, she says, "Oh no, it's supposed to be on Wednesday!"

Luckily, the wonderful staff at Schuberts completely understood and allowed me to reschedule my order for the following Wednesday.  What a great bakery with fantastic customer service!  

Great customer service is hard to find these days, so when I find it, I like to shout it to the moon and tell everyone who will listen.  Schuberts is an exemplary business and I am proud to do business with them.  

Schuberts, thank you for your yummy, beautiful cakes and A+ customer service!
author: Teena O.

description:
When I need to bring a cake or baked goods to any gathering, Schubert's is the ticket - their cakes should come with a stack of business cards to pass on to all the people asking "where did you get this from, it's so freaking good!?".  And all the cakes are freaking good to be PC. 

I recommend their Swedish Princess cake (comes in cake form AND slices) but you have to be a fan of marzipan. The large and individual size mousse cakes fit all occasions and come in several flavors, my favorite is mango which has a definite fresh sweet mango celebration in your mouth. Other baked goods are equally fantastic, you can't go wrong here - nothing is too sweet or taste artificial, it's all honest and baked with care.

To top the good goodies, the service is friendly and fast, even when the place is swamped with people trying to decide which of the tempting cakes they pick. And they decorate any cake while you wait with a personal message, of course - but it's always good to call ahead and order so you get what you want.
author: Finn T.

description: The best black forest cake I've ever had! Perfect balance of rum-infused cherries(not overwhelmingly strong), fluffy whipping cream, and moist chocolate cake. Will definitely be coming back for many more cakes.
author: Arun T.

description:
CHEESECAKE!!  What a great find for light airy cheesecake.  Pure fresh ingredients are used. You can create your own out of toppings such as : black currant, mango, apricot, and raspberry. 

While this bakery has pastries, tortes and traditional cakes, one glance at the menu of  mousse, and whipped cream cakes you know they have a patent on these kinds of dessert.  The names of the cakes "Swedish Princess" (raspberry, marzipan, kirsch), Pink Champagne , Coffee Crunch Cake are fun and delectable.    

I think it is cool this bakery has been around since 1911.
author: Infodiva B.

description:
yes, their cakes were reasonable, but was quite discouraged today when they tried to sell me a fruit flies covered cake!  there were at least a dozen fruit flies swarm around and on top of the cake.  the staff didn't do anything nor trying to find another fruit-flies free cake.

the manager came out and simply took the cake away and no apology.  wow,  may be their business is so good that they simply do not care about their customer.
author: Tkd K.

description: Their princess cake is to die for. It is SO good! If you like princess cake this is the place to get it from. Hands down the best in SF and very reasonably priced!
author: Shayna M.

description:
PRINCESS CAKE. oh my god so delicious. 

I've been on a good cake hunt for the last few months with my boyfriend and time and time again we find ourselves disappointed....nothing ever seems to quite hit the spot. 

this is where Schubert's comes into the picture. we came in on a sunday morning, because cake for breakfast is always a good idea. we ordered some princess cake and after the first bite were immediately sent to cake heaven. the chewy marzipan icing shell contrasts PERFECTLY with the delicate and fluffy cake & cream that makes up the center of the cake. i think one slice totaled $4.11 and it was totally worth every penny (especially compared to some of the equally priced or more expensive places we've visited down on the peninsula) and we had to exercise some serious self control to keep from ordering everything else we saw. we will be going back ASAP to try out the mango mousse and other treasures they have there. 

i know writing a 5-star review over one dish may be a little dicey, but seriously this cake is just on a different level from so many others i've tried recently. considering how busy the place was, too, the service was patient and polite. we'll be back soon. very, very soon.
author: Kaden F.

description:
Loving you is a like a song I replay
Every three minutes and thirty seconds of every day
And every chorus was written for us to recite
Every beautiful melody of devotion every night
It's potion like this ocean that might carry me
In a wave of emotion to ask you to marry me
                                               - Lauren Hill, Turn Your Lights Down Low

That is how i feel about Schubert's Bakery.  Do your self a favor and have a slice of the swedish princess cake, the fruit torte, and any of the mousse cakes and thank me later.
author: Ray R.

description:
I wanted to get my friend a cake for her birthday, and Schubert's was on my list of places to try.  I called in and placed my order 5 days in advance.  I went with Vince K.'s suggestion and got a 10" Swedish Princess Cake.

There were 11 people at dinner, and there was more than enough cake to go around.  The cake was delicious!  I loved the marzipan icing.  I ate all of my cake and started picking apart my friend's icing, too.  The light almond flavor was yummy!  The cake was $36.95 and well worth every penny!

Parking around here is a bit of a pain.  Clement is super busy on the weekends, so bring someone to drop you off if you want to pick something up.
author: Patra I.

description:
They say that with age, comes wisdom; in this case, wisdom also comes with deliciously-created cakes!  Schubert's Bakery is one of those RARE examples of how a business that can survive over 100 years must be doing something right as it must also be doing it really well.  My friends and I made the itinerant drive through random parts of SF (after a short hike @ Land's End) in hopes of being rewarded with beautiful cakes that tasted as good as the reviews indicated they would.   I am happy to say YES, Schubert's lives up their hyped reviews and deserves to stay open another 100 years! (if humanity manages to survive that long.....I hope Schubert's does)

One thing that sticks out when one "discovers" Schubert's for the 1st time is that it's situated in an almost all-Chinese/Asian neighborhood.  If you didn't know the history of it, you would have thought it's owners probably got lost or found a place that had really cheap rent and chose to set up a completely non-Asian bakery there.  In fact, the exact opposite is true since 99% of all other businesses probably closed down or moved away as the Asian invasion of the 20th century permeated SF.   This alone should give Schubert's one star just for resisting the desire to move elsewhere (and probably get better business in the city).

Upon walking inside this "mom n pop" bakery, you ll find a few small tables/chairs as well as an L shaped display case.  These tables/chairs are perfect for those impetuous, must-eat-now customers who buy a slice and can't resist taking a few bites (or the whole slice).   Since we were just visitors and didn't really have a home to go back to, we ate our slices there with the provided plates and forks.  In terms of the cake variety, you ll find a menu with over 20 cakes: mousse/regular cake/cheese cake varieties.  Some of them sound great, some of them sound okay, but it's still hard to decide on what to get!! I took about...10 minutes to choose my one slice.  Individual mini cakes/slices go for $3.95, entire cakes start at $22 up to $37 depending on the size you get.

The cakes we ended up getting (and sharing a few bites) were the Swedish Princess, Mango Mousse, Chocolate Almond, and mine was Neapolitan.  Each of these cakes had their own distinct tastes (duh) and all four were good.  However, I did prefer my cake as it came with two large slabs of dark chocolate on the sides, and the cake was mostly cake and less cream/mousse.  The Swedish Princess looked really cool (lime green frosting), but the taste overall was kinda just "sweet" and good.  

The Mango Mousse was light, fluffy and not too sweet, so I enjoyed the two bites that I had (but im not a huge fan of mousse since it isn't "filling").  The Chocolate Hazelnut Almond cake was the sweetest of the four, so I would probably need milk to eat that entire piece.  Did I favor my own cake because I spent 10 minutes choosing it? Maybe....probably....but I mean everyone always gives self-bonus points to their own choices right? :)  

Overall, Schubert's Bakery is a must-visit place for a fan of sweets and gourmet cakes.  This isn't your ordinary bakery where the cakes are made in bulk and sold for $10 for like a 30" cake (i.e. Costco).  Come with a slight rumble in your stomach and an open mind to a different spectrum of pastries and you will not be disappointed :)

As I wrote this review, I was eating a 4-day old piece of cheesecake.  Now only did it still taste DELICIOUS, it pretty means the cheesecake was either super fresh.....or I'm going to be sick shortly :P
author: Rob C.

description: One of the Yelp reviews says they request raspberries be substituted for cherries on the German Black Forest cake.  Sounded perfect for a friend who loves chocolate and raspberries.  I called to order cake.  The pleasant woman on the other end asked the chef who said no substitutions.  Okay, no order from me.
author: Richard E.

description: Fabulous. Great pastries and cakes. They take custom orders right over the phone and are super easy to deal with. I ordered a large chocolate cake for 25 people with custom decorations and they delivered. My guests had nothing but compliments, many wanted the name of the bakery. Yeah.
author: Jean B.

description: Best bakery ever! Amazing cakes and great service. I usually get a slice of cake here and it runs at approximately 3.75 which is well worth it. My favorite is the tiramisu, but they have a ton of other options which include fruits and chocolate. They make large cakes as well for birthdays. My family has been going here for at least 10 years, it's our favorite!
author: Katherine M.

description:
Old time, neighborhood favorite.  

Whenever I need a good cake for dinners, bdays or any random dessert days, I come here.  I've never been disappointed with this place.  I'm not usually a sweets person but the cakes are never so sweet that I would complain.  (Boy, and I do complain a lot when it's too sweet...)

All of the cakes are beautifully done and always impresses people when I bring it to dinner.  I guess I can't complain much there!  I got the normal strawberry shortcake once just because they ran out of other cakes and thought it might actually disappoint. And.....I was wrong.  Everyone loved it and said it was the best strawberry shortcake that they've ever had.  Like what Charlie Sheen would say.. "Winnnnning."

Just a side note -  You should probably pre-order your cake if you know which one you want because they get quite busy at times.
author: Shirley T.

description:
A great bakery smack in the middle of busy clement street.  this bakery has a lot of histroy.  

the workers here are nice.
author: Amy L.

description:
I am a huge fan of Schubert's! Everything is delicious from their Princess cake to their chocolate mousse cake. The desserts are beautifully decorated and you can tell a lot of time and effort go into each one. The hard part is deciding what to get because everything looks so yummy!

Have ordered cakes from here a few times for special occasions online and it was really convenient. 

All the staff are really friendly and helpful. 

Hands down my favorite bakery in the city!
author: Anne K.

description: Although I was very upset about my ordering being cancelled with no call they more than made up for it . They sent me a refund check and surprised me with a gift certificate. I appreciate the fast response to my issue and fast refund, I still love their Swedish princess cake so I'll be back. Thanks
author: Linda L.

description:
I bought a chocolate truffle cake here for my sister's birthday. When I placed the order, I also bought a Mickey&Mini toy topper. They decorated the cake to go with the toys. It was so cute!

The cake was delicious!! Everybody loved it. They all wanted to know where I got it. 

The same lady who took my order and whom I picked the cake up from was real nice. I forgot her name ): 

This place really has it together. I came about an hour earlier than I initially said I would to pick up the cake. It was already finished and ready to go. Since I had to double park (because finding a parking space is like finding a needle in a hay stack), I was in a real rush.
author: Jeanette P.

description: Great prices and delicious cakes and pastries! I got two of the small cakes the White Chocolate Raspberry Mousse and the Chocolate with Chocolate Shavings and both were amazing. As a chocolate lover I absolutely loved the chocolate cake. I also got a few pieces of the Raspberry Rugelach which was some of the best Rugelach I've ever tasted! I will definitely be back to try more of their desserts!
author: Laura C.

description: I'm a fat kid who loves cake and schuberts is the one! I love the chocolate mouse cake. Very rich cake. I got it for my birthday. Recently tried the opera cake and I'm not a fan of nuts on my cake but my husband loved it. Once decision is made on which cake to order, pre-order on the phone, skip the line!
author: J C.

description: Just placed my order for Thanskgiving...pumpkin and apple pie along with a mango mouse cake...Yippee - what a value for three items $45.00
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Close to 600 of 4.5-star average?  Gotta be a must try!  I went online and ordered a strawberry cheesecake, and was glad to find that Schubert's has lots of other special cakes.  All the cakes look very nice, and they make a nice dessert for any special occasions or just because.  

The online order process was fast and simple.  You select the type and size of cake you want, next choose a pick up date and time, key in your credit card info, and walla...

The day I went to pick up the cake, the store was pretty packed.  It's a difficult neighborhood to find parking ( Richmond District Chinatown), but I got lucky.  Since it's prepaid, all I did was give them my full name and the lady brought out the cake all nicely put into a box.  

As for the taste, I wouldn't call it a true cheese cake.  It was a bit too moist and too fluff.  Have you every tried tofu dessert?  It's almost like that consistency, and it's got  the right amount of sweetness.  But the flavor is there.  I could smell the strawberry just standing near it.  And the cake looked really nice.
author: Tadaa T.

description: lots and lots of desserts to choose from! great hours and anything you order taste great! everything looks very decadent and fancy i love their frosted sugar cookies
author: Justynne B.

description:
[M]ona: 5 Stars
[W]ayne: 3 Stars
Average: 4 Stars

+ Great Selection of Cakes
+ Decent Prices
+ Order by Slice or the whole cake

- Some cakes you have to pre-order

[M] I love you Oppa~ Thank you so much for finally remembering the name of this place!!! I've been craving for the Princess Cake for the LONGEST time now and thanks to my brother Eric, I was able to try it again. The first time I tried Schubert's was when my brother brought home a slice of Princess Cake for me. Ever since then, it has become my favorite cake! :3

I came here again with Wayne and bought several cakes home. This time, we got the Mango Mousse, White Chocolate Raspberry Mousse, Tiramisu, Plain Cheesecake, and the lovely Princess Cake (All for less than $18) :3

My BF tried the Plain Cheesecake while I had the Princess Cake and shared the White Chocolate Raspberry Mouse. Wayne didn't like his Cheesecake very much and thought it was too "soft and bland" for his liking. He liked the White Chocolate Raspberry Mousse though. I tried a little bit of each cake (except for the Mango Mousse) and thought the Princess Cake was the tastiest out of the 6. Fondant haters will not like this cake though...

I also wanted to try the Pink Champagne cake, but that one you have to pre-order. Perhaps I'll order next time for a special occasion.
author: Mona C.

description: Very soft and moist cakes at a very affordable price, especially in the Richmond. The variety of their cakes isn't as large as other large bakeries, but you'll get what you pay for. The tiramisu is especially soft and delectable.
author: Danny C.

description: The best cake I've ever tasted. After seeing so many reviews on yelp I got this cake for my friend's birthday. Everyone just loved it. Tried many bakery, so far this is my favorite place.
author: Mannu M.

description: I love this place. I don't live nearby but go when I'm in the neighborhood and order special occasion desserts from here, too. One time I ordered a cake online and mixed up the day of the party. So, they made my cake a week before the event. The next week, I send my cousin to pick up the cake. They do not have my cake, the one big enough to feed 20 people. They have lost the cost of having produced the cake from last week, and my (college-student poor) cousin has no money. Schubert's goes through their cakes, gives her two cakes that can feed my 20 guests, puts a beautiful message across the icing, and tells my cousin not to worry about the money. Hopefully, they were able to cut up my abandoned cake and sell slices. It was just very classy of them not to make a scene or embarrass my cousin.
author: Therese M.

description: As soon as I walked into this place, I found myself constantly fighting the urge to say "give me one of each, please!" to the girl working there. I ended up spending a good 5 minutes walking back and forth in front of the case trying to narrow down my choices. Everything is fresh, light and so delicious! No wonder it has been around for over 100 years! Their main business comes from cake orders. You will definitely be a popular person if you show up with a beautiful cake from Schubert's!
author: Ally W.

description: Whenever I have a bad day, I like to come here and buy myself some mini cakes.  Thankfully that doesn't happen too often but my favorites are the fruit tarts and the strawberry shortcakes.  The little bags of cookies are also really good.  The buttered cookies with the crushed almonds are the best!
author: Tina L.

description:
I don't really like sweet treats (other than ice cream or candy), but occasionally I do like Schuberts!  Their cakes and tarts are delicious!  

The workers are nice and quick, so I'm in and out with my sweets! 

My favorite is the white chocolate raspberry cake and the mango mousse.  I occasionally feel extra greedy and order one or two more things than necessary.
author: anita h.

description:
uniquely parless
old world charm
chocolate tour de force
my birthday treat
annual oolala
long may you wave
Schubert's of Frisco
author: Lloyd M.

description:
Back when I was very young, bright-eyed and bushy-tailed 
                                                 (\_/)
                                              = (* *) =
                                                 (")(")

I used to work  at a domestic violence shelter in a confidential location in San Francisco. My clients where the little ones who were also trying to escape domestic violence with their mothers.   Sadly, they experienced abuse in their lives from the very person who should be protecting them.  

These kids will oftentimes find themselves still living at the shelter during their birthdays and holidays.  If safety (and their mothers) allowed it,  I used to take  the kids to Schubert's to choose their birthday cake.

The cakes and pastries at Schubert's are so pretty and super-cute that they made even the saddest little heart smile.  Their faces never failed to  light up like the candles on their cake when it was time to show their cake to their little friends, the mothers and staff/volunteers at the shelter who were eagerly anticipating the "pretty" cake.

Did I mention very delicious as well?  Schubert's cakes are very fresh, moist and known for not being overly sweet.

On a lighter note, I went back to Schubert's to get a cake for a family party. Of course I had to order my ultimate favorite-- "THE PRINCESS CAKE."  Thttp://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/DyXoC_NhJW0Xx5j_OPQRHQ?select=cLuNTK4tWY5mwWEfPUsjOQ The Princess Cake is a traditional Swedish dessert consisting of layers of moist white cake with raspberry jam filling in the middle covered in marzipan icing (sugar and almond paste).  

It was such a hit during our family barbecue.  It was very dainty and elegant-looking that every member in the family could not resist and came back for seconds.  

A medium Princess Cake (serves up to 12 people) costs $26.95. Not bad for such delicious, pretty and well-crafted dessert.  Next time I'll get the large one- or better yet the XX Large! More for me if they don't finish! ("Crossing fingers behind my back! ";P)
author: Leah E.

description:
My friend David needs to visit us more often. He brings cakes from here when he visits and they are out of this world. 

The most recent one was the chocolate mousse cake and it has been popping up in my dreams the past few days, it is that good. Decadent and amazing to look at. It came with chocolate flowers decorating it and each flower had a drop of a different kind of jelly in the middle which was a nice touch.

I am so glad that Shuberts is not close to where I live, I would be 20 pounds heavier!  Fleur De Cocoa in Los Altos is my all time favorite and I would actually put Shubert's in the same class.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Wish I could award 10 stars!  

And I can't believe I hadn't yet reviewed Schubert's, because it's my favorite bakery in the world!  It was only when I was putting together my Desserts list that I realized my egregious error!  

Time to make it right:  Schubert's is amazing -- from the most simple (yet elegant and beautifully decorated) butter cookies to the gorgeous cakes to the flaky croissants to the fabulous fresh breads...  Oh, if you're reading this right now, just drop whatever meaningless task you're supposed to be doing and head over to Clement Street.  Be patient, soon a parking place right in front of Schubert's will miraculously appear for you.  You will enter and you will find yourself in a little slice of paradise.  Have a nice cup of coffee, peruse the pastry displays.  Treat yourself to a piece of Raspberry Chocolate Torte, Black Forest Cake, or Mocha Torte.  Or how about a Swedish Princess Cake for the Princess?  Or a coffee cake to wow your fellow guests at the brunch this weekend?  Whatever your choice, you can't go wrong.  The cakes are rich and full-flavored, but never heavy.  

For special occasions, call and place your cake order in advance -- you will love how they decorate it for the honored person!
author: Bevy M.

description:
If you find your typical pastry to be too cloyingly sweet then you ought to try Schubert's Bakery. I've tried the apple turnover, almond croissant and other croissants and have found them all to be JUST barely sweet. 
Service is excellent. Coffee is better than you'd expect. 
Raspberry Rugelach however counteract the *hint of sweetness* rule at this bakery... they are UBER sweet and awesome!
author: Libra J.

description: Hands down, best cake I ever had. I got the tiramisu cake for my bf bday, and everyone loved it. It was soft,rich, and not too sweet. You can really taste the rum in the cake..sooo good and elegantly decorated. I also picked up a slice of swiss princess, italian rum, and double chocolate mousse. I liked it all, except for the coating for the princess cake was a little too sweet for me. I can't wait to try out more of their cakes!
author: kim n.

description: First time trying Swedish princess cake and  it was love at the first bite! It was spectacularly delicious and moist! I wanted to bring one back to Houston to devour the following few days but it was not possible :( it has to be refrigerated.... So extremely sad!!! I can't have it as a wedding cake either bc schuberts doesn't ship :( you MUST try if you're coming here!!!!!
author: Elizabeth H.

description: This is my favorite bakery and my family & I have been buying their cakes for over 20 years. My favorite is their double chocolate mousse cake. Their cheesecakes are excellent too. Their pastries are delicious! This place is awesome!
author: Mimi C.

description: Wow.. Amazing cakes. Fluffy and light chocolate mousse. None of those thick fattening  butter cream. Schubert's, You make sf better place to live!
author: Sarang H.

description: I haven't paid attention and don't actually know if they do anything other than mousse cakes, but their mousse cakes are SO light, delicious, and beautiful! I've had so many birthday cakes (mine and others) from here and it's NEVER been disappointing.
author: lynn t.

description:
If you have a sweet tooth like my gf, then you cant go wrong with this place
came here a couple of times to buy her cake
so far, got the chocolate mousse, black forest, the princess cake, tiramisu

her verdict: eyes closed, big smile

come early, supply doesn't last all day
author: Andi I.

description:
About 90% of the time I don't like cake. Heavy butter frosting that sticks to the roof of your mouth, spongy tasteless dough and thick cold marzipan are extremely unappetizing to me. Of the other 10%, Schubert's Swedish Princess cake is on the short list. And for the price, I'm blown away at the quality.
While I live in the bay area, I'm going here for any event that justifies buying a cake or pie. They even make sheet versions of their cakes for big events at ridiculously prices.
Must try.
author: George P.

description:
Had 9 mini cakes: realllly good
I ripped the box slowly with one hand while walking down the street saying (out look) this looks good, this is good this is good, while I slicked my fork through the "sunroof" in the bakery box. I'll admit I did eat and drive a few bites and there wasn't much left by the time I got home, long story short they have really good stuff, if I threw it at someone, I'd probably still eat it as long as it was a clean someone, like my clean, beautiful wife :)
author: Ron A.

description: So recently all of my friends and I have been getting Schubert;s cakes for our birthdays. :) Delicious.. I love any cake that contains mousse it in because of its texture.. Schubert's adds a lot to their cakes.. they pay special attention to detail and the chocolate pieces on the top are always popular.. (we fight for them!) The triple chocolate mousse and Mango mousse is great.
author: Tiff C.

description: I buy everyone's birthday cake from this bakery! They have the best chocolate moose cake in the area!! I haven't tried their other goods though they all look delicious. They bake everything in house. It's small and there's not a ton of places to sit
author: Raquel H.

description:
Beautifully crafted cakes and pastries! I was impressed by the details in the cakes -- and not just  the toppings or frosting either. Nope! I'm talking about the polka dots, zebra stripes, and diamond/heart/clover/spade designs baked into the sides of the cakes. 

The service here is great, and it's such a cute place to sit to start your morning. I enjoyed a variety of breakfast pastries here that were light and flaky, with a hot chocolate. I'd recommend them for special occasions or just to bring some light into someone's day. Even if it's your own ;)
author: Aileen P.

description:
I can't believe I have not reviewed this place. I LOVE SCHUBERT'S! I love all their cakes but my favorite are their fruit torte! My babe recently surprised me with a Vienesse fruit torte for my birthday and it was so delicious! I also enjoy their various flavored mousse cake.

It is also nicely presented!

Great staff and bakers here!

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
author: Chatree T.

description: This is not what you may expect thinking that it's a German owned Bakery. There's pretty much no ambiance and it's a take-out place rather than anything else. The cakes however are delicious.
author: Isa T.

description: I love the princess cake here! Got it for my best friend for her birthday. I love how you can just order it online and personalize it as well - very convenient. It was so good! There's a reason why people come here for the princess cake. I definitely recommend the princess cake for anyone's birthday! Their other pastries here are also delicious too. You can't really go wrong with anything here. There's also a long line here because this place is just amazing.
author: Vivian L.

description:
While visiting family in SF, we decided to do a group birthday celebration, & the discussion of cake came up.  Admittedly, I am a cake snob.  I don't like grocery store cakes, or really sugary frosting.  After using my handy dandy Yelp app, we end up at Schubert's off of Clement St.  

Walking in, we were greeted right away (bonus!), and at 4pm they still had a decent amount of cakes for sale.  After staring at the amazing menu for a few minutes, we walk out with the Swedish Princess cake.  The cake was decorated beautifully, covered in lime green Marzipan, with raspberries amongst decorative swirls.  

It was moist & flavorful, not too sweet.  Great prices too!  Parking was a bit of a challenge, but I most definitely will be back next time I'm in the Bay!  Only problem is...what flavor to try next!?!?!  I figured I'd try out some other flavors before giving this place 5 stars..but I'm sure that's not going to be an issue!
author: Michelle G.

description:
Perfect black forest cake, SO worth the $28 for an 8 inch round. I don't really care for super sweet frosting (including many buttercreams, etc.), so I nearly died and went to heaven when I saw (and tasted) Schubert's selection of whipped cream and mouse cakes. This will be my go-to bakery for cakes from now on -- hands down. 

Don't want a full cake? No problem! Come in for a slice! Be sure to take it to-go -- I believe there is a small extra charge for eat-in, and there are only a couple of small tables.

If possible, call ahead so that they can pack up your cake in advance. They get super busy!
author: Liz E.

description:
Would not go back.

I have to hand it to them, their creations are quite pretty, but in terms of taste? I think not.

I had three of their mousses and a tiramisu, and my favorite part out of all four items were the chocolate shavings on top. None of the desserts had any of the depth of flavor I expect from similar bakeries. The consistency of the mousses was closer to peanut butter than fluffy dense deliciousness. The tiramisu felt like very, very soggy bread in my mouth instead of well-dunked/soaked pastry. Not to mention this place is incredibly hard to get to from where I live (Berkeley), definitely not worth the trek.
author: Rex X.
