description: We have tried this bakery about four times and it's been really really good at least three times and pretty good the other time. Very beautiful looking desserts. Most recently we took out a strawberry shortcake and it was really really tasty. If you are in this neighborhood on Clement Street definitely stop in to this bakery if you have a chance, it's great.
author: Doug C.

description:
Schuberts! Schuberts! Schuberts! Yet another Inner Richmond gem that took me moving out of the neighborhood to finally check out. Sigh!
 
I popped in here to get a birthday cake for my Godmother. I was immediately overwhelmed by how many wonderful cakes, tarts, pies, cookies, etc., were staring at me. I really didn't have much time to spare, so I had to make up my mind pretty quickly. Even though I wanted to sample everything, I couldn't afford to do so. Given that I'm a Mango Freak, I had to order the Mango Mousse Cake. I gave in a bit, and ordered a few Mini Mixed Fruit Tarts as well, because the mango in the Mango Mousse Cake was clearly not enough for me. :0

Let me just say that I was counting the minutes to when the cake was to be served, and by golly, it was so worth the wait. The mousse was sweet, and there was mango bursting with every single bite. The cake was super light, fluffy, and moist, and OH MYLANTA, it was pure heaven. Everyone at the party, from my mom, family friends, and more importantly, the guest of honor, totally raved about this cake and asked where I got it, etc., Needless to say, we are all huge fans. BTW, I had at least two slices.

Oh, I can't forget about the fruit tart, which was absolutely delish. The crust was perfect, and the fruits (mango, papaya, strawberry, kiwi) were so fresh and sweet. I wish there were more mango pieces. I just can't get enough of my fav fruit! Yummy!

Thank you, Schuberts! You deserve this 5 star rating! Service was efficient and friendly. The cake and tarts were outstanding, and cannot wait to try more of your sweets. Cheers!
author: Gill C.

description: Even my friend that tried to boycott the place could not stay away. What can I say that have not been said before....finger licking cakes! I want to try all of them; I really so.
author: Magda G.

description: The cake was beautiful and the villagers loved it. I will definitely return for many more cakes for personal and work. Thanks again, Schubert's Bakery. Bravo!
author: Tana N.

description:
Flaky, buttery, non greasy, thin layers of excellent pastry make up their awesome blueberry turnovers. Even the day-olds taste great.
Oh, if you are Nut about looking at beautiful decorated cakes and pasteries. THIS IS THE PLACE FOR FOOD PORN!!!
author: Lhm M.

description:
This place is great! My friend and I split two pieces of cake: chocolate truffle and chocolate cappuccino.  They were both so tasty!  Wonderfully spongy cake layered with perfectly whipped mousse.

The service was good, they had no problem with us stopping by an staring at cakes for a bit before actually making a selection.  Can't wait to come back!
author: Emily V.

description:
There's been so much talk about the Swedish Princess cake that it deserved a visit of its own. 

TAKE AWAYS: 
- Very Sunset place. If you're a local and you've been here, you'll know what I mean. Wood furnishing, tiled, rustic look. 
- They serve cakes and everything in all shapes and sizes. 
- It's not a Chinatown-esque bakery, so the prices are reflected accordingly. I wouldn't be surprised if you spent a little more than $10 because the bakery is loaded with side trap cookies, tarts, tortes, and cake brethren. 

Come here to help appease the girlfriend's crack habit for Swedish Princess. It's a blessing and a curse.
author: Abel L.

description:
i LOVE cakes/pastries...SCHUBERTS IS SO GOOD

They're pretty friendly and helpful when you want to specialize a cake.  I've had two cakes ordered for my friends.  One was a special girnomous FRUIT TART cake for my roommie on her 21st birthday and another smaller tiramisu cake for my friend's 21st!  (I was running late one day to pick up the cake, I called in and they were super nice and I was able to get the cake YAY!) And I personally received a Swedish Princess Cake for my birthday ;] NOM NOM NOM.

My personal favorite is the NAPOLEON individual pastry (not sure if they make it for large cakes/parties) but they're simply D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S (must try...i miss it - when they sell OUT ;[ they sell out...so i havent been able to get it recently cuz i come in rather late *TEARS*)
author: Steph L.

description: I really like this place.  They serve some really good pastries, and we always get their princess cake for bdays.  This is a German bakery, so don't expect your cannoli.  Service is quick and efficient and prices are decent.
author: Joel M.

description: Back again here picking up 3 more cakes (2 princess and 1 Neapolitan).  Still same wonderful quality, service, and cleanliness.  Laura is the nicest person ever.  Always so nice no matter how busy they get.
author: R S.

description: My coworkers and I occasionally deliver items to Schubert's bakery and I am not ashamed to say, we have had small arguments about who gets to go. Money is exchanged and the person doing deliveries comes back with goodies for all.
author: Jennifer A.

description: Never disappoints. We have ordered many special family occasion cakes here and everyone is always impressed with quality and presentation. As a bonus, they will also do the writing in Chinese characters if you know what you want.
author: Chuck M.

description:
I ordered a chocolate mousse cake for a friend's birthday- easy to do online at their website. The results were fabulous! Not only was the cake light, not too sweet, it was also amazing in presentation! I posted a pic of the decor they added on it - a champagne bottle that matched the text: "a toast to you on your birthday". it was easy to order, seamless, ready for pickup the next day.

Other favorite items:
tiramisu
mango mousse cake
fruit tart- yummy custard filling!
author: Lina C.

description:
Lucky for me there was a Pineapple Shortcake waiting for me in the counter when i stopped by...this is normally a special order cake.  Never even thought about ordering Pineapple over Strawberry before.  It was a hit with my family!  Unlike most fruit basket cakes, Schubert's uses fresh pineapple instead of the canned...GOOD STUFF!  This cake will not disappoint!

Schubert's...I HEART YOU!
author: Judy K.

description: Love this place. I go here for everyones birthday cakes, they are made fresh and they taste great. Ive probably tried everything they have to offer and love it all except their cheesecakes are not the best so stay away but you cant go wrong with the cakes. The staff are always nice and ready to assist.
author: Diana s.

description:
I stopped in here yesterday to pick up a custard croissant for the next day which I just pleasantly devoured this morning and mmmm...was is Amazing!!

Thanks to my yelper friend Cassie J. who suggested this place a while back, I would have never known of this fabulous bakery. So how excited was I to see it in the corner of my eye while on clement St. Yesterday. I quickly jutted over and was  immediately in awe of the amazing, array of beautiful decked out cakes and pastries. I was literally in a baker lover's heaven.

Unfortunately, I had to choose just one heavenly treat. I quickly came to the decision  on the delicious looking custard croissant, one of my all time favorite pastries, which I was so looking forward to try.

Croissant was baked to a soft buttery perfection, with the perfect amount of rich creamy custard in the middle. This literally was the best custard croissant I have ever indulged in, I could not think of one thing wrong with it.

As for everything else, the ambiance is classy and immaculate, service was ok. I did feel a little rushed, however it was pretty busy. 

Other than that, from the one heavenly croissant I enjoyed and for the price of only $ 2.70 that makes my day. I now know where to get my specialty treats and is absolutely well worth the drive, cannot wait to try there Princess cake...Mmmmm
author: Shannon H.

description:
This is a great neighborhood bakery...we've lived in the area on and off since the late 80's and we used to love their bread (sadly, they no longer offer them).

Mother-in-law visiting and we took a little stroll down Clement with a little reward at the end of the stroll - cakes from Schubert's!

They are always crowded...they do not have a "take-a-number" system, thank goodness....it's an interesting experience of the Chinese/Russian elderly ladies elbowing their way...aside from that?  Their service is impeccable...most times...for crying out loud, we are NOT buying a car!!  Most times, it's less than $10-....

Great service....yummy cakes...what more can one ask for....4 stars?  Yeah....the elbowing and jumping in line is not always fun....
author: Barb L.

description:
4/5 busy busy!

i walked in, and all the selections placed me in a fog (get it, cuz it's the richmond and everything is in a damn fog), so it took me a few minutes to stare at the delicious things and finally decide. in the time i was contemplating my confection, 4 or 5 veteran groups walked in and picked up orders and went about their day.

i finally decided on this chocolate/cream torte thing with all these fruits on top - and since i was picking it up for a dinner and it happened to be after 5:30, the thing was 30% and came out to just $9!!! that's amaze.
author: Alvin D.

description: This place is so darn awesome. The cakes are delicious. Ordered a 1/2 sheet cake for a leader's birthday. Everyone loved the cake. Not too sweet and its perfect for people who want to be a bit healthier. Decent price for an awesome cake. My leader is satisfied with it. Thanks Schubert's. Y'all made this birthday event really awesome.
author: Kris C.

description: Sometimes it seems like it's on the pricey side, but it's always worth it. When you first walk in, there are 3 cases with an assortment of mousse cakes, cheesecakes, tarts, and the Schubert originals. They also have slices of each for the individual eater. Nonetheless, Schubert's is always my family's go to place for birthday cakes. We love the Opera Cake or the Swedish Princess cake, both Schubert originals. And my grandparents always go straight for anything that has the chocolate flowers on them. Every one is worth trying to be honest though.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
I'm so glad I read reviews for this place and decided to order a birthday cake for my best friend. The whole process was so smooth and efficient. I ordered a delicious, heavenly chocolate cake, full of fluffy layers and rich mousse on top.It was beautifully presented as well - far exceeded my expectations. I brought the cake to the party and everyone asked me where I got it.

I will continue to order cakes from here for celebrations, or to just spoil myself.
author: Nancy L.

description:
I asked my partner/boyfriend to me on cake duty for my birthday, as I love the ritual of receiving it, and he Schubert's Bakery provided a beautiful, fancy, absolutely delicious cake which was loved by my party guests. 

We picked it up on a Sunday afternoon after brunch, and my party was that evening. I'm usually a big fan of pretty standard but good-quality cake with a high emphasis on the chocolate, and this time was a little different, as he purchased what their website lists as the Opera cake ("hazelnut sponge with chocolate truffle and mocha-praline filling topped with toasted almonds")  (https://www.schuberts-bakery.com  --Special Cakes -- Opera Cake). 

The presentation was very classy and well-done but fairly simple with the chocolate icing thin on the top and sides, crushed nuts on the sides and along the edge of the top, the message he requested written in beautiful script on a rectangular piece of white chocolate propped up by some curved pieces of chocolate which matched the icing, and a handful of chocolate flowers of varying sizes. With a birthday so close to Halloween, I'm usually a big fan of the silly spooky-themed cake decorations, but this was a really lovely cake which fit the fancy cocktail party theme even better and was very well-received by everyone. 

The cake was perfect- not dry, flavorful, perfect proportions of the top and bottom layers of cake to the similar layer of filling between, thin layer of rich icing along the top and sides-- this cake wasn't all about the chocolate, but somehow the mixture of flavors and richness of the chocolate present was still highly satisfying for me, and my guests really loved it. 

Upon checking out the website, I find that his order was probably the 8"x12" for $40.95, which I find even better than reasonable considering the really high quality of the cake, prices I've paid for far less in the past, and inflation of everything in this city. 

Try them! I seriously doubt you'll be disappointed! I'm pretty picky about my baked goods, and I'm savoring the one leftover piece as I type this, which is still really amazing two days later.
author: Kelzorg B.

description:
Although I don't have a sweet tooth - actually, I don't really like sweet things. I am happy to have found Schubert's bakery.

I miss European bakeries and European sweets. The Princess cake her is amazing. For my sister's birthday I ordered a Princess Cake and requested for them to write something in Dutch on it. Although I spelled it out for them, I was nervous they were going to get it wrong (since that has happened to me before at other places), but Schuberts cares about their customers and they took great care of my sister's birthday cake! Boy, was my sister a happy 11 year old kid!

Thank you Schubert! I don't like sweets, but I can indulge in a slice of Princess Cake once in a blue moon and actually enjoy it.
author: Helen D.

description:
Best bakery ever. 
Chocolate mousse cake, fruit tart, cheesecake

They have a huge variety of fruit mousse flavors
All the fruit for the cakes are seasonal, fresh, and clean!
Attentive staff that offer great service

They take pre-orders!
This is our go-to place for special occasion baked goods.
author: Nancy F.

description: Cute little bakery. Lots of European options! Tried the Princess cake and the Napoleon. Very delicious and with the just right amount of sweetness. I was a little thrown off by the fact that they did not serve any bottle drinks, or at least water.
author: Ozzy A.

description:
This place takes the cake!

I have a serious sweet tooth (mostly chocolate) but I'm often disappointed by cake. I've gotten cakes from Dianda's multiple times, and have been happy with them, but was looking for a richer ganache type chocolate cake. I ordered the chocolate mousse with shavings from Schubert's and everyone loved it. It was rich and sweet, best had with coffee.

I was also curious about their other cakes, so I bought a slice of the Opera and a small Mango Mousse (based on other reviews) for everyone to try. The Opera cake was also delicious. It was rich, a bit sweeter than the chocolate mousse, and kind of reminded me of Nutella. While I would gladly eat it again, I don't think I could ever finish a whole slice.

The mango mousse was also delightful. While I will always choose chocolate, we were all impressed by the rich fruit flavor. It was something special that I was glad I got to try, and several of my friends said it was their favorite. The only fruit cake that I've ever had that would win against this cake is Tartine's passion fruit cake. However, I think of Tartine's cake as more of a bucket list, "everyone should try this once in their life" kind of a thing, and Schubert's as a cake I would order for a celebration. If I were buying a cake for someone that is into fruit over chocolate, I would definitely order this one.

All in all, I really enjoyed the three cakes I tried from Schubert's. I think that it has earned a position as my go to cake place. I look forward to trying more of their different cakes.
author: rachel s.

description: Five stars for their Swedish Princess Cake. One of the tastiest cakes ever! If you're a marzipan fan, you'll go nuts over this. We also tried their raspberry white chocolate mousse, which was delicious but I think the crowd fave is definitely the Swedish Princess. A must try for all those in the area!
author: Evonne L.

description:
Schubert's Bakery is a wonderful gem.

No complaints here.

I will continue doing business with them.

Thank you for crafting such awesome birthday cakes. My entire family loved the Swedish Princess cake. Bravo!!
author: Bianca B.

description:
I've only had a few cookies and cakes from here but it's totally got to hooked to this place!! 

Recommendations: 
-butter cookies
-the small specialty cakes
-jelly filled croissants


I normally don't like butter cookies but these were DELICIOUS! So fluffy and buttery! It almost makes me forget about all the fat and calories I'm ingesting! 

The specialty cakes are sooooo cute! And totally affordable! They taste really good too! It's great to get some for a friend because they look so nice and giftable or just for yourself as a great dessert snack! 

The jelly filled croissants are a bit sweet for me, but you don't have to eat the whole thing at a time, you can savior it little by little and let it brighten up your day each time you take a bite :)
author: Amiee H.

description:
I love this bakery! My family and I have been coming here for years! Their cakes are delicious, beautifully decorated and reasonably priced. What else can you ask for? 

I can say I've almost tried all their cakes. I usually preorder them online, so it's always really fresh. The bakery is usually packed too, so you know you'll be getting fresh cakes since they have no trouble selling them. My all time favorite is the Tiramisu. My family are not into sweets, so the Napoleon works out great for them. There is no cake, but just buttery puff pastry. This is delicious as well! 

Their shortbread cookies are wonderful too!
author: Veronica N.

description: Their cakes are heavenly! I've tried chocolate and the coffee-flavored one, and was in heaven. Going back soon!
author: Nikki G.

description:
No amount of words can describe how much i love this bakery! best bakery in the bay area! bless them because they offer the most inexpensive and best quality cakes in the Bay Area! My family and i have always bought our cakes from here for over 24 years and they have never disappointed us with their cakes! their cakes are always moist, fluffy, and FRESH! 

Now that we live in the east bay, i'm still willing to drive there for any of our birthday cakes! def worth the drive!
author: Morgan D.

description: Things look very nice here, but just didn't think it tasted that great. Very old school main street kinda bakery feel.
author: John H.

description:
I've been coming to the place for years, it's a wonder I didn't write about this place sooner, but I always get my cakes here on special occasions if i can't bake one myself. Friendly help, a scrumptiously delectable patisserie, everything on the menu is a must try. The decor is charming from the quaint chairs and tables to the wall furnishings. 

Unlike some bakeries, Shuberts maintains an authentic taste over and over again. Price is reasonable ranging from $3-4 for the slices and $15+ for the cakes. If you want to make sure they have a specific cake for you to buy, calling ahead to request is better, they are very accommodating.

No bathrooms here, but a bite of Mango Cheesecake, Swedish Princess, or Fruit Basket will take away your worries like a dream. Word of advice: Go get some, don't just read this.
author: Mindy X.

description: I purchased their large Chocolate Raspberry Mousse cake that was tied with a ribbon and hand lady fingers surrounding the cake.  It looked super pretty!  It was around $30-35.  The youngsters enjoyed it, but the elders thought it was a tad sweet.
author: J K.

description:
This is a mixed review because the cakes are beautiful and will impress
when brought out but the taste is a huge disappointment. That may not matter when you see these cakes. There is so much stuff on the cakes that you cannot help but acknowledge how good they look. Sort of like an art piece. However lots of the decorations are those flat chocolate sheets cut in different shapes and glazed over fruit. Not fresh stuff. Cake is that standard light, tasteless sponge cake that I notice chinese bakers like. Shubert's was an old German baker that guarded a place in old San francisco's history but these are new owners and have created a new product. Believe me the place is packed..not sure why people are not more critical of the cake. Beautiful, impressive but dissapointed  in taste.
author: dolores f.

description:
We just had Schubert's strawberry shortcake, sheet cake size.  It was absolutely delicious!  The kids couldn't take their eyes off of the beautifully sculpted candy pieces and the girls were trying to grab the little plastic rings while I was cutting the cake; I didn't ask for those rings by the way; the bakery put them on themselves.

Schubert's Bakery has fantastic owners!!! 
Some time ago, I had called in the morning to order a cake.  I was put on hold; time was running and about fifteen minutes later, I got frustrated and felt forgotten and had to run errands so I hung up.  I was still irked about it that day so I went to the website and made a complaint in the comments section, stating that I knew morning business was good and busy, but I felt my business was important also.
I received a reply from the owner who apologized and agreed with me.  He said he talked to the morning crew and asked for my address so he could send me a gift certificate.

I really appreciated that the owner addressed the issue which showed tremendous responsibility and appreciation of his customers. It was an added bonus to receive such a generous gift certificate.  So I've gone back to Schubert's.

The Napoleon cake is out of this world!  We had that in June for my daughter's 2nd birthday.  My guests and I couldn't get enough of it.  This strawberry shortcake that we ordered for today was a good $130 which goes to show how much we love Schubert's, talented baking and trust them to make such an important cake for our oldest daughter's 5th birthday!
author: Kekumukula N.

description:
Just went here today... The cakes were absolutely stunning and I could tell that they only use the freshest ingredients. The staff were very friendly and willing to help you with which particular cake you were looking for.

I tried the Swedish Princess cake slice and it was delicious!!! I highly recommend it and I am looking forward to coming back to try the Chocolate Italian Rum cake. :o)
author: Alina D.

description: Went with my daughter after reading all the great reviews.  Everything we tried was tasteless compared to what we have in MA.
author: Lisa P.

description: It's funny because for most of my childhood, I had a dentist in the area, and I'd always pass by this bakery, but never stepped inside. And I had the biggest sweet tooth in the world. I could eat a whole jar of frosting. I know I'm digusting. Don't look at me. Anyway my friend and I were picking up food on Clement. And the idea of getting cake after dim sum is like the best idea in the world. We got a fruit tart and one of the mousses. I forget which, but they were really tasty. I wanted to try the Swedish princess cake, but they only had them in bigger sizes. On another day, I picked one up, of course after picking up a pink box filled with dim sum, and shared it with a friend. And it was quite yummy. I think that everytime you get dim sum on Clement, you should also get something at Schubert's.
author: April D.

description:
In the words of Cee Lo Green.... F YOU!

Schubert's has lost me as a client!  

This review is about me:
http://www.yelp.com/biz/schuberts-bakery-san-francisco#hrid:dV3jP1jDICwzmAiqGQOvKwz

BTW - The replacement you gave me... the one to replace of the cake I ordered and you FORGOT to make..... was less expensive (and not the type of cake I wanted), I should have received an f'ing refund!

I wouldn't even think about having a wedding cake done here....could you imagine them forgetting to make / misplacing / giving your cake to someone else!?!!  

I'll make the trip to Copenhagen in Burlingame for my princess cake from now on.
author: Sofia H.

description:
My visit to this bakery was bitter sweet. 

The cakes I got were delicious (the petites!) and not so expensive, if I recall correctly. The other cakes on display were all very pretty as well. 

I guess the sad part was that their service was all over the place. It's a busy bakery, making it really easy to get noticed / lost in the process. However, once you get to a person, service is really fast, which I liked. 

Hoping I'll have the chance to come back and try some of their bigger cakes :D
author: Ashley N.

description:
Schubert's is HANDS DOWN, the best bakery in the city. All their cakes & fruits are fresh, each made with extreme care, and the decorations are gorgeous. The owners are extremely responsive to all suggestions, and the ladies that work here are amazing & helpful. 

Favorite cakes: Swedish Princess, Napoleon, Chocolate Mousse with Strawberries, and Chocolate Truffle. 

Favorite pastries: Almond croissant, blueberry danish, apple turnover, or ham & cheese [if you want some savory].

Favorite cookies: almond sticks 

If you have a special occasion, you should definitely go in and discuss options - they can put pictures on it, decorate it with toys, etc. etc.
author: I. L.

description:
My go-to bakery for Princess cake and Mango Mousse. Did you know you can order online as well? You can the selection of cakes online, too.  I placed my order online and then picked it up a couple days later. The customer service is great, too. Super friendly and helpful. 

If you're not looking for a whole cake, they also have single serving sizes, too. I know it's bad taste to buy yourself a birthday cake, but I did for myself (Princess Cake) and I'm not ashamed. Haha. Go indulge yourself!!
author: Lisa X.

description:
Schubert's is a local favorite of mine. I spent many a day there when I worked at my old job. Everything in there is delicious and delicious to look at too. 

It's a great place to get a treat and a great place to order cakes for any occassion. One of my all time faves is the Princess and the Tiramisu.

YUM YUM YUM
author: Ro M.

description:
It was a week before my wedding, and I was searching town for a bakery that would take a last-minute cake order. *I do not recommend doing this*. However, because of the extremity of my situation, I can say with equal confidence that I do recommend visiting Schubert's. Whether or not you're getting married, actually.

It was one of the best customer service experiences I've ever had. Sabine, the baker, was friendly and collaborative, but she was also quick to use her expertise to help narrow down our options and find what I was looking for. The generous cake samples probably helped too. (:

(One slight disappointment: Sabine said that a marzipan coating would work with our Italian rum cake just as well as the traditional fondant. In fact, our guests found it kind of overwhelming. I love marzipan, though.)

My fiancee and I wanted a cake that was chocolatey, not too sweet, and interesting without being potentially off-putting to our less adventurous relatives. The Italian rum cake was exactly what we wanted, and we got it more quickly than we had any right to expect, at a surprisingly low price. And it was utterly delicious. Hooray for Schubert's!
author: Michael C.

description:
MORE PRINCESS CAKE, NOW! It's honestly the best princess cake I've ever had, and just thinking about it is giving me an intense Schubert's craving.

Their chocolate cheesecakes are also just as amazing.

Rock on, Schubert's.
author: Colleen M.

description: Cakes are a little pricier than what I would like, but the quality is quite nice.  I got a large birthday cake and it was super rich and moist.
author: Edgar C.

description:
Of all the dessert places in SF, I think Schubert's tops the cake.  It is as close as I will get to Extraordinary desserts in San Diego.  They have a large variety of small, personal sized cakes/tarts/mousses/etc, and the larger versions of them.  The cakes are very light, fluffy, and not too sweet.  Their most popular cakes are: the princess cake, the mango mousse, and ... something else I forgot.  

Unlike all the other bakeries in SF, Schubert's does not over charge for a small piece of dessert.  Most personal sized desserts are $3.45, and the full sized cakes can cost up to $20.  There's always a constant flow of traffic coming through this bakery, which is a good sign.  They have a few tables and chairs where you can get a piece of dessert and sit down to eat.   We got their mango mousse to share, and it was delicious!! THe mango taste wasn't overpowering, and the mousse was perfect.
author: Diane L.

description:
One word. YUM! That's all you need to know. Now go get some cakes.

Not gone yet? If you must read a review, their cakes are great. The strawberry moose cake that I ordered was moist and delicious. Heaven in a spoon literally. 

They sell whole cakes and small individual cakes the size of a hockey puck. There's a few tables inside the bakery to sit down and eat their individual cakes.

This place has some cake rushes sometimes. People just bum rush the counter without even waiting in line like their time is more valuable. Common courtesy fails when it comes to cake? Just a bunch of impatient people. 

They accept credit cards. Now get going.
author: Steven B.

description:
I think this is where my cake addiction all began.  My uncle would always buy me cakes for my b-day growing up here.  He usually got me the different mousse cakes which are airy but still pack a lot of sugary sweet goodness, which I loved at the time, but not now when I see my dentist bills.  Sadly, my aunt and uncle stopped buying me birthday cakes and whenever I go over their house to celebrate my birthday...I get ice cream...boo.  

I however was recently reunited with Schubert's cakes at my guy's family party; oh how I missed the lightness of the cake and the delicious whip cream and icing topped with chocolate shavings.  It was like being reunited with your first crush; you totally forgot about him after the last time you saw him but then he reappears after being gone for years and you remember why you used to like him so much and can't help but smile and feel a little giddy.  hehe
author: Cat C.

description: I've honestly never tried this place, but every time I go here it's because I want to grab a treat for a friend.  Service is always nice and prompt, pastries and cakes look delicious, and prices aren't too bad.  Next time I come here, I'll be sure to grab a bite of their famous princess cake!
author: Kristen T.

description: So I had to get a last minute Birthday cake yesterday. I purchased a Chocolate Mousse Cake and let me tell you....................................MMMMMMM GOOD ! Rarely I go for a second piece, and I sure did! Glad I ordered the large one because there is only less than 1/4 left lol. Thank you also for writing Happy Birthday on the piece of white chocolate! Birthday girl and friends were amazed and delighted with the cake. SPOT ON !!!! One happy customer!!!!!
author: C U.

description:
Love it!

Chocolate croissants are a must... mango mousse cake is always a hit when you're not sure what to bring... but pretty much, I haven't had a bad thing here and everything is so well priced!

Mango mousse bday cake- $18 bucks (feeds 6-8 ppl)
author: Christine K.

description:
Usually get birthday cakes from here [gf family]Mango Mousse cake i believe. 

The cakes are good, but not something I crave for. Maybe I should try other flavors or different types of pastries. I dont know. I really tried to do that the last time i went in here and I couldn't get myself to eat a whole small round cake to myself[thought it was a bit too much cake for one person plus I haven't eat any food yet] So, I passed. lol The prices looked expensive also another reason I skipped my opportunity. 

I had there struddle at the SF Oktoberfest. It wasn't that good. I had better up at the East Coast [Massachussets]. 

I'll give them another chance in the future. lol
author: Jeff C.

description:
I have never had a single thing here that isn't scrumptious! Lovely little cookies, gorgeous cakes, amazing pastries. It's a good thing I don't live in this neighborhood because I'd be in serious trouble between Schubert's and the dim sum place up the street that's the best in the world. My personal favorite is the Swedish Princess cake, a domed confection of marzipan, whipped cream, raspberry jam and tender cake. Kinda surprising for this diehard chocolate lover to pass up the mousse cake for a pastel green thing that squishes when you try to fork up a bite, but it's just so good. I actually met somebody from the Bay Area when I was in Maui this summer and we ended up rhapsodizing over the Princess cake at Schubert's while sitting watching a tropical sunset!

They actually have good coffee too, which I find unusual for a local bakery. Not espresso, just coffee. Only a few tables, often full, but we often come here at the end of a day of shopping on Clement for a cup of coffee and something decadent. Worth a trip to the neighborhood all on its own though!
author: Joy S.

description: Schubert's cakes are absolutely gorgeous and always blows me away in both taste and design. I've had the Napoleon, Princess and tirimisu cakes and they are just plain delicious. There is no doubt that Schubert's excels in the decorations of their cakes. The crisp flakes inside the Napoleon, sweet cream and strawberries, huge slices of chocolate, and tasty little ladyfingers surrounding the cake. I'm just sad that they aren't located in the East Bay where I could get to them easier!
author: Catherine W.

description: Needed a cake in a pinch and a friend recommended their coffee crunch cake of which I am a big connoisseur.  Call ahead to make sure they have it!  They made a fresh one for me by the afternoon.  Random location.  Cake was fresh and light like Chinese cake.  Had to assemble the crunch stuff on the outside of the cake so it wouldn't get soggy.  Crunch itself was light and airy.  I prefer mine more candy toffee but not bad.  Meet part was whip cream frosting!
author: Denice L.

description:
Wonderful cheesecakes and easy to order!

Their website gives you a clear picture of what you're getting. You can see what it looks like, what sizes it comes in, how many it serves, the price and an optional box for added text on your cake. This may sound standard but not many bakeries go through the trouble of putting all of this on their website (or even having one for that matter).

They have such a huge selection of other cakes, cookies and pastries. They do a great job of making each creation delicious and presentable. I know a former worker from here and she said the employees take their craft of creating desserts very seriously. It definitely shows.

I highly recommend their Mango Cheesecake! It was silky smooth and delicious in taste. It was also decorated quite nicely. I brought this cheesecake to a social gathering and it was a hit. Everyone enjoyed it!
author: Andrew C.

description:
Schubert's Bakery definitely knocks my socks off, with their extensive and beautiful cake selection...
...but then I have to put my socks back on, from the freezing disappointment in their taste.  I may come back again.  But this first round, however, dealt me two cake slices that were overly dry (not to be mistaken as dense), despite the plastic protective sheeting.
author: Diane N.

description:
My friend's wedding is in two weeks. She told me she will get the princess cake from here! I am excited! Consistently good cakes made fresh everyday. Thanks 

They lessened the sweetness of the princess cake recently. Or is that just me? I like their double chocolate mousse best.
author: Alisa M.

description:
if u wanna talk bout 'hidden gens' this IS the BIZZNESS!!!!  lil bakery in the heart of Clement street between 6th/7th avenue...
they got heeeeelllaa cakes, pastries, etc. if u don't know, lemme holla atcha... get urself a slice of  PRINCESS!!!
author: Omar N.

description:
This place is freakin' amazing. The Mango Cheesecake, Mango Mousse, Princess cake, Strawberry Shortcake area all unbelievably awesome. The mousses are fantastic too. It's really quite an amazing place and they make a heck of an awesome cake. Great for single slices and (more so) for full cakes.

Knocked off one star as the in-store seating is pretty mediocre. If the seats/layout were better organized, I'd go visit more often if I could have a coffee and sit there comfortably. There are only a few tables now, and they are often full. So a bit better for "takeout" of a slice or large cake, rather than to buy and sit. Otherwise, this place is basically perfect. :)
author: Mike J.

description: Someone seriously needs to bar me from this place. In the past two months, i've been there more days than I am going to admit to. The cakes are my new addiction because they are so delicious. I have tried pretty much everything from their princess cake to their mango mouse cake. They mouse cake's are not one of my favorites but the individual cakes are. I just love how they have individual pieces to sell already pre-made and you can buy a whole cake too.  My favorita is the neopolitan cake. All the cakes are moist and not overly decadent. They also have other pastries like strudel, petites, coffees, and cookies.  Plus the staff there are really nice and helpful.  There are seats there and it is always busy when I come in.  To top it off, the prices are so reasonable per slice.  I always end up buying at least two pieces each visit. Word of advice...when they say they have gingerbread cookies, they aren't the authentic gingerbread cookies. They are the sugar cookies. They make gingerbread houses during Christmas which look so good for $40 bucks but that's overdoing it for me.  So be prepared. Also there is only street parking so I suggest you get there early in the AM.
author: Zara-Maria S.

description:
"IF"
If Beethoven lived
if Mozart still riffed,
Vivaldi if found,
If Brahms came around
If Haydns, both brothers,
And Bach and them others
 
They  all - if they could-
Would come here on foot
And gladly partake
Of Schubert's great cake.

The owners of Schubert's are simply the best
Among pastry bakers from east to the west.
author: Karl I.

description:
When I was about to walk in, I thought it was another Asian bakery where I felt like I was obligated to speak to the ladies in Chinese. I saw a lot of elderly men through the window. But when I went in, I was so totally wrong. Not only were the employees not Chinese, but they were young ladies who could speak fluent English. They were also very nice and eager to help. Anyways, on to the cakes...

Oh my God, their cakes are soooo good. I bought four cakes, and they were all delicious. I bought them at 5PM and didn't eat them until 8PM, but it was still good. It was a hot day too, so the cakes were sort of melting. But even then, the cake was delicious. I will definitely recommend this place to my friends, and will go back again. This time, maybe I'll get to eat it before it melts.
author: Stacy C.

description:
So Schubert's is decent. I had their chocolate cake and it was prepared beautifully. Was it worth $47 for a cake that hardly fed 10 people? Mmm no.

I do think that the bakers put great care and effort into each cake. I was surprised at how beautiful the cake was, but taste-wise? Nothing to rave home about. 

Tip: Schubert's is on Clement street and in between multiple Asian markets. Parking isn't impossible, but it isn't easy.
author: Rosa L.

description:
This Monday I wanted to surprise my sis with something special, as she started on her first job and Monday being her first day. The most obvious choice that came to my mind was surprising her with a cake. I read through many reviews on Yelp and finally decided to check Schubert's Bakery out. Even though I had read lot of good things for this bakery, I was not prepared for what came my way....

The cakes of this bakery are simply divine...My sis and I are coffee lovers, so my obvious choice was a cake with coffee flavor. So, I ordered a Cappuccino mousse cake and I must say I have never tasted anything better. Till now, my favorite had been coffee ice-cream and now this. My entire family loved the cake...of course my sis was in tears....(joyful). 

Schubert Bakery is excellent in its service. They take credit card, you get parking easily and the biggest plus....you can place your order online, over the phone and of course on the shop. My order was ready right on time, without any hassles whatsoever. The staff is nice and friendly and even help you in making the decision. The pricing is also quite decent, not very much on the higher side. 

Anyone, who loves to enjoy a special treat of cakes, must check this out.
author: Kimberly F.

description:
Hidden among the numerous Asian markets on Clement St. is a true gem, Schubert's Bakery.  For many years, Schubert's has done an excellent job of satisfying my sweet tooth!

They're best known for their cakes which are beautifully showcased in the glass display.  The shiny glaze atop the various mousse cakes, the fluffy cream and chocolate shavings of the tiramisu, and the chocolate ganache garnished with toasted almonds all scream Eat me! Eat me!

Some of my favorites are:

* Mousse Cakes - They come in various fruit flavors such as, mango, strawberry, tropical and peach, raspberry, lemon and currant.  The mousse is covered with a brilliant glaze and is very light, tasty, slightly tart and sits on top of a soft sponge cake.  The edge of many of the mousse cakes is lined with ladyfingers and wrapped with a red ribbon making it look like a beautiful gift!  The Tiramisu Mousse and Chocolate Mousse are divine and taste just perfectly, not being too sweet or too rich.  The Chocolate Mousse with Almonds is presented slightly differently as it is covered with an amazing chocolate ganache and garnished with toasted almonds on the edge . . . very delicious!

* Swedish Princess - I was never a fan of marzipan until being introduced to this delightful creation.  A lime green marzipan-covered mound, which resembles something you would see in outer space, tastes out of this world!  The thin layer of marzipan is perfect as it covers moist white cake layers with thin strips of raspberry and kirsch custard filling and whip cream . . . just the right level of sweetness and richness!

* Italian Rum Cake - This is my all-time favorite!  A white and chocolate buttercream cake filled with chocolate and rum custard.  The cake is super moist and soft and the light custard is perfectly blended and not overpowering.  I'm craving a piece right now!

* Napoleon - For those of you who need a little crunch in your cake, this is a great choice.  With layers of crunchy puff pastry filled with strawberries, rum custard and whip cream, surrounded by ladyfingers and wrapped in a red ribbon, this makes a perfect gift for your appetite.

Schubert's is such a wonderful bakery as their cakes are very reasonably priced, they offer a convenient and efficient online ordering system, the service is friendly and quick, and their cakes are SO BEAUTIFUL!  They get an "A+" for presentation!   Every time I've brought a Schubert's cake to an event, it's always been a winner!  Single servings are also available for many of their various delightful creations so you don't need to buy an entire cake to try them. 

Thank you Schubert's for making our celebrations so delicious and enjoyable!  I will definitely be back!
author: Karen L.

description: probably the best cake i've had so far in sf. the cake was a good level of moist and the cream wasn't greasy that it acts as lip balm. keep me away from here because i'm trying to maintain a good weight!
author: Mae I.

description:
Awesome. Just hosted a Baby Shower. I was going to get a basic cake at Safeway, when I thought I'd try out Schuberts. I know the location well.  I ordered & paid online.  A double Chocolate mousse round cake. I asked it be decorated "festively".  

The cake was delicious and they did a WONDERFUL job with decorating...It was precious.  It  really made the day special.  The ordering process was SOOOO easy.  All online.  

I can't say enough good things about it!!!   I can't wait to go again.
author: J M.

description:
This place is awesome. I trusted my fellow Yelpers on this one, and I am glad I did. My sister and I flew my mother to San Francisco for her 60th birthday and wanted a special cake for her.

They were very friendly and accommodating to our needs over the phone. Due to the TERRIBLE service offered by the Sausalito Ferry, we we're not able to pick  our cake in time. We called them and explained our situation and they arranged for us to pick up our cake, 30 minutes after closing time. What a great experience! The owner of Schubert's ought to train the jerks at the ferry dock on how to treat customers.

Needless to say, the cake was very well decorated and tasted AMAZING! My mother actually packed a piece in her suitcase to take home. San Francisco is a great town, I'm sure I'll be back to Schubert's as well :)
author: Nathan R.

description:
This Sunday I got: Opera cake - a little bit too heavy. And Delicious Currant mousse - it has more fluffy and light dough. Tarty and satisfied my sweet craving...
Can't wait till next weekend.

So far: chocolate mousse with chocolate shavings is the best!
author: Anelya S.

description: One of my favorite bakery's in the city.  The princess cake is out of this world and the tiramisu is a delight to your eyes.  Staff is very sweet and helpful.  Always a win here!
author: Mariam A.

description: I am pleasantly surprised by how amazing the cakes and the taste, especially tiramisu and princess cake. The best cakes I have tried so far. Beautiful icing and great price. Please open a branch in LA.
author: A Z.

description: Always love the cakes from here. You really can't go wrong here. I've tried their Swedish Princess Cake, Mango Mousse, the Opera Cake, Tiramisu Cake, Chocolate Truffle Torte, Tropical Mousse, and Chocolate Mousse w/Almonds. I really can't choose a favorite because they're all delicious. What I would order would depend on the mood I'm in. Seriously though, pick anything that you like and it will be fabulous!
author: Kitty K.

description:
Shubert's, I have a love and hate relationship with you..

Loveeee for your amazing delicacies and artful cakes, one of which I purchased for my boyfriend and his best friend for their simultaneous birthday celebrations.

Now, this is what I don't like: A friend of mine and I ordered that custom birthday cake and on the day that it was supposed to be picked up we had a major scare of that said cake that being made.

The day before pick up, I called to confirm the cake was done and it was. The next day, phone call with a different girl was basically about inquiring to see if our cake was ready for pick up, AND HER REPLY WAS, "I don't know which cake you're talking about, there is no cake like that here." I UNLIKE THIS CUSTOMER SERVICE GIRL VERY MUCH. I drove to the bakery in person and just asked to pick up the cake and it was indeed good to go. But to whoever that girl is she needs some serious customer service training cause her space case, rude attitude will get her bad karma one day.
author: Joanne S.

description:
MmmmmMmmmm good!

Schubert's is worth the craziness I have to go through to look for parking on Clement street.  The cakes are absolutely delicious, beautifully decorated and easy on the wallet.  

I always buy a cake for a friend's birthday, and various other events from here.  My absolute fave?! The princess cake which according to their website is their "delicious white cake layers with raspberry and kirsch custard filling, whipped cream and marzipan icing!"  I think it's their best selling cake and is only $26.95 for their medium size which feeds 10 to 12 people!   

I picked one up for New Year's eve and everyone loved it!  
Sooooo.... if you need a birthday cake or just want to satisfy your sweet tooth or brighten up your day, stop by here and pick up a cake, a slice or a couple and you'll be good to go! 

Yummmmy!  I think I'm going to have to make a stop here soon.
author: Christine P.

description: So, I'm at a party and I spy this PINK cake.  Usually I'd hope for chocolate cake, but when I learned that it was a champagne cake, I could hardly wait to try it.  HELLLL-O!  Yes, I am definitely "a fan" of Schubert's pretty, pretty pink champagne cake.  A huge fan of a cake that actually tastes better than it looks, and it looks real good. Oh yes, real good.
author: Chloe M.

description: My favorite bakery place in the Richmond, I gotta say they're the Best, love their mango cheese cake. :)
author: Terry T.

description: Had their mango mousse cake at a friend's birthday... I loved it!! They had decorated the periphery of the cake with lady fingers and ribbon...highly recommended!
author: Chin C.

description:
Quality is 5 star. Level of customer service 2. I've purchased cakes here for many years. However the level of customer service has gone down hill. From the employee that answered the phone to the instore employee. I noticed they have new employees, and feel that should all be trained the same. Its really conflicting as a customer when the cakes are delicious but the service is below average. First issue... The employee sounded irritated when I asked her about the difference between flavors in cakes. Second incident the associate in the store did not want to provide me plates. She said they dont do that. She was new. When she saw I was irritated she said ok I'll give you plates but dont tell anyone. This is not good customer service.

05.12.12. I purchased a case for Mothers Day and the service was great. Because if that I'm adding another star. As I continue to receive excellet service I will increase the stars.
author: Francisca C.

description:
I went here to get my dad a birthday cake since I heard this place has amazing cakes. I went in looking for the mango mousse, since it is the most popular one, but they ran out! Aw. But the lady was nice enough to look in the back and ask a few people if it was still available, instead of just giving me a flat no :) She also took the time to explain to me which was sweeter and which was which out of all their cakes. 

I ended up getting the 6" chocolate mousse. A bit pricey since it was $16.95 but it was worth it since the designs are incredible and the mousse is so savory. I was able to eat 1/3 of the whole cake in one day because it's not too sweet! My dad was pleased and said that the chocolate flavor was very rich!
author: Vicki L.

description:
One of my husbands students gave him a box of tea cookies from Shubert's and I had one of these moments: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JWac5UT80no
Yep, they were so good that I turned into the Cookie monster. Taste so good Coookie! I will eat them up!
author: Sheila T.

description:
My brothers took a road trip up to SF from Orange County.  They borrowed my car and as a thank you they brought back an ice chest with desserts from Schubert's.  They found the bakery through Yelp and brought back some desserts for me.  

Here's what they brought back:

The Swedish Princess
Mango Mousse
"Special" - Chocolate cake with Vanilla Mousse
Strawberry Cheesecake
Chocolate Truffle
Fruit Tart

Of these, the only ones I liked were the fruit tart and the chocolate truffle.  I've eaten some pretty delicious desserts and these were not on par with them.  I have no idea how much they were but I'm guessing this place has gotten a lot of good reviews because of its pricing.  Reminded me of the desserts at 85 degree Bakery in Irvine:  Looked great but lacks in flavor.

Sorry Schubert's Bakery, but I just was not impressed.  Just MEH for me.
author: Nadia S.

description:
Schubert's Bakery literally "TAKES THE CAKE"... 

I've ordered their cakes on 2 occasions and was very satisfied both times. Believe me, I'm very hard to please (i.e. anal nit picker) and the cakes always come out picture perfect--I meant Bon Appetit cover perfect. 

For Easter I ordered: 
-Swedish Princess: I thought the marzipan would be overly sweet, but it wasn't. The raspberry and custard were a perfect pairing. 
-Chocolate Truffle Torte: YUMMY--rich, creamy, and not too sweet. Just the way I like my cake. 

Since it was Easter, both cakes were decorated with chocolate eggs and a bunny. And, they were hand painted and dusted with gold--how intricate! It was almost, just almost, too pretty to eat. 

Two weeks ago for my bf's surprise 30th b-day party, I ordered the Chocolate Mousse Cake. OMG, it was SOOOOOOO GOOOOOOD. The best store bought cake EVER! The cake was incredibly moist and light, yunno like the chinatown sponge cakes? MMMM....and the mouse was rich, light, and not too sweet. 

Sadly, I only had one bite that night in fear it would come up with the copious amount of alcohol I had that night. I'm not a sweet tooth nor a big chocolate fan, but after that one bite, I had cravings for the next 2-3 days. So, we had to return the day of his actual b-day to buy another just so I can actually enjoy every morsel of it. 

Schubert's is hands-down the best place to get a cake with that "WOW" factor. I can't wait to try all the other varieties.  

Now only I wish they had carrot cake; hint, hint...
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
I love schubert's cakes. They are absolutely amazing. The mango mousse, passion mousse, pretty much any mousse cake is delicious. But just the other day I bought a tiramisu cake for my friends birthday dinner and it was heaven. I usually don't like chocolatey flavored cakes, but it was just right. Highly recommend it and its gorgeous to boot!

TIP: they stay open later than the hours yelp has up for them. Call to double check in case it  varies by day.
author: Kristen C.

description: All is right with the world. The owner of Schubert's contacted my girlfriend Sofia H and refunded the money for the cake that was not prepared despite ordering it online and paying for it. I do like their princess cake so their review goes back to a 4 but I want to let my 1 star review stand as well as a matter of record.
author: Carlos A.

description: The cakes are too sweet. The swedish princess cake is NOT the very best.
author: Diana R.

description:
If the mini-mousse and cakes slices are a sign of how good their full size desserts are, then I've found my new destinations for sugary confections.

Today was a nice day to walk around the City, take pictures, and try new places.
Fortunate for me, Schubert's Bakery happen to be one of those places.

The desserts here would satisfy even the most demanding sweet tooth.

My chocolate mousse had a couple layers of rich and creamy chocolate, covered with milk and white chocolate shavings, and had a little piece of chocolate on top.  Sweet.
The wife's strawberry mousse was stacked symphony of fruit and cake but so airy that it evaporated before I could finish my bite.  Tease.

Great Bakery.
Terrible parking.
But so worth the search to find one.
author: Dan B.

description: The cakes are pretty good her. I got a mango mouse cake for my niece on here birthday. I also got an Opera Cake for a friend. The Opera cake is my favorite.
author: Peter N.

description:
OMG! Their mango mousse cake is light, delicious, and beautiful! I came here this weekend and tried 8 types of cakes. Almost all of them were wonderful! Some recommendations are:

Black forest cake
Mango mousse cake
Peach mousse cake
Chocolate mousse cake
Italian rum cake

Parking might be hard so go early. It gets busy here! There are a few tables there so go early, have coffee or tea, and indulge!
author: Eva Y.

description:
This review is for the cakes only.

When I asked the threads where to go for a special cake for a good friend's birthday I was answered with a resounding "Schuberts!"

To tell the truth, I had misgivings because I had come in once before and purchased what turned out to be mediocre pies (and I like pies) for a Thanksgiving meal. It seemed like an average American bakery.

But I trusted my sources (Brenda Kaye and all the rest) and I liked that it wasn't too far away, so I went to Schuberts. The picture of Sav's bday cake on Stanley's flickr sites nailed it for me (it looked yummy--I think KP bought it). 

I walked in to see an amazing display of just gorgeous, mouth-watering, unique cake beauteousness. 

I had no trouble picking out one my friend would love. (Chocolate Mousse Cake with Almonds)

Okay, Part II.

I get to the party out in the remote sticks where my good friends live. He's a rockclimber (etc) and his friends are rockclimbers (etc) and they are hyped up just talking and bullshitting ignoring the food his girlfriend lovingly prepared and ignoring us gentler folk...I ask his girlfriend (my oldest, dearest friend)--"do you think I should serve the cake yet?" and she's like "I don't know, they're pretty caught up in their stories right now" But I decide it's time we serve the cake and WHOA ~ FOCUS--just like that. Quiet and awe and love spilled forth. Gratitude and appreciation. Some of them had never even seen a cake like that. I think I got their attention ~_~ One guy even said "That is one sexy cake".

So there you have it ~ beautiful, tasty ....and sexy.
author: Liza B.

description:
Been going to this place for years and they still haven't lost their touch! Cakes are ever so moist and fresh.  

What I usually order:

Swedish Princess Cake (on the sweet side but I love it).

Coffee Crunch Cake 

Mocha Torte

Italian Rum Cake

Black Forest Cake

St. Honore Cake (MY FAVORITE!!)

Mango Mousse

Tiramisu Mousse

EVERYTHING LISTED HERE ARE GOOD!
author: Sassy G.

description:
Whenever I'm in the neighborhood, I like to stop by here for a treat. My favorites are the Chocolate Truffle Cake and the Tiramisu. As another reviewer said... the cakes are delicious and pretty to look at too!

I got my wedding cake from Schubert's and it was fabulous. The fondant did melt a little under the hot lights, but that would've probably happened with any fondant cake. They were happy to accommodate the designs we chose for the decoration and their prices were very reasonable.

I highly recommend them and will be coming back for an anniversary cake. :)
author: Mary D.

description:
#200

Wow I didn't write a review for this place yet? I thought I did. 

I come here to get cakes for various occasions, mainly for birthdays. They have a lot of cake/cheesecake/pastry selections. Whenever I come in there's always a lot of people shoving their way up to the lovely ladies that work behind the counter. The last time I came in I got a strawberry cheesecake for bf's Thanksgiving Dinner and the next time I'm coming in should be tomorrow for my brother's 20th bday cake (I was looking through the photos on yelp and that's when I knew I didn't write a review for Schubert's) 

They do wedding cakes also and prices range by height/tiers. I love how most of their cakes have chocolate flower thingys. It's so cute and fancy at the same time. 

Schubert's cakes fit for ALL occasions! 

They do accept credit cards.
author: Tracy A.

description: Didn't know such a bakery was on Clement Street! Parking was relatively easy on the streets. Got a chocolate mousse cake, and it was good! I'd go again if I was nearby, not sure if I'd make my way to SF just to get here though.
author: Soo Jung R.

description:
This is my go to bakery when in need of something special. They have so many delicious cakes, pastries to choose from it makes it rather difficult to just choose one. The icing and whipped cream aren't overly sugar and that cake itself is soooo moist - YUM!

Compared to other bakeries, Schubert's prices are really reasonable.

I've ordered to several b'day cakes here and shared a few delicious desserts after dinner with friends at Schuberts. Love love love Schuberts!
author: Leanne S.

description: +800 review and 4.5 stars. This place must be good. I was looking for a cake that had lots of fruits. My first choice was the strawberry shortcake but they only had the small round size. I was disappointed because most of the cakes were mousse. I opted for the tropical mousse because it had the most fruits. The cake was nicely decorated but it was so.... dry.
author: Kien M.

description:
First time ordering a cake here, though I've tried their tiramisu at a friend's birthday. I came in to the bakery to place an order with the intention of seeing how each cake looks like since I was being picky with the design. They had a good selection on display, but a lot of their specialty cakes weren't available since it is made to order. After much debate, I placed an order for the Italian Rum.

Customer service: I thought they lacked in this area. The girls didn't seem overly helpful and seemed bother that I had questions. C'mon, I was ordering a cake for a special birthday! Then, when I called a few days later to change my order to the Pineapple Delight, the gal who answered was even more rude! 'Well, what do you want to change? Ok, what did you order?' All spoken with an attitude.

The cake: moist and very liquidy. Plenty of pineapple pieces, in fact I thought it was a little too much. Whipped cream was light and not too sweet at all. Definitely a cake that makes you feel less guilty because it doesn't feel like it's loaded with butter and sugar. At first I was a little hesitant they would make the top of the cake appear too girly, but they added a nice touch with a more neutral design.

Overall, the cake price was decent- 10" for $37 and the cake came out with no complaints. Minus one star for the rude customer experience.
author: Lisa C.

description: Delicious, beautifully decorated cakes. I've sampled a few, and each one tasted fantastic. Their cake is moist, and their cream filling is light and fluffy. Even their chocolate adornments are divine.
author: Sophia B.

description:
Every time I'm here, I spend a good 5 minutes mulling over what to get because everything looks so. damn. GOOD. They sell a huge variety from considerably small shop; goods range from cakes to pastries to cookies. 

I've tried two mousse cakes here: tiramisu and mango mousse cake. Both are very light but deliver a lot of flavor.  

The other cake I've tried is the Swedish Princess (their signature cake if I'm not mistaken?). It's the lime-green color frosted cake with RASPBERRY & CUSTARD. Words will do it no justice and you just have to try it. Truly one of a kind. 

The last item I need to rave about is....the VIENESSE FRUIT TORTE!!! Or simply put, a fruit tart. BUT it's not your average tart, no no no no no. The crust is not flaky like traditional fruit tarts. It's pretty dense since it's made from shortbread, which becomes very apparent when you carry the tart -- it weighs a good 5 pounds but you know it's packing some savory heat. To top it off there's a sweet menage-a-five of fruits between blueberries, strawberries, pineapple, kiwi and peaches that completes the yummy orgy your mouth is in store for.

Schubert's sets the standard. Once you've had something here, you won't go anywhere else. 

P.S. Parking on clement is a nightmare but what's new.
author: Annie L.

description:
This is the best bakery I've been to in SF!

The opera cake, all the mousse cakes, Swedish princess cake.... perfection.

And it's all SO pretty! Seriously picture worthy... too bad I'm too distracted eating
author: Melissa H.

description:
Someone gave me one of their large holiday decorated cookies as a gift and I took one bite out of it and knew this place stood out from the rest.  Never heard of this place before that and only tried their cookies so far, but they are so good!!  Could only imagine how good their cakes, mousse, tarts, etc. are. . .   

Bought a box of their assorted cookies, a plastic wrapped bag of these cookies with some jelly/jam in the middle and a large decorated cookie for about $19, which was honestly more than I expected, but the stuff here is good and the people I gave these as gifts to liked them so I can't really complain.  

Was surprised when I stepped in that this isn't a large place - it's quite small inside.  At around noon time on a Saturday when I came here, this place was pumpin' with people consuming their delectable treats;-)
author: Kahanalei M.

description: Mango mousse and Opera cake! Plus berry tarts! My absolute favorites!! I love that this bakery is so close to my house because whenever i'm craving for it, I can always go grab a slice! It's my family's favorite go-to for birthday cakes or any cakes that we need for celebrations. The mango mousse is filled with mango flavor and it's not too sweet. The cake texture is absolutely perfect to complement with the mango! We also love the mango cheesecake too! I can't remember any time that i've ever ordered anything that I hated here.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
My wife loves this place, probably a lot more than me.  The cakes are very asian-style, in that they are lighter and more fluffy than regular cakes you might be used to.  Personally, I like a big, dense, chocolate cake.  But that's just me.

I've used them a few times to get cakes for my wife's birthday and the like, and she's always satisfied.  The St. Honore, Strawberry Romanoff, and Mango Mousse cakes rank among her favorites.  For an asian cake place, this is about as good as it gets (and if she was writing this review, it'd get five stars).

I can only give it 4 stars, though, because I just haven't been madly in love with any of the cakes.  I do consider myself a fan, though.  Definitely recommend checking them out.
author: Chad H.

description: The cakes are undeniably delicious but the customer service can be a little off. I wanted to buy a cake for a dinner party on a Sunday night. Because of parking problems I arrived at 5:01 PM and although the store was still full of people I was told I couldn't come in. I explained that I only wanted to purchase a large cake and they were only going to put it away for the night and sell it (hopefully) one day later anyway. I would have been in and out in just a few minutes. I don't know what they do with their day old cakes but I got the impression freshness is less a priority than closing on the dot.
author: Cynna M.

description:
Beautiful, consistent and scrumptious cakes and pastries!

They never fail to impress.

Chocolate Mousse Cake
Strawberry Shortcake
Swedish Princess Cake
Opera Cake
author: Emma G.

description: Everything inside this bakery looks too beautiful to eat. My brother's girlfriend gave him a mango mousse cake for his birthday...mmmmm! It was delicious. I want a cake from there for my birthday ;]
author: Linda L.

description:
The cakes are better at Ranch 99. Here, the cake was soggy, and the part that wasn't was too crumbly.

We threw out the cake after taking just one bite. Maybe I should've tried the mousse cake...
author: Jess C.

description:
my husband I tracked this place down, because of the great reviews it has from our fellow yelpers.. 

this place is the cleanest bakery I've been to by far! and the ladies there are the nicest! they have many cakes and cookies to choose from. 
of course we tried the Irish Princess cake everyone seemed to be raving about.. it was actually really good and light.. even the green fondant had a light -not so sweet taste .. 

we also tried the cappuccino /chocolate cake,, this is more on the rich side.. but very very good! the cappuccino mousse is so light and the cake is so moist.. perfectly balanced not too sweet at all

Tiramisu cake was wonderful as well!!

I have the neopolitan cake in my fridge still.. but I'm sure its going to be a great one just like the others..

My daughter bought a sugar cookie as well, with frosting and sprinkles.. it was $5.. yeah I know it cost more than a cake slice.. but the cookie was buttery and actually really good!  

Cant complain here.. I'm a super happy customer.. and will definitely come back =)
author: sharlyn g.

description: I love their Napoleon cake, but you have to order two days ahead because it doesn't taste good on the next day. Also, It is not very sweet and the fruit are fresh. I have tried the other cake, they are all above average but not impress. I am a fan of this bakery because you can order and pay the cake online.
author: angel w.

description:
For my work birthday, my coworker got me a cake from Schubert's.

My request was chocolate chocolate chocolate, and the Opera cake gave me chocolate chocolate chocolate.

It was praline, mocha and hazelnut sponge and the chocolatey-ness was just right for this chocoholic!

And the, um, icing on the cake (HA) was the inscription was raspberry flavored. Yum... deelish. 

I can't wait to try the other offerings. 

I wonder what Marie Antoinette would say to me wanting both bread and cake?
author: Karen K.

description: Princess cake a veritable bargain at $20 for cake which serves 8 easily.  Bright yellow marzipan is a bit off-putting, but at the end of the day tastes identical to mint green, chosen color at Victoria Pastry in North Beach and almost everywhere else.   Schubert's prices are considerably lower than North Beach, the parking is a breeze, so a good option.   Haven't tried any other desserts here so my review is limited to their Princess Cake, as we bought one to take out to Redwood City as house gift for my son & his girlfriend.
author: Suzanne G.

description:
I am a princess... According to my father. Daddy issues aside, it is only appropriate for a princess to have princess cake on her birthday. This year for my little quarter of a century shindig I pre-ordered a larger cake to feed my liquored up patrons. The Richmond is nowhere near where I live nor work and with little time to spare, I settled for ordering over the phone. Part of being a princess is being a control freak and having a "my way or the highway" mentality. I was worried about not being able to convey my vision correctly over the phone. I didn't want to go down as the girl who fucked up her own birthday cake with her idiotic ideas.

While lime green is one of my favorite colors, I don't find it particularly appetizing so I asked if they could dye the marzipan black. The answer is no. BUT they can spray paint it black which I imagine looks much better than if they had followed my non-professional idea of using black food coloring. I also asked for minimal decorations. A few swirls here and there and the words "Princess Janelle." When I gave her my credit card info she was surprised that I was ordering my own cake but even more in shock at my sense of entitlement. 

When I saw the cake it was exactly how I envisioned it- sleek and sophisticated... dark and mysterious. Everyone thought I had purchased some heavy, flourless cake that would feel like a brick going down their esophagi. To their pleasant surprise, underneath that tough exterior was a light, fluffy, dainty baked good from heaven. Several people have asked me where I got the cake so they could also marvel in the same success as I did at my party. It  was in July and people STILL ask me about the cake.

With that said, whom do I speak with about my referral fees?
author: Janelle B.

description:
We used Schubert's for our wedding cake.  They were the most reasonably priced bakery we could find for a wedding cake.    They were able to match our color swatches almost perfectly!  And they have a set price for everything, so if you want extra stuff on your cake they do not charge you..

When we went to place our final order and pay our final deposit, it was sort of hard to get any of our questions answered.  Nobody knew the answers to anything and the baker would not talk to us......how nice!  So it made us a little worried the day of our wedding, but in the end the hotel actually told us that they were the easiest vendor to work with.

We did receive a few "your cake did not taste that great."  Thanks a lot!  Anywhooooo, our cake had a fondt icing and fondt does not taste the best, so more for the looks than the taste people!.......We spent around $500 for a cake for over 130 people, and there was still a lot of cake leftover!  One more thing, if you need a cake stand they do not have any or any to rent so you will need to buy or rent one from somewhere else!
author: J R.

description:
This is by far the bakery I would go in San Francisco to get my dessert fix.

There are plenty of choices to build a platter for a party.  You will have a great box of eye candy and real tasty treats!

Just be warned that you will sink a whole lot of dessert money if you are not conscious about how much you are willing to spend ahead of time.

My favorite is anything with berries.
author: Steven M.

description: My favorite cake place to go in in SF. Whenever there's a birthday (and every other holiday event) in the family, we get a cake from this place. I've had many different cakes from here: strawberry cheesecake, mango mousse, raspberry mousse, princess cake, tiramisu, etc. But my favorite one by far is their italian rum cake. The cakes are always fresh. I don't think I've ever been disappointed in their cakes. I'm sad I don't live in SF anymore, but since my parents still do, I still get to eat here every now and then. I will continue to come here for years and years to come.
author: Chris K.

description:
Tried one of their apple torts. The thing looked very nice but the taste was mediocre at best. 

Everything looks amazing but I wonder if it all tastes good. From my experience so so.
author: David G.

description:
I usually get a slice of Princess cake (rated 5 stars) when I'm here, but today 7/4/07 they sold out of Princess cake slice.  They had a small & a large Princess cake, but I just wanted a slice.  Oh well.  

I got instead a strawberry mousse mini cake for $3.25.  Just ok, hubby liked it & he's not a desserts person.  Rated 3 stars.
------
Updated Sun 5/18/08:
Wanted a slice of Princess Cake.  Didn't have any again.  Wtf!
Got a mango mousse mini cake $3.45.  Mango mousse is good, cake is boring.

Credit Cards taken.
author: Ann L.

description:
I HATE THIS PLACE...They have too many choices and I don't have enough money to buy everything in the cases therefore I hate this place...
I gain weight just walking by here.

Came here with a friend a couple of weeks ago and got the ham & cheese croissant and a sticky bun. Now I'm checking myself into croissant rehab. Is there a Croissant's Anonymous meeting in this city?

Pure Heaven and I dream about that damned croissant. I'm obsessed... MORE... I WANT MORE!!!
author: John A.

description:
Why have I not encountered this place after all the times I've walked around Clement? I can't even describe how awfully delicious this place looks once you walk inside. It's literally like you're in the game Candy Land. 

I finally found this place after looking for a good bakery on yelp because one of my coworkers was leaving. I tried ordering a cake the night beforehand on their website but it was a little too last-minute, so I went to pick up one in-store the next day. But their website is pretty helpful and easy to navigate. What I like most is that they have pictures for each of their cakes, so I know what I'm ordering or what I might want.

So the next morning I called in to see what cakes they had (I wanted the Swedish Princess). The girl who picked up was very nice and informative and took the time to answer all my questions (unlike some other places). The store itself is sugarcoated with cakes of different assortments and shapes and colors; you will have the hardest time deciding which one you want. You really can't go wrong with any selection.

But I decided to get the Swedish Princess cake because that is the fan favorite. I ended up getting the 10" cake, which came out to about $36 (not bad for the size and quality). I got it personalized with a message and I was out the door in 10 minutes. 

In terms of the quality of the cake, everyone loved the caked minus the marzipan (they thought it was too sweet). They just don't know what's good and what's hella good. This is hella good.

if you want to try the world's best cakes topped off with excellent customer service, just go to Schubert's.
author: David W.

description:
Okay, this review is probably totally unfair since I've only tried one thing here, and I fully intend to go back and update my review at a later time. However: we got the swedish princess cake for a birthday, and the cake itself was pretty good, but the marzipan covering was a little strange. The cake was GORGEOUS, of course. We all happily ate up our initial pieces of cake, but it must not have kept well in the refrigerator, because none of us could eat it after that... the marzipan tasted awful and had a strange consistency. We ended up tossing the rest of the cake, because no one else liked it either. This must have been a rare occurrence, because I keep hearing and reading such good things about the bakery.

Until next time, I guess!
author: Sam S.

description:
I decided to try this place after reading some yelp reviews and looking at all the pictures of the delicious looking goodies. I am happy to say I was not disappointed. I tried the Tiramisu, Neapolitan, and Chocolate Mousse cake. All were good but I loved the Tiramisu!  It was light, fluffy, sugary heaven in your mouth with each bite better than the last. In fact, just reminiscing about it makes my mouth waaateerrrrr!! I even ordered a large Tiramisu cake for the holidays and it was a favorite at dinner. 
Schubet's is located in a busy area and parking can at times be tough around there but hang in there - this place is worth it.
author: Shoshanna T.

description: All the pastries on display look so luscious that it's positively *obscene*!  While I waited for my St Honore cake, all I could hear behind me as people came in and gazed the the cakes was "wow" ... next person comes in ... "wow".  The inside looks a good bit more refined than we've gotten used to in the Richmond, so it's a very pleasant wait.  The cake was delicious.  Well worth a visit.
author: GreatAlfredini J.

description: I got the princess cake from 7x7 The Big Eat 2013, it was pretty good, subtle, not too sweet, flavorful, masterly crafted, the green icing on the outside was hella good, parents said has an almondly taste or lemonly, but it was hella good.
author: David L.

description:
Awesome cakes ! Not too sweet if you go with the right cake!

I had the Currant Cheesecake and it's really not that sweet. Just perfect. I also tried the Tiramisu on a different occasion and like every Tiramisu, its sweeeeeeet and mousse-y! hahah

Fresh, delicious pasties at a fair price. Please be sure to have a huge sweet tooth craving before you go here! Parking sucks though..
author: Helen T.

description:
My wife and I visited this bakery again last weekend. The desserts remind us why we wanted to come back here from time to time. They look good and taste equally good.
