I have always loved "Black Forest" cake, but I could rarely find it in other bakeries in the San Francisco. I am glad I can at least find it here at Schubert's. Thanks.

P.S. some cakes from the previous day may be available at a discount.
author: Benedict C.

description: This little gem is in the richmond area which is kind of odd as this area is packed with supermarkets and store mainly for the asian regions. I bought the Raspberry chocolate Mousse cake and it happened to be on special for my friend. My friend who is a dessert aficionado luved it and managed to finish it a large cake in 3 days!!! Amazing. Needless to say I visited again and got the Mango cake it was not as good as the one I got before but went well with the crowd. Its hard to find good value when it comes to desserts in SF but this one is right up there.
author: Elvis A.

description: When I was young, my mom used to always buy the sprinkled cookies, chocolate-covered moon/star shaped cookies, jelly-filled cookies, etc. from here. My goodness, they were so delicious I could finish it all within two days! Schubert's also sells seasonal cookies that are tasty, but too adorable to eat. They have a huge variety of well-decorated cakes for birthdays or any occasion. The mousse cakes are very fluffy, light and sweet. The mango or raspberry mousse cakes are the best!  I don't know how they do it, but their flower- and leaf-shaped chocolate decorations are so precise and perfectly made. I can't help but save those for the very last slice.
author: Priscilla W.

description: The princes cake is my absolute favorite!! I demand for this cake on my bday every year...truly amazing piece art. The cake is so moist and has the perfect sweetness/fruitiness to it. I'm not a big fan of cake nor sweets but this cake is a must try!
author: Landon N.

description:
This is a bustling bakery with some of the prettiest cakes I've ever seen.  One day I am going to get one for someone's birthday and knock their socks off!  There are decorative toppings spilling off the tops of these beautiful cakes.
Not being in need of a cake, we had apricot and vanilla custard croissants.  There were lovely.  I prefer croissants to any other type of pastry and these people know how to make one!  It was the perfect blend of crispy and flaky with a delicious custard that was not too sweet. 
note- It is definitely not a sit-down place.
author: Erika W.

description: I've been wanting to come to this place for a long time and finally I found myself in the City on a Saturday afternoon after a morning at the park.  Parking is a little bit of an issue as it is on all of Clement, but it's definitely worth it!  The desserts looked so beautiful and I had a TOUGH time deciding on what to eat.  We ended up taking the Princess Cake and the Raspberry White Chocolate Mousse.  Neither one disappointed.  The Princess Cake was pleasantly light compared to some of the other Princess Cakes I've had.  The mousse was quite flavorful as well.  They are very reasonably priced for such fancy, beautful, and tasty desserts.  Can't wait to go back to try more of their desserts!
author: Jeff C.

description:
The fiance and I are getting married in September of this year, and we knew, hands down, that we wanted Schubert's Bakery to help us with our wedding cake.  

Charlene, who facilitated our cake tasting, was professional, thorough and helpful.  We brought a handful of photos for inspiration, and she helped us figure out what was/wasn't doable.  

The cake tasting, by far, was the best part.  Their mousse cakes have always been our go-to cakes, and settled on the mango mousse cake for our sheet cake.  It was nice to be able to taste all of the cake flavors, and it only took us a second to settle on the chocolate truffle cake for our actual wedding cake.  

Summing it up, Schubert's makes it very easy, both in the decision-making and on the wallet, to provide your guests with a memorable and give-me-seconds cake to nosh on after dinner and in between dancing the night away.  Keep in mind, they are able to execute only so much for your wedding cake.  Bring photos, and an open mind.  

I am also so appreciative of Sabine as I've had the pleasure of corresponding with her regarding the changes to our wedding cake.  She, too, is just as professional and helpful.  

Thinking about Schubert's Bakery for your wedding cake?  Stop thinking. Make an appointment for a cake tasting- your taste buds will thank you.
author: Desiree V.

description:
This bakery is pretty far from my house but I make the drive out because I love their cakes.

It is hard to find a place that will make a good Swedish Princess Cake and NOT overdue it on the almond flavor. Theirs is one of the best I have had. 

Their cookies and other pasteries are pretty good as well but I have had better. The cakes are what you should get!

Some other must trys are...
Napoleon: Great for those who want a lighter cake...sometimes hard to eat because it uses pastry puff layers instead of cake layers. 

Italian Rum Cake: Great for those who love milk chocolate because it isn't too overpowering and it is not bitter!

Chocolate Truffle Torte: For the true chocolate fans!

Swedish princess cake: For those who want something fruitty and different!!
author: Jessica F.

description:
I was only going to give it 3 stars because I find some of the desserts a little tooooooo sweet (I know, impossible right? How the hell am I saying this?) but they have good mousse cakes.. I admit that much.

Plus, one time the baker guy (i'm not sure who he is) hit on my mom and gave her one of those mini mousse cakes. She then passed it along to me where it was greatly appreciated and devoured. Extra star for the freebie.
author: Susy C.

description:
I had been meaning to stop by Schubert's for a very long time, and finally made it out a few weeks ago...wow, this place is awesome!

The storefront isn't much to look at, but once you enter the place, it is wall to wall deliciousness.  They have tons and tons of desserts to choose from, and plenty of helpful folks behind the counter ready to help you indulge your sweet tooth.  After spending forever deciding between what seemed like a million desserts to choose from, my boo and I ordered.  I ordered the chocolate mousse with almonds, which was divine! The almonds were a perfect compliment to the oh so light, and pillowy mousse.  It was so light, I almost thought that it was good for my health :)

After completing our order, we quickly snagged one of the four tables from an old couple who couldn't walk nearly as fast as us, and enjoyed away.  

Overall, had a great experience at Schubert's and I look forward to ordering many cakes in the future for all my special occasion needs.  Keep doing what you're doing, it's splendiferous!
author: David M.

description:
You can not go wrong when you find an old school bakery that does it right and that is what you get with the Schubert Bakery. This is not a place for the latest high priced trend but if you are looking for substantial desserts made from the best and with care then come check out any of their delectable choices. For me this was for a few friends and I wanted variety so I opted for slices rather then whole cakes.

Swedish Princess Cake - This is made with many thin layers of white cake with raspberry and kirsch custard filling, whipped cream and marzipan icing. That might sound like a lot but it was a lot lighter then I had anticipated.

Black Forest Cake  - A classic combination of chocolate sponge, sour cherries, and whipped cream with kirschwasser and chocolate shavings.

Opera Cake - With a hazelnut sponge, chocolate truffle and mocha-praline filling topped with toasted almonds this was more like a light brownie then cake but still so good.

Chocolate Truffle Torte - How can you go wrong when you properly combine chocolate sponge filled with a chocolate filling, made from fresh cream and bittersweet chocolate.

Also check out their Eclair they are an amazing treat.

Okay street parking M - F if you get there before the after work rush :)
Service is polite and efficient.
author: Joseph A.

description:
Wow, Schubert's Bakery came through big time.  I needed a slamming cake or two for my gf's graduation and Schubert's mousse cakes really impressed the whole party.  I got two mousses: strawberry and mango.  They both were "cooked" or prepared perfectly and were light yet flavorful.  These guys have been around since 1911 and their quality backs up why they've been around so long.  I did prefer the mango over the strawberry as the mousse is not exactly the same for each type of mousse cake.  I will definitely be back again in the near future: to try the peach and raspberry mousses.  

I also tried the princess cake and I came away unimpressed.  It did have a good marzipan icing but it can be a bit overwhelming.  I'd say this is either you love it or hate it kind of cake.  The mousses' are what is the most popular items so stick with those if you've never been to Schubert's Bakery before.
author: Albie F.

description:
I love Schuberts!  Most birthday cakes I'd buy are from Schuberts.  I also like their cookies especially the holiday ones.  I would like to try the Neapolitan cake and Coffee Crunch next.

What Ive tried:
Napoleon
Mango Mousse 
Tiramisu 
Black Forest 
Plain Cheesecake
Chocolate Mousse with Almonds
Chocolate Truffle Torte

My faves:
Swedish Princess: white cake layers with raspberry and kirsch custard filling, whipped cream and marzipan icing
Opera Cake:  hazelnut sponge with chocolate truffle and mocha-praline filling topped with toasted almonds
author: she q.

description:
I love their mousse cakes. Their half-choco-dipped cookies are great, too. I usually get the single-serve cakes for me and Steve, but occasionally, I go all out and get a whole 6"-er. One time, I pointed out a chocolate mousse cake that I wanted.

"How many people are you serving?" the guy behind the counter asked.

"Um... just two. We just like cake."

"We don't have a problem with that."

I'm pretty sure we'll be getting our wedding cake from them next year.

UPDATE: we did get our wedding cake from them and it was delicious and they delivered it to the right place at the right time, etc, etc. The one thing that totally sucked is the way they manage cake tastings.  You show up for your appointment and you kinda wait around in this tiny store for a table to open on a busy Sunday. Along with the other couples who are there for a cake tasting. And then after you get a table, someone helps you. It's pretty chaotic.

The most IRRITATING part of it all was that the woman who was helping us kept saying, "Mm... we don't recommend that" every time we made a suggestion and she wasn't sure what the answer was.

"Could we have a chocolate fondant or ganache since it's a chocolate cake?"

"Mm... we don't recommend that. [glances at the form she's filling out] We can only do white or ivory."

"But, there's a chocolate fondant or ganache in your album."

"Uh... let me go in back and ask."

Sure enough, it was do-able.

The cake was completely worth battling through the cluelessness, however. I did see some couples leave in a huff because they weren't being waited on hand and foot. On the other hand, those bozos shouldn't be asking for fresh fruit samples for a summer wedding in the dead of winter!
author: Stacy J.

description: I love Schuberts, I always eat too much there, but its worth it. If you're visiting, just over-indulge. Their passion fruit cake is great, but nothing compares to their Princess cake - its really the best Princess Cake I've ever had.
author: Analisa S.

description: I luv Schubert's bakery!  My favorite cake here is the Swedish princess.  Whenever there is a birthday, this is my number one choice.  I live in Marin, but will make the visit to this bakery. Yuumm, mouth watering almond paste marzipan with a creamy custard and sweet and tart raspberry filling.  Every bite is truly delightful!!
author: Dannash M.

description: Lovely bakery. I've gotten the chocolate mousse cake and the mango mousse cake and both have become instant favorites.
author: Nabila S.

description:
I've been going here ever since I was a little girl, and I've always been 100% happy with my chocolate Danish. They are absolutely delicious, even better if you heat it up for a few seconds.

Also, a big fan of their mousse cakes - both fruity and chocolate ... Special bonus if there are ladyfingers around the cake!
author: Lori F.

description:
Beautiful, amazing, elegant, delicious cakes and pastries!!! Absolutely love this place. We *always* get cakes here for special occasions, birthdays, anniversaries, etc... The "petit four"s are yummy, as well as everything else they sell! I'm a fan of the little cookies and fruit tarts. Prices are totally reasonable, and in my opinion you get more than what you pay for.

Awesome.
author: Julia F.

description:
SWEDISH PRINCESS CAKE!!!!

Do you like Marzipan????? DUHHHHH. 

Do you like the color green??? OF COURSE!

I came here the day before my best friend's birthday to do a little "cake tasting" which consisted of us buying three slices of cake and sampling them at our leisure. We got the opera cake, a chocolate mousse cake and the swedish princess. Swedish princess definitely took the cake (pun intended). It's really delicious. You must try it. Don't let the color deter you, I mean it!
author: Abbey S.

description:
I'm not the biggest fan of tiramisu, of mousse cakes or tarts. And I don't like marzipan (blah!). So if you had asked me a week ago, I would tell you Schubert's dessert cakes are solid but nothing I get too excited about.

But on Thanksgiving day, when I was scrambling to find an open bakery not only was Schubert's open and ready for me but it had a buy 2 pies and get one free deal.  AND?  Their pumpkin pie was delicious!! In my teenage years, I worked at Marie Calendar's and as a result I am somewhat a bit of a pie snob. Now that I have tasted your pumpkin pie I have great respect for you, Schubert's Bakery, great respect.
author: Sarah Z.

description:
If you are in a mood for some traditional European small pastries and desserts and you happen to be in Inner Richmond around Clement St. do give this place a try.
My favorites are:  individual mousse cakes -  any flavor would do just fine, also Princes cake ( marzipan covered  whipped cream atop of a sponge cake with little bit of a raspberry preserve) opera cake for chocolate lovers with very rich velvety layers,  and the list goes on.....

Can get crowded at times so be quick to take a seat before it's too late....
author: M. M. K.

description: I just stumbled upon this place without knowing it was popular in the hood.  It's a nice little neighborhood bakery, with fancyish patisserie-style cakes and tarts as well as more American-style danish and cinnamon buns.  I had a nice, substantial raspberry and custard danish. I'd be happy if a place like this were in my neighborhood in NY!
author: Mark H.

description:
If you ever were a kid, this would be the cake shop of your dreams!  If you happen to have a kid, you can win major points by bringing them here for dessert.  And if you want to bring a really impressive cake or a box of killer cookies to a party, this is the place!  Not cheap, but worth every dime!

It's a little odd finding an old-fashioned European pastry shop in the middle of mostly-Asian Clement Street, and parking can be difficult in this neighborhood, but it's definitely worth the trip!
author: Paul S.

description:
I had the tiramisu and raspberry cheescake on my annual trip to visit friends in SF. They were delicious! Especially since I just stopped by Burma Superstar right before. But the tiramisu was light and fluffy and I could taste the coffee liqueur in the soaked lady fingers, which you must be able to taste in a good tiramasu.

The cheesecake was really rich but the tartness cut through nicely but I think it was lacking a bit more pungent cheese flavor. I had a taste of the rum cake--delicious, similar to the tiramisu but more chocolaty instead of coffee-ey. Yeah I don't think that made sense but I have a penchant for rum and liqueurs in my dessert and ice creams. Mmm rum raisin.
author: Crystal T.

description:
Great place when you need yummy cakes for parties or to spoil yourself. Plenty of flavors to pick from and their pastries are delicious as well.

-1 star for their location, b/c it is impossible to find parking on Clement!
author: Karina A.

description:
Beautifully and artistically made cakes.  Fine work of art that you don't even want to slice it because they are so beautiful.

They boast a variety of cakes from decadent chocolates to refreshing fruit and light whipped cream cakes.

My favorite is the double chocolate mousse!

They have mini sized cakes for you to sample them all if you'd like!
author: JJAMZ C.

description:
Schubert's princess cake puts a silly smile on my face.  I love everything about it, from the bright green marzipan exterior to the kirsch custard filling.  It's all very YUM!  At less than $20 for a cake that serves 6 (actually served 10 with no problems, it's a great price for a high quality cake.

They're wedding cakes are reasonably priced at $495 for a 3-tier serving 100-150 people.  However, they do charge 10% more for square cakes, another 10% for the marzipan outside, and $50 for delivery in San Francisco.  Still, Mr. O and I were willing to fork over the dough for the savory sensation.  

Unfortunately, our date was completely booked.   I would suggest booking as soon as possible.  My 5 months in advance wasn't enough time.

Parking is challenging, but worth the struggle!
author: Stella K.

description: The desserts were very tasty, don't get me wrong, they just don't warrant a 5 stars. I tried their cheesecake, mousse, and pastries, all were tasty. I definitely will go back when I am in the area.
author: Misha Z.

description: I believed the hype and got the princess cake. Other than the look, yuck! The green fondant is so badly sweet. Overpriced for something basically made out of pure sugar and food colors
author: Khoa V.

description: I was running late and I am so appreciative they stayed opened a little later so I can pick-up a Swedish Princess Cake. When I reserved the cake, I asked that they write a message and the penmanship was so neat and uniform! The cake looked green online, it was a little more yellow in real life. The taste was good, especially the raspberry jam, but it was too sweet for me. I had their strawberry shortcake at a friend's house and it was perfect with the right amount of sweetness. I will definitely be back to try their other cakes.
author: Ann H.

description:
SCHUBERT'S ROCKS MY SOCKS!

is that weird? well, it's true. i am a true sucker for schubert's Swedish Princess Cake. if the world were coming to an end tomorrow, if the inconceivable truth is more conceiveable than we think.....my dying wish is to eat an entire Swedish Princess Cake from Schubert's all by myself.
if Marie Antoinette really said what they said she did about the starving commoners that eventually led to her demise, I hope she was talking about a Swedish Princess Cake. from Schubert's, of course.
author: Lori J.

description: Schubert's has the best cakes I've ever had. I'm not exaggerating. I normally don't eat cake in general because I find them too sweet and rich, but I cannot get enough of Schubert's cakes. My favorite is their popular Swedish Princess Cake. It is so moist and fluffy, with a thin, green, marzipan shell that compliments the rest of the cake perfectly. I've tried several other cakes and they are all good. You really can't go wrong with any of them. I can't wait to try more!
author: Jessie L.

description:
I recently had two birthday cakes from Schubert's. One Princess Cake and the other Strawberry Mousse Cake

Presentation wise, princess cakes are just about the same everywhere. 
Personally, I thought there was too much raspberry jam and the marzipan was a bit too rich for me. The custard...it was missing something.  Maybe i am just used to Ambrosia's Princess' cakes, which i reallly like.

I love the presentation of the Strawberry Mousse.  The chocolate flowers that decorated the cake was beautiful and gave the cake a look of elegance.  We all loved the cake, because it was not too sweet  (perfect for the boss' birthday because he can't have too much sweets).  It was nice and light after a fulfilling lunch.  I was delicious, but the texture of the mousse was just a little too light and fluffy for me.
author: Sarah F.

description:
Love, love, love, love, love!!! 

This place has awesome cakes, by the slice, or full on cakes in different sizes. Of course, it's a little pricey but OMG, is it worth it?! YES IT IS. 

These are so delicious. I love the strawberry shortcake (which I don't think they make in full cake mode on a daily basis) and the chocolate mousse. I checked out the opera cake and that was delicious. Not a fan of the bright green princess cake at all. I think the fondant throws my taste buds for a loop.Otherwise, everything here I love. 

They also do wedding cakes. I'm pretty sure this will be a top contender for my wedding cake, if and when I need a wedding cake. 

They open early and close pretty early. If you want a cake, order ahead, or you only get to choose from what's already there. The popular ones go quick! 

I like to come in the morning and get the leftovers or the black sheeps (ones that are cut funny or look deformed) from the day before at a cheaper price. They taste like perfection still, it's just a perk at a lower price.
author: Jeannie L.

description:
Inexpensive specially for the city.
Great tasting cakes!
author: Whitney G.

description:
I've been going to Schubert's ever since I was a little kid and my family always goes here whenever there's a birthday. 

Schubert's is straight up one of my favorite bakeries or in general, one of my favorite places to go to for food. 

The double chocolate mousse takes you on a fast brain-tingling 5 sec elevator ride to Heaven and I don't know what I'd do without their Swedish princess cake. I don't think I have yet found any other princess cake to tower over their princess cakes. 

However, don't go there if you're a starving college student. Quality comes at a price and their prices are atypical of San Francisco aka not cheap. But, hey, when the parents are in town or you want to go out and celebrate...
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Smooth, creamy and you just don't care how many calories you have consumed. Simply put; a place that you go to and enjoy the great deserts.

Luckily for me, there are only 6 tables, so I use that as an excuse to not go in when all the tables are full. If you believe that, I have bridges to sell you; here and in New York.

Great fun place to stop and enjoy a piece of ...well whatever your favorite flavor is. They seem to have all the main ones covered.
PS Note about the service. Maybe someone had a bad day - because it is always friendly and pleasant the times I have been there. Common thread to most of my reviews: San Francisco doesn't have "BAD" service, for that try a place (any place almost) in New York.
Cheers for Schubert's!!!!!
author: robert g.

description: Mango mousse is good and will make you happy. I would pass on the black currant cake. A bit sour and not my taste.
author: Larry L.

description: Simply AMAZING! I always come here for birthday cakes for friends and they always have an amazing selection of mousse cakes and tarts at a great price. Excellent and efficient service as well. Only thing missing is complimentary candles for the birthday cakes.
author: Leslie C.

description: Got the cappuccino mousse the chocolate was a bit too sweet in my opinion make it hard to taste the coffee flavor overall everything else is good, good service. Going to come back and try their other cake
author: Heat L.

description:
Always a pleasure to have a pastry in the early morning and pair it was a coffee from a fine coffee shop in the area.  Don't get the Schubert's coffee, it's nothing special.

I've had the cakes as well, and they are very good!
author: Nathan E.

description: This little spot has the most delectable little cakes I've ever eaten. I was immediately obsessed after my first bite. Their variety of mousses and cheesecakes are top notch. It's impossible to not find something you like here. I've gotten a full cake here for my birthday and I was very satisfied (and elated to eat most of the cake myself). Not to mention the price is more than reasonable as well.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Too pretty to avoid and too good to stay.

The cherry danish & petit fours are my favorite today. Who knows what it will be tomorrow?
author: Bea R.

description: Ridiculously great!  One of the best chocolate cakes I've had in a long time, if ever.
author: Michon H.

description: Dito on all the Yelp 5 Star reviews.  Shubert's has some of the best cakes and pastries in the City.  Everything is delicious and beautiful.  The Bakery ladies are so sweet and helpful and there is metered parking out front. The Princess Cake is awesome.  It is the best in the Bay Area, including Copenhagen in Burlingame.  The pastry case is filled with miniature versions of some of their popular cakes.  You can try them out before ordering something for a birthday or other event.
author: Donna P.

description: Wonderful cake shop! I ordered a cake for my bff on Friday at noon and it was done the same day by 3! The lady who was helping me was really friendly and didn't mind taking a little time out to help me choose the perfect cake. The taste of the Italian Rum Cake was pretty good too. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone! 5 stars all the way!! They earned it :)
author: Crystal N.

description: My husband got me the Princess Cake for my birthday last week. Absolutely delicious. I'm usually not a fan of Marzipan, but it was very good in this cake. All of us really enjoyed it. Prices are also very reasonable. We bought a box of cookies, which we also devoured. Thank you for the deeeelicious birthday cake, Schubert's!
author: Tiffany L.

description: The Napoleon was an awesome crunchy goodness. I also got three other cake slices and they were all good. The different flavors they use on a single cake works very well together. I love how many selections they have in the store!
author: Wilbert C.

description:
I have been wanting to check Schubert's out since my Anutie raved about how yummy her Swedish Princess birthday cake was. Then someone brought a Black Forrest cake to another family function. I was like this is IT i have to go there!

I was on a Sweets hype on Sunday, and i just happened to be headed on 19th Ave towards the GG Bridge. I thought a slight detour will be completely worth getting a sweet something...

I pulled up right in front (yay there was a space!) went inside and was floored by the selection. The BEST part is that there are little MINI cakes, or a decked out slice of all (well, maybe not all - but DAMN near!) the flavors!!

I picked a Mango Mousse -mini cake, Tiramisu -mini cake, and Neapolitan -decked out slice for my family to share. 

WOW!! Absolutely 100% what i was craving!!! I will be back!!!
author: Sara C.

description:
I love this place so much!  When I was on a princess cake craving that lasted about 4 months I would come here Saturday mornings and get said cake and eat it throughout the week.

All of the cakes are as they should taste.  Perfectly made every time.  Only thing is that parking is a pain and they aren't opened later.  But other than that this place is heaven.
author: Vicky C.

description: I tried the chocolate torte and the chocolate mouse cakes. As a chocolate lover I actually preferred the mousse cake-tasted more chocolatey than the torte. I had wanted o try the famously Swedish princess cake but they were sold out. The cakes are very pretty but for the price per slice, the cake was good, not great. I think it's a very solid classic bakery, and great for casual celebration cakes but probably not the first choice for a very special occasion.
author: Piper W.

description:
Schubert's! A friend of mine had mentioned this place and since we were meeting for dinner nearby I came in to check it out. A lot of choices and even though there is a chalkboard with prices it doesn't help much. Lines form quickly but move just as fast, and the woman assisting me was patient which was much appreciated. I brought back these small pieces of cake - forgot their names - of chocolate, vanilla and lemon (yum!) and a fruit tart which was generously covered with fruit. mmmmm...

They take credit cards but it's Clement street so bring cash since the machine wasn't working at the time. They should have a sign at the door or inform customers right away that their machine isn't working, otherwise people are in an awkward situation since I don't know where the nearest ATM is.

It would be nice if they were open past 6 - they could potentially get more of the after-work crowd if they were.
author: Liz S.

description:
This weekend was just a madhouse of eating adventures.  Many were really good and we all had fun.  I had to act like a tour guide of SF, even though I am from OC but I know my way around the city.  It was a lot of fun.  My sister went to the Oscars and left me in the city, so I made the most of it by having a feast! lol 

One of our stops was Schubert's Bakery because I saw a lot of people rave about it online.  Did I have high hopes? Nah. Did I keep an open mind? Sure.  I have passed by this place many times before when I came to Clement and now I finally made it the goal for the day.  It was towards the end of the day so there were less choices of cake and my friend bought the last ones of a few I wanted! Darn him and his gf! lol j/k

I got the Tropical Mousse, Chocolate Truffle, Strawberry Shortcake, and Opera Cake.  Even though the Opera Cake was not labeled, I recognized it and my friend was surprised.  As a serious foodie, I know my cakes.  O=9 Besides I normally love the Opera Cake at Porto's, cheap and good.  This bakery really reminded me of Porto's down in LA for cakes.  Each slices was just a little under $3.50 so not too bad of a deal in SF.  

The SS was refreshing and light.  It was not overly sweet and creamy.  I liked the different take on the Opera Cake as well.  There were a lot more nuts and I thought it was good.  You can taste the nutty hazelnut flavor.  The TM was not bad.  It must have been a passion fruit mousse.  The outer layer of the cake was chewy but the center is soft and moist.  Not bad since I didn't get to have the Mango Mousse.  The CT is very chocolatey and rich.  It is probably best to have a glass of milk to pair.  

If I have a sweet tooth or cake craving next time and don't want to spend too much money then I'd go here for sure.
author: Kat L.

description:
LOVE this lil bakery.  I live a few blocks from this place which is deadly, but I can't help passing by this place without getting something! My boyfriend loves the neopolitan cake and my favorite is the strawberry cheesecake.  We usually get individual slices (3.75/slice) or sometimes the mini cakes.  Their cakes are the perfect lil dessert or pick me up after a long day.  I really like how the cakes aren't too sweet, but just right.  There is always a line at this place and sell out by the end of the day, so get there early. 

If I'm really craving something but can't get there until after work, I call ahead to make sure they set something aside...that's how I roll!
author: Cherie A.

description:
You know u want it bad when u use your 1 hr lunch break to go all the way to Clement from South SF just to buy cakes! Yup...I was craving Schubert's Tiramisu and Swedish Princess cake soo badly that I just had to get some ASAP! U know the saying "never go grocery shopping when you're hungry..." well in this case "never go to a bakery shop when you're hungry." hahhahaha...I ended up getting myself 2 Tiramisu, 2 Swedish Princess cake, 1 Mango Mousse, 1 Strawberry Mousse and 1 Double Chocolate Mousse. and yes folks...it is all for ME! there was no event, no special occasion type of thing...it is ALL FOR ME! I asked the lady to put it in a smaller box and she looked at me weird and just said "it won't fit." hahhahhaa...damn..sooner later if I keep going back to this place...I won't be able to fit into my jeans! LOL! 

I have found my favorite bakery in SF and I am not planning to stop eating these super yummy cakes anytime soon! Well maybe if I gain one jean size....hahhahhaha whatever! life is too short so make this place one of your "MUST TRY" bakery before u die type of thing :)
author: Rika K.

description: OMG Strawberry cheescake, so yummy. Shaved strawberry chocolate on top. We had about 6 cakes from this place at a party yesterday. Its incredible. They all looked and tasted amazing. Can't wait to go again
author: Madrone H.

description:
my office is only 2 doors down fm this place i call heaven. 

the people are friendly, the cakes are yummy. our office nvr settles for anything other than Schuberts cake for desserts!

Yana, Laura and whoever work there ROCKS!
author: Elly G.

description:
I have this friend (you may remember him as "Norman" from the Bamboo restaurant review) who doesn't like chocolate.  I've always said that I can never date anyone who dislikes chocolate, so we're just friends.  For Christmas, I got him a few random gifts, and he said that he had a gift for me too.  Sweet.  We planned on doing the gift exchange after Christmas, when both of us were done with our holiday travels.

A few days after the holidays, I got a text from Norman.  He'd eaten my present.

At first, I was totally cool about it, because I figured it was probably just some baked goods (I usually bake him banana nut bread from scratch).  Then he told me that he'd gotten me the holiday pack of Ferrero Rochers (my FAVORITE chocolates EVAR), and that it was the 16- or 18-pack, in the shape of a Christmas tree.  It was just sitting there, waiting to be given to me, and he was just too tempted to eat it, so he did.

"I thought you didn't even like chocolate!"
"I don't.  But these were just sitting there.  And they were REALLY GOOD."

So, I happened to be in the Inner Richmond one morning and after getting some dim sum, I decided that there was no way I could leave Clement St. without stopping by Schubert's.  I dropped in and picked out the Swedish Princess cake, butter cookies, Tiramisu and a chocolate hazelnut mousse cake (the latter are made into individual cakes rather than slices, like the SP).

Oh my good glory, the chocolate hazelnut mousse cake tasted EXACTLY like a scrumptious cake-version of a Ferrero Rocher chocolate!  It was a fluffy chocolate mousse inside, with a rich chocolate ganache on the outside, and it was coated with chopped hazelnuts.  Party in my mouth.

So, TAKE THAT, Norman!  I don't need your holiday gift pack of Ferrero Rochers!  I've got Schubert's now, and ohhhh it is wonderful!
author: Tori S.

description:
I'm 8 months pregnant and all the baby wants is PRINCESS CAKE PRINCESS CAKE PRINCESS CAKE. The only place I've ever experienced true bliss when eating this delectable cake is at the Palo Alto Baking Company in Palo Alto (California St). I've tried it from several other places and something is always off about it, too much whipped cream, not enough custard cream, etc. 

I found Schubert's on Yelp and called to ask them how many Princess Cakes they had that day, they said they usually have about 12 in a variety of sizes. I asked them when it was made, that morning they said, so I had them put aside an 8 in cake for me. 

It was scrumdidlyumptious! 4 stars for a slightly too thick layer of marzipan on the outside edges. The cake was huge and fairly cheap for that size ($27). PABC charged close to $40 for the same size. Other than that, it was EXACTLY what the baby wanted. Pregnant mommy craving very satisfied.
author: Suzy S.

description: I have found my new favorite birthday cake and that is the Swedish princess cake. I like the whipped cream cakes better than the frosted cakes.
author: Priscilla K.

description:
They have the best mango mousse cake EVER! My mama loves this place so much, every time a family event occurs I will come here and order the mango mousse cake "just for her". :)

I can call in on the actual day and place my order in.  They will have it ready by the time I get off work or before the BIG dinner event.  

Parking is difficult and you do not want to double park and risk a ticket. I would suggest getting dropped off by a friend, it can take about 15mins plus to even get to the cashier and pick up/pay.  

This place deserves a 5 star rating, but the staff here doesn't look to happy when I pick up the cake,. it could be that its the end of the work day,. but I would appreciate a SMILE and a warm greeting THANKS!
author: Chanel L.

description:
It's not a birthday without a cake from Schubert's!  

I don't care about red velvet or ice cream or cakes shaped like body parts or Hello Kitty and friends--I want my gold-speckled opera birthday cake from Schuberts! Fancy pants wants fancy schmancy Schubert's! (try saying that 5 times fast.............)

Cakes here are just classy.  They're not *cute*-- they're straight up gorgeous, and adorned with elaborate details and taste just as fahhhbuloussss
author: Tokki M.

description:
Schubert's is fantastic. i've been here numerous times for cakes and I'm a huge fan of their tiramisu. The princess cake is a bit too sweet for me, but I really have to commend them for their tiramisu. Their other cakes and pastries also look great and the girls working here are very pleasant and friendly.

I think the price is fair for what you get, and plus the ordering online option was easy peasy. I think I've gotten two birthday cakes from here, and both were yummy! I also buy fresh ladyfingers (2 dozens) when I want to make my own tiramisu (around $5!) and they always turn out wonderful! I love Schuert's! :)
author: M J.

description: This review is only for the Napolean.  Hands down, the best I've ever had.  Crispy and flaky layers w. an amazing custard, hint of strawberry jam and the freshest strawberries.  Nice touch w. the lady fingers on the outside of the cake.  Worth every $30 for a 10 incher.
author: Ricky C.

description: Over priced and over rated. Cakes here are mediocre and a bit too sweet. Probably will not be back.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Hands-down, best cakes and desserts.  

I always, always get birthday cakes from here.

I can't resist getting something, if I happen to walk by them...whether it's a slice of cake, some petit-fours or some butter cookies...

A bit on the high end of prices but top-notch quality, great presentation, friendly service.  

They have a nice on-line site, where you can order cakes too.  :-D

Sweet stuff...but not overly sweet.  I want a slice of cake now... NomNomNOM!
author: Fannie S.

description:
Wow. This place has a 4.5?! Out of 500+ reviews?! Totally deserved! My family has been getting cakes here for AGES, and EVERYTIME it is beyond wow!

We've gotten cakes here for just about every relative's birthday feeding up to as many as 50 people and EVERY cake is always PERFECT. 

Everything is delicious and gorgeously decorated. 

A 10inch-ish diameter cake (that's done SUPER well and can feed maybe 8 people) will cost you somewhere between $18-$30ish -- and it is worth every single penny. 

The details are tremendous and incredibly fresh.

I recommend:
- Fruit Tarts (the BEST fruit tarts I've ever had)
- Mango Mousse cakes
- Napoleans 

Yes. This is a MUST. Come here to get your cake for every occasion!
author: Gail N.

description:
So delighted to use a local favorite for our wedding cakes!

Instead of going with a typical wedding cake, we elected to have multiple beautiful Schuberts cakes.  We set up a three-level tier with a (white) princess cake, then a mango cheesecake, then a chocolate truffle torte.  We also ordered add'l cakes for serving.  

The cakes were (of course) perfectly delicious, beautifully decorated + marked with our monogram, ready exactly on time, and received nothing but RAVE reviews from the guests.

I highly recommend Schuberts for all occasions for delicious cakes and excellent customer service!!
author: M P.

description:
Schubert's has been around forever!  I grew up on Clement, and I remember coming here on my way home after school.  YUM!

My most recent favorites:
- mango mousse and raspberry mousse cakes - delish!
- princess cake - fluffy inside with wonderfully delicious marzipan

They're super nice!  I bought a small princess cake for dinner with friends to meet their new baby girl.  From the message, they could tell it was for a baby, and they added all these cute little decorations for free!  There was a duckie, some baby booties, and a "It's a girl!" sign.  It was adorable!  :)

In terms of price - more expensive than a Chinese bakery, but really quite reasonable compared to other western bakeries of its caliber.
author: Fontane L.

description:
I can't remember never NOT having a birthday cake from here and I am going to be 25 in september (definitely having another cake). I remember when I turned 6.. my cake was white filling with strawberries and had little toy cats and pink ducks on the top! =D

So.. beautiful delicious amazing pastries and cakes.. You will NOT be disapointed. Prices are reasonable for the end product you get. mini mango mousse cakes? chocolate and pistachio filling? fruit and custard tarts? sugary merengue ghosts for halloween? A-freakin-mazing.

Even if you just drop by for a coffee and a croissant.. delicious. The staff is always helpful and friendly, its a clean place and everyone's in a great mood! 

Every birthday with my family means a cake from schuberts.. and hey, a quick tip: want to impress your significant others family who are not from the city? give them a dark chocolate and rasberry mousse cake covered in lady fingers, dark and white chocolate shavings, and chocolate flowers and sticks... they will LOVE you forever. You CAN get to people's hearts with food! especially food from Schubert's!
author: Diana R.

description: Who doesn't like Schubert's? My mom loves their St. Honore cake because it's not too sweet.  I just love their chocolate truffle tort and the Italian Rum.  Can't wait to try their opera cake but the last time I was there, they were sold out!
author: Kevin L.

description:
So many beautiful, beautiful cakes. 

They are gorgeous and whimsical and look to have been created in a fairy tale.

These delights? They taste even better.
author: Brittney G.

description:
This place is GREAT. 

I've come here to get special cakes for occasions or for just dessert during the day. 

My favorite is the strawberry shortcake. But I am also a fan of the opera cake, the napoleon, neopolitan, chocolate mousse, and others. I've only disliked one cake which was the princess cake. 

I also once got a peach mousse cake for a friend's birthday because it has a smiley face on it and I was told that it was delicious also. 

They have morning specials out in the morning which are cheaper priced cakes that were leftover from the day before. The cakes are still really good but you get them for cheaper!
author: Jenny L.

description:
I LOVE, LOVE their strawberry shortcake!

It's not just a typical strawberry shortcake, they really know how to make it good!  Their presentation is also excellent!

They are my favorite place to go to for birthday cakes!
The only thing I have to say, is that there really is no place to sit and hang out- which is OK by me, as I would rather be a PIG and order more to eat at home......
author: Alvin M.

description: went today to give their cake a try, since we pretty much got used to our "ice cream cake placed called tuckers back in alameda" so my brother and i decide to come out to sf to get my dad a cake for his birthday! the lady who helped us was super friendly. she had help me pick out the cake and suggested what was kids friendly for my nieces! was going to order a bigger one but lucky we didnt cause we still had a lot left!
author: Winnie C.

description: OMG! this place is to die for!! NOT to mention scary good!you forget about calories, sugar and everything else.... everything here is delicious. They are def the best bakery in the bay area! you have got to try this place!!!
author: Kajal P.

description: We picked up various pastries to indulge my 8 year old niece's wish to have high tea during the summer. With several folks who are careful with their sugar intake, we were pleasantly surprised that they were not too sweet, just right. Service was helpful and patient.
author: Jennie K.

description:
Been coming here for years. 

Princess Cake $2.95  (update: The new price is $3.45)
Mango Mousse Cake $2.95  (not sure if they raised the price on this one)

Both are amazing!!! =D
author: Cupcake s.

description:
o heck, I'll write one for Schubert's!
It's an old time, neighborhood favorite of mine!
It is very similar to Sheng-Kee but with a diffterent flare!  I love it!
Yes. Jennifer C. couldn't have put it any other way.  Just go all the way if you're gonna treat yourself, and may as well do it right..at Schubert's!! 

I love the little pastries and mini cookies they have too! Yum! I like almost everything they offer! I could totally overdose on cake if I could sit there all day, chatting with someone! I'm gonna try that Pink Champagne cake next time!  But I've always been happy with their mango, raspberry or peach moouse cakes!
author: Tu L.

description: I'm actually German, and the blackforest cake at Schuberts is better than many I've had in Germany. Mad kudos, this place is amazing, and beautiful.
author: Barbara S.

description: I was cake hunting for my birthday. I wanted something both pretty and delicious. After an hour worth of research of the most reviewed cake bakeries in sf, I found a winner. I chose the Napoleon. Come on, rum custard, strawberries, some chocolate shavings, lady fingers? It already sounds scrumdidilyumptious. We bought the 8 in. The cake was heavy in terms of weight. Although it was a massive cake, it was semi sweet, not heavy whatsoever. I had a group of twelve to share with and many people were asking me where my bf got the cake. They loved it ! Definitely coming back the next time I need a cake.
author: Becky Q.

description: I got the mango mousse cake for my birthday from here and it was delicious! The mousse is very light, not too sweet, and not too tart. The cake base was also really good except there were too little cake base. The mousse cake was essentially 1/5 cake and 4/5 mousse. I wish it would've been more like 3/5 cake and 2/5 mousse.
author: LeTran B.

description:
My frosted sunflower sugar cookie was dry, yo.
$3.45 for dry.
No thanks.
author: Lauren S.

description: You can not go wrong with Schubert's, I have not tasted a cake I've not liked. I've started out with the mouses and ventured to their cakes, nothing is too overly sweet, the sponge of the cakes itself are of a nice light moist darn-near-perfection consistency. This is the go-to place for cakes for my family and friends as well, because of the relatively affordable prices (most bang-for-your-buck), and compared with the super trendy/popular bakeries in SF such as Tartine's (which is good stuff), they don't charge you $50 + for a cake that would just feed 8-10 people or less. My two friends ordered their wedding cake from Schubert's and it was the opera (I believe) or 7-layer cake, and the chef where the reception was held had to ask where the cake came from because it was the best he's tasted - It was perfect blend of layers of chocolate, coffee, nutty flavors. As the bakery will proclaim their specialty is the Swedish Princess Cake, which my pals got for my birthday and it is too delicious!!! Again the Marzipan or almond paste is tasty and not too sugary. Go ahead try it for yourself....
author: L V.

description:
Tastey little bakery morsels that are eye candy for sure. The little cakes are deelish.
I have not tried the coffee. The little triangular pastries  filled with apricot are fantastic for breakfast. Pop 'em in the toasty. 
Update 3/5/08, the hot cross buns, apple filled croissants are excellent.
author: Bert K.

description:
ORGASMIC. 
Schubert's probably has THE best chocolate mousse cake in the world. I always get the big chocolate mousse cake for my birthday and I never get tired of it. The chocolate is rich but in a semi-sweet way, so you don't gag from eating too much. It is really creamy and soft and they sprinkle nuts and raspberries on top and it's just a piece of heaven. Seriously one of the best bakeries ever.
author: Christine A.

description:
Since this is pretty much the ONLY breakfast place on Clement that isn't CASH ONLY this was a regular stop on the way to the bus. Really yummy freshly baked chocolate croissants and strong coffee. 

Everything in the cases looked amazing! Even the cookies shaped and decorated like watermelons. The descriptions of the cakes made my mouth water. If I'm ever having a party, I'm definatly coming here to get one of the strawberry cakes!
author: AL S.

description: Strawberry custard shortcake. Enough said.
author: Linda H.

description: It was delicious!!! I love their mango cheese cake!! :)
author: Hannah K.

description: they have really cute cakes. it;s about the same as ambrosia and victoria bakery. but their cakes actually smile at you.  (see photo).  this place can get really crowded and i think a lot of people order their wedding cake here because everytime i'm here, someone is looking at the wedding cake menu.  i usually get my princess cake (well i order this cake everywhere i go) but i get the mango mousse here and the tiramisu!.  the tiramisu is very light which i like because it give me room to eat another slice of cake.  i wish they were open late.. i would like to go here after dinner burma superstar but they closed so early!
author: Belinda C.

description:
Most of their cakes are AMAZING! You must try this place out once! I have to be honest that I only got the small dessert cakes but they were pretty awesome cause they were chocolatey and I LOVE chocolate!!

You must try their small cakes. Very tasty but the mousse isn't as light as I'd like it to be.
author: Daniel L.

description: Two words. Princess Cake. Bought the first one while vacationing and came back for business 2 weeks later and snuck another one on the plane to bring back home. They are just that good.
author: Jon W.

description:
Have loved this bakery since childhood!
Swedish Princess marzipan cake, fruit mousse, chocolate mousse, cookies, etc. Beautiful!
author: Bunny C.

description:
I have been dreading writing this review, because having to relive the memory of Schubert's without having it readily accessible is so painful. Am I being too dramatic? Always. But this place was seriously amazing. 

They had me at "Almond Tart." I'm not even sure if that's what it's called, but it was this delicious crumb cake topped with sliced almonds and then glazed over. It was so good---and good thing all the tables inside were taken up by old Asian women, because I didn't have to suffer the embarrassment of having people see my reaction to the almond tart. Yeah, it was that good.

Also tried the Chocolate Mousse with almonds - did I mention that I love almonds? The top layer of the dessert was mousse, which was fluffy and not too sweet. I appreciated that. The bottom of the thing was cake, which was equally moist and amazing.

Just two desserts in and I am a die-hard fan of Schubert's. You know it's bad when you're licking your finger, in an effort to pick up little morsels of crumbs to eat. Yummy!
author: Catherine C.

description: my dessert haven.
author: Patricia K.

description:
My aunt took me here and when I asked her what's good to get here, she said, "Everything!"

I ordered the cinnamon bun and almond tart. I found the cinnamon bun a bit on the sweet side for my taste, but the almond tart was delicious! Moist, not too sweet, and there seemed to be a thin layer of apricot jam along the bottom. The actual shop is cute too. I'm not often in the Clement St. area, but if I am, I'd definitely stop by again.
author: Rosann Y.

description: we ordered a black forest cake; the cake itself was too spongy, not dense the way a good German cake should be. Very disappointed.
author: Miss T.

description: Their mousse cakes are to die for and surprisingly reasonably priced. For a special occasion, this is the place I go.
author: Ms. M.

description:
I LOVE CAKE! As long as it's good cake, I don't want any of that nasty Safeway or supermarket cake! I think I've found a new place for yummy cake in the Bay.

We went right as they were about to close so there wasn't that much to choose from but it was still really good.

Currant Mousse Cake. I loved how creamy the mousse was, but it was a little on the sour side from the tanginess of the currant. The cake was also really soft and spongey. I liked it, though I think I would have preferred it sweeter.

Tiramisu. One of the best tiramisu cakes I've ever had. For $3.45 it tasted as good if not better than the $8 tiramisu's from Postino's in Lafayette, totally worth it! The amount of chocolate and espresso in it is just right and it wasn't too sweet. YUM! 5 stars alone just for the tiramisu! IT'S THAT GOOD!

I can't wait to go back and try their mango mousse and princess cakes.
author: Constance C.

description:
I love Schubert's! Love all their cakes especially the Swedish princess cake! Love their service! Did I say I love Schubert's?!

It can always be busy in this place, and the best way to avoid the crowd is to either order online or call in your order in the morning and just pick it up later in the afternoon.
author: Ria C.

description:
Finally! I've been searching for a bakery in SF for so long. Ok, I haven't been actively looking but there have been a few occasions when I needed some delicious cakes. and I found it!

Schuberts, or Schubertos as I call it, is great. It's a small, neighborhood place with great, delicious, amazing cakes. I recommend the double chocolate mousse, yum!
author: Sandi V.

description: My sweet tooth begs for Schubert's Bakery! They have a great variety of pastries and cakes. I love this place because everything I've ever bought was sinfully good (especially their chocolate mousses). The portions are just right for a single serving as well as sharing with your favorite person :]
author: Andrew C.

description: Probably the most legendary cakes In SF.  As a kid, my mom used to always get a small one for my birthday. They are pricey, but for special occasions there's nothing else like it! The cakes are all as delicious as they are beautiful. My favorite that I've had so far is the mango mousse.
author: Roger L.

description: They make the BEST princess cake I have ever tasted. We've had one or two of their other cakes, but the marzipan covered princess is delicious in a drive-across-town-using-any-excuse-to-purchase-one kind of way.
author: Nomi W.

description:
Get the CHOCOLATE MOUSSE with STRAWBERRIES CAKE! (This cake seriously deserves some praise on Yelp!)

I agonized for days about what cake to buy my mom for her birthday. She likes chocolate and fresh fruit. I decided on the chocolate mousse cake with strawberries. There were NO reviews for that cake on Yelp, so I felt like I was taking a risk by not ordering one of the tried-and-true ones (i.e. strawberry mousse, mango mousse, etc). 

The cake was PERFECT. My family thought it was better than our town bakery that we've been going to for decades! The cake was moist, the mousse was rich but not too sweet, and the fruit was fresh!

I've also tried the tiramisu and it is yum. My husband's go-to birthday cake is the lemon mousse. Next on my list is the black forest... can't wait to go back for more!
author: Cyndi L.

description:
Best cakes ever!

Have had birthday cakes from here for the past two years which have put everyone in raptures.  The only drawback is that the guests wind up devouring the cake so there's barely anything left over when really all you want to do is hoard it all for yourself ;)
author: Femita J.

description:
Schuberts is my go to place when I need a cake- the swedish princess is sooo good with the strawberry filling and marzipan top. Prices are reasonable, people are friendly, online ordering/pick up is hassle free. 

I recently ordered a cake online and used the portions guide to pick my size but probably shouldn't have. The cake I got was WAY TOO BIG and I ended up spending $80 on a cake when I probably could've just spent $40. Not that anyone was complaining...parking is also kind of a pain, but I will return for more cakes in the future.
author: Inna L.

description:
Very pleased to find a decent cake shop in the neighborhood, though not a place I would go to sit down and enjoy cake - definitely a take-out place for me (too many Chinese grannies). But a great selection of cakes in a variety of sizes, reasonably priced. They were busy this morning but had plenty of staff working (all of them helpful and efficient) and they made me feel that changing my mind a few times and having a birthday message added to my cake was no trouble at all. I've so far only tasted a couple of their cakes and although they are far from being the best tasting cakes I've ever had, they're not bad and they score highly for presentation. 
Will definitely be back for more!
author: Izzy A.

description: Ordered chocolate cake online.  I picked it up and it was better than I hoped - lots of deep chocolate flavor and elaborately decorated.  When I picked up the cake (my first visit into the store), they had dozens of other beautiful cakes too.  I'm definitely going back as soon as current sugar-high subsides.
author: Randy G.

description: This is where it all started. My obsession with marzipan & all things marzipan related (i.e. solvang slice from Copenhagen Bakery in b-game, Ritter Sport Marzipan chocolate squares, etc.) The BFF introduced me to their Swedish princess cake about 5-6 years ago & I've been hooked ever since. I've had princess cake from countless other bakeries but Shubert's was my first and still ranks as one of the best. For my birthday a few years ago, the BFF showed up at my house with my favorite 6 inch cake, some candles & insisted on not just singing "Happy Birthday" to me but also on leaving me all alone with all that cake. It was gone by the next day. Thank you Shubert's for burdening me with a life long addiction to princess cakes. I guess I could be addicted to worse things (like beautiful men with commitment issues...)
author: Fancypants X.

description:
These cakes are absolutely beautiful and very very delicious. It was my soon to be brother in laws bday so I decided to pick up the Opera cake...it was my first time trying it and boy was it a HIT! If you love hazelnuts like I do...you will love it! 

The only issue is the parking....Clement street is packed all day!!!

Sooooooooooo good...my mouth waters just thinking about it!
author: Michelle Y.

description:
We had Schubert's provide us with cakes for our wedding.
A fairly large order, all of the cakes were prepared to the same high standard you would expect of any of their range. Most importantly, they were ready for us at the time they had specified. With a wedding day to coordinate any delay could have been a problem and it was a relief to be able rely on Schubert's Bakery.

These guys are true professionals and I would recommend them to anyone.
author: Kes A.

description: Their cakes so soooooo unbelievable decadent and scrumptious. I come probably once a week to buy 2-4 of their slices/mini cakes. It's addicting! Their tiramisu and Italian rum are to die for. The neopolitan and chocolate mousses are soo good. Friendly service. Come here if you're craving sweets and cake!! They'll have you hooked!
author: Jewlz L.

description:
Besides being one of the last old-world bakeries around, and having some of the best cakes for all occasions, Schubert's also has a fantastic online ordering system.

I needed a cake for a friend's birthday so I went to the Schubert's website to find their hours.  I was surprised to see they have a very sophisticated online ordering system for every cake and pastry they make.  There are photos and descriptions of all the cakes as well as a long list of message suggestions for how to personalize it.  As long as you place your order at least 48 hours in advance, you can order any cake, personalize it and pre-pay online.  
 
I wanted one of their famous Strawberry Shortcakes, but did not want all of the assorted fruit decorations they usually pile on top.  I wrote a note in the 'comments' section specifying only chocolate decorations on top, and hoped for the best.  I showed up at the bakery at my chosen time and not only was the cake ready and decorated exactly how I had asked, but I got to skip the line, my cake was put in a bag and out the door I went.  I was out of there in under a minute!  That's a big bonus when you're double parked in the chaos of Clement Street.

Schubert's has kept their delicious history and quality intact while still keeping up with the times.  Long may they reign!
author: SFnativeGal ..

description: This place makes super great cakes. I usually get birthday cakes here. The cakes have very good flavor and they are really fresh. The decorations on the cakes are beautiful. I like how they write happy birthday on a piece of chocolate to put on the cake.
author: Alexander L.

description: 5 stars for the cakes.  The cakes were excellent.  The service horrible.  We went in and tried different slices of their cakes for a birthday party.  When I called to order I asked if the vanilla cake on the italian rum could be substituted for a different flavor the answer no.  I was a little shocked.  I thought maybe it was someone who was misinformed.  I called and asked to speak to a manager to place my order.  I hear the manager in the background say "is it a caterer? is it a hotel? no then handle it."  What a great "manager" with such great customer service!  Needless to say no matter how good the cakes are does not make up for the horrible service.
author: Paul Z.

description:
I got a birthday cake from my friend (see review below), and it was the perfect way to kick off my weekend! 

First off, when I heard the story that my birthday cake was made by the co-owner (Ralph) as a courtesy to my friend, I was really impressed. He basically took the time to read my friend's review, and thought of solutions to improve our opinions of his bakery. I'm a fan! 

Secondly, the cake I got was delicious. It was a tiramisu cake lined with white and dark chocolate pieces along the sides. The tiramisu had just enough hint of coffee and made to perfection. I think the chocolate pieces on the sides were a great complement as well to the rest of the cake. I enjoyed it thoroughly and finished it by the end of the day. Thank you Ralph for making my birthday cake so special!
author: Amy N.

description:
In high school, the classic cheese cake was under two dollars and I would buy myself a slice after-school whenever I wanted a slice of heaven. Best cheesecake I've had, to date.

I hated the Swedish princess cake the one time I got it years ago under a friend's recommendation. I thought the weird green outing was just gross. The mouse is above average and definitely delicious, but not the best I've had. Good selection of pastries as well, but again not my favorite. But a million stars for the cheesecake! (even after the price increase.)
author: Shirley X.

description: Princess cake and the chocolate mousse cake! Awesome!!
author: Lisa M.

description: After cycling at Crissy Field and burning some calories, we decided to get some sugar added and maybe get some coffee. The place itself is very small and expect long lines but it is very quick since service is very efficient. I ordered a slice of Princess Cake it is very sweet. I got a sugar rush after a bite. I think I prefer the  cappuccino cake which is nice and great taste of coffee. The chocolate truffle is also very sweet and we cannot finish the slice. We hope to get coffee here but not enough table and some customer just sit down forever with 1 cup of coffee.
author: Sam M.

description:
Great cake! Love what the place has to offer. Drove all the way from San Mateo to pick up the Napoleon cake for my husband's birthday. The cake is to die for. Pastry with custard, fresh fruits and surrounded with lady fingers. Ooohhh la la! I'm only giving 3 stars for the place because of very very poor service. From the moment I placed the order by phone, ATTITUDE of this younger girl working there is so appalling. When I picked up the cake, I'm pretty sure it's the same girl that I spoke to over the phone that was also at the counter. No smile. No warm greeting. Her service was so bad! I saw the other people working there and they seem pleasant with their customer except this chick. 
If it weren't for the great cake, I would go somewhere else that wants my business. 
And there my friend, you get 3 stars. Find better employees and you'll get 5 stars.
author: Princess C.

description:
Why couldn't they just call it the Prince cake.....and then maybe add purple rain drops to it or something.  It makes me think twice about buying a cake for a dood's birthday when it's called the princess cake.  

However, it's not really a problem buying it for a girl.  Dilemna Dilemna.  Each time I've come here its been for buying a birthday cake.  They make the process so easy, especialy since you know you've had their cake before and you know how good they are.  The princess cake is pretty bomb and the opera is just great for hazelnut lovers.  The presentation is good,and they always have fair priced candles for you to buy so you dont' have to scramble somewhere else to get one.
author: Vincent K.

description:
one star is harsh but forgetting my order is harsher!

i called over the phone to place an order, it was a lady with an accent who answered. took it down and everything. but when i went to pick it up the next day, no evidence of my order =((((

i ordered the coffee crunch and i guess they don't usually have that one so there wasn't even a replacement for it! bummed since i was getting it for my bf's mom's bday, and she only really likes things coffee flavored.

disappointed. i'll remember you! lady with an accent!
author: Christine M.

description:
My roommate's boyfriend got her a chocolate truffle torte for her birthday. The cake was beautifully decorated and the chocolate flower-shaped candies that topped the cake gave it that special birthday feel. 

However, my first bite into the cake overwhelmed me. Though the cake was perfectly moist, it was too sweet for my taste. I felt like I needed a gallon of milk because of the overdose of chocolate. 

I read the rave reviews about the bakery, but wasn't too impressed-maybe it was just that specific cake I had. I would not recommend the chocolate truffle torte if you are not into overly sweet things.
author: Surge C.

description: This place is bar-none the best bakery for cakes in the City.  I have been fortunate to try the Princess, Mango Mousse, Chocolate Truffle and Opera cakes.  The Princess and Mango Mouse were my favorites.  Both are fresh and scrumptious with a light, fluffy texture that is not overly sweet.  I typically don't eat cake because it is too thick or sugary.  Not here - I can eat an entire slice and still want more. I am looking forward to trying out some more of the mousse flavors and am secretly hoping to try the black currant or tropical mousse for my birthday.
author: Mimi C.

description: Yummy bakery on Clement street. Perfect for birthdays! Try the Mango mouse or chocolate truffle, you won't be disappointed. We sometimes grab some food on clements and end up there to have desert. You can actually eat there as well. They sell individual portion so you can try different kind of cakes. I give it 5 start because of the quality, price and variety of cakes they have:)
author: David L.

description: These are amazing cakes. Perfect amount of sweetness. I bought 5 different cakes n they were all great..except for the mango cheesecake. The cake was dry n crumbly/ gritty.  Overall the experience was fun n I would def go back!!
author: Cecilia G.

description:
We got our wedding cake from Schubert's it was delicious and so beautiful. The design was simple but really pretty, and the colors perfect! 
The cake was so much better than the sample we tasted, it was flavorful, sweet and moist! The perfect cake, I would recommend this place to anyone who really appreciates sweet and heavenly cake!
author: Christina L.

description: It's a decent, strong 3 3/4 star Chinese European bakery. It is good and different from your regular Chinese bakery but it's not Schuberts from 90 years ago. We love their flaky almond sticks (buttery, flaky crisp (phyllo?), lightly sweetened, dusted powder sugar and toasted almond slices). They often run out of those but not cheap... I think there's about 10 - 6 inch sticks for a bit under $5. The sticks were about an inch wide but today batch have been shaven down to about 3/4 of an inch wide. The 6" princess cake was $17.99 (That's our favorite). Pastries are ok... but don't carry the rich butter of traditional European cakes or pastries.
author: jane f.

description:
dammit schubert's!! why can't i stop thinking about your mango cheesecake!

everytime i am in the richmond i ALWAYS have to stop by schuberts.  i will even circle around for 20 minutes trying to find parking to get a slick of that cake.

mmm the chocolate mousse is good too. i love the chocolate covered krispies that are sprinkled on the top.

i tried the swedish princess cake for the first time the other day.  twas a bit too sweet for me.
author: JUDY L.

description:
I love this bakery.  I have been going here for over 3 years now.  Their cakes have always been consistent in taste, texture, and amount of each layer.

I always go here for special occasion cakes and for snacks.  =)  I love their Swedish princess cake.  I have not found another  princess cake that has enough raspberry filling to balance the custard and marzipan sweetness.  

I have also almost tried every fruit mousse cake.  Love majority of them.  1 was too sour for me...I think it was the black currant one.  Today, I went and purchased some slices for snacking: princess cake, tropical fruit mousse, mango mousse, white chocolate strawberry mousse, and peach mousse.  I ate the princess cake there as a snack and ate the tropical mousse after dinner.  Yum...
author: Linda C.

description:
Schubert's is simply awesome.  

My past experience has been that most cakes that are pretty on the outside are a little eh on the inside.  Not so with the Schubert's cakes.  They're gorgeous on the outside and oh-so-light and delicious on the inside.  No gagging on oversweet buttercream here.  

Even better, they are SO NICE.  When I had to cancel my son's birthday party due to illness, they didn't make me pay for the cake that I had ordered, and which they had already made (beautifully, I might add).  After such a lousy day, I could have kissed the woman behind the counter.
author: Gina R.

description: We used Schubert's Bakery for our wedding a few weeks ago and were very happy with the cake they created!  Sabine is great about keeping in touch with you and making sure you are happy.  I was referred to Schubert's from a coworker/friend and I will refer them to anyone else who is looking for a baker!
author: Nancy C.

description:
In terms of breakfast pastries, this is quite possibly one of the best bakeries I've ever been to.  

Their cakes are definitely better than average, but the distinguishing item that separates this bakery from others is their danishes.  The bread of the danishes is VERY moist and not like all those dry ones you tend to find in other bakeries or supermarkets.  They set the standard for how a danish should taste.
author: Victor T.

description:
Ok, let's not kid anyone and just get this out of the way.  It's Clement Street; parking is not a given, its a gift around here so if you can park within a couple blocks of Schubert's, buy a lottery ticket!

This is probably the best, let me repeat myself, BEST bakery in San Francisco. Yes, this little place has it all to fill your palate with endless pleasures in the flavor spectrum.  Was there yesterday and tried the mango, chocolate mousse and mocha cakes and I almost had to call a doctor.  Fast service, great employees, big ups to Lorraine, cheap goodies and they'll even have fresh fruit on the cakes, pastries, etc to make you feel a little better about yourself which makes this place ultra dangerous, especially if you're a cheescake fan and the best baked goods around; CAN'T BEAT IT!
author: Myke Y.

description:
husband's bday is coming, looking for something that is different. Co-worker recommended so I decided to try

Store---4 stars, busy but cute. had a couple tables and chairs but no one was there eating, (everyone was there for father's day cakes?)

Sales person--4.5 stars--nice, and....nothing too special about them

Service--4 stars, it was confusing, so many people were in 
there..didn't know it was my turn or not (i hope i didn't cut the line?) 

Taste--4~5 stars, I bought 7 desserts-$26.00
**Strawberry cheesecake- 4.5 stars
**Chocolate cheesecake--5 stars ( my hubby's fav)
**Napolitan--4 stars
**Princess cake--1 star...( i am sorry but it really didn't taste good. my roomates and my hubby didn't like it)
**Chocolate mousse--4 stars
**Peach mousse--4.5 stars
**Strawberry mousse--4.5 stars
**Rasberry mousse--4.5 stars

Will come back from more tasting....
author: Sisi W.

description:
This review is a little late, but since it is such a wonderful place I still need to do it. 

I was in the city on Christmas on having dim sum, when I saw this long line, and I literally got in line behind the last person.

I didn't even know what the business really sold, but the person in front of me started telling me how great everything was, so I had to find out!! I figured I couldn't really go wrong, and I didn't. 

I bought the chocolate mousse cake and it was moist, light, and scrumptious. Not words I use to describe cake very often. 

Everything looked amazing.. If you need anything for a special occasion get it there.

Or if you are having a bad day.
author: Kelly W.

description:
So since my last review, Schubert's Bakery has contacted me to apologize.  They have made an effort to find out what I felt they could have done better and so for that, I will up my rating to 4 stars.  I do appreciate a business that is trying to improve itself.  

In summary, they agreed that they should have contacted me about the change to the pink ribbon and should have been upfront about using white fondant sprayed with pink, rather than pink fondant.  Communication has been great after the wedding, just wished they had made that communication effort before the wedding.
author: Elaine L.

description:
It's only right that I write my first review for Schubert's Bakery. I hold this bakery near and dear to my heart for many reasons--but mainly, they consistently produce excellent baked goods and sweet delights year after year. Like many, my fond memory of Schubert's began when birthday cakes were bought here for family events since I was a child. It's just a comforting thought to know that this wonderful shop still exists for me to enjoy til this day. 

Most popular cakes: Mango Mousse, Swedish Princess, and Tiramisu.

However, I think EVERY cake offered is exceptional. 

For the fruit mousse, if you like the Mango mousse, they also have an array of various other fruit flavors as well to cater to your specific choice such as Strawberry, Raspberry, Lemon, Tropical and peach. The mousse cakes are extremely light, yet flavorful. Mousse cakes are good for all ages because it's delicious, but not overly heavy or sweet. It the perfect treat after a big dinner. 

For the "Swedish Princess", it is white cake with raspberry filling, kirsch custard, whipped cream, and covered with marzipan (almond paste). Marzipan has a distinct taste that will make you either love it or hate it. For an alternative, Schubert's offers the "Pink Champagne" cake which taste just as delicious as the princess cake, but frosted with whipped cream instead of marzipan. (This cake usually requires 1-2 days advance notice to order)

For the Tiramisu, it's more of a mousse layered on top of chocolate cake and filled with a light version of marscapone filling flavored with coffee liqueur. Fantastic! Other options for chocolate-flavored mousse cakes are the Cappuccino, chocolate, and double chocolate mousse. All very light cakes with powerful chocolate taste. Mmm!

For non-mousse, Schubert's offers a variety of whipped cream cakes--some of my highly recommended: "Strawberry Shortcake" and "Napoleon" (puff pastry layers with fresh strawberries, whipped cream, and kirsch custard) So fresh, so good. And my other personal favorite, the "Opera"--this cake is dense and packed with flavor. It is made of up hazelnut sponge cake, chocolate truffle filling, mocha praline and covered in chocolate ganache with toasted almonds. SO good. 

Hope all that information helped. They have so much more on their website and the best thing is, you can order online, over the phone, or in person. Enjoy and create great memories for yourself!
author: Lorraine C.

description:
I probably come here most often to order birthday cakes out of all the bakeries in the city.

For their cakes, I would totally recommend any of the following, mango mousse, coffee crunch, triple chocolate mousse, strawberry shortcake, and fruit basket.  Their cakes are really moist and flavorful!

If I feel like treating myself, I might pick up a little fruit tart too!

Yum!!!
author: Jennifer I.

description:
If I could actually afford it, I would have a fake wedding just so I could justify ordering a ten-tiered cake. Each tier would be one of the luscious yet light-tasting cake flavors at Schubert's such as tiramisu, double chocolate mousse, mango mousse, and princess. Now I'm sure there are more than 10 flavors but I figure asking for a cake with a tier for each of their flavors will seem excessive. Ten just sounds justifiable. 

Back to the fake wedding planning. I would order the cake from Schubert's, stuff all the fake wedding guests all to the brim with the actual dinner so that people just can't stomach another bite and leave early, wait 6 hours after dinner to serve the cake so the remaining people think there isn't cake, and then voila, 10-layer cake is all to myself. 

Now I realize that you may be thinking that perhaps I'll be sick of cake after finishing off 2 layers. That you're wrong because with Schubert's cakes - any of their cake flavors - I'll make room. I will starve for 5 days if that's what it takes. I will run...err walk slowly...a marathon. There is no such thing as too much Schubert's just as there is no such thing as too many pairs of shoes for women. And because their cakes don't taste too sweet - just the right amount of sweetness - I won't have to worry about popping diabetic medication to go through the wedding cake.
