Schubert's is also kind enough to realize such a plan may not work for every cake lover so instead, it also makes miniature sizes of its cakes. Prices are reasonable, which makes any plot to cake hog more viable. Remember this place is on Clement and 6th Street so you'll have to be mentally prepared for parking to get in between you and their cakes.
author: Gwen L.

description:
I can't say enough about this place.  The cakes are amazing!  We love the strawberry cake topped with seasonal fruit usually kiwi and mangos.  Whenever we have a special occasion we make a run to Schubert's.  For people from out of town who have never tasted it before always praise how delicious it is.  
They have a wide variety of cakes and all are delic!
author: Sam S.

description:
I absolutely adore dessert (by that I mean cake) and I swear Schubert's is probably one of the best places in San Francisco to get one or some. I have tried many bakeries and have yet to find one that compares to Schubert's. Every cake that I've tried I have fallen in love with. Somehow, they just get it right all the time. My mom has also fallen in love with their cakes and she DOES not like Sweets which I believe is a true testament showing how tasty their cakes are! This place has become the go to place for my family whether its a birthday or we just want cake. 

The presentation of their cakes are very elaborate and decorative. They use fruits, lady fingers, ribbons, chocolate dipped strawberries, etc. Presentation probably makes the cake taste better too!!! Honestly, its worth the price for their cakes; 8" for give or take $26.95 and 10" for give or take $36.95. I have paid a lot more and have received a lot less. I can't stress how much I love this place! 

The service has its up and downs, hence, the 4 stars. Sometimes, it can be slow. But, I love this place so much I wouldn't let that discourage me from their bakery goods. I do wish they opened later....

I would recommend... 

1.) Tiramisu (My all time favorite.)
2.) Black Forest
3.) Mango Mousse
4.) Tropical and Peach Mousse
5.) White Chocolate and Raspberry Mousse
6.) Chocolate Cheesecake
7.) Mango Cheesecake

Many more things I would love to try!
author: Amber D.

description:
I love this bakery! I called a friend who referred me to this place and I called in about 20 minutes before arriving to put a simple, small tiramisu aside for pickup for a dinner party I was going to directly from the bakery. Upon arrival, I saw many more cakes and got extremely curious.

I began to ask what was the most popular ones and the ingredients in each one. I like how the girl who helped me really knew all of the ingredients in each cake and was extremely helpful. I changed my mind and swapped the tiramisu for a mousse cake. After asking about the swedish princess cake and hearing the ingredients for that, I quickly changed my mind yet again to the swedish princess cake. 

Everyone at the dinner party was impressed and loved the cake! Thanks, Schubert's, for helping me make a great impression and also for dealing with me and my pickiness!!!

Great service and excellent product!
author: Garrett C.

description:
The Mango Mousse is really good. I'll try some chocolate flavors next time.

The best cake in S.F so far :)
author: Kyle S.

description: Princess cake :)! I like how the bottom of the cake has a cookie type thing. It gives the cake a really nice texture.
author: Janet Z.

description:
LOVE their cakes & cookies! Probably more expensive than a lot of the bakeries in the area but well worth it! 

My personal favorite is the cookies assortment box. There isn't a single one in the box I don't like! 

The custard crossant is also worth sampling! Enjoy!
author: Marissa P.

description:
This place was nice.  They had plenty of cakes n pastries... Price is really good too. I ordered over the phone, and she took my order n told when it would be done.

Only issue (not that big) was when I was at the shop, I guess I looked like I was still deciding, bekuz none of them asked me for help. 

As for the cake I had,

Simply amazing!!! Very Light and fluffy. Had alot of freshly cut fruits on it.. which was good too.  

I will come here for cakes.
author: Roger A.

description:
Shopping around for a wedding cake was an experience.  To qualify that statement - that's at least what my fiance informed me.  So many bakers with great tasting and fantastic looking cakes made the decision selection difficult............until we visited Schubert's Bakery.  We met Sabine and she guided us through the process of tasting and flipping through their design portfolio.  She was very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable and made our selection process less difficult.  She even sketched out our cake, per our decoration selections, right there on the spot!  And yes.........we selected the Princess cake.

Although our wedding isn't for another month, we are now on to our other last minute decision.  Oh, as for all of the other beautifully decorated bites behind the glass, try to taste them all.  You won't be disappointed!
author: Grant T.

description:
i'd always pass by this place but never got the chance to try it until my sister's bbq. her friends came by and bought her a graduation cake and it was THE best cheesecake i have ever had thus far. it was either a peach or a mango cheesecake. i forgot which one it was. and just earlier this week i got the cheesecake and a peach mousse cake for my friend's bday. let me tell you.. do not and i mean DO NOT leave your cake in the car on a hot ass day!! we went to eat sushi on 2nd and geary and went to get their nails did while the cake was sitting in the car. haha finally when she decided to eat the cake.. it was warm and not so great. i mean it was still good but it wasnt the best. hey at least the birthday girl loved it! :) thats all that matters.

oh yeah.. on top of that, they were so nice to put a happy birthday on her slice on cake and it was free. thanks a bunch!!
author: Shirley Z.

description: Okay, I've been to over 3000 events and about 1000 birthday parties. So, I've tried my share of cakes. Schubert's bakery ranks among the best cakes I've ever eaten. 5 stars!
author: Daniel C.

description:
berry tart!!! wake my driving bf....lol
love it
author: Yelp Z.

description:
I am not now, nor have I ever been, a big fan of the sweets--all this extra chub--that's ALL savory goodness--save a good four days out of every month, and literally EVERY time I'm within a two block radius of this damned bakery.  It all started back in the stroller days when my grandmother and I would stop by this quaint little Clement spot when I had been especially good or when she felt the need to be especially bad.  I don't remember what she'd order me--I think it was the eclairs--all I remember is chocolate awesomeness mingling with sweet bready goodness.  

However my addiction wasn't fully realized until my high school job, when it just so happened to be the closest bakery.  Around birthday time, the celebratee would have to choose his/her fave Schubert's concoction and the first time I was privy to such an event (and many times after), it was the mango mousse.  From the very first moment I tasted this fluffy, foamy, mango-ey, ridiculousness--I was hooked.  Like slap my arm, find the vein, hooked.  This little vehicle is perfection: just-enough-but-not-overpowering-sweetness, perfectly-balanced-tart, airily-delicious mousse, a moist and lovely cake base... 

You know that sound that Homer makes when he sees a donut?  That drool infused utterance of pure and unadulterated lust?  Yeah, I am quite possibly audibly making that noise now...
author: Jasmine L.

description: Seriously in love with the Princess Cake. Marzipan and raspberry filling and fluffy white fluffy goodness is what I'm usually stuffing my face with on my birthday. Reasonably priced compared to other Princess Cakes in the city. What more could you ever want in a cake?
author: Natasha P.

description:
I still can't believe my luck, stumbling into this place without looking it up on Yelp.  Right?!

Easy on the eyes, easy on the wallet, and yummy in my tummy!  How can these dainty, pretty, tasty desserts come from such a random spot on Clement St., right in the middle of dim sum hole-in-the-walls, flower shops, and boba after boba joint?  Not that there's anything wrong with Boba milk tea...mMm!  I digress.

I had a small cup of coffee and shared a slice of cappuccino mousse cake with my SO.  We desperately wanted to share another dessert immediately after downing the first...perhaps we'd try the Princess cake which everyone raves about...until...

Damn you, New Year's resolutions!  Why did we have to discover all the deliciousness that is Schubert's AFTER New Year's?
author: Kristen S.

description:
I can't believe I haven't rate this place yet!

Anyway, Schubert's is hands down one of my favorite bakeries! Reading all the previous reviews, I can understand it might be difficult for someone to find a specific cake to try but that's because everything is seriously good! The cake is always light and fluffy and the frosting is hardly ever too sweet, well, unless you get one that's suppose to be that sweet, haha.

I've been going here for maybe 2-3 years now and the cakes are always a hit with whichever party I bring it to. Love, love, love everything. I'd have to say so far my favorite is the Chocolate Truffle & the double Chocolate but that's because chocolate is my favorite! Most bakeries have cake that's too dry or chocolate that's too heavy/sweet but it's always on point for me at Schubert's.

Oh man, I'm already craving a slice from there!
author: Janell Y.

description: Swedish Princess Cake. by far the bestest one i've tasted in the entire bay area. must try
author: Christine K.

description:
Their cakes not only look pretty: decorated with chocolate-mold flowers and  chocolate shavings, but those cakes are amazingly light and delicious. 
I fond of their tiramisu cake or any other mousse cake and fruit tarts alike.
author: jjj j.

description:
I came here because I was strolling around Clement Avenue and I was headed to Genkei's. I browse around and saw their beautiful cakes. I think they are too beautiful ---I don't want to them. 

We bought this strawberry mouse cake. Their cake tasted yogurtly. But I have to give props to the cashier because she was helpful and she didn't get annoyed when asked if their cakes have alcohol on it.

So, I'm going to give them another try...maybe I bought the wrong cake. For sure I'll come back because I like gazing at them cakes =)
author: Rokayah S.

description:
oh man, where do i start?

we love their tiramisu cake! soooooo sooo good! And prices are CHEAP!!!!! They have mini sizes, and big sized cakes. I drive from Oakland out to Schubert's just to pick up my tiramisu cake.

I tend to go early in the morning just so I can find easy parking hehe.
author: michelle h.

description: We ordered an opera cake (half-sheet) for our engagement dinner and it served about 60 people with some to spare. Everyone complimented on the flavor and quality. Thanks Schubert's! We're also considering them for our wedding cake too!
author: Stephen Y.

description: delicious mousse cakes! love! Had the mini chocolate mousse cake and it hit the spot. Not too sweet or any other. Gotta return for the white chocolate mousses :)
author: Sophia K.

description:
We ordered our 3 LAYERED  WEDDING CAKE HERE  
Thank you so much for for the sweet stuff ,all of our guest love it and we're looking forward to ordered more in the future,I will recommend my family,friends to your place I love it.
The best cake ever...
author: janelle t.

description: Beautiful and deeeelish cakes/ pastries! Chocolate ecclair is one of the best I've tasted! Ordered a Swedish Princess cake and had my moms pic scanned on it...at no extra charge! Friendly staff, reasonable prices, superb quality!
author: J G.

description:
These folks are wonderful - the staff, cakes, everything!

I contacted Schubert's for a fundraiser, and they were super sweet and very on top of things. Though it was hard for us to get a hold of each other, we never had a problem with communication. Their cakes are delicious, especially black currant mousse cake and opera cake. The opera cake is hazelnut sponge with a chocolate truffle filling, with hazelnut praline cream. Everyone was a fan of these cakes, and I was impressed with their level of professionalism and punctuality. ;)

Their staff is warm, friendly, and professional. They really do care about their customers and the community. Will definitely be ordering from them for a party/gathering/any event that could use a mouthwatering cake! =)
author: Tejal D.

description: I've tried a bunch of their cakes and haven't been disappointed :)
author: Mertani G.

description: Their mousse cakes are sooooo good! I've only tried the tropical and mango cakes, but I would try them all if I could!! I love how they call them "cakes," but they are actually mostly mousse which is a plus for me! They decorate the cakes beautifully with things such as chocolate flowers and shavings, and the mousse is so light and fluffy, almost like a cross between creme brulee and custard. Definitely try the mousse cakes!
author: Stacey Y.

description:
Beautiful cakes that not only look beautiful, 
but tastes wonderful too! 

Little pricy, but well worth it.

Go early in the day, cuz they usually sell out.

I like their fruit tart and cherry pie!
author: Sunny S.

description: The best cheese cake in sf. very decent price compare a lot bakery.  not even cheese cake is good, double chocolate mousse cake is also deliouse. cakes r not too sweet, taste perfect! n they take credit card!
author: Sanly L.

description:
This is where it all began- my obsession with baked goods.  I was born and raised within a ten block radius of Schubert's.  One of my earliest memories was getting free cookies from the nice couple who owned and ran the bakery, finding a dime on the ground...  good times.  Flash forward to day, I'm still as enamoured with Schubert's as ever.  Not much has changed except the couple sold the bakery to a Frenchman.  I still love the apricot pocket, German cheesecake (when they make it- I miss this!) and, of course, the Princess Cake.  Perfection wrapped in a tidy marzipan fondant.  
My birthday is coming up, ahem.
author: Monica L.

description: Sure, I'm trying these with a whole different standard palate (wedding cake standard), but the only cake I liked here was their chocolate truffle - which was good to be sure. The princess cake was too sweet with that artificial raspberry drizzle.  The vanilla with choco frosting was uninteresting.  It might be because it was a free tasting and not on par with what they normally offer.  In any case, probably good cakes, but not wedding caliber.  They have great service, but only wished they had more cakes with that extra special something.
author: Peg S.

description: I still believe this is the best bakery in the city when it comes to desserts.  The princess cake is out of this world.  The raspberry mousse thing is amazing.  Really it is all delicious.  Perfect for a special event or a craving.
author: Cork C.

description:
One of my favorite places in the city to get a dessert. It`s a small place with a few tables and lovely display of cakes and tarts. 
My absolute favorite is the chocolate truffle cake. So rich and, well, chocolaty! :)
author: Sunshine H.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE! Swedish Princess is to die for.
author: Diane L.

description: I wish I didn't have to rate this place 1 star, but there is no option for no stars. The service SUCKS! Not only is their website not updated, but the employees are dumb and don't know what's going on. My fiance and I wanted to check this place out for our wedding cake, so my fiance called to make an appointment. We had a time picked out, and we were ready to visit the place when my fiance decided to call the place and let them know we were on our way. They said, "great, see you in a bit, oh by the way, we don't do wedding cakes anymore." My fiance was like "what? it's on your website AND when I called I said we were coming in for wedding cake tasting." How stupid can you be? Apparently they aren't going to be making wedding cakes anymore starting 2013, but they're also not taking anymore orders this year. F this place! Just lost an easy sell. PLACES LIKE THIS NEED TO BE OUT OF BUSINESS!
author: Greg P.

description:
YUMM--  Needed a birthday cake for a colleague and was in serious need for a cake ASAP-- a Pretty One!! (Sorry- Can't do a Safeway Cake) I did not however expect for this cake to be not only pretty - excellent presentation!! but it was also very good !! Tiramisu-- Never fails.  They even put her name on a chocalate sheet for the added special touch.

The one star knock down is because I also picked up a pastry for myself before work and, well, thats where that star went. The specialize in cakes, so I don;t blame them for haveing okay choclate filled crissonts -- go figure. 

Hightly recomenned, easy parking!!
author: RG P.

description:
This place is as good as it gets!!! The cakes are light and fluffy and are so flavorful! The best part is that the prices are really good and I MEAN REALLY GOOD!!!! For an 8 inch cake it's only $26.95. At other bakeries they charge like $40-$60!!! 
The cakes at Schubert's have great quality. The cakes are fresh and oh so delightful.
Plus, there are many different flavors to choose from.
They also have a little pastry section that looks delicious and I must try it the next time I visit.
author: Olivia W.

description:
This review is based solely on the Strawberry Cheesecake! I had the strawberry cheesecake a day after my bf bought it, because it was meant for a birthday that was not in SF. Hence, I did not have it fresh the day it was bought, but it was so very nicely decorated. So pretty that I did not want to eat it. 

-Strawberry cheesecake: Strawberry flavored white chocolate shavings and regular white choco shavings are layered on top of this cheesecake. The chocolate flowered hearts and the fresh raspberries/blackberries here and there on top of the cake were a nice touch. Wish there were more fresh berries! The cheesecake was really rich and you could taste the fresh strawberry puree/preserves between the chocolate shavings and the cheesecake portion. No graham cracker crust, I think they use white cake on the bottom, but b/c we saved it to eat a day later and the cake became soggy and wet. It was still good, but too rich for me. A little bit does the trick. 

I can't wait to try their other cakes/desserts. I guess I need to have them fresh next time, but I can't help but stare at all their beautifully decorated cakes every time I pass by this bakery.
author: Tracy T.

description: AWESOME!!! I love their Raspberry Moose Cake with the lady fingers!!!  It's a MUST!!!  This is my favorite cake place even though I don't really like cakes :)
author: Jen L.

description:
The most amazing cakes! I adore stopping in for a little bit with some tea or to bring a beautiful cake home or to special events. They really know how to create artistic masterpieces in the cake world. 
Delicious, simple as that.
author: Jamie K.

description: Change isn't always good!... We've bought mousse cakes from Schuberts for years - a fav of older Asian parents - but a PRICE HIKE for a SHORTER CAKE? Yes, over $40 total for a 9" cake that's much shorter at just 2" tall!!! Not worth it at all now...
author: Brian L.

description: There were so many options. When we came, it wasn't busy at all. Past 1 pm and the line became longer and longer.  I truly enjoyed the mango mousse and the napoleon. I wish I bought more of the napoleon to go. I'll be back when I'm in the area again.
author: MP N.

description:
neopolitan(?) the flaky strawberry one with all the ladyfingers.. mmmmm

and the raspberry mousse cakes.
ohhh and the fruit tarts.. mmmmmMMMMmmmm
author: Lisa N.

description:
My husband and I have been to 2 weddings where the wedding cake was from Schubert's. Their cake is light and delicious, and seeing that our wedding banquet was a 10 course Chinese meal with 2 desserts, we also went with Schubert's. We chose the mango mousse cake. It was not too sweet, and light enough so that our guests would be able to somehow get the cake into their mouths.

It was easy to work with Schubert's. We had booked a tasting almost 6 months in advance, was advised that we can look at the portfolio online, and they also gave us their portfolio to look at in the store. It was fun doing the tasting, and I had narrowed it down to the mango and the guava (which is a little bit sweeter than the mango, but it's so good!)  I almost went with guava because I had wanted to be different, but my Tony warned that guava may be too different and too much for our traditional relatives. So we opted for the safer mango flavor. 

On the day of my event, the cake delivery folk arrived promptly on time. And the cake was a hit.  It was definitely very easy and stress free working with Schubert's.
author: Annie Y.

description:
I would be giving Schubert's 5 starts, but I'm sorry to report that customer service is lacking :(  I have been coming to Schuberts regularly for the past 4 years.  I get their Swedish Princess Cake every year for birthdays.  I have always been pleased not only with the cakes, but the service I receive in the store.  Today I was treated exceptionally rudely by a woman in the store when coming in to pick up a cake I reserved and paid for online.  I extended my disappointment to the manager, who agreed to refund the cake I had already purchased.  I told her I would come back since she refunded the cake, but honestly, I don't even want to come back.  I appreciate that the manager wanted to compensate me for the bad experience, but I have to say that the experience ruined it for me, and most likely I'll be taking my business elsewhere in the future.

The cakes are wonderful - absolutely no complaints - but I don't see myself coming back.   What a shame.
author: unknown u.

description:
A tase of heaven! Yes, that's what I call the chocolate wreath's cake for $10.  You have to go early to buy it because they usually run out by 11am.  

I also love their cakes.  It's more expensive than the chinese bakery but worth it.  My favs include the Opera Cake and recently I tried the Mango Cheesecake which was really good.  

Not a big fan of princess cake although it looks really pretty.  Just not my taste - a little too sweet.  

Finally, they also sell shortbread cookies in a nice box for gifts.  Great alternative to the usualy See's candies box.
author: Cin T.

description:
I've ordered a ton of desserts from here and they always get rave reviews from friends and strangers.  The mousse cakes just melts in your mouth and it's so beautiful!  If I lived closer, I would probably come here all the time for a special treat for myself!  Luckily, I'm just in a short driving distant.

Highly recommend it, they are always fully staffed and prompt in their service so you can go in and out very quickly (if you're in a rush for your event).
author: Tina C.

description: Got a cake here for my aunts birthday and it was seriously amazing. The presentation was incredible and the mango mousse tasted fantastic.
author: Alice T.

description:
Schubert's produces a product that is hard for me to understand. It isn't completely unique. It isn't flawless. But It is, and not just because of its fat and sugar content, totally compelling.

Take their eclairs, for example. I prefer them to other eclairs, but can't point out why, exactly. I know that the pate choux (the puffy pastry) is made correctly, because its a little crunchy on the outside and very airy inside. But I love them almost more because of the foolishness of putting both whipped cream and pastry cream in the filling. Most places just put whipped cream inside and call it a day. The proper filling is pastry cream, but Schubert's compromises, and somehow this makes them totally loveable.
author: H G.

description:
I used to work at a place where 95% percent of the employees were women and being women, they felt it was their natural duty to celebrate every single person's birthday, even if said person didn't disclose the date to the rest of us. These bitches would get all sneaky and ask around, listen to every single word you said for any hint of your birthday and then go write it down. Even if you took the day of your birthday off, they would still make you "celebrate" it the day before or even a few weeks afterwards. Even worse, was being forced to celebrate others' birthdays, as you stood around eating sheet cake from Safeway as every single person bought up why they couldn't finish their piece. 

And then, we hired Margie. Margie was an insane nurse practitioner who also happened to be an SF native. She loved celebrating people's birthdays but the biggest difference was that Margie was a foodie and instead of getting us shit cake from the store she always bought tarts from Boulangerie and most importantly, she always bought princess cake from Schubert's aka BEST PRINCESS CAKE EVER. So light, so fucking good. So good you'll tolerate celebrating Ann from accounting's (fake name and position by the way) birthday even though she made some sneaky comment about how slutty your platform mary janes were. You'd even go to that bitches' party. That's how powerful Schubert's is.
author: Maria D.

description: I live in Concord, which is one hour drive from the Bakery, and I order my cakes for special occasions only from Schubert's, because they are so good.
author: Gulya J.

description: Strawberry Shortcake...8x12inches...$50...WORTH EVERY SINGLE PENNY.  And we are in a recession.  But I will tell you.  Best white cake ever.  They are so accommodating, I ordered the day before, and they had a ready.  The lady Ana on the phone is as sweet as her cream frosting.  I will be back again and again.
author: Mar M.

description:
I lived in Inner Richmond this summer. My first night living there, I stumbled upon this place, and had the BEST BERRY TART I HAVE EVER TASTED!  I looked around, trying to find the place later, and I finally did.  Love at first bite, as they say.

Every morning before work, I went here.  The first time, they had freshly baked croissants. My morning has never been more amazing.  I made friends with the people working there, so they'd greet me in the morning.  I don't like chocolate, so I didn't try any of their chocolate things. I'm also not a huge fan of mousse, so I only tried their mousse cakes once or twice.

Every morning, I'd get a breakfast food (Raspberry Ring or Croissant), and then a dessert to eat with my lunch.  I normally got the Swedish Princess Cake, the Berry Tart, or the Strawberry Shortcake.  They were all AMAZING. 

I moved away from SF at the end of summer, but I still have these overwhelming cravings for their berry tarts or their Swedish Princess cake.  I wish I had some right now.
author: Jenee H.

description:
"Identity" is a key construct of modern society. Our name is our biggest identity. Hence, to confirm to Yelp's wishes of "Real people, real reviews" I had to change my yelp persona from "celebguru" to "Kaustav C" in order to be made elite.

Ed M has made racial jokes(esp. self deprecating ones) the new cool. So, let me start with a racial joke.

"Who is a coconut?" 

"It is someone who is brown on the surface and white underneath".

What has identity and names to do with Schubert? Everything. The name Schubert conjures a WASP'ish image. That is the bait, it reels you in. Instead of Schubert, if the name was Chan(or Ravi) I would'nt have gone to order  a cake for such an important occasion( Elena S's New Yr's party).

But once you come to Schubert, you realize that you are in the "Chinki" heartland of Clement Street. Which is not a bad thing as  Schubert gives you "ethnic" prices for European quality.

It is mid night on the 31 st of December and the uber-delicious taste(of the Green sugar crust) of the Swedish Princess Cake has given me a greater high than all the other sugary substance I have been snorting all evening.
author: Kaustav C.

description:
My co-workers are a thoughtful bunch.  On occasion, one of them will bring in a couple of things from Schubert's to share with the staff and faculty. It's our bakery of choice because it's conveniently located down the street, it's reasonably priced, and it's soooo goood.  How good, you ask?

It's well known that you can not walk onto school grounds with Schubert's without the risk of being mauled by dozens of ravenous sweet freaks.  They come out of the bushes and jump out of trees to get a little taste of anything from Schubert's.  They'll eat your hand off to get to a bear claw from this bakery.

So when I walk in with a sweet treat from this bakery, I go through a couple of steps before I enter the teacher's lunchroom:

1. Disguise Schubert's bag with Walgreen's bag.
2. Sneak in the back gate.
3. Hastily drop treats onto lunchroom table.
4. Run for my life.  

Usually, whatever I put on the table is gone by first break.  Schubert's ROCKS THE HOUSE!
author: Kristina R.

description: Wow, incredible. Just had the princess cake and I'm obsessed. Quick, friendly service, great prices, INCREDIBLE baked goods. What more can you ask for?
author: Christine H.

description: Everyone knows this place just owns. Best bakery in the area. The I had some type of raspberry twist that was top notch. Amazing, you can really taste the quality (or amount of butter) with every bite. So many pastries at other bakeries are lacking that old school quality and feel. Not this place, the pound cake is good too! But the raspberry twist is a must. The only reason I did not give 5 stars, is that the selection is not consistent and sometimes they are all out of my favorites. Other wise this place is 4 and a half stars!
author: Chelsey G.

description:
Back in Chicago,
 I grew up in a German neighborhood and we had a Shuberts Bakery on every corner with a bunch of old German guys sitting outside drinking coffee.

Here in SF,
Shuberts is filled with very pretty asian girlfriends delicately eating pastries and chatting it up.

Gotta Love San Francisco

I recently treated a friend to a Black Forest Cake.
 It had a whipped cream icing. wow
I would love to buy one for myself but too much cake makes too much Katherine.
author: Katherine N.

description: A SanFran staple, Schubert's lives up to its reputation with its sugary delights and friendly staff. When I am in the mood for a fancy little treat I pop on over to this joint and get an iced cookie or some sweet bread to go. I also like to swing by during the holiday season to pick up a pie or three as they are always a crowd pleaser! I will say, as a chocolate enthusiast, and dessert gal in general, I prefer my desserts to be a little more on the "homemade", rustic side, as compared to Schubert's more refined, artisan approach. But it is a craft and I do appreciate that, and everything is delicious no doubt. Just wish it was a little messier I guess :P
author: Leigh W.

description:
Fancy cakes with a not-so-fancy price.

So far, I've tried:

Cheesecake (plain): Not bad, but I prefer Zanze's.

Raspberry mousse cake: I like it, not too sweet, light and fluffy. topped off with a raspberry glaze, fresh raspberry and a piece of chocolate

Mango Cheesecake: This is the one that my sister was obsessing over about, so I had high expectations. It was good, but not as good as I expected!

I liked how their cakes are not too sweet and overpowering, light and fluffy textures, and the beautiful decorations they top it off with.

I'm not saying I don't like their desserts, but because of my high expectations, it brought it down a notch.
author: Nance W.

description:
We ordered the Strawberry Romanoff cake for my father's birthday and it was seriously the best birthday cake I have ever had in my life!  And judging from the way my diet-conscious relatives dug into that cake (even after a monstrously huge dinner at R & G Lounge), it was the best birthday cake they had ever had as well.   We are all birthday cake connoisseurs considering how many birthday parties we have each year and all the different bakeries we have tried through the years (Chinese bakery fruit cakes, ice cream cakes, The Cakery, Sheng Kee, etc. etc.) 

The cake itself was moist and soft, almost angel-cake like in texture.  The filling was heavenly - strawberries and custard...yummers!  And it was awesome how much chocolate shavings they put on top of the cake for decoration.  The combination of the cake, the filling and the shaved chocolate just made a delicious mouthful.  

Prices here are also pretty reasonable.  We ordered the half sheet, and it more than fed the 40 guests we had.  It probably came to $2 a head, which is really reasonable.  We even had a small 5" square piece leftover- man, that made for awesome dessert/midnight snack the next day.  

In any case, I'm looking forward to going back and trying out more of their delicious-sounding cakes.  The only issues I have are the lack of any pictures of the cakes that you can special order and the fact that you can't necessarily get tastes of those cakes before you order them.

Edit 3/6/2008: Schubert's really deserves 5 stars....4 stars just will not do for the stunning cakes here.
author: Angela H.

description:
Best bakery ever!!! Not a huge chocolate fan so my favorite cake is the "Strawberry Shortcake", which used to be called a "Fruit basket." It is a white cake with a little bit of caramel (yum!) inside and it also has sliced kiwis, strawberries, pineapples and blueberries (not sliced, they're tiny!) with a little bit of Schubert's design like chocolate pieces on top to make the cake stand out! Wow, that was a long sentence, but it's dead on!

Oh, and you can tell them which fruits you don't want on the cake.

It's one of those cakes that you don't feel guilty eating...or as my friend likes to call it, "a silent killer."

Just, heavenly.
author: Narina A.

description: My friend bought me a raspberry birthday cheesecake and OMG- it was SO GOOD! Not only was it to tasty, it was also soooo pretty!! The brown and white chocolate decorations with hints of red raspberries is the perfect combo. Schuberts, I will definitely try other baked goodies from you in the future!!
author: Eileen Z.

description:
The tiramisu is so dang tasty!

I remember making one awhile back and the ingredient cost me well over $50, maybe because I put too much alcohol in it. Oh well....
author: Stanley K.

description:
This is the best dessert bakery in town. I have people who now demand I bring back some cakes from Schubert's when I visit. They have the best cakes, cookies and coffee is even pretty solid. Prices are as reasonable as the bakeries in North Beach. They can customize a cake and have plenty of ready made cakes if you forgot a B-day, anniversary, etc and need something quick. 

I agree with a previous review... don't let people cut in front of you. I guess they can't wait to get any of the dessert either. Nonetheless if you're on Clement and want dessert or on a date and want to impress this is the place to go.
author: Dan T.

description: So many amazing treats, it's hard to choose. I love coming here once or twice a month for a tea and desert in the middle of the day. You gotta spoil yourself a little. There are some great cakes made to order to birthdays and special occasions too. The staff is always very friendly, even thought they are very busy at times.
author: katrina w.

description:
i got the Swedish Princess Cake and while reasonable for it's price, it was very dissapointing on an absolute scale of cakes. The filling was way too sweet and the cake texture was average. I did appreciate the marzipan layer and that definitely redeemed the cake a bit for me.

In my opinion, I prefer cakes from Sheng Kee or Sakura Cakes.
author: Andrew H.

description:
I had the

Rasberry Mouse
Mango Mousse
White Chocolate and Rasberry Mouse

I want to try the Princess.....thats what its called right? that one with the green? 

all very good...not too sweet..just the way I like it...
author: phillip w.

description: We have been buying cakes at Schuberts for years. They are always fresh and flavorful.
author: Marty M.

description: An hour drive to collect my mam's birthday cake is totally worth it. Schubert's has been my top bakeshop for years and they are a part of every birthday in my family. Yesterday was no exception - phoned them very late in the afternoon and when I came around almost till closing they had my chocolate truffle on ready. Awesomeness didn't end there though. They always run out of custard cinnamon jesuit - my favorite pastry at Schubert's - but that day they still had half a dozen bars and I took them all. Definitely made my day.
author: Aurora A.

description:
YUMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM.

If you're looking for a cake store in San Francisco, make Schubert's your default. For some reason, all the cakes that I've had before from Schuberts always seem to be some sort of mousse. Definitely pre-order your cake! Either call in or do it online -- it's SIMPLE, EASY, QUICK, and definitely CONVENIENT. You can even customize what you want to say on your cake but does anyone else agree with me that the writing for their cakes aren't that pretty or cute? It's kinda ugly in my opinion...

Their mango mousse cake and white chocolate raspberry mousse cakes are to die for. I want to try their Opera cake...and well...okay I want to try all the other cakes in the store. 

Too bad they don't make cupcakes.
author: Heidi C.

description:
I spent many an afternoon here with a chocolate croissant and a novel my first summer in San Francisco. When my friends from Houston came to visit, we started off our days armed with hot coffee and cookies from Schubert's. I moved on from their pastries to the mango mousse cake and haven't turned back! Though I think I might try their princess cake next...

ETA: Finally tried their princess cake...delicious! I can't believe I waited this long to try it. The white cake and the raspberry combination rules. My boyfriend peeled the green marzipan off and shoved the whole thing in his mouth but what I managed to wrestle from him was tasty.
author: Nathalie L.

description: omg, i am sooo happy that someone recommended Schubert's bakery to me when i was looking for a wedding cake.  All of their cakes are delicious, and it was waaaaay less expensive than other bakeries in town.  we chose a cake similar to the Swedish Princess cake (white cake w/kirsch custard and raspberry filling) minus the whipped cream (to avoid it from spoiling) and the marzipan.  i think it came out to be around $3/serving.  ridiculously cheap for such a beautiful and tasty cake.  but one of the very best things is that, instead of saving the top tier of our wedding cake and eating it on our first anniversary, they gave us a certificate to bring back a year later and they gave us a FREE cake!  YUM!  is there anything better than FREE CAKE!?  of course we chose the Princess cake, which, by the way is ORGASMIC.  The Black Forest cake and Chocolate mousse cake are favorites as well.
author: Eileen H.

description:
Prettiest cakes in town, without a doubt.  You don't have to go to Europe to get European-worthy baked goods - they are being made right on Clement Street, among the dollar stores and BBQ duck joints.

Schubert's is known for their mousse cakes, which look incredible and have a light, fluffy taste - mango is very popular, and I have also had the raspberry, lemon and chocolate.

The Princess Cake is lovely.

For far less than you would spend at Whole Foods for a just-ok cake, you could have a piece of artistry and expertly baked confection that would be the crowning glory of a birthday party or meal.  Excellent to bring to a dinner party.

Morning pastries are also very good - I am partial to the almond croissant, which has toasted almonds (with delicate charred edges), and a nice amount of almond paste.  Flaky, buttery but somehow not greasy at all.  You will want to turn the bag upside down in your mouth to get every last crumb.

Say you have no party or birthday to attend, but really want a festive slice of something sugary?  No fear, individual portions available.  Pick one up today and celebrate yourself.
author: Liz S.

description:
i have to review this place or else i will forget what it's called and freak out trying to remember/google it.

we had a bbq and one of our guests brought a cake from here. it looked cute, like a princess cake, but it also looked like it was too cute to be tasty. also the guest kept raving that it was a 'marzipan' cake, and that made me think of fondant (which is an epic cake ruiner).

so i had already decided the cake would be chewy and gummy fondant heavy shell obscuring dry crumbly cake. it was however DELICIOUS and the outside 'shell' really was marzipan...not fondant. it was like having my cake and eating candy too :)
author: Lynne C.

description:
I cannot visit Green Apple books without a visit to the best bakery around. Schuberts makes gorgeous cakes, pastries, breads, cookies. Perfect to grab a showstopper dessert if you're going to a party, or hosting a party.  

Favorites are the raspberry mouse cake with chocolate cake alternating with rich, tart raspberry mouse, a glazey raspberry on top, and lady fingers around the edge.  Glamorous and delicious.  

The mocha cake is also excellent.  If you aren't sure which cake to buy (they are a bit pricey), try one of the slices first.  It's a win-win!  It reminds me of being in a delightful Viennese coffee house.
author: Hannah Lee H.

description:
Schubert's Bakery sells great pastries and cakes in the Richmond District.

I recently tried individual sizes of the Tropical Mousse Cake, Mango Mousse Cake and the Peach Mousse Cake.   The mousse in all cakes was very light and flavorful.  There wasn't a favorite, as they all were delicious!  The mousse is on top with a small cake layer below the mousse.  I noticed a very thinly slice "cake strip" with artistic design partially wrapping the outside of both mousse and cake.  I love the design on the cake strip and wondered how they make the designs on them.

It was so sad to eat such a beautiful creation of a cake.  All that's left is a happy stomach with great memories!!
author: Janet H.

description:
A few weeks ago, I put my feelers out on Yelp Talk for a really good bakery. I needed to find a birthday cake- a strawberry shortcake birthday cake, to be exact.Thank god for Yelp Talk, because a wondeful Yelper named Fancy S. pointed me to Schubert's Bakery and after seeing all of the positive Yelp reviews, I knew I couldn't go wrong!

I called Schubert's and was greeted by a very pleasant sales lady who helped me pick out the perfect size strawberry shortcake for my party. I went last Saturday to pick up my cake, and inside the bakery were rows and rows of beautifully decorated cakes, cheesecakes, and  pastries. Each one more exquisite then the last- I wanted to try them all! 

About the strawberry shortcake I got: It was beautifully decorated with fresh strawberries, raspberries, and chocolate designs with really cool patterns on them. It was a two layer white cake and in between the two layers there were fresh strawberries and whipped cream. The cake was frosted with whip cream, and the "Happy Birthday" part was written on two white chocolate rectangles that sat very artistically on top of the cake. I was very impressed with the way this cake looked. But, not only was this cake beautiful on the outside, but it was delicious! The white cake  was light and spongy and not too sweet and the whip cream and fresh strawberries added a sweet/tangy taste that was absolutely perfect! We shared this cake with 10 of our closest friends that night, and every single one of them loved it!

The price for this cake was reasonable too- $34.95 for a 10" cake that fed 14-16 people. I highly recommend Schubert's!! I can't wait to get my next cake here!
author: Kristine Y.

description: What can I say?  I'm not really into cakes or desserts, but this place has some awesome cakes.  The cake that they're most well known for is their Swedish Princess Cake.  This big green slate of yeast-infested yumminess is quite good.  Not sweet or bland, the icing is just right, and the berry jam fillings balances your taste buds really well.  Try it out, they have dozens of other tasty cakes and desserts.
author: Phil H.

description:
Okay, dont' hurt me but I only had some of my friend's baked assorted cookies. These cookies aren't your grocery brand of cookies and they're certainly a great find. This is a great spot for those with a hankering for the baked dessert, especially if you've walked all the way here from PPQ (see previous review tonight). And you can't go wrong with their cakes.

One of the cases was entirely empty. I hope that it's a sign of great business and not a reflection of this economy.
author: Alexander L.

description:
Not once was I disappointed!!! Whatever I bought from them was always a success and all my guests loved it. I think they have a wonderful selection of cakes, pies and cookies and some very yummy bread too. Everything is always fresh, which is so important. 

They help you with selections, they will work with you to make the best cake possible for any of your events. Very welcoming and professional staff...his is what stellar customer service is all about. 

Way to go guys...I need another tiramisu...;-)
author: Katja S.

description: I ordered a tiramisu cake from here a few days ago for my cousin's birthday . The cake looked nice but it didn't taste as great as it looked . It tasted decent but it lacked flavor . The tiramisu was dry , not moist . Can't wait to try their other beautiful cakes .
author: Eileen L.

description:
I've been enjoying cakes from this place for years, my co-worker turned our office onto this bakery and we always order from here. 

HANDS DOWN THIS PLACE HAS THE BEST CHOCOLATE CAKE IN THE WORLD!!!!!  I am 43 years old, traveled and had many a chocolate cake, so...I CAN say this.....and this by far wins the GRAND PRIZE! 

Their other cakes and desserts  are totally amazing as well.  Folks, all their cakes are totally artistic and amazing, but the taste is OUT OF THIS WORLD!!!!!!!!!!  This place is a MUST!

I think they need to call their chocolate mouse hazelnut cake "BREAK A DATE CHOCOLATE CAKE, it's definitely worth it's weight in gold...and you may just wanna break a date to stay home and enjoy this cake LOL!
author: Bahvee V.

description: Do yourself a favor and get the princess cake.  Best princess cake I've ever had.  So fluffy and not too sweet.  The marzipan was also pretty good and I loathe marzipan, absolutely can't stand it.  However, I'll eat a whole tub if it means I can have the princess cake here.
author: Karen N.

description:
It's San Francisco, so, you know, a "Princess Cake" need not be gender exclusive.  Thank God, because it's both lovely and delicious. 

Minus 17 Schrutebucks for closing before I wake up most days.
author: Fernando V.

description:
I love the double chocolate mousse.  I'm born n raised in the Rich, so this place has been my local bakery for my entire life.  Good thing for me, its definitely one of the best in the city.  The chocolate mousse is my family's favorite.  Its fluffy and not too sweet as others tend to be.  We always have to get one for a birthday and its not offical until we cut the cake.  

*nom nom*
author: Steve H.

description:
Letting me know about a new bakery is a bad thing for my diet.  Always go to this part of Clement St. in pairs when driving, so that one person can go down while the other circles around looking and hoping for parking.  The bakery is a suger loving person's dream.  You have pastries, mini cakes, full size cakes, cookies, etc.  Their cakes are fluffy and touched off with light tasting frosting and cream that you don't feel too guilty over.  

Recommendations are everything in the first case as you go in.  Specifically- Tiramisu, Princess Cake, Eclair, Cheesecakes - all flavors.  

All future party cakes will now come from Shubert's!  Try to come during the week where you can get the full selection of goods and a possibility of a parking space.
author: Jason A.

description: I love schuberts. Ive been going here since I was a kid and this is my favorite bakery in san francisco. Their chocolate mousse cakes are to die for! Recently I tried their rasberry mousse cake and it was delicious. Literally they melt in your mouth. Prices are reasonable and I love how they decorate their cakes. Very pretty. I always come here to buy cake for people's birthdays and everyone has always said great things about the flavor, texture and design. If you ever come here, try any of their mousse cakes! Oh, and their tiramisu is delicious as well !
author: Colette P.

description:
finding parking on a sunday around noon was difficult.  it took us about 20 minutes just to park, and i really only needed 5 minutes in the bakery.

I come here for their box of cookies! they're the best! lol

half pound: $7.25
1 pound of cookie box: $13.00

if i didn't live so far away, id want to buy one of the big cakes and bring it home haha
author: luxe o.

description: A friend brought their mango mousse cake to our going-away party and she kept apologizing for the cake because she said her husband was driving terribly and the coulis part of the cake basically fell off the top of the cake. Me, being a non-dessert lover, didn't really care and took only 1/2 a piece to be polite. Well, it blew my mind -- SOOOOOOOOOO delicious! Even with the coulis not completely intact, I wolfed down the other half a slice. If I hadn't been so full that night, I might've been able to down another slice. It was so light and fluffy and contained only a small amount of actual cake (which is great cuz I do not like the cake itself). The mousse part was just divine!
author: Anita L.

description:
I know this place has really delicious mousses, birthday cakes (the opera cake is divine) which i can vouch for. Really good stuff and at serious bargain prices.

This review  is for the tarts. The best friggin' tart I've had in my life. We got the blueberry almond tart (for under $15) which provided dessert for us and friends for a week. The filling was made of fresh blueberries and almonds-you could taste that. The crust was flaky and buttery and perfect, mouthfuls of this stuff just melts in your mouth.

Highly recommended if you are in put in charge of bringing a cake or dessert someplace, you will make bff's left and right. If you are just walking by, we recommend the apricot cookies (next to the tarts), i realize they don't look as phenomenal as the rest of the stuff, but they are seriously good with a cup of coffee. you can also eat it while you walk down clement street.

The service is always great as it can get really busy in there, but the girls always help promptly and with a smile. 

My fav place to indulge!
author: nina B.

description:
The Pink Champagne cake was awesome. We both love white cake with raspberries, so I got my husband this cake for his birthday. I know the name sounded girly but I didn't think the cake would look so girly! It was super cute and very pink. Luckily he is very secure guy so he didn't mind the pink cake, especially since it was delicious. The way I would describe it is the perfect balance between a chinese cake and a western cake. They use whipped cream frosting and really light white sponge cake like a chinese bakery, but then they use a custard and raspberry jam filling like a western bakery. Makes for a deliciously moist and not overly sweet cake. 

Not only that but the cake was decorated very beautifully and the price was pretty good especially if you compare with a lot of these fancy bakeries these days (esp ones that sell cupcakes for way too much!).

I can't wait to try more cakes from Schuberts!
author: Karen C.

description: We had the Swedish Princess Cake for my mother in law's birthday yesterday and it was sooooo good! The delicious white cake layers with raspberry and kirsch custard filling, melts in your mouth and is super moist. MmmmMMmm.... yums! My tummy is growling just thinking about it. Too bad  the bakery is all the way in SF or I'd get all of my cakes from there.
author: Cynthia C.

description: Best cake I have had in the city!  Never had better black forest cake - this place is just crazy good.
author: Ali G.

description:
I let the boyfriend pick the cake of his choice for his birthday. He wanted Lemon Mousse. I ordered a couple of days in advance over the phone, and picked it up with the day of with no problems. It was delicious. Not a fan of the tartness, but the boyfriend liked it.

A couple of days later, it was my momma's birthday. I phoned back asking if they had any 6" Tiramisu Mousse cakes. The lady said, "I have a ton! Come on in!" And she was right. The only thing was I should've picked up a bigger size. Because my mom said (and I quote/translated from Chinese): "This tastes better than the Mango Mousse! From now on, for all birthday cakes, just get this one!"

A couple of days later, my mom was like, "Your aunt's birthday is coming up. Let's get her that cake!" She raved to my aunt about the cake over the phone. So on July 4th, I drove by to see if they were opened. They were. Learning my lesson from my mom's birthday, I got the biggest Tiramisu Mousse they had (it was a family event), and a tiny Mango Mousse for the elders who might not like the coffee taste. Everyone loved it! Even my grandma, who refused to eat cake, caved into the Mango after I said, "But it's soft. See?" and poked into the mousse.

And you know what? It wasn't even my aunt's birthday. My mom lied. She just said that so I would go out and get the cake because she wanted to eat it again.
author: Sandy L.

description:
I ordered a princess cake from Schubert's for my coworkers birthday.  After being spoiled by Copenhagen Bakery in Burlingame, I wasn't sure what to expect.

They did a wonderful job, beautiful presentation and delicious cake.  Now I know where to come when I need to get a cake on the fly, and don't have time to drive out to Burlingame!
author: Christy L.

description: Wow.  Really...wow.  My friend just bought me a cute little chocolate mousse cake with almonds from here as a gift.  It was not only pretty, but tasted perfect. The inside was light & fluffy chocolate mousse, the outside was coated with fresh almond pieces, and the top was decorated with chocolate spheres and slivers.  I just ate it for lunch and I loved it.  I am so excited to come see the bakery in person!!!
author: Julia D.

description:
I want to knock off stars for not having the right sized cake for me. The anal retentive perfectionist in me is dying to rant and rave about how I completely lost my shit when I went to pick up Princess Nadja's Princess birthday cake and found only an 8" cake instead of the large one I'd called to confirm they had for me...

Alas, the expressions of sheer joy on the shiny happy faces of Yelpers at Friday's DYL were enough to convince me that Schubert's earned their 5 stars based on the deliciousness of that cake alone. Light, fluffy layers of cake, ribbons of kir cream and fruit filling, and all wrapped up in marzipan fondant with delicate pink decoration...it was the closest I've come to food orgasm in a long time. I think most of the other partygoers were right there with me.

Schubert's turns out beautiful, delicious pastries and confections. I know. I shoved about 4 different items down my throat while I was having a massive heart attack over the cake size. The opera cake, the cheesecake, and the mocha cake are divine. As are the buttery cookies. What can I say? Eating calms me. 

The shop is small and cozy. BEAUTIFUL cases filled to the brim with cakes for the taking line two walls. I highly recommend ordering ahead of time as this place is HOPPING! The shopgirls are sweet and helpful and did an awesome job of writing a lot on a pretty small cake. I've had at least 5 requests for Princess Cakes for future Yelp Birthdays (mostly from boys...). Mommy's getting all of your cakes at Schubert's from now on, princesses! Happy Birthday, Nadja, and thank you for turning us all on to what will surely be the end of my girlish figure.
author: Autumn K.

description:
I used to pass by this place all the time when I was a kid, forced to petulantly accompany my parents and grandma as they trolled the dim sum shops and grocery stores.  I never gave this place much of a second thought.

Not until a good twenty and some odd years later was I introduced to a Schubert's cake at a friend's birthday.

It was like someone had caught 100 lily-white cherubs, crushed them up, and baked them right into this cake.  Unbelievably moist and delicate, the mango flavor dissolved on your tongue.  It took every ounce of respect and dignity to not shove the birthday boy out of the way and indulge myself with abandonment.

The Swedish Princess cake is also tantalizing, with the same fluffy moist cake inside and a fragrant almond marzipan icing on the outside.  Imagining it now is making my mouth water.

Another great thing is that you can order and pay for the cake online, and just pop in to pick it up.
author: L Y.

description:
Schubert's is definitely one of favorite bakeries in the city... I always get one of their personalize sized cakes and their fruit tart.  

For my 20th birthday, my then- boyfriend bought what seemed like every type of cake sold in the bakery (the mini sizes, of course!).  I think there were about 18 kinds, but anyway.. he put a sparkle candle on each cake, and I still remember it til this very day.  I, of course, got to try every flavor.. and I love them all!!!  (btw.. Great birthday idea for you clueless boys out there)

Anyway, Schubert's has chocolately cakes for those chocolate lovers out there, as well as fruit mousse cakes for old Asian folks that hate anything sweet.  Seriously, get those little cakes so you can try more flavors, rather than one huge one.  The price is about the same.


So yummy... me love mango mousse cake long time. rawr.
author: S L.

description:
3.5 stars. A neighborhood gem of a bakery with Beautifully decorated cakes! I cant believe i hadnt heard about this place before. I had more Swedish nostalgia and saw that people were raving over their princess cake (ohBoy!). We stopped by before T's doctor appointment and picked up a slices of princess cake, chocolate mousse, mango mousse, green petit four, raspberry rugalech, raspberry filled cookie. I think the pastries are pretty good, but definitely on the sweet side.

I was disappointed by the princess cake though - it didnt really taste like the princess cake from vette katten - marzipan was way too sweet, no custard layer, not enough whipped cream. Guess ill just have to make it myself or make my way back to sweden! Id go back to try the other things but for chocolate mousse cake i really like virginia bakery in berkeley.
author: Cammy H.

description: A very nice coworker brought in a chocolate torte cake with chocolate frosting and ganache on top. it was AMAZING!! Moist, not too sweet, frosting was amazing. I wish i could eat more right now.
author: Em F.

description:
Came here with a few friends and got to try several desserts. Super cute decor and really friendly staff. It was really crowded and there wasn't so much a line as a mob of people claiming staff members as soon as they were ready to order, but service was still really fast and pleasant. We had:

Opera cake: Delicious! It was the only thing I really liked, but it was so good it earns this place 4 stars. So good! Nutty andchocolaty, with delicious dense wafery dough... You have to try it! You'll probably need a glass of water though :)

Black forest cake: I'm not a black forest cake expert, but either it was mediocre or I just don't like black forest. The cake was extremely light and fluffy, but I couldn't really taste the chocolate. It was overwhelmed by the frosting, which was also super light and airy and surprisingly good, but there was just too much of it and it had too bland a flavor. And on top of that, the cherries were just too sour, so that was all I could really appreciate. 

Mango mousse: Decent, but I've had a lot better - only the glaze really tasted of mango; the mousse itself was kind of bland. 

So, get the opera cake!
author: J M.

description: Their round cakes are so cute! I love Tiramisu prepared for my friend's farewell party:) The price is very reasonable compared to other cake shops.
author: Maitai N.

description: I have been here more times than I care to admit over past five years. It is great, and I have never had anything bad. Aside from almost everything being  incredibly good, I have only had one pastry once that was sub-par. Other than that, I cant think of anything critical. It is a terrific Bakery worth  the drive to visit, and parking can be challenging, but just  cruise the side streets and you will find one. My favorite is their Napoleon. It is really excellent. If you need a cake, you should try this place, you will not be disappointed. Go early, and go often!  Oh, and by the way, THEY DO HAVE OTHER ITEMS THAT ARE EXCELLENT OTHER THAN THE SWEDISH PRINCESS CAKE  and worth mentioning (I can say this being  Scandinavian!). This is a 4 1/2 star bakery. Hyvaa Paivaa Suomalinnen (sorry bout  the spelling all you Finns out there!)
author: Jeff V.

description: Ordered two items when I came here. The Swedish Princess Cake and the White Chocolate Raspberry Mousse. DELICIOUS! You can tell they put care into their desserts. Goes great with a glass of wine :) Definitely will come back for more of the Princess Cake as I love the flavor of the marzipan. I also thought their poster of the periodic table of desserts was cute!
author: Justine T.

description: Run.....don't walk to Shubert's. Love the opera cake and chocolate mousse cake. Very rich and yummy. For those that don't enjoy such a rich tastes, no worries......they have light and tasty desserts, too. Enjoy!
author: Michelle T.

description:
4 stars because I've only tried one thing from here..

I haven't had the opportunity to visit this place, but a friend bought the Tiramisu cake to bring to our girls night. Had we not eaten so much for dinner, we would have finished the whole cake.

Schubert's puts a lot of effort into the design of the cake without compromising the flavor of the cake at all.

Once I get the chance, I will definitely try other things on their menu.
author: Michelle P.

description:
Tiramisu!!! 
The only place i could get my fav desert that taste like my Aunt Doris used to make.. I think the price was to cheap for the quality of their cakes.. well, works fine with me.. =)) i'll buy one tomorrow~
author: Bernard V.

description:
Years and years and years ago when my mom would take me and my sister to Schubert's, I insisted on calling it "Mary's Bakery" (defiant 4 year-old, "mine! Mine!-ness"). I loved it that much. 
The rich smell of coffee, chocolate and butter fill the air; it's such this irreplaceable smell in my memory duct that Schubert's will always be near and dear to my heart. 
Those little butter cookies with dot sprinkles on them are to die for. I could eat a whole damn tray if only I could get behind the counter (one reason I shouldn't work at a bakery...) 
If you love Schuberts as much as I do, you must go to The Cakery in Burlingame, now run by the old owners of Schuberts!
author: Mary Ella D.

description:
On some days in which I have a freakish need for sugar, I actually leave work twenty minutes early in order to make it here before they close at 6:00. They have a section of discounted items after 5:00, but it gets crowded by the end of the day and so most of them are often gone.

Admittedly, I've only really tried their pastries and scones, not their cakes, but I do like how the blueberry scone isn't too sweet. The atmosphere inside is quaint, and their coffee is quite good as well. I love all of the vintage bakery prints scattered on the walls. 

Go here for a snack on the go, or for a coffee and pastry in the morning, or just some place to sit and chat with friends!
author: Anna H.

description:
Schuberts! I love them. For my birthday, my boyfriend organized a dinner party at one of our friends house -- TrulyMed's food was wonderful, btw -- and for dessert, he ordered a big Swedish Princess Cake. I'm not too fond of the name because I'm nothing like little miss princess, but the cake was incredibly good. 

Delicious white cake layers with raspberry filling and custard, topped with a whipped cream-marzipan combo. Sinfully good! A friend of ours peeled the marzipan off her slice and saved it for the last! It's one of the best cakes that I've had. Definitely a must try for birthdays, special occasions or heck just ANY day.
author: Erika I.

description:
Grade: A

One of my favorite bakeries in SF! Their cakes are beautiful, and we used to get them for a lot of birthday celebrations. The are best known for the mousse cakes. I am not usually a fan of mousse cakes, but I loved the ones from Schubert's. My favorites: tiramisu mousse and mango mousse. YUM. And oh, so pretty.
author: Lisa N.

description:
I've never been a fan of chocolate, but for my boyfriend's birthday, I got him a chocolate mousse cake. We had about 20 people for his dinner and every single person raved about the cake. They could not get enough of it. Too bad I didn't expect 20 people and they all ended up getting teeny pieces. 

They claimed that it was very creamy, but the flavor wasn't overly sweet or too overpowering. 

I, on the other hand, am a big fan of the tiramisu. It was the best tiramisu i have ever tasted. The lady fingers were so light and fluffy. It was seriously a slice of heaven. It wasn't overly sweet and all the tastes worked well together. 

Service over the phone is great. I was having trouble deciding between cakes and they helped me. They told me what customers liked about each cake, and so forth. They were very patient with me too because I took awhile to decide what I wanted. 

The in store service is a little eh. The cakes were always on time, but I was standing in line behind this lady. And she was taking her sweetass time, while I was rushing to make it on time to a birthday dinner. The person who came in behind me was helped before I was. 

Parking is hard. Nearly impossible to find on its street.  Prices are pretty expensive. You don't get a lot for the amount you spend. But you do pay for the quality.

I'm not a fan of cake, but this place could make me fat.
author: Karen C.

description:
I bought a strawberry shortcake from here for my friend's birthday and it wasn't too special, slightly below average.  I'm not sure, but it seemed a little dry and somewhat bland.  Maybe it was the season of the strawberries or something..  Or maybe it was a fluke or just a bad day.  They get some stars for making a good wedding cake, like 3 stars good.

stinky tofu
author: StinkyTofu S.

description:
As far a personalized cakes in SF, Schubert's can't be beaten on value.  Their staff is really attentive during tastings (and they don't charge you for as some places do) and are great with follow up from your initial order placement, to designing your cake and double checking details to actual delivery.  Their cakes are not necessarily "gourmet" in quality, but they are very tasty, moist and come with a myriad of filling choices (I went with the kirsch custard and currant filling).

I brought in the stamp I used on an invitation and asked them to replicate it as a pattern on my cake and they said, "no problem".  When it was delivered, there was my flower motif on the cake in exactly the shade of aubergine I asked for.

I've heard of people ordering event cakes for $15/slice and I remember nothing about the cake's flavor or design - mine was $3.25/slice, delicious and personalized in style, color and design.  

I've also had the pleasure of tasting a few of Schubert's mousse cakes while out with my friend and they were equally as beautiful and tasty as the cake I ordered (and just as reasonably priced!).
author: Marissa C.

description: Ditto all the 5 star raves for Schubert's and their Swedish Princess Cake.
author: Joc V.

description:
Omigod what was that? You came gliding into our life so innocent and sweet.

I thought it was going to be a one night stand but you were still as delectable the next day... and the next.

My girlfriend and I love you. Come back Swedish Princess Cake come back. We want more!
author: keith h.

description:
Great baked good,

Slipped a little over the years but a nice alternative to Krispy Creme.
I love the Raspberry rings. Now these rings are copied all over town. 
But these are the best. Get one on a sunday morning with a hot cup of Peet's. The best!!!!

Interesting story. I got pick-pocketed here. Yeah at the counter some guy kept bumping into me. Living in the city right, its either a horney woman or a someone being rude. You ignore it. Well this guy or who ever it was succeded in opening my cargo pocket and getting my wallet and Keys!!!!! I felt nothing, very practiced. That and I was seriously hung over.
author: William H.

description: We got the chocolate mousse.  Beautiful presentation, but it was quite sweet.
author: Angela L.

description:
I've walked by this bakery a million times and not noticed it, but after having ordered a birthday cake last week, you better believe I will be coming back! 

I checked out this bakery after reading all the great yelp reviews and decided to order the Princess cake for my boyfriend's mother's birthday dinner. His mom absolutely loves anything purple and I asked them if they could somehow make the cake (originally green) into a nice shade of purple. "Not a problem!" they said when I placed my order over the phone. They were efficient, friendly, courteous and just wanted to make your life easier! 

When we picked up the cake, it was perfect! A beautiful shade of lavender and tasted just as good as it looked. The cake was moist and the cream filing was rich but not too sweet (like some American cakes). We also had a small sampling of the mango mousse and tiramisu and both were delicious. Although, hands down, I think the Princess cake is the way to go. It's uniquely decorated and the combination of cream, marzipan, cake and berry filling just melts in your mouth with every bite. 

I can't wait for the next birthday as I know exactly where the cake is coming from!
author: Whitney Q.

description: Short but sweet: I'm giving Schubert's 5 stars for not only making the most amazing *looking* cakes, but also making them taste great, too!  ;)
author: Cassidy P.

description: Schubert's!  I came in here looking for the world's best birthday cake or something that would come quite close.  Although Schubert's may not be world class, it sure is up there.  I did not want to buy a mousse cake so I got the Raspberry White Chocolate cake because my-long-time-no-see friend from middle school who works there recommended it, and I bought it, thinking it was a white cake.  However after the song was sung, wish was made, candles were blown, it turned out to be a mousse cake!  Imagine my disappointment... and then imagine the delight of my tastebuds when I had a bite of this cake!!  It was amazing.  I'm going to come to Schubert's now even if there is no occasion for cake.  Next time it's going to be the mango mousse.. yum.
author: Vivian H.

description:
I first heard about Schuberts on Yelp when I was looking at eateries on Clement. So when a friend of mine was visiting and it happened to be her birthday, I wanted to treat her to a birthday cake. I remembered the reviews about Schuberts and thought it would be the perfect opportunity to go and try their cakes and treat my friend! And when we walked in, we fell in love with Schuberts.
The store was so cute, it's like we're not even in Clement anymore or not in a cake store of this time. Their selection of small cakes were so good we had such a hard time deciding what to get, we ended up sharing 2 small cakes between 3 people:
-Chocolate truffle
-Cappucino Mousse

I've had a lot of good cake before. And they were pretty good. I really liked the Cappacino Mousse cake, with its layers of chocolate cake and cappacino mousse. The designs of the small cakes were simple but well decorated. Their cakes were both rich but in a good way =)

We sat down in the store to eat the cakes and it was such a delightful dining experience. Whilst eating we got to admire all the other options we could try next time. The interior of the store had some really cute artwork such as the perodic table of cakes. 

Definitely worth spending a little more money on Schubert's cakes!
author: Chloe C.

description:
DELICIOUS lemon mousse cake! We come here all the time for sweets, but wound up here getting a cake for daughter's birthday. They personalized on a huge white chocolate bar with her name on it, which of course was HERS to eat! 

Don't forget to try the chocolate mousse as well as strawberry mousse here---also very good! Decadent treats, but oh, so worth it!
author: cindy c.

description:
I love Schubert's Bakery!

I like getting here early on Saturdays, before 9 am.  I know it sounds crazy, but think about it: at 8:30 am on Saturdays, you don't have to feed the meters, fight the crowds or wait in line.

Sometimes, I come here before breakfast at my Mom and Dad's.  I pick up some raspberry, apricot and plain croissants and "surprise" my parents.  The pastries are incredibly fresh and practically melt in your mouth.  The prices are a bit steep by the Richmond standards, but the pastries are totally worth it.

For special occasions, I always pick up a cake from Schubert's.  The cakes look more expensive than they really are, and you can give your suburban friends a truly jaw-dropping experience.  Comments such as "Aww, you shouldn't have," "How much did THAT cost you???" and "You have GOT to tell me where you got this cake from" are very common.

I strongly recommend a tiramisu cake or a strawberry/raspberry mousse cake.  They're moist, light and, forgive the cliche, "sinfully delicious."  All cakes are beautifully decorated with chocolate shavings, bonbons, strawberries, etc.  Schubert's will gladly write your message in frosting on a piece of chocolate and place it tastefully right on your cake.  Whether you're saying "Happy Birthday," "Will you marry me?" "I think we should see other people" or "Sorry I ran over your dog," your message will look and taste beautiful.

I am not a fan of their Opera cake (it's just too rich for me) or their cheesecake (it doesn't really taste like a cheesecake should), but everything else is absolutely great.  Try it, and I guarantee you'll be hooked on Schubert's.

Must . . . have . . . more . . . cake!
author: Yan G.

description:
You are what's wrong with the world these days. How dare you set up shop many years before my dentist did and entice me to eat your sugary confectionery goodness! How dare you for being sooo decadently scrumptious and consistent with your total awesomeness!!! I swear, you are the cause of a majority of my cavities and may have contributed to my low level diabetes! But I can't help but run back into your arms each and everytime I go see my dentist...Hell, I show up at your door step even when I don't have a dentist appointment just to spend money on you...Oh, such a pitiful existence I am of a man...Brought to my over dramatic knees by something as simple as a mango pudding cake...Woe, is me...Woe, is me...

Sorry for being overly dramatic but that kinda sums up my relationship for Schubert's. I thank my aunt for showing up one day with a tiramisu cake that they make...Freaking FABULOUS with the loud flamboyant gay voice! And ever since I knew it was right across the street from my dentist, I was in heaven and hell at the same time. Thank god for dental insurance!
author: Anthony L.

description:
STUNNED.

That's what I felt the 2nd time I stepped into the store.
First time it looked lame because they were out of most of the stuff. 
But the 2nd time. OMG. The display case is filled up with GORGEOUS cakes. They are not the sponge cake with frosting that you get from Safeway. The are more like, say, your wedding cakes. They are absolutely gorgeous, and I'm sure they taste just as great as they look, judging from the small pastries that I've tried.

I don't know how much truth is there in the "authentic viennese" part, but I do find the croissants of very high quality, almost as good as Tartine. The apple croissant looked the least appealing to me, but somehow I got it. After taking a couple of bites in the car, had to put it away so I couldn't finish the entire (big) thing. The next evening, took another bit, it was almost just as good as about 35 hours after I bought it, which is pretty amazing. Croissants usually get stale very soon, even the ones from Tartine. The apple filling has a very good balance between tartness, sweetness, and spiciness. 

Will definitely keep coming back and trying new things. Most pastries are $3.50 (ish). I'll eat here every meal if I could.
author: Yuchi C.

description:
omg SWEEETS!!!  so i used my boyfriend's birthday as an excuse to buy one slice of almost every cake they have!  i wanted to taste everything so i could figure out their BEST cake!  i tried the different cheesecakes, the mousse cakes, the swedish princess, the strawberry shortcake, fruit tart, and so on.  

in the end, i was pretty disappointed with their swedish cake, because i was most looking forward to it.  it was wayyyyyyy too sweet for my taste, esp the green marzipan topping (?).  after i ruled that out, i loved everything else.  in the end, i went for the mango cheesecake!  it was just incredibly delicious and i knew that even if i ordered their largest size, we could finish it.  since then, i've been a big fan of their tropical mousse cake and fruit tart.
author: Irene W.

description:
Some thoughtful person bought  me a white chocolate birthday cake from Schubert's last year and it was great! I love this little Richmond District Bakery. 

Just so you know, they make a nice fruit tart too.
author: Jessica D.

description:
Warning: My first yelp review! But how fitting - dessert! 

I picked up a Mango Mousse cake for a birthday (a little hesitant because I don't think the birthday person is the biggest mousse fan) - but he thoroughly enjoyed it. The first Schubert's tasting I've had was via their tiramisu, which I had fond memories of, so I can now add their mousse cake on my list of Schubert fav's.

Mango mousse cake - light, not too sweet, and was perfect for the two of us to share. I'd definitely recommend it. I'm interested in sampling their other mousse cake offerings.
author: Janet P.

description:
Cannot say enough great things about this place. Honestly if I could I would love to occupy Schuberts. Their neopolitan (spelling?) is to die for. I would suggest this place to everybody. 
To reiterate my point I am going to use a bunch of exclamation points. Seriously, it is that good. !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Tina C.

description:
