This is the ONLY place in San Francisco that deserves to be called a Bakery!

Every time I go there, I am always fascinated by the look of their cakes: so beautiful and fresh!
The staff is quite efficient and pricing is fair considering the quality of the ingredients.

I just wish that the seating area was a bit more cozy. I would love to sit there and enjoy my cake and a cuppa tea for hours...They do have a few tables but you cannot call that a "salon" area. According to my husband, their coffee is not great unfortunately.

My favorite cakes are:

Black Forest cake
Tiramisu
Profiterole
Mango mousse...
author: Anastasia M.

description: Wasn't incredibly impressed with their cakes.  Presentation-wise, the cakes I got for my friend's 30th birthday was beautiful but taste-wise, so-so.  A little pricier for my taste, $25.50 for an 8" round cake.  But my friend enjoyed the cakes and her birthday.  Difficult to find parking.  Won't be coming back here again.
author: Jen S.

description:
Imagine, its december 23 and your 3 year old ONLY wants a strawberry shortcake for her birthday. So as a loving mommy what do you do?
I trekked over to Schuberts to order said cake and almost choked when I was told, "since strawberries are out of season, it wil be $42.00". That was the best strawberry shortcake I've ever had, loaded with fresh strawberries and yummy whipped cream and worth every cent.
Now on to the best almond croissants in the world,  super flaky and filled with sweet almond paste. Get there early as these sell out by noon.
author: Ivy C.

description:
Holy crack bakery, Batman! 

This is a great little unassuming bakery on Clement Street, sort of the last place you'd expect to see on a street filled with steamed pork buns, boba, and durian fruit. You'll find great cakes, all of which can be preordered online! Whoa Nelly! So futuristic!

Black Forest Cake. That is all that needs to be said. You're drooling now, aren't you. Order up and often. You won't be let down.
author: Charlene L.

description: I happened to find Schubert's while looking for a bakery close to my son's graduation party. What a find! I ordered the Princess cake and the Chocolate mousse cake with shavings. Both simply wonderful cakes, and the Princess cake is a marzipan lover's dream!! The staff was very helpful on the phone helping me decide how much cake to order, too. The cakes are worth every penny. :)
author: Colleen S.

description:
When I asked what type of cake my mom wanted for her birthday this past weekend she said, "Mango." 

I immediately came on here and searched for "mango cake" and came up with this #1 bakery.  I was nervous, ordering a cake from a bakery I have never been to before, especially for my beloved mom's birthday, but I called up and placed an order for a quarter sheet which I was going to pick up in less than 24 hours.  "Happy Birthday, Wonder Woman!" not a problem.    

As the cake came out of the box there were "ooohs" and "aaahs" over the brilliant chocolate decorations.  That was a good sign.  Then my cellphone rang and I had to go pick up a friend from the BART station, which I did as there was no indication that a "Happy Birthday" song was coming on anytime soon.   I came back to find that the cake had already been cut into!  Nobody had waited for the first born who actually bought the cake!  Okay, okay, this was still another good sign.  The proof positive that the cake was excellent - the candles weren't even lit even though I had put them on there before I left.  My mom had just made her wish OVER the moist mangoey goodness of the cake itself.  Damn - now that is some powerful stuff.

As an added convenience, they have an online ordering form.
author: Michelle Q. S.

description: I'm a little ashamed to say that I've lived in SF my whole life and I have never walked into this place until yesterday. I love cakes and dessert and I knew the minute I walked in that I would be coming back again. It is clean and everything about the cakes (creativity and taste) makes me feel like I'm in one of those expensive bakeries but minus the outrageous prices. I had the tiramisu and my bf at the chocolate mousse cheesecake, both were really good. I'm already thinking about my next visit and when the next special occasion will be so it'll give me an excuse to buy a whole cake.
author: Queena T.

description:
I'm really big on desserts.  
This bakery makes great cakes.  
The napoleon is awesome, with its lite puff pastry layer and fresh fruit.  Its a cake that everyone loves.  
The Vienesse Fruit Torte is also a winner and very colorful.
The tiramisu is like no other, very pretty. 

I've brought many a cake to share at the office and Schubert's is one of the favorites.  Girls started calling me the devil...
author: David L.

description:
this place is dessert heaven! i'm always leaving my dirty lil prints all over the counter while i ogle over all the pretty cakes. i don't get to come here often and the only time i really indulged was when we were looking for a baker for our wedding cake. we were so thrilled with our white cake with mango filling - it was one of the best tasting wedding cakes EVER!! (i'm not trying to be biased, honestly!) too bad that the guests were already stuffed from the 10 course meal AND the other desserts. not only are their cakes tasty but they were so easy to work with! they totally delivered on all our expectations AND *drum roll* they even give you a free cake for your one year so you don't have to do the gross "freezing the top of the cake for a year" tradition. 

BEAT THAT WITH A BAT!
author: Jane Y.

description:
Oh, YEAH!!!

Now that's cake, BABY!!!

I miss living in the city, simply because I can't visit Schubert's as much as I'd like.

CAKE SUPREME!!!!!  Oh, yes!!!

Mmm-mmm-mmm!!!
author: Ladi Da A.

description:
Now this is how cake is supposed to taste!
Once a week I'm allowed to indulge and ever since I sank my teeth into the Strawberry Shortcake, this is my go-to place for yummy happiness.

Neither my dad nor Chris like cake but with a single slice of fluffy goodness, Schubert's has converted them both!

We're getting a very affordable wedding cake here and I can't wait!
author: JaM W.

description:
I used to spoil my belly with their Princess Cake. It's a swedish cake that makes my belly sing and... big :)

It's covered with Marzipan! OH YUM. This bakery makes it the BEST! ... not too sweet and just the sweetest looking cake. Perfect for the princess or for your girlfriend on one of those days you need to make it up for your bad behavior. My ex used to get me smiling with one of these cakes. 

I just tell myself it's fat free... forget the guilt. just eat it.
author: Hana N.

description:
Always a family tradition for special occasions.  One of only two bakeries we go to for quality desserts.....

We go here about 6 times a year eventhough we are in NY.....just that good!

Get the double chocolate mouse cake!
author: V. R.

description:
Mmm... delicious cakes by the slice! 

Light and airy Mango Mousse cake...$3.45
Princess Cake with a citrus-like fondant, white cake layers and raspberry filling...$3.45
Opera Cake with layers of dark chocolate and ganache, covered in almonds...$3.45
Little perfect Petit Fours, so beautiful with a tasty light lemon filling...$1.60
Dentist bill...$200-500...

Monday night, post-birthday celebration gluttony? Priceless.
author: Anna S.

description:
I selected the suitcase wedding cake for my daughters wedding.(May 30th) My daughter and son-in-law love to travel so we felt it would be perfect. I loved the picture they provided and asked the pastry chef if it would turn out exactly like their picture. (Except I asked for the top suitcase to be in a pale aqua color with darker aqua color straps.) I told her absolutely NO pink. She said yes no problem. I even gave them a swatch of aqua fabric to match. After I left I noticed the paperwork said blue straps. I called them and told them that the paperwork did not mention a pale blue suitcase. They said don't worry there would not be any pink on the cake. I called them at least three more times and sent them the travel stickers they asked for. Everything seemed to be going great. Then I saw the cake at the reception!!! I was so angry. The top suitcase was PINK with blue straps! None of the suitcases looked like the picture. It looked like an amateur decorated it.  As for the cake itself? I overheard someone say, "They could have gotten a better cake from Costco". I wanted to cry. 
I called the bakery several times to complain in the first week after the wedding. I could not get a hold of the manager. I live approx. 400 miles away and could not go in person. Finally, In Late June I was able to speak to Ralph the owner. He said he was sorry and said he would refund the full amount of the cake. He asked for my address. Never got a check. My husband called him and wrote an e-mail. Finally, in August we received a check for $100! The cake was $635. They had no problem taking a deposit for $160 on the day they took the order. He wrote in his letter quote, I am just as upset as you. I highly doubt that Mr. Wenzel! See pictures On my personal profile.
author: Laura T.

description: Super little spot to satisfy your sweet tooth! Great selection of cookies, baked goods, and tarts. Big selection of cakes for birthdays or any kind of special occasion. The Mrs. loves the coffee crunch but really you  can't go wrong with anything in this joint.
author: T L.

description:
Service is hit or miss, smile or all-bizness like so just one little star off.  I guess the front staff are really busy.

Great cakes!  Real pros, all the little details.  $17 for a six inch double chocolate mousse cake.  Gorgeous.  Delicious.  

This place is a solid, sure bet for cakes!
author: Mrs F.

description:
I ordered a strawberry shortcake cake for my boss' birthday here yesterday and everyone couldn't stop talking about how good it was. Took a few leftovers for my friends and they loved it too. It was so good I came back here a second time with the same friends (after they ate the leftovers). That time I had the Neapolitan, they had a Mango Mousse and a Tropical Mousse, all very yummy... 

Quite possibly the best bakery in SF. Or ever? Try it, you won't be let down
author: Anita W.

description:
Wow.  When I think of "cake," the first thing that usually pops into my head is the dry, crumbly, heavily shortening-frosted rectangles of yuck that are typically passed out at office birthday celebrations.  This is NOT that type of cake!!!!   

I initially came in to order a special baby-shower cake, and ended up walking out with four slices of some of the best pieces of chocolate heaven one could imagine.  They were supposed to last me at least a few days...  *sigh*

I suppose I should be glad that parking is so difficult in this neighborhood...
author: Jessica B.

description: I buy cakes here for most occasions. They are usually very helpful on the phone when ordering. Pick up is a pain in the ass. Parking is usually a mission and the place is always packed. The cakes are beautiful though and taste really good too. They are nit overly sweet and I love all the different options and flavors. The chocolate decorations can be a bit much when your actually eating the cake but they really make the cakes stand out. If you receive one of these you will feel special for sure. They are a bit pricey but you are paying for quality.
author: Lauren N.

description: i had the most decadent and moist chocolate mousse birthday cake from here. yum!
author: Helen Y.

description:
Beautiful creations are made here.

Very lovely cakes. I haven't tried everything, but I've had a few cheesecakes from this bakery for my birthday and it was delicious. It's a very cute place to walk-in and just stare at all the wonderful creations. Everything looks too pretty to eat! This place is an expensive treat though, so I only visit once in awhile.
author: Bets Y.

description:
I heart my wedding cake. This was my first stop when I was planning my wedding.  I didn't know what kind of design I wanted, all knew was that I wanted my cake from Schubert. With all the great reviews from Yelp, I knew I couldn't go wrong.  We went for a cake tasting and I put down my deposit on the spot.  We went for an alternating layer. One layer, we went for a yellow cake with kirsch custard and strawberry filling. The other, chocolate cake with rum and raspberry filling.  The girl who helped us was really nice and answered all our questions.  I was a bit reluctant to have a fondant overlay since I was so use to butter cream and whipped cream...but the cakes with fondant looked so pretty. Initially I thought they would end up charging an additional cost depending on the design because a lot of places do base the cost on the design of the cake.  And there was no way I was going to pay over a grand for a wedding cake. To our surprise the girl who was helping us said we could bring any design and the bakery chef would work off it at no additional cost. Yay...I score once again. First with wedding dress and now the cake. I love being a bargain hunter.  It's the Asian blood in me.

Schubert's portfolio didn't exactly do them justice..perhaps due to copyrights?? They didn't want to be sued for taking someone's design??  Anyhow, I found this cake design and asked if it was doable. And so the bakery chef said no problem.  Was I taking a chance?? Yeah, I was...but I trusted them completely. Excitement built and couldn't wait to see our wedding cake.  

On our wedding day.. oohh..the cake was so pretty.  Prettier than I imagined.. =). And it tasted very good.  I only had several bites of the chocolate with rum and raspberry filling.  You all know how wedding are, the married couple never really gets to enjoy the food.  The hubby and I have the top layer of the cake in the freezer.  We ate two slices of the cake the day after the wedding...I don't think I could have waited a year... =)
author: hello k.

description: I returned to the Richmond district for a quick scour at Green Apple Books and stopped by Schubert's for a treat. The store is very packed but service is quick. The mango mousse cake still rules with fresh mango.
author: Matthew Y.

description:
We just ordered our wedding cake from Schubert's.  I called and made an appointment for the wedding cake tasting and although the place was packed, the staff was still really friendly and took time out to help us answer our questions.  They were able to match our colors and design and the prices were really reasonable.  

They do have a long list so you have to order well in advance!  The first thing they told me was they weren't taking any more orders for 2007!...and this was back in July.
author: Jen L.

description:
Schubert's Bakery was the first place my fiancee and I checked out for our wedding cake. We scheduled a tasting on a Saturday. Even though it was super busy, the woman that served us gave us a lot of attention and was very nice to us. 

The cakes we tasted were really nothing special. I was a little dismayed that they served us on styrofoam plates with plastic forks (environmental reasons aside, it seemed kind of cheap). We tried the mango, raspberry, and apricot fillings. They were all just OK. The cake itself wasn't very thick and kind of reminded me of out-of-the-box yellow cake I can make at home.

Overall: Service was good, cakes seemed cheap. Not really up to wedding caliber.
author: Ryan S.

description:
4.5 stars. Delicious cakes!!  

Was planning to use them for my wedding cake but I contacted them too late because they already have too many cake orders for that month.  :(  But back to the cakes - it's a solid bakery with delicious cakes at a reasonable price.  The shop can get very crowded but it's worth it for the event you are planning. The cakes are moist, soft and not too sweet - if that's what you like!
author: Mavis G.

description: Tried the princess cake which looked promising n had a great reputation preceding it. It was a party in my mouth right away. Marzipan melts in the mouth n is pretty rich. We also tried the black forest which was equally yummy.
author: Natasha I.

description: I had the mango mousse and mango cheesecake which were delicious. The chocolate they use to decorate is a good quality, it's rich and creamy. The mousse and cake are not too sweet and has a clear taste of what it's is suppose to be which in my case mango. I also love how you can get cakes in 3 different sizes daily instead of special ordering. In addition they  will actually handwrite a message on your cake if it fits or on a piece of chocolate.
author: Jess H.

description:
OH MY GOD.

wow!

yummy yummy yummy

I stumbled across their delicious piece of art at (of all places) my Dentist's office.  He was celebrating his 24th year (go Dr. Yee!), and was serving up little slices of this cake.  Looking at it, I thought...nah...it's gonna be too sweet, but much to my surprise, it is PERFECT!  Each little layer is like a layer of LOOOOVE, not too sweet, but ever so tastey.  This is some sort of chocolate/coffee cake with multiple layers of different colors of brown and tan.  When I push my fork down over it's gooey goodness, a little squirt of brown comes rushing out the side (different ideas pop into my mind, but I know the end result is pure heaven).

I will be back...my gooey little friend.
author: Matt V.

description:
After over 500 reviews Schubert's is still at 4.5 stars, that in itself says something. I bought a 6" Chocolate Cheese cake for the lady's birthday today. 
#1) It was $13.50. I have spent $30 + on cakes that were so/so... If I paid $50 for this cake, it would have been a good investment
#2) This cake had many layers of flavor, artistic flare, and was just damn tasty
#3) Just go there PERIOD
author: Corey A.

description:
MMM...yummy yummy princess cake... yummy yummy strawberry shortcake.....

not so yummy mango mousse cake or mango cheesecake.....
author: C. T.

description:
This has to be my favorite bakery for desserts in SF.

The mango mousse cake, double chocolate and tiramisu are personal first choices.  Instead of the full cake you can choose several of the small individuals.

Everyone can find something here.  They look fantastic too.   I think I've tried just about everything they make!
author: Perry S.

description: I've been coming here for years, and Schubert's never disappoints. My family loves all of the mousse cakes, and we just recent tried the St Honore for a special occasion, which is a new MUST have for us now!
author: Stan L.

description: I ordered my wedding cake from Schubert's Bakery.  They did a wonderful job!  The cake was not only beautiful, it was also delicious!  All my guests loved the cake!
author: J T.

description: We used Schubert's for our wedding cake and they did not disappoint.  It looked and tasted like perfection.
author: Siobhan C.

description: Cakes are pretty looking and delicious.. esp. the princess cake. They do wonderful designs and free scribing too which comes in handy on birthdays and special occasions.
author: Patrick L.

description: I just have to make sure to give credit where credit is due.  I have had rush orders and they always try their best to accommodate me.  I love their prices and their cakes (all of them!) and am so glad to have found them! You guys rock!
author: Val G.

description:
Counter guy wasn't sure of the flavor's of each cake. 

"Which one is this?"  

"Umm, I think it's the strawberry mousse"

"What about this one?"

"Umm, I think those are chocolate mousse."

In my mind, I'm thinking, "Umm, you suck."

But the chocolate mousse cake for $15.50 didn't suck.  Pretty f----n good actually.
author: greg e.

description:
I use to work near this bakery, and whenever it was one of my co-worker's birthdays, we would get a cake at Schubert's. 

I've tried practically everything in this store. Mango mousse, black currant mousse, chocolate mousse, tiramisu, you name it. They're all equally great.
author: Tina C.

description: I have been getting birthday cakes from Schubert's for several years now and they have always been solidly good.  UNTIL TODAY.  I called for my favorite cake -- basically a princess cake with rum custard filling instead of the raspberry jam.  The person on the phone says that they no longer make custom cakes!!!  WHAT???  A bakery that won't make cakes the way that you want when you preorder?  Have they become Safeway?  I will be getting cakes elsewhere from now on.
author: Aleta A.

description:
You don't need me to give you a history or anything on this place since everyone else has done so already.  

It's a quiet, old fashioned bakery with everything you can tempt your sweet tooth with: cakes, pies, treats, cookies, brownies-- everything looks delicious and yummy.   

The cakes are not overly sweet and they are well made and not as expensive as you would think.

My shining moment was when I saw the petite fours in the bakery case!  Petite fours used to be my favorite treat growing up!!  Loved them.  Though they were cute here, they were not as good as I had remembered them to be.  Nevertheless had I never experienced a better petite four, this would have been great!
author: Denise B.

description:
Had a really delicious chocolate mousse cake from here. The texture was light so it didn't feel too heavy going down. The chocolate taste was perfect - sweet enough to satisfy and chocoholic but not too sweet that it makes you cringe.

Bottom line: Really good choc mousse cake. I plan to drop by their store to check out what else they have.
author: Jim C.

description:
Didn't check Yelp before deciding on this bakery, as our groomsman's girlfriend used to work here.  He thought we'd get a good deal, and he was right.  Yelp just reaffirmed what we were thinking.

For regular pricing:  four tiers ($660), plus delivery to Napa ($140) to feed over 200 guests = less than $4 per person.  Sweet!  

For a point of reference:  Our other two vendors were charging $10+ for the same thing.  Then again, one is the exclusive bakery for The Ritz Carlton, HMB and the other previously won a Food Network baking competition.

The fruity fillings were too tart for our taste, so we went with two layers Opera cake (hazelnut sponge with chocolate truffle and mocha praline filling topped with toasted almonds).  Other two are simpler with white cake, vanilla filling, and chocolate truffle.

Can't wait.

 BTW - it's really cramped in there.  Oh, and book your tasting AT LEAST six months in advance.
author: Anne Marie P.

description:
Setting:  Quite small, quaint.  Just 4 or 5 tables.  Very homely, mom and pops-ish, which makes it quite special.

Food:  Delish!!!  I'm a bit biased because my fiance and I ordered our wedding cake from them.  But I tell ya, all the cakes we tried were very very good!  Plus, we came back for more...the tiramisu mousse cake was heavenly!!!  Not bad coffee neither.  I'm not sure what they brew, but it's really good.

Service:  Awesome people.  The 2 who helped us with our cake decision were very friendly and informative.  Everyone else in the staff were very nice.  Thumbs up for these guys!
author: Jon D.

description:
UPDATE***Just bought the tropical mouse cake here for my boyfriends bday over the weekend. The bakery was so accomodating to my requests-with the batter design and size that I wanted it-they made it perfect. and mannnnnnnnnnn that cake go fasttttttttt in the lounge last night.....everybody ate it up so fast there was NO mess

So damn cute! I love all the cakes, tarts, & cupcakes they have here! You can also look on their website and see the variety of cakes they have-you can also order online-which makes it really convenient if you are ordering something ahead of time. I ordered a Black Forest cake for a co-worker's bday-it was beautiful and I was in and out of the store. The staff was helpful and very friendly. I would definitely recommend this place for buying cakes & other treats for all occasions!
author: Dessa R.

description: Delicious! As everyone has said the Swedish Princess cake is to die for!!!
author: Bri R.

description:
I had Schubert's for this first time over the weekend at my nephew's baptism.  I think this may be the best strawberry shortcake I have every had.  The cake was moist and the whipped cream was light and airy.  The cake was encased in white chocolate tiles.  It was beautiful and delicious!  

Here in the Bay Area there seems to be so many trendy bakeries with beautiful cakes, that don's actually taste that good. This is definitley not one of them.  And it's been around forever!  How did I ever miss this place!
author: Anna C.

description:
Even with a chorus of opinions, we haven't gone wrong yet!
Schubert's Bakery has become the place of choice for office birthday treats.  As much as I love Trader Joe's - it's above and beyond... waaay beyond.

Every cake that we've gotten is somehow just right... whether it be the tart Lemon Mousse, the rich Italian Rum Cake or the refreshing Currant Mousse or... .. .
The choices are endless and so are the inquiries of, "so where is that amazing cake from?"

Even if you're just stopping by for a small treat, a slice of cake or cup of coffee you will certainly be taken by Schubert's.  Though it's no longer owned by the original proprietors it seems like they haven't missed a beat and it's popularity continues to soar in our office!

My cake picking buddy and I practically glow with delight when we run off on a Schubert's errand.  Our next mission is to find a cake that isn't so well-received... I have a strong feeling it's going to be a failed mission.
author: Rashmi N.

description:
I've been holding off reviewing this bakery for a long time. It's just cause I wanna be savoring the sweeeeeet love I get from this place all by myself. But as my cousin says, "sharing is caring"...and I care!

Okay, case in point all the mini cakes are now $3.45 across the board, except for the tarts and the eclairs. GEEZ, that's pretty pricey. However the baked goods especially Pineapple turnover (OMG ALOHA!) is still $2.85. It's the best flaky layered goodness I can turn to in times of comfort. The Apple wasn't my favorite, but the apricot one was really good. 

LOVE LOVE LOVE the Chocolate Nut Mousse. In any shape. I don't care if it's molding in the case, it's still good.  EEEE. The Cappuccino Mousse, Italian rum and the delicious Opera cake are orgasmic. Dang I didn't realize I ate so much (grumbles). 

Second is the White Chocolate Raspberry Mousse, definitely try the Mango one too. Laura L. swears by the strawberry cheesecake. That's her favorite.

They do wedding cakes, but I haven't seen their order books. They also offer tons on the written blackboard that you have to special order.

Nice servers, and always ask about their specials. Sometimes they are half-priced cakes cause they have a really short shelf life. If you don't care if your mousse is a bit lop sided but still fresh, then go get it. YUMMY.
author: Pauline L.

description:
(Cheering) SCHUBERT'S, SCHUBERT'S, SCHUBERT'S, SCHUBERT'S!!!!

Excellente!!!  Now i know exactly where i am getting all of my cakes for any birthday, event, holiday, etc!!

On our way to get some cheap dim sum, we passed by Schubert's.  We had heard about this place on yelp, and decided, hey, we're in the area, might as well check it out. The minute i walked in i was impressed by an assortment of cakes all decorated to PERFECTION.  They really are beautiful!  Okay, so they were really good looking, but did they taste just as good as they looked?

No, they didn't....  they tasted BETTER!

So they sell some of the cakes by the slice, or mini, individual cakes in case you don't want to get the whole cake.  So i got a slice of the princess cake, and dom got a chocolate mousse with almonds.  We took it home to eat... it was delicious!  The cake is moist, and light, and not at all too sweet.  There were so many other cakes i wanted to try.  They have many mousse cakes:  mango, peach, raspberry, current, lemon, etc.  There is such a big selection of cakes to choose from... fruity cakes to chocolate cakes, cheesecakes, mousse cakes, tarts, you name it..
author: Kimberly F.

description:
None of that buttercream crap here.  Just real cream.  
Not many bakeries have the variety they do, and manage to keep it so consistently good.  I didn't think that I would like the Swedish Princess cake, but that velvety layer of marzipan that envelops the layers of cake, custard, and raspberry actually makes me drool.  They have one of the largest varieties of cakes that are consistently good and beautifully detailed.  From whip cream cakes like the Fruit Basket, to the St. Honore you can't make a bad choice here.  Get here early or reserve your cake by phone, especially on holidays.
You will need to pony up for cake here....about $28-30 for a small one, but it is worth every penny.
author: Arlene C.

description:
This place is awesome. Their cakes are the most beautiful and delicious that I have had. Ordered a strawberry chocolate mouse cake and it was really really good, light, and not too sweet.
Ordered a mango mousse cake for pick up tomorrow, looking forward to it!  They are more on the expensive side, so I would consider this a special occasion cake place for like bdays and anniversaries.

They also sell small slices of their delectables along with cookies, coffee, etc and they have a few tables. Good place to grab a quick snack and coffee.
author: Petri Y.

description: Love the bakery! This is my "go to" place for all occasions. Favorites are the Opera cake, triple chocolate mouse cake and the cherry pie.
author: Y K.

description:
I am not a big fan of cake, but Schubert's cakes are simply irresistible. 
They are light and have a great balance of flavor. 
Schubert's has a great selection of flavors and the cakes are so incredibly beautiful. I love how friendly and helpful the staff is, especially when it come to wedding cakes! They are very accommodating, have free cake tastings and will work with you to create your vision. Although I have to admit our wedding cake tasted about five times better the day of the wedding then it did at the tasting. :)
author: Yulia K.

description:
I hadn't really lived until I tried a piece of their Swedish Princess cake -- a thick slice of cake with (graham cracker?) crust, cherry jam, white cake and whipped cream, and then surrounded by lime-flavored marzipan. YUM.

Friends have also had luck with ordering personalized cakes for next-day consumption.

EDIT (8/7): They have an online ordering system, and you can tell them when you'd like your cake ready. Note: If you say 10 am, the cake will not be ready on the dot. Ask to have it ready before you arrive.
author: Helen L.

description:
Served their Opera cake at a party on Saturday night.  That's the one with chocolate and hazelnuts. It was fantastic.  All was done on the phone with them and they were very helpful.  

Highly recommend.
author: Jim M.

description:
DELICIOUS!!!!
You don't have to buy the huge ass cakes. There's smaller portions if you're just treating yourself. The strawberry moose cake is moist and drool-ly delicious.
Tiramisu cake = YUM
Swedish Princess Cake = tastes kinda funny. don't know how to explain, but it does.
Raspberry Moose = a little too sweet.

yeah...I haven't tried all of their cakes yet, but it's good so far.
author: nimmy s.

description: Every office birthday I order a cake from Schuberts.  I order more than 2 cakes a month sometimes.  My coworker and I get into the car and make our way to busy Clement st.   We have a routine; she circles the block while I run in to pick up my online ordered cake.  You gotta be careful of those meter maids cause they'll get you good!  But it's all worth it to get our piece of the cake.
author: Rosalind S.

description: I used to love Schubert.  I got their cakes for everyone's birthdays or any occasions.  I would always find an excuse to buy them BUT....now they are so cheap!!!!  The mouse that used to come with their chocolate mouse cakes used to be 2" thick.  Now the sponge part is 2" thick and you get a tiny bit of mouse.  If you want an over priced cake that taste so so...this is your place.
author: Kris H.

description: As someone who has lived in the Inner richmond for most of my life, this is got to be one of the better bakeries in the city, possibly the entire bay area though I've only been to a few other places. It's been around for a very long time, they have the classic french and European desserts. I especially love the mango moose, strawberry shortcake and tiramisu here. Too bad they aren't open later and sometimes they do run out of your favorites.
author: Petra S.

description: This place is to die for!!!! the chocolate mouses are sooo yummie!!! i get my cakes here all the time!!!
author: Maria R.

description:
Growing up in the Richmond [10th&Lake],we always got our bread,and anything we needed for celebrating special events at Shubert's- plus weekly,my Mom would stop by to pick up pastry's or other treats on her way home as a Nurse @ [Children's Hosp...I have such wonderful memories of Shuberts!!! Though I now live in the East Bay,my Son & I recently stopped by for coffee and pastry's while on Clement Street and Shuberts is still as good as when I was a little girl more than 55 years ago!!
 My daughter, getting married soon, will be looking at them,hopefully, for their wedding cake.... It's amazing and refreshing that a business has survived this long,is still on Clement Street, and Still continues with  the same quality and producing so much yummyness that has brought thousands of  lovers of Shuberts back through their doors for more goodies year after year.....          Thank you Shuberts!!
author: jellybeano b.

description: Hands down the best cakes I have found in the bay area, and I have been to a lot of bakeries! We live in the east bay and this is the only place we get cakes for special occasions. From presentation to quality of ingredients to taste this pace can't be beat.
author: Natasha B.

description:
If all beautiful things can taste this good.... 

..psst... don't forget to ask for their 'day-old' cake for a tasty deal ~.^
author: Kat S.

description:
My roommates and I walked here every Saturday morning without fail when we lived in the inner Richmond to get pastries and coffee from Schubert's. Their cakes are so attractive and delicious. It looks as if they are made for princesses.

I love all their crossaints. All of them. I love that you can still find coffee for a buck and some change. I love the little table in the window where you can watch little Chinese children meander down the sidewalk with their parents and puppies.

But most of all, I love the buttery, flaky goodness.
author: elaine m.

description: THEE BEST DESSERT IN SAN FRANCISCO! Not too sweet like most Western style cakes. The Napoleon is my mom's fav. And I LOVE the opera cake. It's a bit hard to find a parking spot though... So if u are just dropping by, you must go try it!
author: Kimmy F.

description:
Hell of a place!
Needs two tings: espresso machine and parking - and all five starts are theirs.
author: l t.

description: If you're going to have cake (muffin) for breakfast, for the love of all that is holy, go to Schubert's and do it right.  I love that for every regular sized cake, they also have a single-serving version for instant gratification.  My favorite is the Swedish Princess, but I've never had anything from there that I didn't like.
author: Jenn C.

description:
Their Italian Rum Cake is my favorite of their cakes.

I haven't had it any better from anywhere else.

Their pastries are pretty darn good too.

I'm salivating just thinking about their desserts.
author: Michelle N.

description:
Imagine it:  your day has sucked.  Not a little, but a lot, enough to make you need something to make it all go away.  Since Schubert's does not put Vicodin in any of their goodies, the next best thing is to just take the virginal treat as-is and make a better day with it.

It will work.  

Schubert's is cake and pie heaven for office-marms in charge of celebrations, and an intentional community of overindulgence for anyone who needs a fix.  

Don't be afraid if the line is long, it dissipates quickly and suddenly you are in the Forbidden Temple of Badonkadonk.  Not only will their temptations make your booty juicy, they will look pretty as they get closer to your mouth.

Wee mousses in mango, raspberry and strawberry plus coffee equals total personal nirvana.  Take it to go since it is rarely quiet enough in there to have a Madeleine moment.

I have experienced an extraordinarily odd phenomenon at Schubert's almost every time I go.  There is always ONE ALMOND TART left.  Just one.  No matter what time of day this is, it's like they know I'd never bring a friend in there who would want one too.  They only have one for me.
So weird.

Take yourself there early to get the best selection and avoid the parking madness that embodies this particular stretch of Clement.  The DPT is as present as doo-bags in a Bark Park and does not hesitate to "Intercept" your mission with a pricey ticket.  Schubert's is good, but adding 40 dollars to the cost of those damn tarts makes it dangerous.  Be careful or ride your bike.

Also, be mindful of the occasional Bridezilla on the warpath.  Like  hungry bears fresh out of hibernation, they are not to be messed with and might eat people out of sheer desperation.  They are starving themselves to get into their dress and facing the worst of all tortures: a frickin' bakery where nothing is fat-free.  Steer clear of them at all costs.

A great spot for a mid-afternoon shopping break.  Hit the markets for fresh bok choy, fish, and tofu.  Then...

Mousse meet.
author: Lea N.

description: I think I may be on my 7th cake from Schubert's. This is my go to place for cakes. Sometimes I order online and the transaction is seamless - one time I ordered for the cake to say Happy Birthday in Russian and it worked out perfectly too. Great for picking up cakes last minute (happens a LOT) and they always have a great selection. Everyone is sweet and helpful. Finding parking can be a bit of a drag - but that's just typical of this area. Anyways, for the price, service, selection, and presentation of cakes you can't go wrong.
author: Cathy B.

description:
Their cakes are not too sweet, yet very sweet to your eyes. Different from traditional all-sweet-butter American cakes, yet priced nicely from 13-15-and around 20 bucks.
Cookies and pastries are great too, and I bet you get hooked by just trying a piece of them! 

The shop keepers are very kind to help you with what you are looking for your occasions.

It is always hard to find parking near by on the poplar Clement street, especially on weekend though.
author: Chacha M.

description:
Everytime my family has a holiday gathering, the one thing we look forward to is a cake from Schubert's Bakery. Every cake from the mango cheese cake to the chocolate raspberry has been amazing. Never over the top on sweetness, excellent flavor profiles and the presentations is amazing. 

Check out their website to preview their selections, or just visit the store to pick up a mini version of their cakes.

WARNING: DO NOT ORDER ONLINE, their web order system does not use SSL, and thus is not secure for financial transactions. Instead call in your order.
author: Venatius P.

description:
We ordered our wedding cake from Schubert's because we refused to believe wedding cakes had to cost a movie ticket per person to taste good.  Even though our wedding was in Saratoga and we had to pay for delivery, their prices were really reasonable.  We had the opera cake and got lots compliments on how moist & delicious our cake was!  In addition to our 3-tier cake, we ordered sheet cake versions as backup in case we ran out (these are much cheaper).  We brought extra wedding cake to eat during the flight out for our honeymoon.  Since we had so much, we shared some with the gate attendants who ended up upgrading us!

Schubert's books up fast, so order early.  They also give you a gift certificate for a 6" cake on your 1-year anniversary (this makes so much more sense than the custom of freezing cake for a year...).
author: Sandra H.

description:
I have never tasted a cheesecake that was so light! And it was decorated with chocolate flowers an shaved white chocolate. It was a hit with Mom (for her birthday) and though I usually don't go for fancy cakes, I had to have a piece! 

This place is tiny, and on Saturday about 11:00 am you could barely turn around in there, but the service was fast. I paid 30 bucks for the cakes (got one strawberry, too). For Mom (and to a lesser degree, me,) it was worth every penny. They have tons of other good stuff as well.
author: Aaron B.

description: The danishes are fantastic. I'm totally hooked.  It's well worth it making a trip from Daly City to get them.  it's my new favorite place to get the sweet delights. The danishes are just as good as Stella's and the old Victoria Pastry in North Beach. Sad to say the new Victoria's is no longer up to par.
author: George Q.

description:
WARNING: If they mess on the writing of the cake do not expect your money back or any kind of compensation.

My boyfriend ordered a cake with my name on it and they got the name totally wrong. The girl even spelled it back to him correctly so I do not know how this happened. It was on a piece of white chocolate they could have made it again on another piece of chocolate or clean it off the chocolate and make it again but they said they could do nothing about it. They basically said you are screwed- deal with it. I think that since it is such a popular bakery that they do not care if you are satisfied which makes this place the worst birthday cake I ever had. It is my first and will be my last.
author: hime s.

description:
Princess cake for anyone's birthday cake is always a good decision!  

To begin with, I love green.  Aside from that, the people were very nice to us when we picked up the cake order.  And the cake wasn't too sweet or flooded with frosting like other places.  It was simple, light, refreshing, and just oh so delicious!  

Princess cakes for everyone!
author: Cat S.

description:
This is my second favorite bakery in the city and I only come here for two types of cake: strawberry shortcake and tiramisu.

Schubert's uses fresh strawberry, quality flour and ingredients into making the cake that the texture is very exquisite. It is hard to put down the spoon after one bite so beware. 

My girlfriend absolutely loves the tirmisu cake from Schubert's and I get it every year for her birthday. The tiramisu is made with buttermilk, cream, cocoa powder, flour, and other ingredients; surrounded by square chunks of white, dark and milk chocolate; and topped with chocolate flakes. A bite would put one in a chocolate coma. 

Also, the mocca cake here is pretty good too.
author: Allison H.

description:
I happened to stumble upon Schuberts Bakery as I was helping a friend move a huge birthday cake from Schuberts to her work.  I guess you can say I was the delivery driver.  As I was browsing around the dessert shop, I was tempted to grab a fork and taste everything they had!  Schuberts is heavenly bliss for someone who loves desserts . . . someone like ME!  

Although I wanted to indulge in everything they had, I knew I had to just choose one.  I asked for the most popular dessert treat and they recommended the Swedish Princess.  Swedish Princess Cake was very good but I am not a fan of fondant.  Besides that, the cake was very moist and fresh.  You can tell that Schuberts Bakery uses the best ingredients to make their desserts as the flavors are extremely savoring and the pastries are very high quality.  Seems like every piece of dessert they had been made with love.  The placement on the baking sheet and the designs are so artistic.  

I would come here again and again, but since I don't want to be 250 lbs by next year, I will force myself to patron Schuberts Bakery on a once a month basis at most.
author: Manton R.

description:
There isn't a single thing at this bakery that I do not like, and devour at every available opportunity.  
The mousse cakes and fruit cups are heavenly!  
Yes, this is THE place to hit up for birthday cakes (and always go a "size larger" because noone ever eats just one slice :-) )
author: Godot -.

description:
This is the second year I've ordered by bday cake from here.  This year my boyfriend ordered 3 bday cakes:  mango cheesecake, strawberrry cheesecake, and chocolate mousse.  They were all EXCELLENT and looked beautiful.  I highly recommend this place.   I brought the leftover cake to work and they were gone almost before I sat them down - GREAT STUFF PEOPLE!  

I love that you can order your cakes online (especially if you have a difficult to spell message).  I HATE how you have to pick them up!  It's always crowded and the counter is a little bit of a "free for all."  I'd been waiting 5 minutes while the clerks helped other customers.  This woman walks in, elbows her way next to me, and when the clerk walks up and says "next!" she says "oh me!"  I politely said (in my most territorial tone) "Oh no, I'm sorry, you just walked in and everyone else has been waiting.  I was next."  and put my purse in front of her face on the counter.  (Oh come on, she deserved it!)  The clerk smiled and took my name to get my order.  Just had to add that to the review - be prepared to affirm your place in "line!"  Muhahahaha!
author: Silly P.

description: OMG...this is truly one of the best bakery around town.  It's cake are very soft and there are tons of choices to pick from.  I've pretty much tried most of them.  My favorite is the...ahh...they are all too good.  All of them are my favorite.  Writing this review is making drooling for more...hahaha =)
author: Calvin T.

description: Finally was on this part of town and remembered I needed to check out Schubert's and voila, I happened to walk right by it.  Totally legit bakery with tons of fancy looking treats to choose from.  We grabbed a chocolate mousse and a tiramasu and called it a day for the time being.  Awesome stuff.
author: Sean H.

description:
I like Schubert's Bakery for their unique cakes. A variety of flavorful and creative cakes, some decorated with different chocolates in different forms (dark, white, roll logs, shavings, bars, etc).

My favorite is their mango mousse cake!! And those are trimmed with chocolates too. There's a good selection of cakes and pastries. They even have a web site where you can pick your cake and size.

They're only kind of pricey. So I go their for special birthday cakes and occasions. And parking during the day and weekends can be tough.

Only one Schubert and they've been around for many, many years. A true San Francisco treat. I noticed a couple of copy cat bakeries in Daly City, but Schubert's is the original!!
author: Roger S.

description:
Yet another craving led me to another delicious discovery. This place hits the spot. I only tried the tiramisu and mango mousse cake, both of which were amazing!! Each creation looks too good to eat, but I managed to devour every morsel.

Another patron suggested I try the chocolate truffle, but since chocolate isn't my usual flavor of choice, I declined her recommendation. Still, she insisted it was fabulous and the look on her face as she took her first bite said it all. If it's nearly as delectable as my selections, I give it a blind thumbs up for those who enjoy chocolate truffles. 

I'll definitely be back this weekend after brunch or before dinner. I'll make my way back somehow to try the chantilly, napolean, and their selection of tarts.
author: Katie G.

description:
Yeah, um... KILLER.

* Innocuous-looking strawberry pinwheel pastry = the joy of my entire day-long visit to SF.  Every bite was like a trip to texture heaven and back. Plus the big sugar crystals really added something to the flavor.  And the custard.  And the strawberries.  I think there are kiwis, too.  They should call it the strawberry dreamwheel.

* Little snacky cookies in plastic baggy whose name I've forgotten = perfect crunch and simple unassuming flavor.  I actually usually hate hard cookies, but these ones definitely give hard cookies a point on the scoreboard against soft chewy ones.

Not bad for a place that primarily does cakes that all of San Francisco seems to swear by.
author: Catherine H.

description: We've been coming to Schuberts for the past 2-3 years, even though we don't live too close to the city.  They have the best swedish princess cake and their st honore is really really good as well!! Next, I will be trying their strawberry romanoff and strawberry shortcake!
author: Rachel V.

description:
Dude....


A slice of delicious, light, fluffy, awesome plain cheesecake for $1.45


You can't beat that! You can't!

A dollar forty-five! For cheesecake! I mean seriously.
author: Alex O.

description: I haven't had a cake here I didn't like.  My favorite is the swedish princess.  Do it. You're Welcome.
author: Sam L.

description: Is Schubert's Bakery THAT good? i have the BIGGEST sweet tooth and i thought the Mango Moose cake was JUST OK. My brother bought the cake our mom's bday and it wasnt that great. i also thought the princess cake was kinda dry too.
author: Carol Y.

description: Cappucino cakes, different types of leche flan, and cheese cakes... oh my!!! If I wasn't concerned with going to the gym, I could get fat here. I ordered two slices of raspberry cheese cake for only $5.90. That's a deal if you ask me. I'll definitely try to make it back here for the Cappucino cake which I hear always sells out. It's no big deal but the lady at the counter offered a free glass of water with the order.
author: Gerard Y.

description: Best cake place in SF! this is the ONLY place i order cakes from because its the best around. they make it fresh (day off) and their service is outstanding. No complaints on anything. Prices are cheap for what you are getting, other places charge more AND their cakes dont taste as good. Must try.
author: Q W.

description:
Bought a birthday cake here for a friend.  The cake was beautiful and tasted good too.  Plus, the way they wrap it up in a pretty box made it feel worth the 25 or so dollars I paid.  My friend was happy, I was happy.  A good experience.  They were very pleasant and nice about helping me make my selection as well. 

When I walk buy, I see older gentlemen just sitting there chilling.  Oh the life.  One thing to look forward to when I get older.  That and acting crazy just cause I can because I am old and should be respected.  +)
author: Mark C.

description:
Tried a slice of Swedish Princess Cake for my Cousin's Birthday.

Best stuff ever.  It was Superb. Must I say more?

Must try for yourself! 

The sugar cookies were also bomb, but pretty pricey. Gotta spoil yourself sometimes... :)
author: Amy D.

description: I have been passing by this bakery for the longest time since my hair salon is just a block away but I've never once stepped inside until recommended by a friend recently to try out their cakes! Oh my gawd, the Mango Mousse Cake was HEAVENLY and fabulous! Great value for money and a decent sized cake! My friends love the Mango Mousse cake. I bought a small tropical mousse cake to try as well and that was equally as good! Fabulous!
author: Yan M.

description: Finally! I've heard such awesome things about this bakery and I got to finally come here. My friend got me the fruit basket cake, which has fresh fruit inside the cake! It was delicious and the entire thing was so beautiful! I could stare at their cake display for hours... everything looks so nice and you know it all tastes so good! I think it's funny that this place is in an Asian neighborhood, but it has been here forever! AAHHH cannot wait to try something else from here! :)
author: Anna V.

description:
I love the Black Forest Cake here. I can literally eat the whole cake by myself, but since I don't want to spike my glucose levels, I usually eat a slice a day if there are left overs, and after a few days the cake is still good. 

When I'm not buying the Black Forest Cake, my second favorite is the Italian Rum Cake. I love rum and chocolate, like the See's candy Rum Nougat.

When I'm not buying the Black Forest Cake, and the Italian Rum Cake, I buy one of their mouse cakes. If you choose, currant, strawberry, mango, etc., they're all really good.  

It doesn't get better than this if you want one store with a variety of cakes that you can choose from.
author: Jenny L.

description:
me love, me love, me love
The second time was as good as the first time.
The strawberry cheesecake is my favorite, it is not the usual thick rich cheesecake, but more of a light fruity one, but still very good.
For around $3 a slice, it is not expensive for the quality.
author: Erica B.

description:
So the one thing I found out while living in Sweden was that their princess cake is ORGASMIC. So coming back to the US, I was sad that the only princeesss cake I could find was the frozen kind at Ikea...

until I stepped into Schubert's! AHHHHHH! So great!  Their princess cake is seriously on-par with the ones in sweden! The strawberry shortcake is great too! zomg  i have such a sweet tooth :D


Edit 5/22: Actually I got the princess cake today and the marzipan was too sweet. I guess it's either a hit or miss.
author: Helen H.

description:
Bakeries like Schubert's is what I've been searching for since I moved out of SF two months ago.

Fresh pastries not-too-small to leave you wanting more, not-too-big to  make you sick, and pleasing to both sight and taste are around $3.25. They also have "specials" which are a day-old and discounted if you are on a budget. 

I got a white chocolate raspberry mousse, chocolate almond mousse, fruit tart, and a bag of assorted cookies for $12. The lady put them neatly in a box which I carefully packed away in my luggage. Too bad everyone else wasn't careful with my luggage and the former beauty of the three cakes is now only a memory.

My lesson learned: When transporting Schubert's on an airplane, carry it on!!
author: Jennifer L.

description: This place has been around forever and you should know why. It's the best! I've never had cakes that looked so beautiful and tasted sooooooooooooooo amazing!!! When I used to be an Office Manager this was the only place I would order cakes from. For my birthday I had the Princess Cake. OH MY GOOOOOOOOODNESSSS. It was nothing but goodness.
author: Rana A.

description:
Alright, so I have never actually been inside Schubert's or spent my own money on their cakes, but I made the suggestion to my parents based on positive Yelp reviews, so now I can pat myself on the back for being so good to them (letting them buy yummy cakes for me.)

They picked out a mango mousse cake and a tiramisu cake, plus some ridiculously cute flower cookies that kids will love to eat, and adults will love to look at.  

The mango mousse cake was really airy and light and tasty, not to mention gorgeous.  Tiramisu didn't have the full rich flavor I had hoped for, but probably even prettier than the mousse cake topped with tons of pretty decorative, edible chocolate flowers, leaves, etc. etc. 

If you have guests over and you want to wow them with really really pretty cakes, this is the place.  And because it's been open forever and many old folks stop by and it's located on Clement where value trunks packaging, the price is more than reasonable.
author: Candice B.

description: Not bad for a birthday cake at work! We had the raspberry chocolate mousse cake.  Yumm.  The raspberry sauce was a bit too sweet, but the fluffiness of the rest of the cake made up for it.  Thanks Lannie!  I will definitely get one of these for a friend's birthday next time...to try a different one. kekeke..jk..?
author: kim w.

description: Visited for the first time yesterday because of all the favorable reviews.  Their mango cheesecake was just okay.  My dinner guests agreed that it tasted like frozen grocery store cheesecake (or maybe not even as good).  Staff was friendly, so I'm giving the bakery 3-stars and might try one of their mousse cakes if I'm in the neighborhood again.
author: Ann W.

description:
I ain't gonna lie. . I have a strange affinity for what might be called "Old Lady Cakes". I love cake.   I particularly love old school cakes with lots of cream, chocolate, sponge, mousses, etc.   The first time I ever went into Merritt Bakery I almost died of happiness. . . until I tasted the goods and was overwhelmed by the taste of pure chemicals in the sub-par ingredients.  I shied away from Old Lady Cakes after that because I was scared.  

The other day I was craving Old Lady Cake fiercely and was with a friend who lives in the city - I promised him a ride home if he'd come with me to Schubert's.  I had it in my head that I had never been there.  Of course, once we passed the threshold, I realized that I had been there before WAAAAAY back in the day with my abuelita to pick up some sugar cookies for "the nuns" (cloistered nuns who to this day live in a big convent across the street from my mom's).  Anyhoo, I was interested in some black forest cake and perhaps a slice of princess cake. . . princess cake is somewhat of an anomaly for me as one of my biggest mentors loves it so and I have yet to understand why.  Enter Schubert's. . . they do princess cake right.  Soft sponge, creamy center, thin layer of raspberry jam, crispy cookie layer on the bottom. . .and green MARZIPAN, not nasty ol' fondant, enrobes the little slice of sweetness.  I finally could understand my mentor's love of Princess Cake!  I also ended up with a slice of Black Forest, a mini-Chocolate Mousse Cake and a piece of Opera Cake.  What?  I had driven ALL THE WAY from Oakland. . . you know that I not about to leave with one paltry piece of cake!  

The Black Forest was good but I am not a big fan of boozy desserts.  . . I like my booze neat, not in my sweets so that and the Princess cake had a little too much kirsch and kirschwasser for my taste.  My dream would be to have a custom Princess cake with no kirsch in it. . .OH YEAH!!!  The chocolate mousse was creamy and moussey and chocolaty with nary a hint of chemical warfare.  The Opera Cake was my favorite. . my only quibble would be that the toasted almonds that adorn the outside should be toasted hazelnuts but that's just me being picky and pastryqueen-ish.  

I didn't really notice how much things cost - I think I found the prices fair for what I got. . I will fully admit that my mind gets foggy in the presence of so many baked goods.

Also, I can neither confirm nor deny that I went to Schubert's today to get LouLou a slice of Princess Cake for her 3rd birthday.  Nor can I confirm or deny that little birthday pit bulls really like green marzipan.  :)
author: Lainie L.

description:
My only dislike of this place is that it's too far from me so I can't just go here when I want to.. :[

Well, when I do get to come here, my favorite thing (my family's favorite) is the mango mousse! The small ones for $3.50 (?) just isn't good enough! Lol. We usually order a larger size one that cost around $26, I believe? I enjoy eating the chocolate flowers on top, too. xD 

The strawberry mousse is good too, but I don't think it can compare to the mango mousse. It's just the right amount of sweetness without giving me a cavity and the cake part of it was so.. sponge like and soft. Oh man, WHY MUST THIS PLACE BE SO FAR FROM MEEEE?!!!!!1111

By the way, I seen a lot of people order the swedish princess cake. Can someone tell me what's in it or if it's really good? (x Please and thank you!
author: Jessica T.

description: just had princess cake for our [mine and my 3 year old daughter] birthday cake and it was the BEST cake idea ever. SO GOOD and so easy on the eyes gorgeous.
author: rachael s.

description: Great bakery, love it. Very artistic as well.
author: Mee G.

description: love to come here for special occasion cakes! a little pricey, but worth it!
author: E S.

description:
Whatever birthday party I'm hosting, I call ahead to Schubert's, tell them how many people I'm expecting, the birthday boy/girl's name and tell them to get an opera cake ready for me. Every single time I hear the inevitable, "Ohhhhhh. Oh my God. OH. MY. GOD. This is good, this is really good. Where is this from? Oh my God, it's REALLY good." I don't remember the prices, but definitely not outrageous. Pretty good I'd say for the amount of party girl praise you'll get.

Perfect Emergency Birthday Cake spot!
author: Mekhala I.

description: Yum. Pretty much my main bakery for birthday cakes. Always an excellent cake! The only issue I've had is one time a cake they sold me was partially frozen. I think they make their cakes ahead of time and keep them in a freezer or very cold fridge until they put them on display. That wasn't exactly pleasant, but when it thawed it was still delicious.
author: Zach B.

description:
A friend brought over a chocolate mousse cake for a lunch party - it is die-licious.  So so creamy, fluffy, airy, chocolatey goodness.  Not too sweet and just perfect to satisfy the chocolate demands of a PMS'ing crank monster.

Looking forward to another excuse to try their other cakes!
author: Linh T.

description: I love the opera cake here. The best bakery in bay area.
author: K M.

description: Last minute rush for a birthday cake and Schubert's bakery turned out to be the savior. Good price for a yummy cake and pretty decent service too.
author: Prague G.

description: I don't live in SF but celebrated my birthday there. A friend suggested I buy a cake from Schubert's since it had some good reviews and was on her street. They spelt the saying incorrectly " Two champagnes, friends and birthdays." However they kindly corrected the saying and gave us a few bags of madelines. They are not the most friendly because they seem so busy.  Everyone loved the cake! I did not expect so many chocolate flowers and it was beautifully decorated. I thought the price was reasonable.
author: Cali K.

description: I get cakes here frequently. I love their Princess cake! They are efficient and not overpriced. Highly recommended.
author: Emily C.

description: I had a wonderful cake from here for my birthday! My girlfriend got the "Swedish Princess", very fitting i guess?? But anyways, the marzipan was top of the line and the medley of fruits, icing, and cake inside was fantastic.
author: Kevin L.

description: This review is not about the cakes but about service.  (I think most of us agree that the cakes are delicious especially the ones with rum custard.)  I came into the store inquiring about wedding cakes.  The gal who was designated as the one who was in charge of the wedding orders came to "help" me.  Well, every question I asked had a terse, short answer.  She only cared to elaborate when she provided the order sheet assuming that I would surely order my cake there.  When I hesitated providing all my personal info on the form and asked if I could fax it in at the time of the order, she curtly replied that the forms would likely get lost if I were to fax it in and she was just trying to save some time.  Well, a wedding cake order would have easily been a $300+ order.  Perhaps, Schuberts doesn't need the business...
author: FoodJunkie S.

description: There are only a few places where you can go and order anything and I mean anything and know you won't be disappointed. Schubert's has one of the most beautiful displays of desserts that I know of. Every item in it is worth a try (not all at once). One thing that I really like is that their desserts aren't super sugary. You actually get to taste the flavors and not just sugar. If you don't mind buying day old dessert (if there happens to be any leftover) come early to get yesterday's leftovers at 50% off. Just got a beautiful full size fresh fruit tart for only $9. Three days later and I'm still slicing off pieces. If I'm not trying something new I'm going to Schubert's.
author: Brett W.

description: opera cake i discovered you late in life (in my twenties)..it's like eating nutella with cake biscuit...5 stars for the win!
author: Jen C.

description:
this review may be a little biased since i use to work here many years ago..but their cakes, pastries and cookies are really amazing! they make everything from scratch and are definitely good at what they do..thats how they maintained their business for so many years!

too bad i moved on to a different career..i would of loved to have stayed at schuberts..and gain an extra 10lbs or so....
author: M W.

description:
I bought 2 cakes here within 2 days. Sunday, I went for the mango mousse, but they were out. Therefore, my friend suggested the raspberry mousse. The mango mousse is their most popular cake, so I expected the raspberry to be almost identical. The cake looked really nice (as most/all of us agreed). But I didn't like the taste/feel to it. But NO, I'm not hating on Schuberts. Its just that I'm not a fan of mousse (except for hair mousse).
Yesterday, I came back and saw the other suggested cake - Opera Cake. I had gone there a bit before closing, wanting a BIG CAKE (but knowing they wouldn't have one). I asked "is this cake reserved?" And they said, "no". It was meant to be. There it was, and there I bought it. Very rich. I liked it. My friend liked it. A beautiful $40 spent.
author: Elaine H.

description: Consistent, fresh and delicious. What greater combination does one need in that search for a decadent pastry or cake? What more needs to be said?
author: Mashimaro M.

description:
Excellent mousses here. When my dad used to take me shopping with him on Clement, we'd always stop by Schubert's to pick up a cake..yep. Once a week. And they gave me a free cookie each time (score)! Probably because I was such a cute kid. Or maybe because they were really nice people.

The previous (original?) owners started another bakery called the Cakery, located in Burlingame. So if you're ever on Burlingame Avenue, drop by! Mango mousse,  chocolate mousse, raspberry mousse, mousse mousse. Cookies. Yay for Schubert's!
author: Liz L.

description:
Excellent cakes and cookies selection.  Their pastry selection is not as strong as I normally like, but their overall assortment is cool.  Staff is nice.  If you don't feel like going to Citizen to pick up an impressive cake, come here.

Parking sux.
author: Dong T.

description:
okay, 3 birthday cakes later, i'm still a fan.  they should have a frequent buyer program b/c i'd enroll.  i'm known by peers as the cake queen. 

i actually got my butt up early to grab the chocolate, chocolate mousse cake 2 weeks ago...it is sooooooo worth it.

oh and i tried a croissant one morning...delectable!!!

ps - i live in lower pac heights and work in so sf, so getting over to clement in the am, is no small sacrifice to my sleep schedule!!!!
author: Hiromi N.

description:
This is the place to get your hon the B-Day cake.  
btw: It is one of the few places left that you can get the Princess Cake. and if you like Chocolate. Try their Truffle Torte!
author: ben s.

description: Oh, I've found the lightest chocolate mousse cake ever!  Light as in texture not in calories!  So sinful and totally worth it!  "Diet, what diet?" my inner demon speaks to me.  I can never say no to Shuberts even when I have to fight for a parking spot!
author: Tammie C.

description:
It's a shame Schubert's is tasty because 60% of the time I visit, the people behind the counter are so rude I wish I didn't have to go back there again.  When they get busy, the staff behaves like they were trained by the Soup Nazi. Yesterday, I purchased 3 pieces of cake to go and on the way out, stopped at one of their tables to have a few bites before heading out (there's no way I could finish more than half a slice of cake at any one given time). No less than 5 seconds later, the woman who took my order came by to chastise me - "you're going to eat here?! I didn't charge you tax!!"  I explained I was on my way out and she just gave me a dirty look and walked away.  I'm surprised she didn't shake me down for the 50 cents.  If I had better aim, I would've thrown the quarters at her head as she was walking away.

Swedish princess cake - better for people who like marzipan bc it really overpowers the rest of the cake, which is pretty subtle

Tiramisu - has a moderately strong rum taste.  If you don't like alcohol taste in your desserts, you probably won't like it

Chocolate truffle - sweet and non-complex.  Good in a comfort-food way.  Very soft texture minus the crunchy, chocolate covered ball-shaped crisps on top
author: Tina H.

description: How is it that I've lived in SF for 31 years and never heard of this place until recently?  Every cake I've had from this place is a 5-star cake.  Before Schubert's, I always got my princess cakes from Victoria Pastry, but now I know there is another option as sometimes Victoria's cakes are a bit dry.  The chocolate cake here is AMAZING!  How it can be so fluffy-ish yet so rich at the same time is a mystery to me.  You must give Schubert's a chance!
author: Kandi K.

description: I had Schubert's cheesecake at birthday parties before but i had never been to the actual bakery before.  I finally did the other weekend and i was so blown away by the choices.  I got mango cheesecake, strawberry cheesecake, and mango mousse.  I especially loved the cheesecakes.  I think they are the BEST in SF!!!  Can't wait to come back here for more yummy for the tummy :)
author: Jessica N.

description:
I was really expecting an orgasmic experience considering all these rave reviews ... I got the princess cake, which is probably the most talked about cake .. and the mango cheesecake, which I've been craving since I went to Pacific Catch and ordered mango cheesecake for dessert and they said they were out :(

The princess cake: it's good, soft, moist, light ...
The mango cheesecake: tastes almost artificially mango .. mango really is just one of those flavors that's difficult to get away with if you're not using fresh mango .. 


maybe i'll have to try the other cakes, but honestly i'd rather walk down the street to Genki's to satisfy my sweet tooth (which is what I ended up doing).

as far as cakes go, I would refer you guys to Delessio's .. they make an awesome caramel praline cheesecake and the best tres leches I've ever had ..
author: Anvy A.

description:
great place in the neighborhood.  I've gotten a few birthday cakes from here and it never failed me.  This time, I ordered a 12"x15" cake to feed 30 people and it was good.  I ordered a chocolate cake with raspberry and chocolate filling and it was good! You can custom any cake to what you want.  Go on their website and check out what they have.  Another plus is if you need a cake quick (like next day or same day) they can accommodate that also! 

btw, they killed the 12"x15" cake that I ordered... so either they were pigs or it was really good! haha
author: Kapo T.

description: Best desert place around. The cakes are great and the mouses are great and the cookies are great and everything is great. We always get cake here for parties, because it is the best.
author: Nikita K.

description:
This is probably my favorite bakery in San Francisco, and there are a LOT of bakeries here. When I'm back home from the East Coast and there's a birthday that needs a cake, you can be sure to find me picking it up at Schubert's. 

The favorite cakes that I've had from here include, but are not limited to: the Swedish Princess Cake, any and all of the mousse cakes (mango mousse is my *favorite*!), the fruit basket cake, strawberry shortcake, and the tiramisu. 

The Swedish Princess cake here is so amazing. I usually don't really like the layer of marzipan on the outside of princess cakes, but I like the marzipan here and the way it compliments the raspberry and custard fillings on the inside. The cake is so light and moist -- I could probably eat it all day. 

Schubert's mango mousse is the best mango mousse ever -- that mousse layer is just to die for. It's not too sweet, either, for those of you who are weary about mousses being an overkill on the tooth. 

Another thing about the cakes and pretty much all the desserts here is that they're always decorated so beautifully. Even the mini mango mousses look fit for a great celebration!
author: Yvonne W.

description:
The princess cake is one of the better ones that I've had.  I bought one for my cousin's bbq and it was an instant success!! People oohed and aaahed over it and it tasted great! 

I can't wait to try their other items.

As I walked out, I just had to try one of their apricot pastries and it was really buttery and tasty.  Def. coming back for other items!!
author: AhLin C.

description:
Ordered the Swedish Princess
Think Green Marzipan surrounding soft white came, whipped cream and raspberries. - A tad sweet, creamy and moist

Cheesecake 
Baked light cheesecake - pretty good - light, flakey

Black forest 
Whipped cream, chocolate cake, maraschino cherries, and chocolate shavings - soft chocolate cake, though I'm not a cherry fan


Good choices..
author: Charlene C.

description: Awesome. Pretty to look at and tasty tasty stuff here. Princess cake in a world of its own. Sponge, raspberry, whipped cream covered with a scandalously thin wrap of marzipan. Delightful!!
author: Karen W.

description: All of their cakes are delish! My mom's a picky eater and she swears by Schubert's mousse cakes.  Every birthday and holiday cake for the family has to come from here because of the Asian matriarch's orders. This German-style bakery also has other types of baked goods such as coffee cakes and fruit tarts which I've had at parties.  I also like their mini cookies which are really tasty, crisp and wrapped in simple cellophane bags.
author: Bodhi D.

description: This is the source for just about the best birthday cake that I have ever had. Moist, yummy, creamy, dee-lic-i-ouussss.  Absoluuuutely scrumptious.  Their other pastries (danishes, tarts, etc) are quite good as well.  I need to get back here!
author: Harry W.

description:
Hands Down, One of the best  bakeries in the Bay Area. 

Standouts: 
Espresso Moose cake
Fruit Tarts (so good)
Opera Cake
Éclairs
Strawberry Shortcake

Just go there, parking might be hard to find. But it is on Clement street, in SF, so take the bus.
author: Mei L.

description:
I've had 2 different cakes from Schubert's.  One from my friend's bf's birthday (Mango Mousse) and one from my brother's birthday (Tiramisu).  The mango mousse was delicious.  Very light and just sweet enough =)
The tiramisu on the other hand was wayy too sweet for my liking and I feel like I've had better before.  I did notice that the decorations on both the cakes were pretty much the same.

I'll probably go back for the mousse cakes.
author: E C.

description:
I swear,  Schubert's is  the best bakery in San Francisco, and I have tried many.I have yet to find one that compares to Schubert's.  I have fallen in love with every pastry and cake I've ever bought  at  Schubert's. 4 stars for
 Schubert's. Woohoo!!
author: carol c.

description:
I ordered a custom birthday cake for a friend here.   It was chocolate cake with cream and raspberry filling.  DELICIOUS!  The only bad thing is that I asked for the cake to say "To Champagne, Friends, and Birthdays"  and they wrote, "Two Champagnes, Friends and Birthdays."  We had a good laugh and they were more than happy to rewrite it.

Thumbs up!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Affordable, attractive, kind, helpful, professional, convenient, tasty....

Arousing, no but seriously, they bake things sexy here.
author: Lee M.

description:
It's really more like 3.5 stars. Their cakes look fancy and great, and their mousse cakes are quite good, but the others taste stale and relied a little too much on pretty lookin' fondant that was hardly sweet. 

It's around $3 or $4 for a small, individual cake, and around $30 for an 8" or 9" cake. My friend tried a slice of their cheesecake for $1.45. She said it was gross.
author: Anna Y.

description:
Yum yum in my tum tum.

What can I say the Princess cake will make your mouth water and leave you wanting a second slice or  wish that the slice you had was bigger in the first place.  It's layer after layer of a raspberry and custard filling with whipped cream and a layer of marzipan on top.

The breakfast pastries are yummy too.

Make sure you go early because  a lot of the cakes are gone by the end of the day.
author: Jennie N.

description:
Wonderful find! Apparently, everyone else in the city knows about this place but me. Probably because I'm not that much of a cake person...but this place in the bomb.
Ordered an assortment for a bridal shower for a friend who very much loves the sweet stuff. She was very impressed with the detail, design, and the yum factor. I think she might even get her wedding cake from Shubert's.  They even have an application on their website where you design your cake and specify when you want to pick it up....and BAM, it's ready!
Not being that into cake, hands down give this place 5 stars for the service (they were very helpful with planning and suggestions) and the fact that their sweets are friggin' good and awful purty!
author: Jocelyn J.

description:
What more can be said about Schubert's. I just gotta say I love the Swedish Princess. That name in and of itself is worth getting the cake. We just got the cake for a party and it's fun to say we brought the Swedish the Princess.

The small cake was $16.95, I think. It's got a marzipan frosting/coating and underneath - a tasty delight. The cake so moist, not too sweet but sweet enough. Love it! Get a slice and try it.
author: Wendy B.

description:
They prepared a special order of opera cake in petite bites for an Opera party that I hosted. The opera cake is really delicious and it was really great that they were able to accomodate me.

Their fruit tart is also delicious except for the crust.
author: Marina N.

description:
I've been told that I rock because I bring the best cakes to the parties.  Thanks, Schubert's.
I was like 13, and my mom's best friend brought a Swedish Princess torte to my birthday party.  Ever since then I have been a fan in search of a bakery that does it justice (my fiance requests that it becomes the very top layer of our wedding cake!)  I found Schubert's a few years back (now I live 7 blocks away, uh oh, trouble!).  Other than the Swedish Princess torte, try the Strawberry Romanoff (needs to be ordered a day in advance), and the Opera Cake.
author: Meesh K.

description:
I've never been to the actual bakery but friends keep showing up with Schubert's cakes in hand and they are truly delicious. 

Please bring us the Vienesse Fruit Torte next time you come to visit!
author: Sharand N.

description:
OMG I love Schubert's.  First time I've ever had this was at my uncle's birthday party, then again at my cousin's wedding.  I always try to make it part of my stop whenever I come up here to visit.  Too bad Schubert's isn't available in LA / OC where I'm from. =(  I'm sure there are bakeries just as good, but I have yet to find any. (Suggestions are always welcome!)
