The last time I was up here, I got the Raspberry Rum Cake - and I ate 1/4 (in one sitting - I'm such a glutton heh) of it before I had to leave it behind (I gave the rest to my uncle and cousin to enjoy) It was a sad day indeed.


I was told recently that they don't do wedding cakes anymore, is that true?
author: Kathy C.

description:
I flew from So. California to SF to get my wife a princess cake for her birthday. I was able to order the specific cake with personalization online. I also contacted them directly to freeze the cake for the flight home. Without saying my wife was surprised and delighted to have her favorite cake. Even defrosted it tasted as good as ever. 

The bakery is exactly what it is supposed to be, a bakery. They have a wrap around counter with all manner of delicious looking treats. The cake are not too sweet as a previous reviewer stated. They are sweetened just right. You can pick just about anything and you will not be disappointed. 

Enjoy.
author: Lance H.

description: Come here very often to grab some fruit tarts and napoleons for my work place and then i cant help but get a little something from me. I have tried the princess cake that everyone has been talking about but i think its just too sweet for me. I like ALL of their mousse cakes though. Absolutely melt in your mouth delicious  (: oh and fruit tarts are good too.
author: Audrey C.

description: The cakes here are so delicious! I'm happy my friend and I came here while it was pouring rain yesterday; cake + coffee = a great getaway from the terrible weather. This place is way cute and all the cakes looked delicious. Had I not had lunch before I would've eaten way more than I did.
author: Devy E.

description:
I love Napoleon pastries. 

With that said, they have one of the best Napoleon pastry in SF. I highly recommend it. 

Also, my friends tried the chocolate mousse, strawberry shortcake and mango mousse and thoroughly enjoyed their snacks as well. 

FYI: $3.45 for one pastry
author: Akito N.

description: This is the best place if you want some dessert. The swedish princess cake has always been my favorite. The flavor really has depth, not just sweetness. We still try other bakeries. But we always could not finish a 6 inch cake from other bakeries. While we eat the swedish princess cake from Schubert, we always feel like to eat more.
author: V L.

description: Awesome bakery!!! I bought a mango tart for a party and it was soooo good. The tart was not too sweet and not too rich which I like. They have a wide variety of pastries and cake which all look so good. Highly recommdend this place!
author: Leon C.

description: Best croissants in SF!  Staff is super friendly and the cakes - Oh My!!  Try the strawberry cake, it'll blow your mind!
author: Lily L.

description: Schubert's Bakery makes the best cakes I have ever had.  Not only are they works of art, they are delicious!!!  The cookies are also yummy.  I highly recommend this bakery.
author: Kathleen K.

description: I worked in a wedding industry and tried many-many cakes. You cannot beat Schubert's bakery! They have so many flavors; presentation is just amazing and all of their cakes are soooo delicious. Their customer service is great as well. We just got a cake here for my daughter's BD party and had so many compliments. The cake was just beautiful and tasted so good. Even people on a diet had to have a piece :). Now I am ordering Tiramisu cake for my Mom's BD party. I would highly recommend this place.
author: V B.

description: Yummy, they have a good selection of cakes. The problem is finding parking and sometimes it would be so packed inside. When that happens that means not a lot of selections for the day. Well, in my case that is. But this is a good place to grab small cakes when you're craving for something sweet.
author: Nancy T.

description:
The fruit tarts here are awesome!

This place has been around for years and there's a reason why. It has lots of wonderful baked goods. The cakes can be a bit overly sweet...death by cavities.

But lately I love the fresh fruit tarts. Try 'em.
author: M O.

description: Everything is so good here that I find it difficult to decide what I like best.  I'll just have to keep going back until I try everything and then choose a favorite.  If you're a visitor to San Francisco, you'll have to get away from the tourists areas to find Schubert's, but it is worth the effort.
author: Rosemary B.

description:
5 stars for the Mango Mousse and Princess Cakes. 

The Mango Mousse cake is literally like mango pudding on top of cake.  If you're Asian and if you love mangoes, this is the BEST MANGO cake I've ever had!  

The Princess cake is always an excellent selection! 

For wedding cakes, they give a mix 'n match menu of basic cakes and fillings like a PB&J sandwich.  So we felt this type of tasting was unprofessional and difficult to order a tiered cake based on this tasting.  BUT....if you order additional sheet cakes, you can have any cake they sell in the store, even the Mango Mousse cake!
author: MeLuvCookie M.

description:
Tired of these funny colored, huge birthday cakes? Come to Schubert's!

Admittedly, I am partial to their name, but folks, their Princess Cake rivals the best of the Kuchen and Torten in the old country!

Ahh, for the lovers of marzipan, it covers the outside of the cake and is the perfect complement to a cup of Peet's Yemen Sana'a Coffee.

The one-day-old cakes, if there are any, are sold at considerable discount, and are usually in the glass-case on the very left as you enter this tiny vestige of German "Konditorei" among the hustle and bustle of 
our "Second Chinatown."

Worth the detour!
author: Wolfgang S.

description: I used to love schubert's, it's probably the best bakery for cakes that are light and not too sweet. I've tried pretty much everything here, but unfortunately have been disappointed with some of the changes they've made recently. Before, i used to be able to request that liqueur be taken out of certain cakes like the princess cake and i could switch out chocolate cake for white in the white chocolate raspberry mousse. I just think they taste better with these slight alterations and since they have all the ingredients anyway and i order in advance, i don't see why they can't make these accomodations. I also dislike the fact that they started cutting the fruit in the fruit basket into such small pieces and the last couple cakes i've ordered haven't been as good as in the past. I'll probably still get cakes here, but i'm looking for other options with better customer service.
author: Iknowasianfood C.

description: Schubert's made my wedding cake and it was beautiful and delicious. I have loved Schubert's ever since I was a kid and really think they make the best cakes, so it was pretty easy to pick my wedding cake bakery.  The tasting was fun (and tasty), and they worked with us to make an incredible piece of cake art.  The cake was fresh, moist and we got so many compliments on it.
author: Talia S.

description:
My husband and I went to one and only one cake tasting for our wedding, and it was at Schubert's.  All the cake flavors we tried there were delicious, and their prices are reasonable compared to the multitude of SF boutique wedding cakeries out there.  Also, I strive to support local business and as a resident of the Inner Richmond I was happy to go to them!

For the actual wedding, the cake was absolutely delicious (we had two flavors, chocolate truffle in the main/display cake and their signature "princess" white cake in the sheet cake) and we received many compliments.  However, as a picky bride, I must explain that Schubert's lost a star because my instructions were for them to make the decoration on the cake "red" (not sure what would be confusing about that) to match our wedding colors and instead the cake ended up being decorated with a bright blue (robin's egg blue) band around each tier.  Obviously it didn't ruin my wedding or anything, but I thought that the random color choice was odd and no where in the instructions did it say anything about blue.  

So!  I highly recommend Schubert's for their tasty wedding cake, but please be very clear with your cake order if you want a specific color or decoration.
author: Catherine T.

description:
while at clement st... gotta come to schuberts for some desserts. (or if you're STRESSED.lol)

after that 'magical experience' at burma superstar, everyone told me to go to schuberts just because it's..........im not sure why but let me tell you: YUMMMM!. their goodies looked appetizing (definitely you eat with your eyes first).. and tasting it isn't disappointing, at all. (OH YES, i got their SWEDISH PRINCESS CAKE--green fondant with raspberry/strawberry filling, creamy inside and spongy cake!)

wondering why 4-STARS? well........... bakeries that i've tried in my life are equally good to my tummy, especially with san francisco bakeries--with that kind of caliber, definitely no COMPETITION, just making their own goodies based on what's right for them, not what's great for the masses. THAT'S SOMEWHAT A BULLCRAP WHEN PEOPLE SAY THAT EVERY BAKERIES ARE IN COMPETITION... hell no! people making some drama/s about it, really. (=

other than that, COME TO SCHUBERT'S.. one of the mashed-up spots on CLEMENT STREET. j'et aime. xo
author: Marc K.

description:
The cakes are yum yum yum...yummy !

I love the Choc or 2X choc. mousse cake a lot !!! 

Friendly people, hard to find parking!
author: Hanny T.

description: Okay. So how did I get this far in life without ever hearing about Schubert's?! I finally learned of them a bit over a week ago at a friend's birthday party, and my wife and I were so impressed with their chocolate mousse sheet cake she commented that, had we known about Schubert's before our wedding, we would have used them instead of the bakery we chose in Monterey (which was, by the way, also tremendous). Luckily this same friend generously volunteered to take care of ordering and picking up the cake for my wife's birthday this past weekend, and since my wife loves the opera and the theme of the party was "My Favorite Things" (of "Sound of Music" fame) the natural choice was the Opera Cake. Now, I first had this cake as "Gateau l'Opera" while vacationing in Paris years ago, and loved it so much I learned to make it from scratch. I've had it at other times over the years, and Schubert's holds up to or surpasses any that I've had, period. The hazelnut sponge is just right, and the chocolate and mocha praline fillings are rich and creamy. The copious chocolate and white chocolate decorations are of excellent quality, a nice plus! I'll be visiting Schubert's many more times in the future!
author: Chris B.

description: I am known among my friends as the one who gets the birthday cake so I go straight to Schubert's.  They almost always have a lovely chocolate ganach cake available for your same day needs but I try to order ahead and get the Neapolitan cake.   I have also had their pastries. Yum.
author: Kim M.

description: This bakery is just straight up amazing! Everything I tried was balanced well! The cake was moist, the fruit topping tasted fresh, the cream was not too sweet and not too heavy! This bakery has been there for years and there's a reason why. They have a passion for what they do and it always shows in their pastries!
author: Simpson W.

description:
Schubert's is the highlight to any trip to the Clement area. The cake and mousse are both very light and delicate. My favorite has to be the white chocolate raspberry mousse. Other good ones are the tiramisu, pretty much all the other mousses, and cheesecakes. I was not a big fan of the shortcake or the opera cake but it was worth a try. 

One of the best things about getting birthday cake here is that they always decorate it so beautifully - the presentation makes it taste that much better. I have heard some say that the it's a little too chocolatey or too sweet, so watch out for those who are watching their diets.

Great friendly staff, cute clean space. What else could be better?
author: Annelise L.

description: A friend brought over a box filled with cakes from Schubert's.  The orange colored one was the best.  Mango cheesecake perhaps.
author: Wakako U.

description:
My boyfriends Mom got us the double chocolate mousse cake which was delicious.  We each had 2 slices of the cake and it was all gone that same night! I'd like to try their version of the Swedish Princess cake.  I have to agree with others that their prices are very reasonable for the quality cakes they offer.

www.schuberts-bakery.com
author: Jaki B.

description:
Well, how shall I put it? You all touted the mousse cake (mango), so I got one for Christmas eve, and had high hopes. We have been through many cakes from countless other bakeries, so I'm not judging from inexperience.  There was something too tangy sweet about the mango mousse...not quite right, and while the cake was okay-pretty, it was not elegant. 

Remember Le Patisserie on Union Street (since closed)? Now, THEY invented gorgeous, sinfully-delicious cakes. I'm sorry, but Schubert's is not in the same league.
author: Leah B.

description:
A friend took me here to pick up a Mango Mousse cake for my sister's 40th birthday. I have heard about Schubert's Bakery and so I was more than happy to have the opportunity to give their cake a try.

My sister and my family member's all raved about the tastiness of the mousse.  They also raved about how light and fluffy the sponge portion of the cake was.  

It must've been yummy (I am not much of a cake person) because my family wiped the cake out!
author: Soozie H.

description:
FRUIT TART! ahem, I mean...MIXED FRUIT TART! Yes, with stawberries, blackberries, blueberries, kiwi and pineapple!

The regular fruit tart is more of a mixed berries kind of deal. It has strawberries, rasberries (I think), blueberries, and blackberries (I also think). 

Well, I shared the mixed fruit tart with my boyfriend. Here is my analysis:
The fruit - sweet, though not overly sweet
The crust - flakey & light, was not a graham cracker crust, very nontraditional! -gasp-
The creme - good, not too sweet, was very light

The word for this fruit tart is: MELLOW~!

Yes, the tart was very mellow-tasting. Light and flakey yum. I will be back!
author: Cat D.

description:
For both my 16th and 17th birthday, i came here to order my cake. The first time i ordered the mango sponge cake. It was alright. You really have to eat the cake within a few days or the sponge gets hard and the mouse gets gross.

For my 17th, i was more happy with the taste of my cake. I got a chocolate cheesecake and it was great! Let me tell you, i'm extremely picky on how i want my cheesecake and they were able to pull it off.  More than often, many places will put a lot of cream cheese in it, which i hate. The taste is too much for me. Schubert's cheesecake had the right consistency, flavor, and eye tasting cheese cake i ever had.
author: Jennifer Q.

description:
I've heard of this place through my girlfriend's roommates. I had no idea how good this place was, so my girl decided to bring me. I ordered the Strawberry shortcake and a mixed fruit tart. After an hour of having the food inside my car (running other errands), we finally had time to sit down and eat. The fork sliced through the shortcake like a hot knife on butter. And the taste of the shortcake was absolutely delicious. I decided to hold off on the fruit tart, as the taste of the shortcake was already a pleaser, but I can already tell the fruit tart will be just as tasteful (as I'm typing this, my mouth is drooling thinking about the tart).

This bakery is full of cakes, tarts, shortcakes, and many other desserts that are sure to please the taste buds on any occasion and at a very reasonable price. Would I come back here? Oh, you bet I do. Now, if only they made cream puffs (the kind Beard Papa makes too) this place would be an end all bakery spot to go.
author: Michael S.

description:
One of the best bakeries I've been to in a loong time!

The White Chocolate Raspberry Mousse is delicious!! Very light and not too sweet. This is the only cake I've tried so far but I'm hooked. They even have little tarts that look yummm.
author: May A.

description: I love Schubert's. I love their Princess cake, I love their mango mousse cake, and I especially love their chocolate cheesecake. I love their chocolate cheesecake so much that I demand one for my birthday every year. =) Even though I'm really not a huge sweets and sugar person, I love and appreciate delicious baked treats and I'm going to get around to trying every cake and tart and cookie in here eventually. It will be so worth it!
author: Queenie C.

description: big big fan-- the swedish princess cake had so many layers of goodness-- the only part that I wish I could change was maybe the marzipan green covering was a little too sweet. but otherwise, can't wait to try the other flavors, especially their mango mousse!
author: Ellin C.

description: My mother-in-law bought our wedding cake from here and we ate the whole cake in 10 minutes. I usually am not a fan of sweet stuff, but surprisingly their cakes are just right, perfecto! If I will celebrate with some treats, this will be my bakery for cakes.
author: Wine L.

description:
My hubby and I are so grateful that we were able to use Schubert's as our wedding cake vendor. After the initial confusion of trying to make contact through email and then phone, we decided to just go into the store and order our cake. At that time, they said our date was book already but to try and call the store manager. When I called and talked with the store manager, I told him about not being able to get through right away. And since we live in the south bay, we had to wait until our free weekend to go in store. 

The store manager was wonderfully accommodating and said that he would squeeze us in even though they were book. From there on, the process went so smoothly. We scheduled and went in for our tasting (which was so fun & delicious). We ordered a 3 tier square cake + sheet cake for a reasonable price. We described what we wanted & it was truly everything that we wanted for our cake. So beautiful, elegant & most importantly delivered on time- we loved it! And our guest thought it was delicious too! 

We can't wait for our complimentary 1 year anniversary cake! We would definitely recommend Schubert's Bakery for your wedding cake vendor!
author: Mrs. WP C.

description: Opera cake is their best selection. Excellent quality. Love their wedding cakes. A lot of personal touch
author: Fandorin R.

description: I love this bakery and when I lived in San Francisco, this is a place to get good quality cakes.  Definitely more French/Japanese style of cakes where high quality and not overly sweet, and excellent.  I often miss cakes in Japan, which follows French style, and this place serves quality cakes I like.  I want to definitely go back there for special occasion, even though I live a little far from them now.
author: M N.

description:
I would give this bakery FIVE STARS!!

I remember we have all kinds of cake within a month.. me and my sisters realized we were consuming too much fat and sugar in our body so we lessened it ... but every once in a while we do have cake from Schubert's... I'm always looking forward to birthdays in my family because we order  nothing but Schubert's .....it's really worth your 
money!!

chocolate rhum cake was my favorite
fruit tart was my sister's 
cheesecake was my other sister's
author: nice m.

description:
This adorable bakery never disappoints me.  In fact, I've yet to try anything that didn't exceed my expectations.  We've ordered a birthday cake, picked up snacks for a party, and popped in for pastries.  It's all so fresh and the perfect amount of sweet!  Only downside I've found is the whole city agrees and shows up on the weekend to make you wait for the goodies, but well worth it!

I recommend the Chocolate Mousse cake w/ Almonds.  Delectable!
author: Christina B.

description:
My brother and dad swear by the Swedish Princess Cake. But my brother just calls it the Swedish Cake because Princess makes him feel uncomfortable. Just to tease him, I tell people he likes the Princess Cake. Seriously though, they'll buy this cake for my birthday or anyone else's birthday, even if the person's favorite cake is Strawberry Shortcake or Chocolate something. 

I really like the mousse cakes. Raspberry, currant, whatever. I love it. If cakes made people lose weight, I'd live off of this place. WORD.
author: anocha s.

description: The BEST tiramisu cake ever. The only cake I would eat since I do not like cakes all that much. My boyfriend buys me a birthday cake here every year! They also sell most of their cake in little mini version as well. Although it is on the more pricier side, it's worth it! I live across the city and decided to drive 25 mins out here because I was craving. When I came in around 11:30 a.m, I knew I wanted to purchase a 6 inch. However, I didn't see it so I asked the chubby face Caucasian sales woman. She just briefly said no we are all sold out. Curious, I asked will you have them later in the day and she just blurbed out I am not sure with quite an attitude. So I asked well, can you find out whenever you can? And she replied " I'm helping someone else right now". Yah I know I can see. So I asked another salesgirl and she went to check for me and they had it! Parking is difficult but with a little patience you'll eventually find a space! Oh yeah, try to go earlier in the day since they're very busy so most flavors will be sold out by 5:30 it seems like!
author: Karen T.

description: One of my all time favorite places, I don't really need an excuse to to stop buy and pick up one of their great cakes, but luckely my moms birthdayis tommorow,so, here I go again,
author: Amy F.

description:
Anytime I think about Schubert's my taste buds do a lil dance, no joke.

This place has an array of really good cakes, but my personal favorite is the Mango Mouse, it's the closest to heaven I can get. I'm not a big cake fan, so that tells you a lot right there. Their service is always quick and they've always been more than helpful, thanks guys!
author: S A.

description:
Definitely the place to go to get an impressive cake for any special occasion. 

If you like chocolate the Opera cake is amazing! Hands down best chocolate cake I ever had.
author: AA B.

description: Their passion fruit mousse cake is AMAZING!!!  Best bakery in SF hands down!!!
author: Ceejars J.

description: I bought the chocolate mousse and white chocolate mousse cake for my daughter's 5th birthday party and I had a lot of guest tell me how good the cake was. = ) I do agree! the cake was one of the best cakes I've ever had.
author: E F.

description: Wow! I don't even know HOW to start this review! Everything is just that good! Every time I come here, I get the chocolate mousse cake. Mmmm. It's so delicious and smooooth! *drool* Their fruit tarts aren't bad either! Over the years I have tried many of their items and their cookies are definitely something you have to try. The only bad thing about this place is parking, but I'd say that the terrible parking is worth it!
author: Susie N.

description: Schubert's cakes are so delicious! I came here from a recommendation of a friend, and decided to go for a tasting for my wedding.  Needless to say, my now husband and mother in law loved their cakes. I especially liked their mouse and whip cream cakes.  Charlene helped us w/ our tasting. We decided to go w/ a two tiered cake and then just get sheet cakes for the rest of our guests. At the time of the tasting I had NO IDEA what I wanted my cake to look like nor did I have a final decision on what types of cakes I wanted. I actually sent her my final decision later through email. For the two tiered cake we decided to get a chocolate mocha cake and for the two types of sheet cake we got a chocolate strawberry mouse and their coffee crunch. Everyone raved about the coffee crunch. One guest even told me they could've eaten 10 pieces of the coffee crunch cake!  Not only were their cakes delicious they were affordable. Much more so than a lot of the other cake places I was looking at.  I would definitely order cake from them again.
author: Courtney Y.

description: The Double Chocolate Mouse is terrific. Best in the town. Next time I would like to try other mouse cake. They got all kinds of cakes and really good for celebrating Birthday. Highly recommend
author: Bob C.

description: Schubert's and I have become good friends!  I have been here multiple times always to grab some of their smaller tartes, custards or mousses or something chocolatey to bring to a friends' house.  I know when I go there on three small desserts I need to be ready to drop some money,  but I am OK with this due to the flavor packed into each bite of their items.  I have never tasted a mango or currant dessert that is so flavorful that it tastes as if you are eating the actual fruit itself with nothing additional.  Also, their chocolate is so buttery and rich that it is difficult to stop after the first bite.  I am waiting for an opportunity/excuse to get an entire cake/pie.  You can't go wrong going here, the only problem is sometimes finding a parking spot!
author: Adrienne B.

description: I was looking for a cake for a work function for about 100 people. This bakery is great. Very reasonably priced and they did a beautiful job decorating they cake with loads of chocolate shavings. It was so gorgeous I honestly thought, "if it tastes even just decent, I'll be happy with it.' The cake was so incredibly tasty. Numerous guests came up to me to aske where I got the cake and to let me know how yummy it was. Thanks Shubert's for making me look great.
author: Mona B.

description:
I love their cheesecakes because its not hard and dense like most.  It's light and sweet enough.  Their black currant flavor is my favorite, with berries under the surface leaking purple tastiness.  When I bring it to a family gathering, my stunning cousins related only by marriage consume every morsel.

Everything else at the bakery is too sweet.

Schubert's gets four stars (from a base of three stars) because I come here regularly to buy cheesecakes for my family, but I don't purchase their other sweet offerings.
author: Amanibhavam K.

description:
After reading all the reviews on here, I decided to make the cross-town trek to try Schubert's out. I have a chonic sweet tooth and had just spent two weeks in Berlin, doing Kaffee und Kuchen every day, so I was in need of a fix. I picked up four individual cakelets/slices - a Napoleon, a Princess cake slice, a strawberry mousse & a raspberry/white chocolate mousse.

After riding the #22 home and brewing some fresh coffee, I opened up the box and to my great disappointment found a mess. The cakes were so poorly packed that they'd all toppled over. I'd been careful to keep the box level all the way home, so it wasn't due to me swinging the box like a loony.

Whilst the cakes are lovely to look at, as far as the tastes and textures go...entirely forgettable, bog-standard fare. I could have cried. The strawberry mousse was probably the most disappointing...the sponge was on the dry side and the mousse had no substance to it and barely tastes of strawberry...I'm thinking maybe they just wafted some strawberries over the mixture, rather than actualluy adding it.

If I lived in the Inner Richmond, I'd likely go back...as I don't, I won't. If you're looking for orgasm-inducing cakes and actually know what high quality is, I'd skip this place.
author: Dan L.

description:
It's a diamond in the rough. 

The tirimisu is probably the best I've ever had. The coffee mousse is also to die for. I've had the whole thing myself! 

Don't let the location fool you. It's truly one of the best bakeries in the city.
author: Diana L.

description:
I remember watching a film in high school that involved the characters going on a quest trying to find the best tiramisu in their city. I clearly remember myself going on a similar quest after watching the film.

I stumbled into Schubert's accidently on a random day when I was cruising on Clement. I had no intention of eating sweets that day but I passed by this place so many times I decided that I might as well just step in for once. Boy was I glad I did! I found myself surrounded by a world of deliciousness. There were so many goodies behind the glass. I wanted to try them all! As I browsed through the names I was surprised to find that they had tiramisu as I had just finished the film a few days prior. So of course I got it. 

Man! It was oh soo good. Just melt in your mouth goodness! I loved looking at the layers of it as I dug deeper and deeper into the little cake. 
Their opera cake is really good with its hint of hazelnut. Oh, and their strawberry shortcake which I discovered just last year thanks to a special someone. OH and their cookies too! 

If youre having a bad day or craving something sweet, instead of grabbing some ice cream, come in and grab a lil treat. You wont regret it.
author: Van D.

description:
There used to be tons of old-timey Swedish, German, and other small bakeries throughout the Inner Avenues.  OMG, the swirling scent of strudels, cookies, cheese & fruit danishes, each bakery blasted out a warm draft of pure heaven into the foggy morning air.  like air freshener.

Schubert's gives me that nostalgia fix, plus the bakery flavor that's really hard to get with mass-produced baked goods and ingredients.  The creamy layer of the Princess Cake tastes of *freshly* whipped cream. Best of all no shortening residue on my palate after eating a butter cookie, pastry or frosted cake.  They use butter.  Never too much of anything, though.

Their cake selection is well beyond my repertoire, everything I have tried here is top of the line.  they also package their cookies into great gift bags & have individual mini-cake versions of many of their grande tortes.

This is a no-nonsense type of bakery not a "scene" unless you're one of the cute older ladies and men who come here to drink coffee and (presumably) gossip; it gets crowded on the weekends.  The young ladies who work here are very business-like but sweet & have a good sense of humor, too.  That last star is for them!
author: Herb C.

description:
Still the best bakery in the Richmond District. You may ask yourself when there, "A German Bakery in a predominantly Chinese neighborhood?" After you eat a tasty bite you will answer, "Good is good no matter where you're from." 

I heard it was recently taken over buy a former Korean doctor who just loves the bakery. Sweets CAN change lives and butter IS good for you. I have been going since a kid and it's da same.

Key to liking this place: get the almond tart (you can travel long distances with this little guy and he'll still be sweet next day.)

My only downer: lack of seating cuz the same elderly couples like to set up for the day there and people watch with a boiling cup of tea (watch out) and treat. I don't blame them though.
author: Becca S.

description: With such a wide selection it is hard to choose what to get. I cant belive in all my years in the city I have never had one of their cakes! Ive been missing out! I chose a chocolate mousse for my pals bday and it was decadent! So delicious! I cant go anywhere else now because Im hooked! I count down the days another friends bday so I can try the tiramisu or passion fruit mousse cake. OMG! And good thing its close to my house because I hate diets!
author: M K.

description: My parents got their wedding cake from Schubert's back in the 1970s, so it has always had a special place in my stomach.  I have no idea what cake they had back then, but I like to tell myself that they had a giant Princess Cake with the neon green frosting.    Every time I walk by, I have to get a slice or 4 of princess cake.  The fondant, raspberry goodness and whipped cream.  Delicious! It's really that good.  I introduced my classmate to the cake as well, and she gets a couple of pieces each time.  The assorted cookies are not too good.  The mango mouse is okay (my parents like it).  But I always go back to the neon green cake.
author: Nita K.

description: A friend brought a piece of the Swedish Princess to work. I fell in love with it. It's delicious. One day we all woke up early (our early - we're grave yard shift workers) and drove to SF from San Jose to get some slices. The trip was worth it.
author: Gilbert S.

description: The mousse cakes, princess cake, wreath cakes, chocolate tortes, danishes, simply everything is so good!!! I'm so lucky to live nearby and just pick up any delight my eyes fall on.  The cakes are definitely Viennese style. So their sponge cake bases are fine and delicate, their designs mosaic-like and sophisticated, the mousses are so light!  Everything is amazing. Seriously!
author: Sheue L.

description:
yum yum yum yum!!! love their cakes. every time i'm in there i always buy as much as i can wishing it would last a few days but no, i end up eating it all by the end of the day =oP

it's that good!
author: Anna I.

description: My favorite place in The City to pick up a birthday cake or even just some fun dessert's. I have to say they make the best around. Personal favorites are the Strawberry shortcake, mango moose, double chocolate moose cake, and the eclairs are to die for. This place is a must try all fresh fruits are used when making their cakes and you gotta love how great they look. I've heard great things even about their wedding cakes and i'll make sure to keep that in mind ;)
author: mitchell l.

description:
Great cakes! I go here all the time for their eclairs and tarts.

Horrible parking on Clement street, but worth the chocolate creme filled goodness of them eclairs!
author: Marc E.

description: I have been coming to this bakery for many years. We buy many of the cakes for birthdays and family events. Sometimes we just buy a cake straight from the displays and ask them to write a message on it. There are too many choices on the display cases, so sometimes it's hard to make a decision. Favorites are tiramisu, opera cake, and chocolate mousse w/ almonds. The mini sizes are great since you can try more flavors! Service is friendly and helpful.
author: Jane M.

description: Schubert's is just simply AMAZING!  One of our favorite is the Swedish Princess!  The cakes are so moist and have so much flavor!  The blends of flavor range from raspberry to rum to chocolate!  Anything your heart's desire, Schubert's probably has it!  Can't wait to go there again!
author: Bernardo R.

description: Best mouss cakes. Excellent service. Black currant is my personal fav. I'm even willing to drive to the Richmond district every single time. Love.
author: Alina B.

description: I went here one Sunday afternoon.  Oh boy oh boy, soon, I'm buying a 3-tiered princess cake with or without a wedding in tow.  When I took the first bite, it was like nothing I've ever tasted... completely and utterly satiated with the marzipan, the yellow cake... the just-enough raspberry layer....  Holy moly, I'm in love.  Got a 6" cake... to share... but mostly to finish at least half of it by myself.  Soooo bad, yet soooo good.  The eclair I got my sister was said, "REALLY good."  Coming up to the city for JUST dessert, here at this bakery, is a REAL TREAT.  A quality 6" cake for 20 bucks..  not bad of a price.
author: Rainbow B.

description: Absolutely delicious cakes at incredibly reasonable prices! Recently, I bought a chocolate mousse cake after spending *alot* of time with the very patient saleswoman, discussing the many options (which all looked divine in the case). The flavor of the mouse cake was rich and the texture very light. Perfection! Having called many bakeries for information ahead of time, I was very pleasantly surprised by the quality for the price and the presentation was lovely. This place is a GEM! Shop here early, late and often!
author: Mary D.

description: This place is wonderful! Its been around since 1911, so they def have the recipes dialed in. Strawberry cheesecake was scrumptious. Coffee also very good. Many cakes and goodies to choose from. Their cake book, for special occasions was impressive and the turn around time from ordering to pick up for special orders was short. The place was pretty busy (at 2pm) and although the staff had probably been there since the crack of dawn, were all very friendly and helpful.
author: Jina E.

description:
Having grown up in the kitchen of a classic Danish/French restaurant, gone to cooking school for desserts, and worked as a pastry chef, I'm a  tough customer when it comes to bakery satisfaction (read: probably a total jerk with insanely high standards). This is one of the few places I've been where I can not only not find fault with anything, but actually enjoy the hell out of the food. I stopped making my own scones on the weekends after I found Schubert's; I walk there and get something every Saturday morning instead.

Everything about their food rocks: great taste and texture, they use good ingredients, and it all looks fresh, clean, and great (but without going over the top).

For example, their almond croissants are covered with slices of perfectly toasted almonds, the outside is crisp and almost explosive, the dough inside is light and in discrete layers (instead of being over-worked into a bready, solid lump), and the filling gets its flavor from real nuts instead of extract. Textbook perfect and totally delicious.

Whether you're looking for something to eat yourself, supply an event, or give as a gift, Schubert's won't let you down.
author: Nick G.

description: I just had to go here because I love me some sweets. I tried the mango mousse and I SHOULD'VE ordered 3 of them instead of sharing with my mom and sister but noOooO.. I was trying to watch my calories. :(  Oh well. Good stuff... it just melted in my mouth. Had their princess cake. It was good but I wasn't really feeling the marzipan. The brownie was really rich and yummy. I'd definitely go back when I'm in town..
author: uneek v.

description:
The hot young Asians who work there are just as tasty as the sweets. Every time I go in there I leave wishing that I were young and handsome and charismatic.

At least I get to drown my sorrows in the best chocolate mousse cake in the city, though.
author: L S.

description: Schubert's Bakery is one of the bakery I like in the bay area. They have variety of selections of cake and tarts. It makes it  hard to select the right cake because they all look yummy. I love their mango mouse cake, it's very light and lots of mango flavor. Also, I tried the raspberry mouse cake. It was very chocolatey.
author: Stacy L.

description: You will fall in love, and I must warn you it will be hard not to gain weight because you will want to eat there cakes' every day.  Schubert's cakes are delicious, and beautifully decorated.  In the last few months I have tried a number of there cakes's and have loved all of them.  You can get a range of sizes, , including by the slice and  personal size which is a great touch for co-worker, employee or just for you- why not.  Schubert's also has cookies and pastries.  Oh and no need to worry there prices are fair and will not break the bank.  Only thing to note is there located in an area where parking can be difficult. I can't wait to be back in the neighborhood so I can try the there cheesecake.
author: Liz R.

description: I must have walked by this place 20-30 times, but never noticed this little bakery until recently.  I decided to stop in for something sweet to hold me over before dinner.  The place was clean and the pastries and cakes all looked really good. I decided to get a danish, which was fantastic.  I'll be back again soon for a sugar refill.
author: Paul K.

description: I ordered a custom cake at Schubert's bakery a couple weeks ago for a last minute birthday party. I called Thursday evening at closing time and explained my situation that I needed an extravagant cake by Saturday afternoon. They were very courteous on the phone and said to come in the following day and they can accommodate a special order in a rush. The customer service was excellent and the outcome exceeded expectations. The cake was ready sooner than I expected and got to pick up earlier Sat morning. To top things off the cake was a looked and taste phenomenal. It was a 2 tier cake, chocolate mouse on the bottom and tiramisu on top decorated to perfection. Everyone was so pleased with the cake, I recommended this bakery to the whole party. It was  huge hit and I was so pleased to find this place last minute. This is my new found favorite bakery!
author: Louis B.

description:
The best choices at Schubert's:
- Strawberry Shortcake: amazinggg!! the best one in town I'm 100% sure!
- Italian Rum:  you can taste & smell the rum, but not too much that it'll overpower the cake itself..
- Napoleon: deliciouss!!!
- Princess Cake: it's so goodd,.. but unforutnately, Delanghe's princess cake tastes better.. :)
author: Cherish S.

description: I have been going to Schubert for years because of its varieties of artisan and tasty cakes, quality services, and reasonable pricing. In fact, its price is a bit lower than the most of bakeries. Schubert cakes are freshly made daily. The overnight / a-day old cake will be identified and priced lower. Honest business, I like that. I am happy to see Schubert is doing well and more people enjoy its creations. My favorites are its mango moose, chocolate moose, and two-layer chocolate cake.
author: April W.

description: I've been going to this bakery since I was a kid, at year 4 and I've been getting my cakes there ever since. I love the pastries. Sometimes the wait is long and calling them may be hard, but overall I love this place. Fruit tarts and mousse cakes are my fave.
author: Barbara C.

description:
I'm happy to report that the chocolate/custard wreath cake is back (albeit with somewhat solid chocolate rather than chocolate crumbs like they used to have).  Now, if only they would bring back the Danish version!
Also, the relatively new German pastries (cherry, apple and cheese) are wonderful. Not too sweet and just like the ones I love during my visits to Germany!!
author: Miyako O.

description:
the cakes here are beautiful to behold and beautiful to eat.  i wanted dessert so i made Boy bring me here, and we bought some samples for his parents. all in all we had four different cakes.

-swedish princess (the one with the green top) - i didn't read the reviews of this before i went but i, too, was very pleased. my favorite. yay for marzipan.

-napoleon: good flaky crust. a little difficult to eat, but delicate and not too sweet. mom would love it.

- chocolate mousse cake ... mmmm
- white chocolate raspberry mousse cake ..... mmm .. 

it's not 5 star only because there's pretty much nowhere to sit. but go, get ur cake and go, it's yummy.
author: alice y.

description: Today Margaret said we had to stop here so I could write a review for Yelp, so we dropped into one of the last vestiges of a time when Clement Street was a European neighborhood.  This store has been here since Margaret's childhood at least, and I used to visit frequently in the 80s.  Although it has turned over -- look behind the counter -- the recipes have done well under the current owners.  We drop in from time to time for coffee and the little pastries in the display.  My favorite today was the fresh fruit cup, although I have been known to order most of the mousse selections.  Today the clerk serving us spaced out and forgot he was working, but all's well that ends well.  The treats are first class, and the eclairs are terrific.  Germany lives on; we'll be back again.
author: David D.

description: Schubert's makes me want birthday cake.  It's not my birthday, not any family or friends.  I want it because Schubert's cakes are so damn good.  It's so evil of them to sell single portion cakes to get you hooked.  Prices of the cakes are extremely fair for the fancy product you get in return.  Most are decorated with chocolate twirls and huge shavings that I just want to pick at!
author: Eric W.

description:
What a huge disappointment.  I went in person to Shubert's to choose a birthday cake for my BF's Big 3-0 Birthday Party.  Day of the party, I went to pick up my cake and the order was "missing".    

They had happy Birthday Bob and Happy Birthday John, but nothing for my BF.  

What kind of Bakery can take an order and just lose it. They are in the special occasion business and they ruined this one for us. I had a party with no cake, as I did not want to give them my business after this major flub.  Bad service so I will be getting my cakes elsewhere.
author: Mya P.

description: Not sure how much more I can add to everyone's review here. If the birthday person has no bakery preference, there is no doubt that I'll order the cake from Schubert's. I have yet to have anyone voice a complaint. Everyone enjoys the mousse cake. The mousse cakes are so light. Even the gals who keep screaming that they're on a diet go for a second slice.
author: Cathy H.

description: got two slices of Napoleon custard  and one chocolate mousse today.  I took a quick glance and it seem that they have raised the prices and all my faves are all $3.45 a slice (ouch!) now.   the cakes were still good but the service not so much.
author: L C.

description: Ok..this place opened in1911!!?? Its older than my dead Uncle Pete! They have the most beautiful cakes I have ever seen. I tried the Opera cake and the cappuccino cake...omg, too good. In the span of 45 minutes, there were 6 people leaving with ginourmous cakes. This is the place for beautiful, great tasting cakes! Their cookies are fabulous too!
author: Barb B.

description:
seriously, i think this is the best bakery hands down in san francisco.  they have a variety of cakes and they are all so beautifully done and delicate tasting.  no oversugaring here!

whenever my girlfriends get married (and this happens often), i always refer them to schubert's and they are always happy with the results.  so am i when it comes reception time - i have no shame in asking for 2nds or 3rds or stealing other's slices when it comes to cake.

oh and let me say - the way to my heart is through the swedish princess cake....almond fondant lovers unite!!
author: Josie M.

description: Great place for birthday cakes. It's in my neighborhood and I love to walk around Clement for my daily 30 minute walks as an exercise routine. After my exercise, I like to come here and fill up my calories and carbs back with cakes from here. They sell individual ones if you are really on a diet but I like the 8" mousse cakes. They have a lot of flavors ranging from mango, lemon, topical, strawberry, and raspberry. They are all very good but strawberry's my favorite.
author: Juliane N.

description: My family gatherings aren't family gatherings without a Schubert's cake. Birthdays, Christmas, Easter, you name it. I could list everything I've tried, but you should just look at their website because I think the pictures speak for themselves. The mousse cakes are especially fantastic, but everything here tastes as good as it looks. The only thing that I can recommend that is not on the menu is the specialty cake that they offer around the holidays. I don't know what it is called, but it is a yellow layer cake with a custard cream filling, a crunchy pastry-like bottom, and cream puffs and chocolate curls on top. We get it every year and it is amazing. I cannot wait until next Christmas for another slice.
author: Lauren Y.

description:
Think of me for being kind for even giving stars..this should really be ZERO stars, but because I admit that *some* of their stuff is actually good, I'm going to give them the benefit of the doubt in that area. It's really more about service for me than anything else. The cakes at this place are good, but they taste disgusting for someone like me who has been treated like crap when I walked in. 

What I will NOT give the benefit of the doubt is one instance in which I walked in and was completely ignored by the person behind the counter as she helped every single person who walked in behind me for the next 10 minutes. It was like I didn't exist. I said "excuse me" a lot and was just standing there but she totally ignored me and was greeting the person behind me. Granted, I don't look like a serial killer.. I think I actually look like a fairly nice person. Then another person came out from behind the kitchen, this older Asian lady..by this time I was fairly frustrated, and I was like "excuse me..I haven't been helped for the last 10 minutes.." and she pretty much said with some crazy attitude..that well, it's not HER fault because she just came out from the kitchen. So.. imagine me, after being frustrated and pissed off after a good amount of time of being completely ignored and treated like I don't exist...and then receiving that kind of attitude when someone finally "greets" me...well, it was the final straw. I turned round on my heel and left. Now everytime, I see a cake from Schubert's, I kind of want to throw up. Completely unacceptable service. 

I'm in the service business and I realize that no matter who your customer is..whether they're tall or short, young or old, look rich or poor, black or white.. it don't matter, you're supposed to treat them well and show them that you're ready to help. It's what service is. I absolutely did not feel like this place deserved my business, no matter how yummy their cakes are, and I have not been back since. Sure, people have bought me cakes from there (bdays, etc) but I bring myself and my business elsewhere.
author: Nebula H.

description: Usually if cakes look amazing, I assume the taste will be somewhat less than amazing. OK- serious yummmmmm factor here! Berry flavored light cheesecake with lots of little cake bits, different kinds of chocolate shavings-- really, really good! Thankfully  it's a bit off my beaten track or I would be rolling myself there!
author: Keri B.

description: I didn't realize that this place was so popular since it was just a small bakery on Clement where we would always get our birthday cakes from. Little did I know that it's one the highest rated bakeries in SF! I think I've been missing out since we always got their mango mousse cakes for birthdays. For my friend's graduation this year, we got an Opera cake, which is chocolate with nuts and everything. It reminds me of a cake version of a Ferrero Rocher; it's very rich and instead of cream to layer the cake, its layered with chocolate. They also have tiny cakes to try. We had the current mousse cake, which is a bit tart and also the mango cheesecake, which doesn't really taste like a traditional cheesecake. I think it tastes better and I've been missing out on the cheesecake all these years. So much for giving up on delicious cakes and pastries, but I have to indulge every time I come home.
author: Bailey Z.

description: Ok, so I haven't tried anything else except for the princess cake...AND IT'S FREAKING DELICIOUS!!!!! Ok so a little background of the cake: it's one of the 4 or 5 classic cakes and it is a white sponge cake with thin layers of raspberry filling with a little cream. It is topped with green colored marzipan - MY FAVORITE! I can eat this for DAYS, if only I didn't gain any weight from it! You gotta try this and invite me if you do.... PRINCESS CAKE!!!!
author: Cristina D.

description: Schubert's came through at the last minute and delivered two incredible cakes, one mango mousse and one chocolate mousse. Very reasonable price for beautiful cakes that tasted great, and they also have the whole spectrum of tarts, cookies and other baked goods. We ended up eating cake until 4am.
author: Phil M.

description: Having read all of the rave reviews, we decided to order my birthday cake from Schubert's instead of D'Alessio (which I still love, but am trying to expand the bakery horizons). Five stars for the fantastic Swedish Princess Cake which was lovely to look at, and even yummier to devour!
author: Suepattra M.

description: by far, my number one pick in bakeries in the bay area!  it never fails, when a birthday or *special* occasion arises, i'll drop in or make the call to reserve a *cake*.  from the princess cakes, to the passionfruit rum custard, cheesecakes and the cookies - delish!  i even ordered my wedding cake here.  parking can be a pain but it's all worth the wait.
author: elaine i.

description:
this review is based entirely on our wedding cake tasting experience. We had been looking forward to our appointment since we have always loved their cakes/cupcakes, etc. 
when we arrived for our appointment, we were quickly seated at the table next to the counter, however then we had to wait for someone to come meet with us, finally one of the workers came by, gave us a list of the available flavors along with the pricing list and instructed us to pick 3 flavors, then left again. Returned after ~ 5min, took our requests, then was gone again. Finally she sat down with us and after asking us a few general questions for contact info and then after we gave her our wedding date, she replied "oh, i've already had 4 other couples come in today with that same wedding day, you'll have to make a decision soon because we only take 6 reseverations" She answered a few of my questions and then left again...returned later with 3 small pieces of cake in the flavors we had chosen, and by small, I mean, each piece only allowed my fiance and I to take 1 bite each. Basically, after that, she just handed me the papers and said "when you decide to come back, just bring this with you" 
I pretty much decided on the spot that we would not be returning here for our wedding cake since I was so annoyed by then. BTW, they charge an EXTRA 20% surcharge if you want a square (rather than round) cake.
author: A W.

description:
I've only been to the bakery once, and spent no more than 15 minutes there.  I bought a mousse cake (i think it was the tropical fruit flavor, or something close to that).  The service was friendly.  The mousse cake was good, but I didn't like the flavor because it was oddly, unevenly sour. I did love the milk chocolate signs they used to write your message on the cake.  The prices were not cheap either.

P.S. When I was there, I had to wait in line for about 10 minutes, so don't expect to double park when you go there, go in get something, and come back out immediately.
author: Karen C.

description: I'm not too into sweets, but "yummy", this place is probably the only place where they have a cake just for me. Those little small ones behind the glass for $3.75 or something. Yea.. those things are delicious! The prices for the bigger cakes are nicely priced too! If only they made all the big ones into those tiny little ones... I'd be able to tell all my friends I've tried some of the most delicious types of cake! EVER!!!!1
author: Andrew W.

description: Best little chocolate dipped, jelly filled, sugar cookies you will ever eat...and they come in different shapes! They sell them in little packages or boxes. They have many little sweet treats in their cute store, but I love the cookies the most! They have so many different kinds of cookies, you'll want to eat them all. Go ahead, try it and you won't regret it.
author: Kimberly H.

description: Mango Mousse Cake is the bomb, nothing like it, sooooooo gooooooddd. The staff here is very nice and I love the cute flowery decorations made of chocolate they put on their cakes.  When you take one bite of that cake, you forget all about the agony of driving around trying to find parking and fighting the crowds of this street (specially on weekends). And you just can't stop eating, yummmm.
author: Kanwal A.

description: We stopped in here after a visit to Green Apple Books to buy a few goodies.  The eclair was the standout; large, delicious filling and chocolate icing topped with a lovely fresh raspberry...one of my fond SF memories.
author: Jan M.

description: Princess cake is very good, not outstanding though.  Black Forest cake is delicious, not too sweet.  Napoleon and Tiramisu are both tasty, worth a shot.  The Almond Tarts are awesome for you almond lovers.  Can get very busy, order cakes ahead of time.  Very reasonably priced.  Check them out!
author: Junglist S.

description:
I wanted to take the opportunity of this review, to establish proper line etiquette at Schubert's Bakery.  
I know the minute people walk into Schubert's their sugar-cravings kick in and they can get a little irrational, a little overwhelmed by the all the mousse cakes, cheese cakes, ladyfingers, etc.  
But more than once, a co-patron has bitched at me for jumping the line, when in reality, they were too busy plastering their faces to the display cases to notice when the clerks called for the next customer.   
So here it is - the RULES OF THE LINE. The line starts at the register, at the back of the store. That's where the friendly and helpful clerks will be calling for the next customer. Even if you don't know what you want, and have questions, you have to at least step away from the eclairs and establish your line presence next to the cash register. Standing 7ft away by the cakes-by-the-slice or milling back and forth between that and the pastry case - that's NOT establishing your next place in line. 
Sorry if that sounds harsh, but I got a mocha torte (which I ordered over the phone) to pick up, and I won't have my time wasted by the indecisive.
author: CINDY K.

description:
This is another evidence that collective intelligence does exist.  Peter Russell is a genius.

Due to the hectic 70-hour work week (excuses, excuses), I forgot to order the (personalized) cake from this other South Bay bakery that I've promised I'm going to bring to a friend's birthday dinner tonight.  

Yelp says: 4.5 star average and 237 reviews (this is the 238th).  
Even better: the place is ten minutes away from my lovely San Francisco crash pad.  

Was initially apprehensive about the often horrific parking situation around Clement Street.  Yet found a parking spot a block away from the place within the first minute of getting there.  Thank you Parking God.  

Lots of mouthwatering cakes on display - mango mousse, strawberry mousse, Swedish Princess (plump white cake with raspberry and custard filling and light green icing), good old chocolate cake, and tiramisu.  

After much deliberation, we picked a mean-looking tiramisu, complete with a personalized message (done in literally one minute).  

Walked out of the shop with the cake and coffee to go, feeling very proud of self.  

And very wired, too.  Their coffee is extra strong.  You have been warned.

Note: For those of you who have more sense of preparedness than I could ever have (that would mean approximately 99% of the population), you have the option of ordering the cakes online.  Then you can pick it up en route to whatever birthday/anniversary/baby shower celebration, rock up in style and impress the hell out of everyone.
author: Ange L.

description: My most favorite bakery in the world... well at least in the grand circle of 100 miles....  I've been going for years.  I have never once been disappointed.  Not only does everything taste great but it looks soooooooooooo beautiful.  Parking can be a bit of a challenge, but if you don't mind walking a few blocks or driving around the block a couple of times it is really worth the stop.  Just to gawk if nothing else...
author: Robin G.

description: Its hidden. You may just pass by it and not even see it. Great for early risers, you can wake to a plethora of freshly baked pastries (at the end of the day, if there are any leftover - which is rare - they are only a dollar!). The mango mousse cake has now become a staple cake for every occassion! Also the cakes come in practically every size - from the mini self serve to a huge flat sheet for 50. Don't miss this chance to indulge in great desserts!
author: Judy L.

description: Opera cake is amazing.  The cake prices are a steal considering the high quality.  Also, the decoration on the cakes is beautiful - not your typical frosting rosettes.  Just get someone else to drive so that they can wait in the car (illegally hovering in the bus stop outside of green apple books) while you run in.
author: Miriam W.

description:
i love everything. the mango. raspberry. chocolate. tiramisu. pretty much everything they had.

BUT, i was PISSED at their service when i came in this past sunday. it was 2 minutes before they close and i just came in randomly, thinking that they were still open. when i came in...i asked if they were open since i saw the girls cleaning up. the girl rudely says...yes you have 2 minutes.... errr okay. 

so as i was choosing which cakes i wanted, i asked if they had anymore mango cakes. "NO" says one of the girls cleaning up anxiously waiting to go home. mmm alright. geezus. i just paid & left. arghh. wtf.
author: Rosalynn D.

description:
I just don't know about Schubert's.
I know this place is like one of the best in SF, and I'm trying really hard to like it, but I just can't.
I feel like these guys specialize in what I call 'old-lady desserts'.  Everything is kind of bland and unimaginative.  All the cakes from this place that come through work (I work as a birthday party host at BADM in Sausalito) looks like there is a washed-out picture of it somewhere in the back of a1952 issue of Ladie's Home Journal.  It's always loaded with the things that would clutter an elderly woman's home: fruit, plastic flowers, and aesthetically-unappealing MOUNTAINS of chocolate shavings (OK, so maybe 2 out of 3 on that one).  Where's the color?  Where's the pizazz?  I'm not asking to whip up some Ace Of Cakes creation, but would it kill them to think outside the box every now and then?
Then again, playing it safe is probably what's kept them in business for so long.  The cake itself is passably good, but nothing truly special, at least to my palate.  I'm just not into Schubert's at all.
author: Jody A.

description: Cakes, Pastries, Tarts are all very good.  There are some cake variations I've tried that are not good, but I stay away from those.  Therefore, if you've had something you didn't like, try another and you may find it yum!  The ingredients are fresh and prices are reasonable.
author: LoveFood I.

description:
pretty delicious selection and quality of European cakes

this bakery has been here since the early 1900s and you can see why when you try their cakes. The three of us had the swedish princess cake, the mango mousse, and the tiramisu. All three of them were very fresh and not too sweet. The tiramisu was very rich in chocolate flavor and was very soft. It was the best tiramisu Ive ever eaten and I would recommend this one above the above three. The swedish princess cake is probably their best seller and was also very good. there was 4 layers of different flavors in between layers of cake with a green candy like frosting. The mango mousse was good and had a very strong mango flavor but I wasn't too impressed with it. I feel the other desserts were better. The cost of each dessert is around $3.50 but I doubt you will regret it if you try the swedish princess cake or tiramisu. I would definetly come back to try other desserts. I have my eye on the various cheesecakes.
author: Robert Y.

description: This place seriously has some of the best cakes. We almost always get cakes her for birthdays and holidays. Their Tiramisu is probably their best cake. We also get the princess cake, mango mouse, and their cheesecakes are also really good. They also have pretty good cookies as well. The only reason why I didn't give them 5 stars is because their staff is hit or miss. Sometimes they are great and sometimes they are real bitches. I guess it just depends on who you get to help you. This place is definitely a must try.
author: Diane M.

description: This place shoots past Dianda's to become my new preferred cake shop.  It's cheaper and has a cozier ambience, but most of all their selection of pastries and other non-cakes stands out...the coffee cakes especially are soooooo good.  I don't know about you, but I have lots more occasion to eat coffee cake than real cake.  I brought one to a picnic and it was a hit, but there was one problem--no coffee!  This cake is so perfect as coffee cake that it practically screams for coffee the second you put it in your mouth.  Oh well, guess I'll just have to come back for another one.  Try a slice with your latte one morning before work but be warned--it could be a tough habit to break.
author: Wes M.

description: I bought a Neopolitan cake (which consisted of layers of chocolate cake, vanilla cake, and raspberry mousse) from Schubert's for a coworker's birthday.  The cake was delicious and lighter than the ones I usually get from Citizen Cake or Tartine.  Also, the prices are quite reasonable: $36 got me a good quality cake that fed about 15 people.
author: Grace W.

description:
I came here for the first time when I was a sophmore in high school. It's been about 5 years, and I still haven't forgotten about this place! My friend and I even used to ditch class just to come here to get one of their little cakes =x. I've tried every flavor of their mousse cakes, and they're ALL equally good. 

But I have to say.. their cheesecake isn't all that great. I don't know what it is, but it has a weird fluffy texture and taste. It looks really pretty, but if you're coming here for the first time and don't know what to get, stay away from it.
author: Kari G.

description:
we love this place and visit whenever there's a special occasion and we're on point to bring dessert. our favorite is the mango mousse but the tiramisu is a very close second.  both were not too sweet and just beautiful -- they could easily be on the cover of a donna hay magazine. :) 

their service is prompt, courteous and organized. i like that we can place orders online or over the phone.  

brides to be -- they're very generous and patient when you go in for cake testing. we had a lovely time when we went in for ours and our guests loved our selection!
author: yvonne g.

description:
damn i hate it when ppl hella hype up a place and you have all sorts of fantasies and expectations in your mind only to come here and be all disappointed.  

first of all this place close up at 6 (or something ridiculous like that), so i mad rushed it here one night to try their oh so "delicious" desserts.  my friend swears of her life that their cheesecake here is the best she's ever had.  Laur you should be dead right now because it is not all of that.

i bought the chocolate, strawberry, and mango cheesecake slices to try which one was the best (about $3 a slice) and it was just REGULAR.  i didn't melt, i didnt have any dessert-esque orgasm... i had wayyy better at the cheesecake factory.  suffice to say, i wouldnt go back.  

not that service here was that great either.  i stood around for 10 mins before the lady even said she'll be with me soon.
author: Tina L.

description: I stumbled upon this bakery when I was trying to find a yule log cake during Christmas time.  My parent's favorite bakery closed down so we were back to square one when trying to find this cake that had become tradition in our household.  We took our chances and it was worth it!  So far I've had two cakes from there and they have been delicious.  The prices are not bad either, almost so cheap how could you ever eat a costco/grocery store cake ever again?  I think the next cake I try there will be there Opera cake.
author: Kirsten M.

description:
Chose this bakery over Tartine's after reading some of the reviews and was very disappointed and would not return because of the following reasons:

1. Staff are unable to speak English properly and behaviour may be cultural but comes across as rude and are very impatient to get to the next customer.
2. This is not a European bakery although the presentation looks similar - walks like a duck, talks like a duck but it isn't a duck!
3. Found a long hair in an item that was bought  - this could happen but it turns you off.

Tartine has its shortcomings, but for me their quality is more European and worth the wait and price if I am craving a particular pastry.
author: Katy B.

description: Had the most amazing birthday cake from Schubert's - some delicious white cake confection with raspberry filling and pink icing.  Not too sweet, nice and airy.  Yummm!
author: Sandra W.

description:
I don't like giving 5-star ratings, because I think they should be reserved for something truly extraordinary. Yet, I would feel bad if I underrated the tira misu that we had here. It was received with universal acclaim. Simply, we loved it.

If I come across a better cake bakery in the future, I'll return and reduce this rating accordingly.
author: J R.

description: If you wanna get sugar high, go to Schubert's. Fancy cakes but I feel are little bit overrated. I personally prefer those $10 cakes that you can get at any of the other asian bakeries on Clement.
author: Tommy B.

description: After all the raving reviews for this place I had to check it out.  I ordered the Strawberry Cheesecake for my GF's sister.  You can choose between a 6" or a 10".  The 10" will set you back about $30.  The writing for the message is done on white chocolate so you don't have to worry about it smearing all over the cake.  The cake itself was very rich as expected but was missing something I couldn't quite think of.  The chocolate shavings on the top was a good combo to the cake.
author: Danny P.

description:
I dont even like lemon, but I liked it in the lemon mousse cake. 

The sponge cake was soft and fluffy. The lemon flavor was tarty and balanced very well with the cake. The ladyfingers on the outside had a good texture as well.

Will definitely be back to try the other cakes!
author: Retired B.

description:
Their mousse cakes are SOOOOOOO good and the prices are very decent.  Yum!    
Too bad that it took so much effort for us to order the cake for the birthday we needed the cake for.  Online seems very efficient, but take care to order the cake a few days in advance!  (I think it's 48 hours?)  We needed the cake the next day so we couldn't order online.  We called Schubert's ALL DAY LONG before getting an answer.  I guess it was either super busy or nobody felt like picking up the phone.   When I picked up the cake, I also happened to drop it on my way out.  (It fell straight down) The cashier that rang it up for me helped me replace the flowers that cracked and the cake looked as good as new.  Hehe. Minus one star for the hassle of ordering and for the LACK OF PARKING.  (I had to double park and wait in line to pick up my cake!  So you can imagine how sad I was when the door hit the cake on my rush out!)
author: Cheryl L.

description:
as a native san franciscan, how it possible to have missed this place?  what the heck was i thinking?  there's was a bakery (who shall remain nameless) that i ranked as  my favorite..but since discovering schubert's..things have change.  SCHUBERT'S IS #1!!!  

the extensive array of choices make anyone keep their diet for just a one day.  my top choice is the tropical passion fruit mousse cake...YUMMY!!  one may think that the cake may be heavy but it's light as air.  if the tropical mousse if sold out...as it is many a times..go for the princess cake...another top choice.

this place is pretty popular..get their early as many of the cakes are sold out by the end of the day.
author: rosemarie l.

description: AMAZING!! from now on, it's gonna be Schubert all the way. Any bday is goin to be them. Shooo..i might even get one for my dog's bday. We got the white chocolate raspberry mousse and it was delicious. It was a bit foamy and lite on sugar which is the way i liked it. I ordered online and picked it up without problem. Gonna order another cake today :)
author: Ernie P.

description: My friend got me a cake from my birthday from here. It was deliicous<3 :) No lies. Strawberry mousse. Loved it. It was also cute :) Things were even. There wasn't really anything over-powering anything. The chocolate decorations on top were cute and also yummy.
author: Tiffany Y.

description: All I can say is OMG is this place great! What a super find on a recent visit to the Inner Richmond. The best danish outside of Europe ;-) This is a keeper and i will be telling everyone about it.
author: S K.

description: I have not encountered a cake or pastry from Schubert's that I didn't just love.  Not your traditional flour and butter cakes, these are lighter than air mousse cakes.  Heavenly.  Passion fruit, mango, strawberry - they're all good and uniquely decorated.  They bring a different flair to any party.  I recently tried their strawberry cheesecake.  Let's put it this way, it was very hard to have to share it with other people.  It's very light, and smooth, and the sweetness of the strawberry flavor is just enough to give you a delicious sugar rush.   The line out the door the day before a holiday will give you an indication that this place has some good stuff inside.  Best part is that you can now order your cakes online.
author: Denise M.

description: I picked up a great birthday cake last week.  Good service. Accurate decoration frosting. Clean place.  Watch out for crowds and parking.
author: David G.

description: Schubert's has the most beautiful and delicious cakes EVERRR.  My grandmother loves to pick up desserts from here every once in awhile.  The little fruit tarts are so cute and yummy.  A definite must try for everyone.  They are of the perfect size and the fruit is always so sweet.  The mini mousse cakes are also very rich in flavor for something so small in size!!  I'm not a real big cake fan but these are just the right size so that I won't get sick of it.  We also get the personalized larger cakes which are very nice to look at.  If you ever need to impress with a unique cake- try this!!  We often have the Chocolate Truffle Torte (because my dad LOVES chocolate) but sometimes it's TOO chocolaty for my taste.  I usually have to have a glass of milk even with a sliver of the cake, but if you are a chocolate cake, this is the one for you.  Another favorite is the Tiramisu Mousse, which looked so appealing to a waiter at the restaurant we brought it to, that he asked for a piece.  And he loved it, as do we :]  It's at a great location, so pick up some dessert and discover what Clement Street has to offer!
author: Nicole G.

description: Some friends brought me a mango mousse cake for a party. It was light and fluffy and not too rich. We all had a slice. When everyone left, cake inhalation took place. I don't know anything about this place but next time I am in SF, I am going to check it out.
author: Dru T.

description:
Between the months of November to January I have probably spent over $300 in your bakery, and you have never disappointed me! 

From the holiday celebrations, birthday celebrations and little treats for friends, your cakes and cookies are delicious. Among my favorites are the Swedish Princess and Pink Champagne Cake. The petit fours are yummy too, and perfect with tea or coffee. Recently bought the fruit tart for my husband's birthday, and it was so fresh tasting.  Worth every penny!
author: Camille B.

description: one of the highly rated bakeries in sf and definitely worth a try. they were known for the princess cake, but it wasn't rlly for my taste. the entire cake was covered in fondant, which made it overly sweet. i think the napoleon was rlly good because it's not overly sweet. their mousse cake is pretty good too.
author: Joyce B.

description:
The best! Try the Marzipan, the Napoleon and the other cakes. They take credit cards and provide fast service. Everything is fresh and tasty.

They even have day old cakes at a discount (I've never tried one). 


Parking is a nightmare so perhaps get someone else to drive you and pick you up. Otherwise plan to take 20-30 minutes to park. If you plan for this extra time then it won't piss you off so much.
author: L E.

description: Generally the bakery of choice for cakes when we have a birthday in the family.  We usually get one of the mousse cakes because none of us are into the creamy cakes.  Yesterday afternoon we decided to try the Swedish Princess as a congratulations cake for my little sis' new job.  How'd we pick it?  My nephew was insistent on getting a BLUE cake, but of course, there weren't any.  So he settled for green.
author: Kris L.

description:
I got two parking tickets on crappy Clement Street darting in and out of Schubert's for their delicious goodies over the years... and it was well worth it.

This place was our go-to bakery for so many years when we lived in the city.  Great people, reasonable prices, and the best cakes ever.  Mango Mousse was always a crowd pleaser but the Swedish Princess cake took it to another level.  

Schubert's also does great design work and is always eager to accomodate any special requests.
author: Tobias L.

description:
i don't see what's so great about this place.  their cheesecakes are okay; it's not bad, but not worth 35$.
their swedish princess cake was only okay too.  their little marzipan frosting was wayyyyyyyyyyyyyy too sweet.  the rest of that cake was exactly like something i would pick up from the safeway bakery -- but for only 10$,
overall, their stuff isn't bad, but it's not fantastically great that i'd spend so much for it.

edit:
i had their chocolate moose cake, and that was actually really good, but still almost $40 a cake.  this cake miiiiiiiiiiiight be worth the money though.
author: H. L.

description: i have never been disappointed with any of their cakes for my birthday or any special occasion! every year i get a double chocolate mousse cake for my birthday and its still as good as i remember it every year. its so delish! i also love their mango mouse, strawberry shortcake, strawberry mousse, opera cake etc...their all very very good!
author: Stella J.

description:
So many delicious cakes in various sizes right at the store.  All tasty and best decor of cakes.
We were very happy to find a nice small cake for my 2-year-old son's birthday - mango mousse cake.  They quickly wrote on a white chocolate to make it a special birthday cake.
Loved it!!
author: Miinno N.

description:
Great!  Wow, walking in is like going to a candy store.  I wanted to try every single cake!  I decided for the chocolate mousse cake with almonds, a fresh fruit tarte, the Swedish princess cake and the mango mousse cake. They were all fantastic!  Not too sweet, just very flavorful. Not that I ate them all by myself or anything... ;)

They have a huge selection. The cake decorations are awesome as well, each cake looks like a piece of art. This is definitely the place where I'm ordering the next birthday cake!
author: J R.

description: For as long as I can remember my family has been buying cakes from Schubert's.  Birthdays, anniversaries or for a Sunday...their cakes are perfect.  I even know two couples that purchased their wedding cake there!  Try their mixed fruit tart if you're not into cakes--it's divine!
author: Marie B.
