description: If the chocolate mousse and tiramisu that I tried are indications of how delicious the rest of their desserts are, then I'm sold. Schubert's, how I wish you would deliver to Southern California...then again, I would probably easily gain 20 lbs. if that were to happen.
author: Emily C.

description: My boyfriend got me two of their cakes for my 30th birthday and they're sooo yummy. The chocolate mousse with almond ($17) was a little too soft and moussy, which makes it difficult to cut. It's probably better to freeze it before cutting it to keep its appetizing shape. The swedish pricess cake was just delicious with it's marzipan icing and rasperry and kirsch filling - my favorite!
author: Joselita T.

description:
I love their mousse cakes - the quality of these cakes are consistently good!  Recommend you try the mango mousse cake.

We got our wedding cake from Schubert's as well.  These guys are pros - they met all our expectations (courteous service, good selection, on-time-delivery, and very reasonable prices).  We'd recommend them 10 times over!
author: T L.

description: Schuberts was my choice of bakery for my wedding cake.  I chose the opera cake with the floral design on the exterior. The bakery was able to customize the colors I wanted and the final product was PERFECT!!!  The tasting experience was so professional.  Staff was great to work with!! My guests loved the cake.   I highly recommend.
author: Tina K.

description: Simply the best!  Voted as best in the bay area too!  I love the mango mousse cake.  Well, I love all of them, even the fruit cake I had once.  I can sit there all day and just let time pass me by.  The staff are very helpful too, they seem to like what they do.   A nice treat to bring on long conferences as well esp. when you're ass is sitting down on a 2 hour long meeting and you have really nothing to say but stuff yourself a forkful of cake, then the treat is really for yourself...I swear when I'm diving into that slice, I cherish every bite, and lose myself in its delicate taste  and I have absolutely no clue what on earth everyone else around me is talking about....there goes the  meeting minutes...I wish that one day my performance and bonus will be based off how good I picked out a cake for those people - Schuberts -Yum
author: A D.

description: great bakery for cakes - my favorite in sf. they're not only wonderfully decorated but also tasty (and reasonably priced). everyone at the party loved the 8" mango mousse ($25.50) cake that i brought. the princess cake's also tasty - the marzipan wasn't too overpowering. the 8" raspberry rum cake was also fabulous and only $17 in the store (vs. $25 on the website).
author: Diana B.

description:
good pastries, there are probably other places that are a litttttle bit better, i don't think its completely authentic... but 

5 stars for discounted pastries if you go there towards the end of the day!!!!!!

good for them for pushing the left overs, selling day old pastries is a big fat no no.

decor-wise, not the cutest bakery, but it gets the job done. i prefer the cakery and copenhagen in burlingame, they have more charm.
author: Irene C.

description: I bought a whole fruit tart pie.  I ate the whole thing so it must have been good.  I haven't tried any of the cakes so I cant give it 5 stars.
author: Fatty A.

description: My work place is absolutely in love with Schubert's Napoleon whipped cream cake.  Layers of cake with strawberries.  Decorated with lady fingers on the outside.  A real crowd pleaser.  Their mousse cakes and Vienesse Fruit Torte are yummy as well!
author: Mick S.

description:
Dear Schuberts,

You never dissappiont me, i love your desserts and most of all your cakes. Your cakes are always light n' fluffy and just melt in my mouth. I've been coming to your bakery since i was a child and never has the quality or freshness gone downhill. For every birthday we order cakes from you. No other bakery in San francisco or anywhere in the US can compare to you. Forget Citizen cake, Madelline, Ambrosia, and Tart to Tart, they are nothing compare to you. Although i am always indecisive about which cake to order to take home or to just have a slice, my personal favorite is the Double Chocolate Mouse cake. I think i might be the only person that orders a glass of milk with my cake just like when i was little. I plee to order my wedding cake from you whenever i get engaged. 

If you are the owner/chef of this bakery and are reading my review, all i want to say is that my family and everyone i know do drive to sf just to have your cake. You put alot of smiles on everyone's faces. 

I LOVEEEEEE Schuberts.
author: Setareh s.

description: I can never get enough of this place. They have the best tasting cakes you'll ever try. The people working there are super nice and you never have to wait long to get helped. If you want something special though, you have to placer an order a day before, but if you're just looking for a last minute cake they have tons already made fresh and ready to sell. Be sure to try their Mousse Cakes! Yum...thinking about it makes me want to run out and get one.
author: Bella S.

description: I bought three cakes here for co-workers birthdays, and everyone just loved them. Two chocolate mousse, and one strawberry cheesecake. Both were great (and the presentation was wonderful- decorated beautifully and in a nice box) but everyone can't stop raving about the chocolate mousse. The prices are pretty reasonable as well.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Excellent cakes and cookies!!! Went there for my birthday cake.. ordered Swedish Princess cake... AWESOME!! I normally am not too crazy about cake, but this was AWESOME!!
author: Daisy S.

description: The cakes here are really good. My favorite would be  the Napoleon. The tiramisu is pretty good too. I didn't like their mocha cake very much. The design of the bakery is pretty and the service is good. I really like the decorations of their cakes. They are really beautiful. I buy most of my friends birthday cakes here. Overall a delicious!
author: Audrey M.

description: I love this bakery. I like that it's just a good, old fashioned bakery. You won't find cracked black pepper cupcakes or basil n fennel pound cake. Just normal, nontrendy cakes and desserts. It's pretty small inside, so get your sugar to go.
author: Melissa C.

description: This review will be short because there simply aren't words to describe the deliciousness that I associate this bakery with. What I do have to say is, they do what they know how to do and somehow, this appears to be every type of cake I've ever heard of (Princess to lemon-doubles, truffle cakes to eclairs! Everything!) A bit on the expensive side but NOT compared to the leaps and bounds quality-wise in which they are above their competitors!
author: Alex T.

description: Such cute, yummy cakes!  Oh I was enamored with this place when I walked in, the interior is a little out of place on Clement St. but it's definately a keeper!  I love walking in here, and just picking out cake after cake after cake.  The service is great, fast and I can be in and out within 10 minutes (including deliberation).  The best part is the periodic table of pastries on the wall across from the counter.
author: Asha H.

description: The cakes here are gorgeous!  The strawberry shortcake and tiramisu are both fair.  Service is quick and friendly --great, but I'm buying the cakes for $20+ per.  Schubert's is a good place to stop in for a quick taste or a special occassion.  If you need a place to get a light cake for a birthday that is pretty photogenic, then look and go no further.
author: Jennifer Y.

description: Being a San Francisco native, I was mortified to know that Schubert's had been around for while and the first time I tried their cakes was during my boss' birthday! If I would have known, I would have been a monthly regular getting my fix of the mango mousse or the double chocolate cake! They are so delicioso!!! Not only are the cakes to die for but the decorations are beautifully presented as well. It was a must for a birthday party.....I cannot wait for someone's irthday to come up. :)
author: La C.

description: Concurrence, it's so good and hidden. That's what makes it good. The cakes are exquisite. Deserts, good price, good tastes, good times!
author: Michael C.

description: After reading the reviews I had to try the Mango Mousse cake.  Though it may be a local favorite I thought it was just OK and nothing much to rave about. I thought it could've had a more flavorful mango taste, I served it with raspberry sorbet to give it more flavor.  I would rather drive down to the Southbay and get a Guava cake from Aki's, or a chocolate cake from Icing on the Cake, or even a plain white cake from Cosentino's.
author: Cindy B.

description: This is THE BAKERY! Seriously, if you want a real dessert, you got it. The chocolate truffle cake is delicious.. along with the Mango one is soooo good.. the prices are actually reasonable for the quality.. the service is good too.. It's been around for awhile and i think it is the best bakery I've been to.. I've had it for wedding cakes, birthdays, and even just for fun.. I've always been happy with the desserts and hopefully when I get married I'll have their cakes as my wedding cake!! If you want a really special cake for a birthday, wedding, anniversary.. Schubert's is the place!!
author: Rochelle F.

description: Absolutely great cakes!  I never have time to just stop by and have coffee and a dessert, but for pre-planned events, i think of this place first in the city.
author: Roy N.

description: Best Bakery in the Bay Area! I am a chocolate lover and Opera cake is my favorite. They are very easy to work with you and you will be very pleased with the decorations!
author: Laura N.

description: I love Schubert's. They're one of the last old time bakeries in SF. All their treats are fresh and tasty, but I have to give the five stars to the cherry tart, the hot cross buns (Easter time only), the coffee cake and the eclairs.   All the mousse cakes are delicious, perfect for a dinner party because they're light and not too sweet. Cheesecakes are wonderful too. The coffee is good as well, they always serve Viennese. If you need a delicious fancy cake, you'll find something here.
author: Sabrina L.

description: One of the best cheesecakes I've ever had and their cookies are well too!  Very clean and upbeat and the staff are very knowledgeable of their items.  Sadly its all calorie and carb packed so plan to work out hard before and after a visit!
author: R C.

description: I love, love, love their Swedish Princess Cake!!!!  It is to die for!!!  I buy one for my sister's birthday every year and it is absolutely amazing!  If you like marzipan then this is a must eat.
author: Amanda T.

description: Good stuff. I love this bakery because it's delicious without feeling overly heavy. The baked goods always taste incredibly fresh, have a lot of fruit in them, and the staff is knowledgeable and professional. The prices are great too. The mango mousse, strawberry shortcake, and chocolate mousse cakes are all great. Nice place to get a birthday cake.
author: Joyce G.

description: We ordered a cake from Schubert's this past weekend and I loved it! I had a wedding tasting here a while back and wasn't impressed with the things I tried, but the tiramisu we had on Saturday was very good. It wasn't too sweet and didn't have that strong taste of alcohol that some tiramisu cakes often times have.  Parking in this area can be tough so it may be helpful to have someone come with you to run inside and grab your order. They have a wide selection of flavors and the prices are reasonable!
author: Yelp O.

description: I give all their cakes with chocolate 4 stars, the Strawberry Mousse 2.5, their Swedish Princess (white cake, raspberry filling, white frosting, all covered in marzapan) a 2.5 and a minus 2 for not serving cappuccino... I suck at math.
author: yvette l.

description: the chocolate mousse cake is one of the best deserts i've ever tasted.  every single thing i've tasted from shubert's has been delicious.  it rocks
author: ari b.

description: I am just writing this review for their wedding cakes. I had a tasting about a year ago and I was not impressed. The wedding cake was very dry and to mask it they sprayed WAY too much syrup on it. They implyed that they didn't make any of their specialty cakes into wedding cakes. The cakes on the regular menu are very good, i just wouldn't go with their wedding cakes if you are pick about taste.
author: Ivy T.

description: Shubert makes the best mango mousse cake I have ever tried.  I have literally ate the entire "large size" cake by myself in one day.  My favorite cake ever!!
author: Eva E.

description: I've never ordered from Schubert's, only had their cakes at birthday parties, but based on those experiences, I can say that I love their cakes!  The mango mousse cake and Swedish princess cake are standouts.  Creamy, delicious, and beautifully presented.  I'm sure I will be ordering from there for birthdays in the future.
author: I-Chant C.

description: I don't have a big sweet tooth - but my lil cousin worked here years ago and I got hooked on their mango mousse cake and cookies.
author: Amina B.

description: My favorite bakery of all!!! I used to come every other week but it was a bit much....so, now I come only once a month. If there's isn't an occasion for cake, I get a personal one for MYSELF! They  are the only place that I know that has the Opera cake --hazelnut sponge with chocolate truffle and mocha-praline filling topped with toasted almonds ! MMMmmmMMMMm
author: Kim D.

description: Schubert's makes beautiful little cakes. The peach one has a happy face on it!! :) The cake part is a little bit dry, but the moist fruit part is really succulent. Try the tropical, mango, strawberry, or peach tarts. One day I will try the Swedish Princess !!
author: O K.

description: One of my all-time favorite places for cake in town. Especially when taking a stroll down Clement on a nice sunny afternoon, it's hard not to stop by for a quick piece of double chocolate mousse cake (or anything else)! Mmmm... Fifth star is only cuz the place is kinda small, not as great for sitting with cake and coffee as I'd like. But still great for take-out!
author: Nancy W.

description: I love this place, whenever I need to get a cake, this is the place that always hits my mind first. I remember getting this coffee or was it toffee cake for my mom for mother's day and she asked me where I had gotten this cake from and next time for any special occassion you need to come back here and get this exact same cake. I guess she loved it that much. I have to agree, it was really good... Really soft and moist, just like how cake supposed to taste unlike safeway cakes... all hard and dry... ew. Anyways the little petit cakes are really nice as well, small, but packs flavor! I love the strawberry shortcake from here. Oh, so, delightful! Next time I come here I want to try the cheesecake of the tiramisus... sounds so scrumptious!
author: Johnny T.

description: I was craving a fruit tart one day and my friend recommended this place.  Man... was she right.  This place is great.  I went into the store and there were so many goodies.  If I could, I would've bought every pastry they had.  They have cakes, pies, and tarts.  If you name it, they probably will have it.  I purchased a single size fruit tart and a tiramisu cake.  They were both DELICIOUS!!!  The appearance looked so YUMMY!  When you purchase your items, they package it up in boxes so it would not get damaged during transport.  They even have a small box for a single size tart.  Now that I know of this place, I would definitely visit them again when I need a dessert fix.  Good job you guys.  Keep up the good work!
author: Louisa L.

description: I'm a sucker for cute European bakeries. This place has row after row of enticing, gorgeous pastries and cakes. Not a place for the indecisive. I picked the fruit napoleon, original cheesecake, princess cake, and mango mousse to bring to a dinner party. All were delectable, but my favorite was the napoleon. Good, good stuff.
author: Jen S.

description: This is more like 4.5 stars really!  I have been going to this bakery for over 10 years and although I've had many different types of cakes from bakeries all over the city and elsewhere, Schuberts is truly one of the best.  Beautifully decorated and nothing but the best quality work from them. It's great to buy a cake for a special occassion or if you just want to sit down in the corner and enjoy a slice and a cup of coffee on your own, it's just as great!  It's a pretty busy place, so its not a quiet snack, but the taste is definately worth it! Not to mention their delicious cookies!
author: Grace K.

description: Their quality of cakes is great. But if you trying to order cake for a birthday, make sure you will bring the picture or will pick one from their catalog. Recently i was ordering a child birthday cake with some baloons on it  for a boy and received a flower chocolate cake with rings, o well it was to late to change at that moment. Cake tasted great and everybody liked chocolates on top, but it was not what i ordered.
author: Lana B.

description: Ordered a cake for my gf's birthday and it was great. I got a Chocolate Mousse Tiramisu and everyone at the dinner annihilated the cake. It was great. Would come back again
author: Jon K.

description: Strawberry Romanoff cake is absolutely delicious, and the cake itself looks absolutely decadent and stunning, like any good celebration cake should look.  But the cake is light, moist, and fluffy, and sweet without being overly so.  My only qualm about Schubert's is the location, and the near impossible parking.  I had to double park and turn the hazards on for 3 min. as I rushed in to pick-up a pre-ordered birthday cake.  Regardless, I give it 5 stars because the cake itself is worth any hassle.  I will continue to order cakes from Schubert's again, and again.
author: Gina L.

description: I voted this place the "BEST BAKERY IN TOWN" Frequent patronage of almost 7 years! and I send all my co-workers and friends here!  Everything is so delicious here from the cute little German cookies to the German chocolate cheesecake (must I add which is my favorite).  Caters to every taste bud if you need just a little sweet you can buy anything from one cookie, or a tart, to a full sheet.  The prices are affordable and such a great value unlike Tartine which is super expensive.  Great service, superb staff (attentive & efficient), good location, easy street parking (quick access).  They always have the cases STOCKED! unlike other bakeries that just run out of cakes.  Which is great when you need a cake the same day!  Whoever runs this bakery knows their stuff!  and exactly how many cakes to make.  They must bake 24/7.  Other great tastes: Black Forest Cake, Tarmisu, Fruit Tart Pie.
author: Corissa v.

description: We came in around 4-4:30pm and they did not have many selections left. After we came in a line started forming since the two girls were busy helping two separate customers with their cake ordering needs. Having heard the mango mousse/mango cheesecake was good on yelp that was what i was hoping to order but i did not see either. I decided on the tropical mousse and my friend got the lemon mousse. She was hoping for a tiramisu but that was not available. It was not after we sat down at a table did I notice that they had their cheesecakes on the opposite side from which we stood and ordered so I did not see them. The tropical mousse did taste like mango and it did taste better than the lemon which was sour. I myself did not enjoy my tropical mousse too much. I thought it was ok. Perhaps I'm just not a mousse person? I do like how they decorate their cakes though. For $3.45 per slice it's not bad of a price. I would like to come back to try a different cake.
author: Helen L.

description: I love this bakery! Their cakes are always tasty and at a good price. When I planned my wedding the bakery recommended by the hotel was over $1500 for the cake. Schuberts made the exact design with the exact flavors with deiivery to the south bay for $600! They are very very good!
author: A. S.

description:
My abosolute favorite place for decadent, amazing cakes. An all-time favorite local, neighborhood bakery. Great for treating yourself to a pastry. I always purchase birthday cakes for my friend's birthdays here. Unless they prefer the light, "Chinese" style cake.

Schubert's really knows how to make those special cakes. check out the website for ideas on the various varieties and specialty cakes they make.

My favorites are the princess cake and the tiramisu! yum.

The staff is very friendly except for when it's busy, but it's always worth the wait.
author: nightlife i.

description: Check your ordered cake before leaving the store!  They screwed up and gave my Italian Rum sheet cake to someone else, sticking me with a so-so Mango Mousse Cake with someone else's name on it!  I'll stick to DIanda's in the Mission for future parties.
author: GRACE M.

description: My fave cake housee!! :D Such a hidden gem in Clement St, since it's surrounded by Oh-so-Asian environment. I like the Tiramisu the best and also Swedish Princess cake. All the cakes are so pretty, tasty and so reasonably priced. Loving it.
author: Marlis T.

description: I think this is the best bakery in the city. Great deserts, cakes and pastries. I would highly recommend Black Forest cake. I also really like Napoleon.
author: Sophie N.

description:
i LOVE sweets and i like this place BUT only one thing i wana tell the owner of the place that ****


"please sell the each kind of cake by  SLICE ! !! !!! !!! !!!!!!! "



when they having few kind of cakes i only have few choice  cuz they r   lazy to silde cake ...poor! ! !

whole cake were left......l0l
author: R R.

description: Yule log, oh yes!!! I can say that I have had 2 this holiday season and I am in it to win it!  Thank you Schuberts for giving me an extra 3 hrs at the gym, but cake well worth it!!!
author: Nicole F.

description: The cakes here are beautiful and delicious.  I have had the mango cake for a friends birthday and I got the Swedish Princess for my roommate's big 3-0 since anyone who knows her knows that she is definitely THE Swedish Princess:)  Both were fantastic.  The prices are not low, but the cakes are good.
author: Kate B.

description: Whenever there is a birthday or any other occasion that calls for a cake, I always go here. They have a nice selection of mousse cakes [currant, raspberry, mango, lemon, etc] as well as rich, chocolatey cakes. I personally love the princess cake because of the marzipan "skin". The strawberry cheesecake is deeeelish too.
author: kristin e.

description: It's all about the Tiramisu!  I had the gigantic cake, 12 inch by 15 inch, for my bday and it was so gorgeous and so delicious!  It was like a work of art with tons of chocolate pieces.  Gawk at the website, it's amazing.
author: Debbie Y.

description: We got our wedding cake here.  The staff was helpful, they let us try more than the 'standard' number of samples after we couldn't make up our mind.  Also we changed the size of the cake as the date got close and didn't have and issues with that... and most importantly on our wedding day, the cake looked great and tasted great as well!  The only issues I would have visiting Schubert's again is parking can be a pain and not much room inside the store either.  But once you stuff your face with a sweet baked treat, you'll soon forget about those little problems..
author: Alan M.

description: Came in today to pick up the double-filled chocolate cake (hazelnut and chocolate truffle) with ganache icing and toasted almonds that I ordered for my brother's birthday. I made sure to eat very little dinner to make room for dessert. When I finally had a slice of this cake, I discovered what all the rave was about. The cake was light and spongy, the fillings were of just the right consistency and flavor, and overall presentation was very well done. Bravo, Schubert's and thank you, fellow Yelpers, for showing me the way to great cakes.
author: April B.

description:
mmm!  i never been to schubert's before, nor eaten their stuff, only heard about how ass-kicking delicious it was... 

so my coworkers gave me this leftover cake dessert thing last nite... triple layer, chocolate-coffee-chocolate, with white shavings and chocolate shavings... watever.  i took it home, put it in the fridge, and ate it this morning... 

HEY, it aint fresh, but this is some pretty dam good shiet!  8D
author: Ethan L.

description: I have had yummy treats since I was a wee little girl.  I think it has changed owners since my days of Princess Leah hair, but I still enjoy going in there to buy a yummy treat on my "bad" days. They have great cakes which you may think are on the pricey side, but they are worth every penny. The ingredients are so fresh and the presentation is gorgeous. A birthday cake from here is sure to impress.
author: Amelia M.

description: I really like this bakery.  They have a huge variety and you can order online from their website.  I got my last bday cake here - princess cake and it was great!  I've also tried their mango mousse and strawberry mousse cake and they were yummy!  The prices are cheaper than other fancier bakeries so I think Schubert's is a pretty good value.  Unfortunately, it's located all the way across town from me so I won't ever just pop in, but I would definitely order from them again for special occasions.
author: Karen K.

description: The cakes here are AMAZING. You know it's good when theres always a long ass line just to get a cake. This is the king of guilty pleasures of eating cake and other sweets!
author: Terry S.

description: Schubert's did the cake for my wedding and it was sooooooooo delicious! Plus it was about $900 cheaper than the other places I looked at. I had a three layer cake with different flavors in each layer. They are great to work with and they let me design my own cake stealing different patterns from different cakes in their look book. The cake ended up looking great! Everyone raved about the cake at my wedding. The only thing is their cakes are covered in fondant which is not that tasty but who cares, you can just not eat that part.
author: Cathy T.

description: Their "princess cake" is my favorite cake!  Extremely good tasting.  I would definitely buy my next cake from them, and it will be another "princess cake"!
author: Q N.

description: I've tried schubert's three times, and everytime, I seem to end up disappointed. Maybe I'm so used to rich desserts, but schubert's can be bland and a little dry. The cake decor is all I can give a thumbs up for.
author: Christine A.

description: i'm a hardcore dessert and cake fan and trust me, this place is goooood. if you are in need of a good place for cakes, this will be your stop cuz there's no need to look any further, unless of course if you are willing to spend a lot more at some fancy bakery like Miette or something (btw, Meitte has the BEST princess cake *drool*).
author: meL Z.

description: i've been coming to schuberts for a long time and i know i'll be going back for a while. we started out solely eating their various mousse cakes. blackcurrant, passion fruit, strawberry, mango, raspberry etc etc. think light mouse layer on light sponge cake that tastes exactly like the flavor you chose.  then we started getting their tiramisus which are not the traditional tiramisu - it's a chocolate/coffee cake combo.  then my mom really got into their custard croissants. for the price, really the best stuff on earth as there is a ton of custard in the croissant. and now, my favority is probably the princess cake. right thickness of marzipan layer on top of yummy light cake with cream and raspberry. probably the best one i've had in the city so far...
author: Eleanor C.

description: Love the variety of cakes and pastries that Schubert's offers given their size.  The atmosphere is nice and they have a killer strawberry cheesecake.
author: Alan T.

description: I hope no one ever tells Schubert that he could charge double for each and every thing in this shop. Always a delicate blend of flavors and textures, always too scrumptious to share.
author: Christina S.

description: I like coming here for sweets whenever I'm in the Clement area.  Though I have to say, the only desserts I've gotten the two times I've been here is there Currant Cheesecake. I absolutely love it!  (The taste, the texture, it's not entirely sweet)  It was about $3.00 for a small slice.  I have yet to try the other items but I love the currant cheesecake so much!
author: Jboogie L.

description: Schubert's has its time and place. It's great if you need a quick fix, and the individual cakes are quite convenient and just the right size. I like the napoleon. The marzipan laden cakes I could do without.
author: Faye P.

description: One of my favorite bakeries in the city, period. Schubert's makes amazingly delicious cakes, pies, and pasteries. This is a very unexpected place surrounded by neighbooring shops selling groceries and all kinds of trinkets for cheap in the heart of the Richmond District. I love getting birthday cakes here or just a great pie to bring home to eat. The princess cake is one of my favorites, not that I consider myself a princess or anything.. but the marzipan coating and sweet delectable interior just flushes my emotions with pure joy and happiness. I could go on and on about the cakes but all I can say is to try it for yourself. That is, afterall what this site promotes, right? My fellow yelpers seem to agree with me. Schubert's is a win-win situation and they definitely won't let you down.
author: Jen Y.

description: Schubert's bakery makes the best mousse cakes.  I ordered my wedding cake from them.  I designed my cake based on pictures on their website.  My husband picked out the flavors for the cake we chose two layers to be yellow cake with guava and vanilla custard, and the other layer was chocolate with raspberry.  The cake came out looking amazing.  Our guests were complimenting us on how good the cake tasted and beautiful it looked.  I had 140 guests and order a cake enough to feed 150.  We ran out of cake because guests were asking for seconds.  I loved how the cake turned out.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Cross Wedding Cake off your vendor list cause Shubert's is it! First, set up an appointment to taste some cake and get the ball rolling. They have a book of cakes to help you decide the overall look and size of your cake. The pricing is way better than any other vendor I found, many of whom were $9 per slice, about twice what I found at Shubert's. The cake is so moist and delicious. I tried the strawberry and rasberry fillings and both were extremely good. The staff was very helpful and made picking out a cake fun and easy. I would highly recommend Shubert's to do your wedding cake, they are pros! This place is a baked desserts mecca and dont be suprised if its packed when you come and full of folks loudly making MMMMMMMMM sounds! Enjoy.
author: Michael G.

description: Another vote for the swedish princess cake.  Delicious.  I wasn't a fan of the mango mousse or their cheesecake (it was a little light and I like my cheesecake dense and rich).  A great place to take-out a few slices for dessert (not much room for sitting in).  I would purchase a birthday cake here next time I needed one.
author: Kari L.

description:
UPDATE 5/22/08:  
OMFG  THE TIRAMISU CAKE!!!!!!   got to pick my b-day cake again -- yippeee (have been celebrating for a month, so i had a couple of b-day cakes already, pretty good b-day cake year for me)  tried the individual serving a couple of months ago.....BUT ITS ALL ABOUT  the 8" tiramisu cake i got........from the presentation of choc. shavings on top, little rectangular dark & white chocolate plaques surrounding the outside of the cake & tied w/ a red ribbon......everyone ooo-ed & ahhhh-ed when the cake was revealed........serious cake papparazzi -- 3 cameras taking pictures, several angles at the same time........to that 1st bite -- sooooo INCREDIBLY MOIST, SINFULLY CREAMY, but there's a lightness/fluffiness to it @ the same time, taste the coffee liquer more than the individual serving i had..............    also got 2 slices, 1 opera cake & 1 italian rum cake.........both good, but not as memorable as that tiramisu cake.......will go back & try another slice of italian rum cake since i dropped 1/2 of the slice on the floor..........

______________________________________________________

WOW!!!!!!  passed this place a ga-jillion times.....raised in sf & only recently discovered this in feb. 2008!!!!!   finally came after reading all the yelp reviews, while looking for b-day cake for my mom......

HIGHLY RECOMMEND for b-days, mom's day, wedding, or any occassion, excuse or if you're like me .....just because or don't need a reason..........

tried their 3 most yelped about cakes in individual servings, which happens to be schubert's top cakes:  mango mousse, tiramisu mousse & the princess.....
ALL of the cakes were SOOOOO moist & SOOOOOO fluffy........

mango moussse......OMG!!!!  divine.....nice mango flavor sweet w/ hint of tartness, (did it have lil bits of mango?  this review is long overdue, trying to remember from memory since feb.), mousse was SOOOOO light, airy & fluffy, perfectly balanced with the moistness of the cake.....this was the winner choice for my mom's b-day cake!!!!  & it was an absolute hit!!!!  

side story:  came about 2 hours late to my mom's b-day party  (was frying chicken wings FOREVER, haven't made & fried this pupu chicken wings for about 4 years, so thought it would take 2 hours, WRONG took me 5 hours....and i only brought 1/2 of what i prepared)...  i was the one with the cake, i was the one everyone was waiting for, so when  i came everyone cheered & clapped.....
 
back to mango mousse cake......when i revealed the 1/4 sheet of cake, everyone ooooo-ed & aaahhh-ed......from the presentation of the cake EXQUISITE, BEAUTIFUL...... perfect touches beautiful white & dark chocolate flowers, happy b-day greeting on chocolate plaque, lady fingers lined the edges, tied with a ribbon. EVERYONE raved about the presentation & the taste!!!!!  (good job schuberts & me, the cake was soooooo good, i think everyone forgot how late i was)

tiramisu.......one of THE BEST tiramisu i've had after ristorante milano, mousse was again fluffy, airy, light, flavorful & nice hint of coffee liquer.....perfectly balanced with the cake.....

princess cake.......not an expert on princess cake, think i've only had 4 in my lifetime spread out over 4 years.......from what i can remember it was really good, a bit too sweet, the sweetest  & #3 of the 3 cakes i got that day....but don't get me wrong, i still enjoyed it &  it was still really good!!!!

sounds good right now, really need to go back soon............
author: Cindi N.

description: I must have passed by Schuberts several times but have never once gone it though Mary constantly raves about the cakes here. The first time I tried their cakes was at a birthday party and the chocolate cheesecake was excellent and generously sprinkled with loads of chocolate flakes. I am never a big cake fan but i couldnt pass up the chocolate. Today, at the cafe I tried the Swedish Princess highly recommended by Daisy and it was rather nice and light and I loved how the wafer at the bottom of the cake added another dimension to it. I loved the light green marzipan on top, the chewy texture was rather nice. However, I was dissapointed that the cafe did not serve any iced beverages of any sort....and I wanted the cake to go with an iced cafe latte. I'll be back to sample other cakes but I'll probably share it with someone next time.
author: Topazskye L.

description: Although normally really crowded, I happened to pop in on a slow day.  The workers are extremely friendly and willing to answer any of your questions.  Was in and out in five minutes and the cake looked great!
author: Tammy L.

description: Incredible. First of all, the atmosphere is amazing, the people are incredibly nice and helpful, and the pastries...mmm...They are perfect for any occasion.  You can buy your fancy party/occasion cake there, or you can just simply enjoy a few breakfast pastries, depending on what you are in the mood for.  My personal favorite is their shortbread cookies though.  They are the freshest, softest, and richest shortbread cookies I have ever had. So if you are into that type of stuff, I highly recommend going there.
author: Daria M.

description: Dessert heaven!!! Schubert's is my favorite bakery, hands down. The cakes are beautiful and irresistably delicious, not to mention the prices are very reasonable. The swedish princess (love love love!), neopolitan and assortment of cheesecakes are amazing. If this place was located in San Jose I'd probably develop cavities and diabetes.
author: Angie L.

description: The only one I would pick is mango mousse cake.  However, usually the cake part at the bottom is dry (or maybe not fresh).  For a cake charging that kind of price, I would expect a little higher in quality.  There are so many other bakery shops on Clement Street.  Though the look of Schubert's cakes beat the other, the taste and the price may not.
author: Roserrele W.

description: I have been going to this place for over 10 years and if they keep up the quality I would be their lifetimes customer. I order cakes from this bakery for pretty much every occasion and to satisfy my sweet tooth. They make great cakes and pastries. The cakes are so fresh and light that it literally melts in your mouth.
author: The Critic A.

description: Oooooh the strawberry and mousse cakes really are amazing...so light and just sweet enough!
author: Bridget W.

description:
wow, this place is seriously amazing.

you can place orders online but you will have to do an in person pick-up

+ Swedish Princess
+ Assorted Cookie Packages
+ Tiramisu Mousse

if you are in for a road trip with the cake(s) for an hour or more, let them know before hand so that they can freeze the cake in prepration for the trek.

Good luck with the parking on this street - the parkiing powers that be do not seem to favor this area.
author: Anita J.

description: Pick up the Swedish Princess Cake for your princess.  Marzipan, white cake, strawberries.  Yum!
author: K W.

description: tiramisu...HMMMMMMMMMM that's all i have to mention. Love this cute bakery, the bomb in cakes, absolutely good quality for the money.
author: Ateh M.

description:
It was my friend's birthday and we decided that we'd get him some cake from Schubert's. We decided on the tiramisu mousse 'cause some people don't really like chocolate cake (it's bizarre!). 

Anyhow, I had to wake up super early to pick it up since I was going to see him later in the morning, so I really appreciated the fact that they open at 7. The box was pretty hefty and the design was absolutely beautiful. I didn't have my camera on me so once I gave him the box, he started picking at it. *sigh* By the time other people came to see the cake, it was already missing some vital pieces of chocolate. 

Everyone loved the cake. It was light and tasty and even my friend, who's no fan of tiramisu, ate some. Next time I think I'm going to go for the Swedish Princess. 

The only con is that I have to drive twenty some minutes to get to the place, but believe me, it's worth it.
author: Connie J.

description:
and Schubert's comes through again!  This place saved me when I needed to bring something to our work potluck for the 4th, and a fruit torte it was.  Very good, and reasonably priced!  Today, I got the princess cake to share with another group, and thankfully, it was a huge hit!  I was hesitant at first to purchase it, thinking it would be too sweet or heavy, but it looked and tasted wonderful.  I'm not much of cake person, so I was there for 20 minutes trying to decide what to purchase.  The lady at the counter was so patient with me...they must encounter that numerous times daily, but everything looks so tempting, it's difficult to choose.  

Best chocolate croissant I've had, ever.  And cheap.  I usually pay more for dry croissants.  

Next on the list, I'm going to try a mousse cake.  Or maybe I'll bring that to the next work potluck.  

You would never expect this bakery to be in the middle of all the Asian places on Clement.
author: Christine H.

description: This is a great Euro style cake/sweets bakery. If you want the run of the mill overly sweet American style cakes, don't come here. I don't even like cake and I like this place a lot. I'm so getting my wedding cakes here! Their cakes are amazing looking and tasting!
author: Samantha H.

description: Wow!  We've ordered cakes from Schubert's bakery a few times in the past year for birthday parties.   I'm not a big fan of cake - typically it's dry or too sweet with waxy frosting - but this cake was incredibly delicious.  Their cakes are enormous, too big, really.  We put a large piece in the freezer, but it lasted only a few days!
author: Zen M.

description: So far I had tried mango mousse, white chocolate and rasberry mousse, tiramisu, and princess cake. It is the best mango mousse I have ever tried. Others are really good too. One thing about the cakes, they are light and not too sweet, the way i love it. My friend warned me that chocolate mousse is way too sweet, so I skip that.I will try their fruit tart maybe when I am no longer on my diet. Oooh.. I am so happy that I still have an individual serving mango mousse in my fridge :D (FORGET MY DIET!)
author: Etika T.

description: Wow... We used to come here for birthday cakes and have always been satisfied with the service and the product. Today was a huge disappointment. We walked in for a cake tasting on time. There was a huge crowd of people around the case, all waiting to take something or other out. We were told to take a seat at an empty table and someone will be with us. Not a big deal. We sat down and waited. Ten minutes passed, and we were offered coffee. That was really nice of them - we accepted and the coffee came with the wedding cake book. We were told to look through and get some ideas for cake decorations. Everything in their book was covered with fondant. We are not fondant people, and we thought to ask about buttercream instead. Ten more minutes pass and nothing. Another ten, and someone else came by asking if we knew which flavors we wanted to try. Uh, noooo because we don't know what flavors you're offering. We finally got a menu. We picked our three flavors and waited. And waited. And waited some more. They were accommodating and gave us a little bit of fondant to sample - not being big fondant people, we wanted to make sure we didn't mind covering an entire wedding cake in the foul stuff. They use one that is marshmallow-like in flavor and satiny smooth in texture. But man, oh man, did the cake samples suck. The chocolate with vanilla cream filling didn't taste like either chocolate or vanilla. It was wet, not moist. The yellow cake was dry as sawdust and could have used some of the moisture form the flavorless chocolate cake. The strawberry filling tasted like strawberry jam out of a jar. I would not have been surprised to find a huge jar of Smucker's in the back. And the Swedish princess sample was just not that good. Overall, the experience was blah. Turns out the fondant was the best part of the whole appointment, which really is a shame. The extra star is for their ready-made cakes. I would not hesitate to grab a chocolate mousse cake next time I'm in the area and headed to a birthday party or a get-together at a friend's home.
author: Vania M.

description: One of the best neighborhood bakeries in the Inner Richmond. Reasonable prices (think opposite of Citizen Cake) and a great value overall. Try the double chocolate mousse cake or the tiramisu. Wedding cakes are popular here too.
author: Tami Y.

description: I wish that I could talk to you about the wonderful selection of baked-goods at Schuberts.  I mean, everything in the glass cases looked good.  But really, I've only ever had their princess cake, and I don't even like princess cake (but yes, I am Daddy's Little Princess), but I don't think I'll ever try anything else from Schubert's becuase the Princess Cake is so delicious.  I ate a left-over piece, 3 days old, and it was STILL GOOD.
author: Jackie D.

description: This place has the best fruit tarts, and i can't get my hands off them. I wished they made in the 18" without ordering a few days before. Anyways they have many other light cakes too. I really don't like the very sweet ones so no comments on those. The sarvice is sometimes good, depending on whose helping you.  I don't know is it the asian girl thing or what but it just go as well. But other than that, every things good!!!
author: GaLei J.

description:
Did Schubert's sell or something?  This looked like every other generic Asian bakery with prefab layered mousse cakes, and strawberry whipped layer cakes, to me.   

I went looking for the much discussed Princess Cake, but there was none be had.   Was it listed on their menu board? I sure didn't see it. Maybe it's a special order kind of thing?  I'll stick to Victoria Bakery.
author: BJS ..

description: For my 17th birthday, I had to work on a Saturday and my co-workers really nicely bought me a cake and it was from Schubert's. I had the mango mouse cake, it was really good, not too sweet, and not too plain. ^^" It had a good amount of mango taste to it. Loved it.
author: Milenna L.

description: They have a huge selection of cakes in all sort of sizes and flavors. I was able to roll in and get one last-minute, without any pre-ordering, and they even added a custom message right then and there. They wrote it on slabs of white chocolate instead of right on the cake, so I imagine they could add a message to even a tiny cake. The cakes are beautifully decorated, with chocolate flowers, sugar-coated berries, etc., so I highly recommend this place if you need a good-looking, tasty cake quick. The place was busy but they had a bunch of people working there, so I was in and out in no time. The opera cake (chocolate, nuts, etc.) was $38 for 20 people.
author: Victoria G.

description: Hmm... I think I've tried one of everything that they make over the years that I've been going back to this place. They carry cakes, cookies, tarts breads...hmmm I think thats it. Well, anyway, anything they make is good, I am not a fan of tarts, so to me they don't taste that good, however my friend swears by them. I am a fan of their princess cakes, they are great, even though I think that the top coating can be a little sweet and sometimes it coats a little too much.
author: R Y.

description: This is my favorite bakery in the city.  The Viennese style cakes are perfection and I like the informal atmosphere.  The service is always very good with no attitude at all.  Don't forget the apple strudel!
author: Thelma Lee G.

description: Their Napolean cake is AMAZING! I had it at a friends birthday then ordered it for my daughters birthday and it was a huge hit. We got a half sheet and everyone wanted to take an extra piece home. It's my dad's birthday and I wanted to order one for pickup today but all the bakers are gone for the day. I need to find another bakery that will make the same cake fast, please someone help. I must have this cake!
author: Ravenous T.

description: Love the bakery!  Chanced upon it a few months ago.  Tried out a few of their pastries - mm, mm, mm.  Have had their cakes at a few birthday parties.  Beautiful - and delicious - works of art.
author: Nick K.

description:
I had a delicious slice of the chocolate cheese cake - thin base of chocolate cake, rich cheesecake (like new york style as in not ricotta, but not quite new york style), topped with milk chocolate shavings. Pretty decadent and yum snack!

The service was quick and friendly as well!
author: Nors P.

description:
First time I got introduced to the taste of Schubert's fruit pie in Christmas last year by my aunt.
It was good but I did not think anything special (yet) at the time.
Well, I am not a cake lover. I mean, I do eat cake on special occasion (birthday, holiday...) just not on a regular basis.
Then, one time after eating at Spices, we strolled our way to Schubert's and managed to buy a slice of Raspberry Truffle cake.
It was delicious and I started to notice that this cake was much better than Sheng Kee's where I usually got most of my cake order from.
The price is about the same like Sheng Kee's. 
I like the fact that the price does not put a hole in my wallet.
Today, I dropped in and bought Swedish Princess cake for $15.
Actually I was going to put the order for Pink Champagne cake online yesterday  (which you can do that at http://www.schuberts-bakery.com but you have to order 2 days before the d-day) and I needed that by today so I had to drop in today.
They did not have the Pink Champagne since it was under Special Cake category (so that means they will not have it if you do not order).
Most of the cakes were the mousse types, a few were the whipped cream types.
They were all pretty and it was hard to decide which one I should get.
I finally decided to get the Swedish Princess cake, the smaller one (since they did not have the bigger one) for $15.
Not bad.
Finding parking in this area can be a problem.
Just keep your eye on those pedestrians walking to their cars to see if they are going to leave.
This place accepts credit card: Visa, Master, and Discover.
I do not believe they accept Amex.
author: Oribel ..

description:
They made, hands down, the best ever wedding cake for us! I am very serious about cake, especially the quality of the cream, and would gladly admit if somebody had a better cake. However, of all the cakes I had at weddings (none of which were from Schubert's), ours really was superior thanks to Schubert's. It was light, fluffy, not too sweet, not too heavy, and best of all, they didn't go crazy with the butter cream filling. We actually ate the top part, which is supposed to be frozen until the 1 year anniversary, the very next after the wedding. Is that bad luck? You can't be called unlucky with a mouthful of delicious mango mousse cream!
 Their prices were fair considering the quality. They made us a cake shaped like stacked luggage. Our guests were amazed at the presentation, as were we. They also delivered right when they promised they would. I only found out later that in the process, they smashed our cake topper. But, oh well! That's apparently considered good luck. Go figure. 
 I don't live in SF, so I've only been here 2 times. However, I am greatly looking forward to my next visit.
author: Katerina F.

description: So, the cakes are very pretty and the service is good too.  They are very good about writing whatever you want on the cake, free of charge.  But as far as taste is concerned - I've had better!  I mean maybe I've been spoiled with European cakes but these just taste a little bit too plain for me.
author: Riri S.

description: Schuberts. Great cakes. Great cookies. You can order your cake online at their website. I mean. How great is that? I've never done it, cause...you know, technology is the devil. No, I'm just paranoid so I call in my orders. Nearly anything you get here is going to be good. You come in to look at cake and you just stare dazzled at the selections of cake through the glass. The problem is deciding which cake you want.
author: Tiff L.

description: Obviously, I'm just one of many many fans of this establishment.  I do have something to add, however.  This place is all about customer service.  Last night, I was picking up a swedish princess cake for a bday party.  The thing is....I was late!!  Late, as in they close at 6pm and I was still stuck on the bay bridge at 6:10 late.  I called, told them how I had been stuck for too long in traffic and that I'd be late.  They let me pick it up at 6:30!  The cake was just too tasty and I will be back for more.  My guy friend loved his princess cake.
author: Cat R.

description: i love this place...i make excuses to come here every chance i get! parking is kinda hard but well worth it. I drove out here from Oakland during rush hour to get my birthday cake for my party here. i had 2 one was a chocolate raspberry mouse and the other one was a chocolate mouse with fresh strawberries....heaven..
author: LaLa n.

description: I love Schubert's. If I went there everyday, I wouldn't be able to fit in my jeans anymore. We usually get the mango cheesecake or mixed berry tart for special occasions. But, I go there just to eat their madelines and cookies when I'm strolling by. My mom loves the apple strip and coffee twist. It's not too sweet which is a sure sign of good pastries.
author: Erica U.

description: my review is purely for the princess cake, the one wrapped in green marzipan. it's gooooooooooooooooooooooooooood.  i'm not a huge fan of the marzipan layer on the outside generally, but theirs is just about right so that if you eat a bit w/the cake, it's a pretty good balance.  i love my cakes to be moist, not that dry stuff like from safeway and whatnot. the cake is as moist as any chinese bakery shop (good stuff!) and the filling inside is nice and yummy too. my mom's brought home several of these and each time, i'll have to admit that i'm the one who cuts huge slices in the middle of the night and finishes the cake before the rest of the family can even have more than one or two slices. mine, all mine....
author: ML N.

description: I love this place! And sounds like so does everyone else who has been here.  I'm just sad that they close early so it's almost impossible for me to drive across town after work and pickup some after dinner dessert on a daily basis.
author: Brian H.

description: It is such a random place on Clement, oh what a surprise. They have the most beautiful and Delicious goodies around!
author: Andrea R.

description: I ordered my wedding cake from Schuberts and they did a great job, both price wise and taste wise.  They are not the very high end kind of bakery - where you get charged $8-15+ per person, but they are very reasonable with delicious cakes.  I was just a little disappointed that they didn't use real fruit in their cakes, but just fillings, but they turned out great anyways.  While planning the wedding, we had to think about the overall budget - what to spurge on and what we could save on.  We went overboard with things like our reception site and open bar, so in balance, I saved on my dress, invitations and cake.  In the end, it was totally worth it and the cake was still awesome.
author: Emily W.

description: I have to give them all 5 because of my soft spot for a perfect whipped cream frosted strawberry short cake, cake. I bought this and a pie for Thanksgiving and was so full when we got to the cake following dinner I was worried my family was too stuffed and we would end up skipping desert...well that was SO far from the truth when i started slicing this bad ass cake up... it was devoured so fast I was smart to have served myself first! Hands down delicious with soft perfectly sweetened whipped cream, layers upon layers of fresh strawberries and that cake! light and just a bit sweet to compliment but not over power the strawberries and cream. My new FAVORITE bakery!
author: Luke P.

description: Shubert's is wonderful! I needed a cake at the last minute for my dad's surprise 60th birthday party. I had serious work stuff come up which prevented me from baking a cake myself --something I love to do for my loved ones' special occasions. So, having run out of time to do it myself, but knowing a Safeway sheet cake was not the answer, I called Shubert's.  The woman I spoke to couldn't have been sweeter or more helpful, and within three hours, they'd baked me a beautiful cake, and decorated it beyond anything I could have done myself. I was nervous because I had really wanted the cake to be hand-made and special, and I had never seen or tasted cake from Shubert's so I really didn't know what to expect but it was gorgeous and the guests at the party all raved about it. Definitely worth a try. I'll be going back.
author: L W.

description: I HEART the Swedish princess cake!!! My BF got it for my birthday party last year, and all everyone who had a piece cleaned their plates, some snagged a second serving. Even my skinny bitch friends got off their diets. Yes, it's THAT good. Luckily we got the giant sized cake so we'd have leftovers, which sadly only lasted like two days. I know what you're thinking, what a fatty! I'm not, I swear! But, what can I say, I've got a sweet tooth.
author: Lisa B.

description: I came here last year and got a mango moose cake for a friend's birthday and everyone loved it. The cake was very moist and the moose was amazing, can totally taste the mango flavor and the sweetness is just right. I'll probably come here from now on for cakes. The only bad thing is that parking can be a hassle since its right on clement.
author: Mazie H.

description:
by far the most excellent cakes i have ever tasted! [even if one was kind of a leftover] cookies are great too...[not to buttery or over the top sweet]
the cheesecake a friend ordered for my birthday - oh boy oh boy it was delicious and scrumptious. loads of chocolate on top. 
a mousse cake a friend bought for her birthday - even if it was a day old, the cake tasted great! pairing with some chocolate slices on top of the cake enhances the mousse-y flavor even more to make the taste buds water. 

after two cakes and a few cookies - i'd come here again to get a friend a birthday cake, more mousse and chocolate.
author: Court L.

description: I didn't want to spend a ton on a wedding cake, but I wanted it to look good and taste better.  Schubert's definitely came through.  We had 3 tiers and each with a different filling flavor.  It was moist and delicious... although I didn't get to eat a lot of it by the time we cut the cake.  Our guests seemed to lap it up.  The design was beautiful and similar to the picture we had brought in during our initial appointment.  Their delivery was on time, and Lorraine helped us out during the ordering process.  She was a sweetie and very easy to work with.
author: T O.

description: Forget about any diet aspirations upon entering premises!  Okay, so I sold my soul to the devil over their chocolate eclairs; but I know I'll get it back in the New Year once I hit the gym...NOT!  This little bakery is always crowded and rightly so, their cakes, cookies and other pastries are awesome.  Don't bother to try and find parking since it's impossible - just double park the car and run inside to grab some sweets!
author: Daria i.

description: I'm not a big cake or pastries person but this place is amazing! all of their cakes and pastries are incomparable. The mouse stuff is priceless! GO THERE!
author: Mickail M.

description: I've been a regular at this bakery for nearly a decade now... just a year or two shy.  My first encounter with a Schuberts Rasberry Chocolate cake in 1998 at my sister's birthday party.  Since then, it was routine for a weekly visit.  After I got a job and a life and what not it became a monthly visit.  However, I still alway recommend Schubert's goodies against any lead competitor anyday. So, Citizen Cake, step aside cuz theres no room for you in my belly, except for your awesome breakfast creations.  This past weekend proved my family and myself to be huge fans.  We got a Pink Champagne, Tiramisu and Princess cake for my little cousin Pearl's bday.  It was so good i forgot how good these cakes were.  Schuberts is definitely a must try.
author: Diana T.

description: i like this place.  the baked goods are fresh and rich in flavor.  they have a good selection and the prices are decent.
author: amee m.

description: the chocolate cheesecake and princess cake made for the perfect date one afternoon! this place is bustling and confused, but the desserts are homestyle and rich- perfect cheerer upper for a bad day.
author: Liz S.

description: okay so this place is AMAZING! so yummy, it makes your HEART melt!! Mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm! and the decorations of the cake are JUST BEAUTIFULLLLLLLL! i havE to take pictures of the cakes everytime we get them for parties before anybody cuts into it, they're just so pretty and very amazing! 1 star off only because once i got a pink strawberry or rasberry lady finger cake and it was ok .. i mean it was good but im a very CHOCOLATE CAKE type person so the flavor was too "light" and subtle for me.. it was arite. but overall, this place is just AMAZING!!! i dont think you could ever go wrong no matter WHAT flavor you pick from here!! and they'll write just about anything on the cake for you as a courtesy!! :)
author: Sofia M.

description: Talk about choices on cakes of all types!  Whether you try to decide upon a mango, tropical fruit, current or chocolate mouse cake, these cakes are rich, light airy and fully of flavor.  The cakes are moist and are really pretty!  If mousse cakes aren't your thing, they have whipped cream cakes, buttercream cakes, fruit tortes, cheesecakes and even pastries!  Prices on the mousse cakes are pretty good value as well, I am normally not a big fan on the mousse cakes from certain bakeries in the past, they were expensive for what they were and to be honest I never really cared for them.  (WARNING, mathematic figures to follow...)  That said these seem much more flavorful, and what I was surprised by was that upon cutting into the cake usually the ratio of mousse to cake is usually 50/50.  Cutting into their mousse cake I was surprised to see 80/20 mousse to cake ratio.  More mousse means more of it per bite and to someone with such a severe sweet tooth that is a good thing!  Parking is very slim here, generally tons of luck and patience is needed to find a parking spot on this street, and it is metered.  Fortunately people here work quick so you could run in get your cake and be out in minutes, but I by no means am advocating double parking, that said having a friend who you can bribe with sweets to circle the block while you shop is also a good way to get the job done.  They will personalize the cakes as well for birthday wishes, work functions and whatever holiday/event you wish to celebrate!  I think a couple was in the shop the other day to make plans for what seemed like a wedding cake.  So if you want a specific cake you can call your order in...  call 415-752-1580.
author: Chris T.

description: As a wee child, growing up in Scandi-friendly Seattle, I was raised to appreciate the virtues of the Swedish Princess Cake (SPC).  It could have been the thick layers of whipped cream....or the perfectly moist yellow cake...or maybe it was the raspberry jam on top of that...but most likely, it was the layer of marzipan that surrounds the cake, making it an experience that simply transcends words.  After moving to the Bay Area five years ago, I was disheartened at the fact that I would no longer be near a SPC.  However, I soon found Schubert's and rejoiced the moment I stepped in the door of their Richmond bakery to the sight of dozens of immaculately prepared desserts, among them the SPC.    One bite and I knew that they too had mastered the art of SPC-production.  The cake had the same great flavors and textures as the SPC's I had grown up on.  I have returned several times to Schubert's and been tempted by its other offerings, but always end up ordering the SPC.
author: Graham A.

description: alot of people love shuberts but not meeh, ive had alot better. they are great for presentation but not to be eaten, well depends on what cake you get. fondant is so gross its just an easier nicer way of decorating a cake. your better off going to safeway for a cake or to king lee's on mission.
author: TINO G.

description: Great service & has the best mango mousse cake in town!
author: Rochelle F.

description: If I was on my deathbed and I had but one wish for a dessert to have before I die, being a pastry cook and all, I would pick the Swedish Princess cake from Schubert's Bakery. Not because, "hey I'm dying and I couldn't possibly make the dang thing myself." But because, Schubert's I believe has perfected the Princess cake and I wouldn't dare mess with even attempting to make a cake I know would not measure up in a thousand years. That is how good this cake is. Layers of delicate yellow sponge, raspberry jam, bavarian cream, whipped cream and traditionally tinted green marzipan complete the most heavenly of cakes. I've been lucky enough to have eaten this cake a lot of times and I encourage all of you Yelpers and non-Yelpers to get thee to the Richmond and have your Princess cake. And if you can't eat a whole one, they sell them by the slice as well. Also, every other thing in this bakery is just as awesome. They have a variety of other goodies and cookies and mousse and layer cakes that my hubby and I have tried, and let me tell you, if I weren't already working in a pastry shop, I would stalk these people until they either hired me or had me arrested.
author: cora j.

description: This place is amazing!!!  In addition to the old school cred and the reasonable prices, I got the Swedish Princess cake for a birthday party and I have never in my life gotten so many compliments on a cake that I've served.  I had to write down the name and address of this bakery for 7 people.   Everyone was blown away!  I will definitely be back to order more cakes in the future!
author: Kenois M.

description: walking in here... i figured anything must be good!  heavenly warm delicious scent.  after rudely being cut in front of by a semi large obnoxious middle aged woman buying ten different sweets for her "niece", i bought shortbread cookies and a slice of princess cake.  the cookies were rich and buttery and in just the right sized pieces.  the cake was really good but super sweet, good thing i split it with my bf.
author: Em C.

description: Cakes are always reliable here.. always fresh and nice presentation. Family has been here for cakes for all occasions for many years... You have to try their Princess Cake.. It's the best.   I always get wows for bringing it to parties.
author: Jen M.

description: They truly excel in what they do.  Having moved to the Bay area over ten years ago, from Tahiti (a French influenced island), I was really searching for exquisite-genuine-tasting French pastries.  As I have been spoiled eating refined French patisserie growing up there .  I tried many places in San Francisco and have been disappointed over and over again until I found Schubert's Bakery smacked right in the "Asian" neighborhood of the inner Richmond on Clement street.  I have never ventured to any other bakery shops ever since I found this place whether it's to grab a simple almond croissant (I love their blueberry turnover and custard croissant too) for breakfast or ordering any cakes/tarts for special occasions.  The service has always been amicable and helpful.  You really can't go wrong with your purchase here.
author: Nadine M.

description: Great for a quick snack, or a serious cake-type endeavor.  Want to go back more often to try everything, but each item I've tried so far has been wonderful.  Tropical mousse was wonderful, and the opera cake was chocolate heaven.
author: Dwight B.

description: i've gotten a strawberry shortcake for my birthday from here EVERY YEAR since i was 7.  it's the best!!!! and their princess cake is amazing!!
author: Shanti G.

description: not only are these cakes tasty but they look awesome!  i've had the coffee crunch, mango mousse, and the tiramisu.  all were awesome except the mousse was not my favorite because of the texture. it was light and fluffy which is not my thing.  i like my cakes moist, thick and rich which the other two cakes were.  i highly recommend this place.
author: Thom Y.

description: I come hear for the princess cake...and you should to. My only con is that they don't sell water. I was absolutely dying of thirst after gorging myself on sweets (my fault) but no water was available. After buying water from a convenience store, I bought another slice of princess cake for later. =)
author: Fresca T.

description: Nothing compares to Schubert's cakes , they are absolutely the best. Opera cake and Black Currant Mousse cakes are my favorite. No other bakery comes even close to Schubert's quality and taste.I wished they opened a location in South bay or Penninsula. Cakes from Satura or La Baguette in Stanford are good, but still lose to Schubert's . I tried cakes from Whole Foods, Draegers, Prolific Oven, Bijan, Aki's and Peter's bakery - nothing compares to Schubert's divine chocolate or mousse cakes.
author: Marina Y.

description: Two words "Mousse Cake".  So far I've tried the chocolate with almonds and the chocolate with strawberries.  The best cakes I have ever had.  Sweet and moist.  But not "little kid birthday cake sweet".
author: Jaime G.

description: 200+ reviews can't be wrong.  Just don't go right before closing, like we did.  Despite being told we were pretty much too late as they were putting away everything because they were closing, we came out with a delicious blueberry almond tart for only $12.
author: Dian C.

description: I don't like cake.  I never eat it at weddings but I had to order one for a birthday.  Otherwise I walk by here and see the absolutely gorgeous cakes but never try.  I still didn't eat this cake as I'm also not a fan of chocolate BUT all the people who ate it absolutely raved about it.  So you have about 12 reviews in one here.  The writer is just passing the message along I guess but it was beautiful.  They did the photo cake for me and it was truly just beautiful.
author: Misti L.

description: my fabulous "peruvian boyfriend" got me an opera cake from this bakery and it was delicious.   i'm not that into sweets but i really wanted to eat a big piece.  it was the perfect end to a great meal.
author: Seong P.

description: they have so many different types of yummy mousse cakes here. i must've tried most of the mousse ones. but the princess one is delicious too. i like the individual ones.. perhaps because i get them for no occasion at all. yes, they're that good.
author: Mel L.

description: Wow....my friend specifically drove me to San Francisco and brought me here to one of her favorite bakeries in the city. Amazing display case of pastries, cakes and cookies. The mousse cakes are light and delicious....not overly sweet. My favorite dessert by far is the swedish princess cake.....OMG! I never was a fan of marzipan, until now....this cake is dee-freakin-licious.Its so freakin good that tomorrow I am gonna drive from San Jose to San Francisco to pick up the cake and then head into the east bay to take it to a party! Yum.......it'll all pay off in the end : )
author: Tabitha B.

description: I keep coming back to this bakery for its great selection of cakes.  My personal favorite is the mango mousse, light and not too sweet, but very tasty.  I have tried their other cakes as well, such as their cheesecakes.  I have not been disappointed yet.
author: P Y.

description: It's been a while since I had something here. I ordered a mango moose cake or mango cheese cake for my brother's birthday and it was good. I think I also had ordered a piece of Tiramisu and it was good. This place is a bit pricey, but well worth it as a treat.
author: Jen C.

description: This place probably doesn't need any more awesome reviews, but here it goes!  I've been coming to Schubert's for years and the quality is always excellent.  I just ordered by wedding cake and it literally was 1/2 the price of other places.  Try the swedish princess or the opera cake next time you are there.  That's what we're having for our wedding cake and it was only $500 including delivery for 150 people!!!  What a bargain!!!
author: Yelp L.

description: i've had the mango mousse cake for my birthday for a couple years now. they put a smiley face on it. totally agree with anita m.: proportion of mousse to cake is high=good.
author: Lijia X.

description:
my friend qiu's favorite bakery

got the cheesecake-it was weird, maybe because it had been out of the fridge for a bit but i imagine it is actually b/c it isn't very good

and double chocolate mousse-ammmahhzing, as i would say...so good; definitely recommend

also qiu said the mango mousse is great; for next time
author: Kate R.

description: i've always walked past schubert's but never stepped in until today when i had a huge sweet craving.  everything looked amazing, but i went with a slice of cappacino cake and a slice of tiramisu.  the cappacino cake was heavenly-it was lickilicious good. the tiramisu, however, didn't seem as flavorful and was a bit too heavy for my taste.  the staff is wonderful, but the wait was not.  it was only a weekday afternoon and the line almost extended out the door!
author: Amy Z.

description: I've gone here a couple times with my brother, he always seems to know where the good bakeries are so when he asked me if I had room for dessert, I was eager to say "YES! WHERE TO?" This is a really small bakery that has many pastries to choose from. Dark chocolate, white chocolate, mango mousse, you name it! And everything looks too pretty to eat. I remember we got 3 different desserts and each one was beautifully decorated and full of flavor. I loved the fact that even though we had 2 kinds of chocolate desserts, they tasted distinctly different. Not just your average chocolate cake. Also, they were very efficient when it comes to ringing people up. Very organized place and the price is unbeatable! I can't wait to get a cake here for a birthday party!
author: Rhea A.

description: you can get a decent cup of coffee here. the pastries looked really good too but I didn't try any
author: Joy T.

description: Stopped by here after lunch and grabbed the individual size desserts to go. I got the tiramisu. It was great, I enjoyed the marscapone filling and the cake was spongy and not dry. My friend had the peach mousse, which was just ok. I liked the decoration and the mousse was delightful, however the cake was on the dry side. I'll have to come back and try the other desserts/cakes.
author: Gabrielle V.

description: Honestly the best princess cake I've ever tried. The color and decoration are so unique, too. This will be my go-to cake place from here on out.
author: Sheri E.

description: great place for cakes, its in a friendly neighborhood.  the cakes are just awesome here, for sure one of a kind. i love the place and the staff!
author: Tony P.

description: My wife and I did not pick our wedding cake from here...and we both regret it.  We had a taste of our cousin's birthday cake which was a chocolate/chocolate mouse (white/milk) cake and it was really good, one of the best that we've had.  The cake was fluffy and moist, the mousse flavoring was delicious, we'll be coming here for our future cakes.
author: Cal H.

description: do not get the princess cake.  on the other hand, the strawberry and chocolate slices my friend got were not bad.
author: Dorothy L.

description: I went here in search of the highly recommended coffee crunch cake but I was disappointed to learn that it is only sold by special order.  Instead I tried the mouse cake with chocolate shavings.  The cake was very tasty and moist and fresh.  The bakery has a huge selection of cakes and pastries.  On first impression it seemed like everything was mass produced and may not be very good, but the mouse cake proved me wrong.
author: colleen s.

description: I love this place!  They have the delicate-tasting desserts (as opposed to sugar-coated American desserts) that I've been looking for.  The only problem that it's all the way in the Richmond district.  Nonetheless, five stars :)
author: Kim J.

description: This place makes the best mango mousse cake. It's not too sweet and tastes like real mango. I buy it for my grandma every year. It's really addictive!
author: Jenn F.

description: One of the best pastry shops in the city, in my opinion.  We always get a christmas log and fruitcake here and the little slices of fancy cake are pretty good too.
author: Priscilla P.

description: this place brings me back to my childhood days. I love their mango mousse and tiramisu cakes! they're SO good!
author: Tesa B.

description: Best place for pastries and cakes!! It looks good and tastes good.
author: Miss D.

description: this place has the best everything. the cakes, the cookies, pastries, you name it! i can't get over those jelly-filled cookies! so tasty! and dad bought  like 20 boxes for x-mas gifts, no lie. i'm about to eat all of them before he has the chance to give them all out! ahaha.
author: Jasmine T.

description: I couldn't decide whether to give Schubert's 4 or 5 stars. Here's why. My husband and I went here last week. I got a fruit pinwheel pastry that was a pastry with creme (which tasted like creme brulee, yum!) on top of it and then glazed fruit on top of the creme. It was delicious! Definitely 5 stars. But then my husband got a pastry that was filled with apple pie type filling. It was good, but there wasn't very much of the filling in it. I wouldn't say it was as good as mine taste-wise either. I decided to give them 5 stars though, because it is rare that I get a pastry that knocks my sock off, and the pinwheel pastry did just that!
author: Debbie P.

description: One of the best bakeries in San Francisco. A classic!  I've ordered their cakes for many special occasions.  All of the pastries are fresh and if you like chocolate and rasberry - the star and moon cookies are the best!
author: ChaCha C.

description: I ordered a Princess cake 1 week in advance.  This was the first princess cake I've ever had.    It was extremely tasty.  I especially like the Marzipan on the outside.  The marzipan layer was really thing though.  I would have liked it to the a little thicker.  However the cake was nice.  The rasberry filling was perfect but would like to have a little thicker layer.  Overall very nice cake.
author: Tau S.

description: When you come in here, you should have an idea about what kind of  treat you would like.  Maybe it was just that particular day I went, that the girl behind the counter didn't even look like she revels in the decadence of the desserts.  She was rail thin!  So here I am asking about what her favorite treat is, and she couldn't even tell me.  She said, 'whatever you like'.  Well, it was my first time there, and I just wasnt sure.  They have chocolate, cheesecake, moousse, shortcake.  If it's texture that you are looking for, this place has got it.  The mousse is so light it floats on your tongue.  It doesn't even seem like you are sinfully eating such decadence.  I didn't get to try the strawberry shortcake, though the gal sitting next to us said it was like heaven in your mouth. mmm.   So this place gets 4 stars all because the girl behind the counter didn't know what she was talking about.  If she could describe flavor, and texture, and the products she was selling, then I would have definitely given this place a 5.
author: gem a.

description: I thought I'd refer my neice to Shubert's bakery since my first experience with this bakery was not only affordable, but overall great service.  I even received a thank you from the owner, Ralph, for posting such a great review for his bakery on yelp.  He even told me to ask for him directly next time I needed to order a cake.  So, naturally, I thought I would send my neice to order her cake from here knowing that she would get a great deal and excellent service.  Unfortunately, her experience with Schubert's bakery was not as appealing.  She tried to contact Ralph on a daily basis and was always given an excuse that he couldn't come to the phone. She left several messages, no returned calls.  After two weeks of trying to get a hold of Ralph, she finally decided to speak to another baker, which gave her a high quote for a cake...nowhere as good as the price I received.  Here I am referring someone to a bakery I trusted would deliver on service and prices, but I was extremely disappointed how my neice was treated.  Needless to say, I would not be referring anyone else to this bakery.  I feel a bit jipped and mislead that my future orders from here would be the same as my first...WRONG! I return to a business as a paying customer  not only because of customer service and products, but also for their business ethics. Schubert's bakery is lacking in this area and I'm quite disappointed. Obviously won't be coming back here again.
author: Live Love L.

description: yes i will eat a NAPOLEON for breakfast. theyre just that good.
author: M M.

description: this is the place i would reccomend for people who ask about pies, cakes etc.  special occasion or not, the cakes are soo good.  although it may be a little expensive, i think it is worth it.
author: Beck S.
